description:
This is a wonderful little yogurt shop! You choose a base of chocolate or vanilla and then choose one or more toppings to blend in. This is great because you get all the toppings in every bite (unlike traditional self-serve froyo). 

The first time I went, I got the mocha chip, which was good, but was very espresso heavy. The second time, I got the blueberry coconut and it was incredible!!!! Highly recommend getting anything with fruit in it because it increases the volume a lot and makes you feel like you got a lot. 

The biggest surprise to me was the rice pudding - they let you try samples so I had the cookies and cream and chocolate chip and both were really good! I had no idea I liked rice pudding, but when I go back, I think I would try it!
author: Nicole Z.

description:
Great after dinner treat but an operation's nightmare. 

This is our go to spot Sunday and weekday nights around 7/8pm. Don't be fooled by the short line. Anytime we go, and there are more then 2 people ahead of us in line, there WILL BE at a 25-30minute wait time -- WHICH IS INSANE FOR ICE CREAM. 

They have anywhere between 1 and 3 people working and only 1 machine. 

Each order requires the machine worker to peel these yogurt disks. Then, blend in the toppings using a hand crank blender 2 - 3 times. THEN, they need to clean the ONE machine between orders. 
If someone orders a large before you, it will take twice as long. The whole process can take 5 - 10 minutes. 

But, if your willing to wait - anything with chocolate tastes amazing.
author: A R.

description:
I like the idea of mixing the toppings into the froyo, there was a decent number of topping options, service was friendly and fast, shop was clean, and to be fair, they didn't advertise themselves as serving tart froyo, but I just wasn't a fan. Had the mocha chip with vanilla base and found it bland with the chocolate chips adding more texture than flavor since they were a bit waxy. Would suggest going for a fruit flavor or the rice puddings instead! Cinnamon raisin rice pudding was yummy but again..nothing special.

Update: If you're looking for plain tart froyo, check out Souvla!
author: Shelley Z.

description: I really enjoy the simplicity of this place.  They don't have a very abundant amount of flavors, but it is the right amount.  My favorite thing about this place was the coconut pudding.  It was pretty much delicious rice pudding but instead of rice they put coconut. I think it's a little bit healthier choice.  But then again it all sweets and I'm not nutritionist. The service was quick and friendly!
author: Carolina W.

description:
Great products poorly run business, probably opening too many stores
Terrible customer service and zero supervision so quality and cleanliness is dropping fast.
Payment system is broken got charged twice and they basically asked to call my bank to solve.
Again great idea, great product, poorly scaled and now charging customers for products they are not selling.
author: Alex D.

description: I love this place!! Sadly I can only get it when i can only travel to sf. First of all they have the picture perfect swirl. Second of all it was amazing! It's called frozen yogurt but it tastes way more creamy like icecream. i got vanilla base w strawberries and nutella and i thought it was perfect! plenty of both flavors. I like my icecream on the icier side and i think the addition of strawberries made it slightly icy!
author: Khanh D.

description:
Not going to lie, that was a pretty absurd experience. The store closes at 9:30pm and I walk in at 9:27pm on Wednesday to be told that they are closed. I asked "but your sign says you close at 9:30, there is no line, is it possible to place my order?" Only for the attendants to spend minutes telling me that they're actually trying to get people OUT by 9:30 even though they technically close at that time....and then finish with "oh look at that! It's 9:30pm now. Sorry we're closed"

Seriously, don't bother. It's not worth that kind of attitude and manipulation to ruin your entire day at this particular Loving Cup store. Because even when they're not about to close shop, this guy is still unnecessarily mean for no reason. 

The froyo is good, and great with the way you can customize it.  But it wasn't good enough to bring an entire day down with that kind of patronization. 

To the management of this establishment, frankly speaking, you should fire the GM or whoever the male is working this shift (there was another female on staff at the time). He will lose you loyal customers with his attitude and aggression.
author: A W.

description:
I was having a random dessert craving so I decided to endure a .5 mile walk just to get some Loving Cup! .5 Miles might not sound very far, but when you're coming from North Beach, it consists of lots of intense uphill walking, to the point where you might not be able to feel your calves anymore! The Froyo at Loving Cup is definitely worth sweating blood and tears for!

My favorite is the Matcha Latte Froyo (if its in season) with Crushed Oreos and Salted Caramel. It is absolutely heavenly and definitely will satisfy any ice cream cravings you might have! If you're craving a somewhat "healthy" dessert, then visiting Loving Cup is definitely a must. They also serve different flavors of rice pudding that looks quite appetizing too!
author: MyTien P.

description: Came here on a Thursday at 2pm and they were closed :( I sat outside for a bit and then observed a worker unlock the door and walk in. When I inquired if they were open (as the sign indicates) she was talking on her phone and told me no. How weird! Bummer that I couldn't try their products and that the customer service wasn't better.
author: Angelina H.

description:
During my trip to SF, I knew I had to make a stop at this place or else I'd regret it. I visited this location because it was closer to touristy destinations like Lombard St and the piers. I came during the evening on a Saturday and there was no line.

There are A LOT of options of what to put in your frozen yogurt. I didn't know this place made your order on the spot, which is pretty cool! I chose blueberry with the vanilla base, and I was so impressed. It was blended very well and had bits of blueberry in every bite. Great quality for a decent price. It was starting to drip pretty fast, even in cold weather. So maybe don't take too long taking pics lol.
author: Leslie S.

description:
Why am I just learning about this place? Probably a good thing ....and there are 3 different locations???? what???

This place serves fro-yo AND rice pudding. I LOVE rice pudding and when I saw the signage that said RICE PUDDING ...I squinted my eyes and thought to myself "that can't be right" I've never seen a sign proclaim they have rice pudding. But...I'm here to report they "specialize" (did I really type that ) in rice pudding.
Rice pudding-
I went with a combo of:
a) Cinammon Raisin Rum
b) Oreos (?) 

Both were super good and I'm glad I split the serving so I could have a little of each although but would be good as a standalone. 

Froyo- 
Cinnamon Toast Crunch- Oh so good and I highly recommend. 

So many good ice cream/gelato/chocolate spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 

I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Polly Ann Ice Cream
5 Salt and straw
6 Chocolate Covered
7 Loving Cup
8 Smitten Ice Cream
9 Teuscher Chocolate 
10 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
11 Over the Moon
12 Lush Gelato
13 The Ice Cream Bar
14 Coletta Gelato
15 Cako Creamery
16 Bi-Rite Creamery
17 San Francisco's Hometown Creamery 
18 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
19 Mitchells Ice cream
20 St. Francis Fountain
21 Z Cioccolato
22 Joe's Ice Cream
23 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
24 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
25 Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop
26 Recchiuti Confections 
27 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description: Quality has greatly declined with the expansion to more locations in SF. Please bring back the original, made-with-love experience!!!
author: Carolyn C.

description:
I like small shops because they have a cozy atmosphere. Everything is made in a specific style with a lot of dedication.  Loving Cup fascinated me at the first sight.  I ordered a frozen Vanilla yogurt with banana and strawberry flavor. It was spectcular. Nice and fresh ingredients.
I will be back for sure!
author: Elena L.

description: I got the mocha chip mixed one. It was so yummy! Not too sweet and the dark chocolate and mocha beans swirled in gave the froyo a nice crunchy texture. They make it on the spot for you. Prices are s little steep!
author: RachEl L.

description:
Ahhh!! I have NEVER seen a dessert shop that serves RICE PUDDING!!! I thought those were only in Asia!!!

We stopped by to get coffee next door at Saint Frank's, and then stumbled upon this gem! I love that Loving Cup has a couple of different options to satisfy your sweet tooth. Whether it be a sweet fruit smoothie, a cup of Froyo/ice cream, or RICE PUDDING, Loving Cup has got all of those covered!

I got to sample the Cinnamon Raisin Rice Pudding and the Cookies and Cream. They were so freaking delicious! I got a small cup, with half of each of the flavors. They reminded me of the dessert shops in China/Hong Kong. And to top it off, each cup is less than 200 calories!!!

I'd definitely come back. There should honestly be more places that serve rice pudding!! Such a light but tasty dessert option :)
author: Rebecca W.

description:
Finally got to try it today!! The flavor combos all sounded so delish and i had a hard time deciding. I'm pretty impressed with how the machine works to create those perfect yummy swirls (wish i'd invented it). Though it was tasty, i do like when there's texture to a frozen treat, like when you can actually pick out the textures of chocolate chips and nuts and the different ingredients - i didn't really realize that here it would be pulverized into one homogenous blob. I got walnuts in mine, but instead of getting the crunch from the nuts it kind of just felt like eating sandy ice cream, couldn't really taste them in there...nonetheless I'm glad to have tried it and it did satisfy my dessert craving. Knowing what i know now about how it gets blended up (no Coldstone paddles here, y'all) i would probably try a different nut-free combo next time. I took a taste of my friends' two cups too - the strawberry one and the butterfinger (i got the banana bread). All three were pretty darn great.

One issue we had was that the girl preparing one of the cups put it on the counter in front of us and looked right at us so we assumed it was ours and put a spoon in it. It was actually for a girl who had taken a seat at the front of the place, good thing she didn't mind, but it would've been nice if the employees maybe paid better attention to who ordered what - just basic customer service really, there were only 4 of us in there after all.
author: Theresa C.

description:
I recently went to New York and had the most amazing rice pudding there and wanted to find something similar in the bay. One of my friends heard of this place so we decided to take a little food adventure to try it out. They only have 5 flavors for their rice pudding, but have a wider selection for their froyo. 

Upon arriving there was a small line and when it was my turn to order, I asked for a sample of the cookies and cream rice pudding. The cashier let out a huge sigh and went to dip a sample spoon in the mixture and handed it to me. When I was about to toss my spoon in the dirty spoon container, she grabbed the container (which had like 5 spoons in there) and angrily emptied it out. My minute of interaction with her was just a WTF experience and totally uncalled for. I would understand if I was being difficult or a rude customer, but all I did was ask for a sample. Even though the rice pudding was good, I wouldn't come back here to be treated like that.
author: Renee Y.

description: Their froyo is very interesting! I would say it's very similar to blended McFlurry. I appreciated all their flavors and how cute the shop looked, but also thought it was too pricey for a froyo. Good to try for the first time but would rather get McFlurry for a fraction of the price.
author: Theresa H.

description:
Very good!

My interest was peaked when I saw organic all natural. Then they followed it up with a delicious non-fat frozen yogurt. I got a vanilla base with salted caramel and cookie dough. I was with two friends who were both skeptical, but they were both VERY pleasantly surprised and ended up having multiple bites of mine.

Highly recommend for a relatively healthy way to treat a sweet tooth.
author: Ezra B.

description: We loved this place. My husband and I both ordered things off the menu (you can create your own too), and we both enjoyed the yogurt very much! Small spot, but it's easy to walk and eat it, so no big deal for us.
author: Moriah F.

description:
My interest in visiting Loving Cup was recommended by a friend who says their rice pudding was amazing. I recently came back from New York and had the most tastiest rice pudding and wanted to fulfill my cravings. This place was bookmarked for quiet sometime so I decided to gather a group of friends to try it out. We got into the shop close to 8pm and there were 2 groups of three in front of us. They offered 5 flavors of rice pudding but have a wider selection of froyo. 

When it was my turn to order, I asked the cashier for a sample of the Cookies and Cream and Coconut. Upon doing so, she let out a huge sigh and gave me a WTF look. I knew samples were available since there was a used sample spoon container on the counter. She scooped the sample as if it was the hardest thing to do and slammed the sliding door. At that point, I felt uncomfortable and guilty for even asking so I continued to place my order without knowing how the other three flavors tasted like. Her interaction towards my entire ordering process was rude and unprofessional and gave me the worst experience at Loving Cup. 
When I received my order and sat down with my friends, they too also told me how bad her mannerism was. 
 
Aside from the customer service, the Coconut rice pudding was tasty and dense. My other two friends who ordered a customized froyo enjoyed their's as well. I wanted to love Loving Cup, but the customer service received ruined it.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Ooh La La who wants some freezing healthy fro-yo when it's raining and cold in SF? *MOI* of course. I remember going here like 5 years ago and trying a groupon for rice pudding which I did not like, then finding out that they also serve fro yo of course! 

I decided to check it out since A) It was less than .5 miles and B) I was feeling lazy and wanted something quick. I checked the menu online and the items looked good AND healthy/probiotic gluten-dairy-fat-everything-free and still had great reviews so why not? I arrived and was served promptly as there were no other looney people at 6pm trying to buy froYo in 50 degree rainy weather. The girl was very friendly and helped me choose the mint-chocolate chip mix in a size small, which she mixed up with a nifty machine in no time. 

The treat was very good and very mint-chip like, without the guilt. I believe it said 120-180 calories for a size small, which ran me $4.25, which I would decrease a bit in the only change to my experience. I went gallantly on my way and enjoyed this treat, not pigging out on any cookies after. New Year's resolutions on FLEEK! 

Ask me later on my progress. 

PS -- They have a lot of cool featured menu items, but you can also choose your own combo and toppings if you like!
author: Mahsa T.

description: 4 stars for taste, 1 star for service and 0 stars for price transparency. I really enjoyed my frozen yogurt, don't get me wrong, but I have to say, I was really turned off by how poorly the two young employees managed the operation. First, when we walked in on a Sunday evening, the employees were openly trash talking the management and making offensive comments. Even as more people entered the store, they continued to speak poorly. Second, we came to this place specifically because they had a lot of non dairy flavors and my boyfriend is allergic to dairy. There was no warning that 1) the store was out of most non dairy flavors and 2) that those non dairy flavors cost significantly more. Just for reference, my bf's frozen yogurt was twice the price of mine. When he asked about two of the non dairy flavors, they said they were out of most flavors except vanilla.  He and I both thought the fro yo tasted good, but were taken aback by the service.
author: Sydney L.

description:
Love the concept, but low quality ingredients left me feeling sick for hours both times I tried LC. 

I'm mildly lactose intolerant and have never had a problem with frozen yogurt, but I think this is more soft serve than yogurt. The "froyo" comes in frozen hockey puck looking things that are thrown into a mixing machine with your ingredients of choice. Seeing the process of peeling a frozen puck from wax paper wasn't appetizing.

Tummy troubles aside, it was good, but wouldn't go back again. If you have a froyo craving there are much better places in the city.
author: Sarah U.

description:
Loving cup is a small but cozy cafe that has some really good froyo! The decor in here is very modern and brightly lit. This place was pretty full though when we arrived, and seats are quite limited. My friend took me here after having dinner just down the street after we found this place on Yelp and saw that they had amazing reviews - so we knew we definitely had to check it out! We ordered two delicious frozen yogurts: the mocha chip and the salted caramel.

I thought what was really nice about the froyo is that it kept its consistency and did not become too watery even after it melted. The salted caramel had a good balance between the sweet and savoury flavours, with the caramel sauce being a nice touch on top of the whole dessert. I was really surprised by the sizing because we got two mediums ($5.75 each) but they were actually huge, so we definitely got a bang for our bucks. 

Overall, great frozen yogurt to take to go. The restaurant has limited seating so it's kinda hard to find a seat, but I wouldn't want to be inside anyways when it's a nice day in San Francisco!
author: Justin K.

description:
Came by here after eating at Nick's down the street. I tried the Mocha Chip, but opted for the vanilla base instead of chocolate. My friend went for the salted caramel and graham crackers. 

We were surprised at how creamy and thick the froyo was. Not to mention the medium was huge. 

Typically I'm used to froyo that melts pretty quickly, but this kept its shape and texture pretty well. If I didn't know beforehand, I would have thought this was traditional Icecream.

Highly recommend Mocha Chip with the vanilla base. Wish there were more espresso beans in the mix (love my coffee), but it did complement the bittersweet chocolate chips well. Will definitely come by again when I'm in the area.
author: Heather N.

description:
Best. Ice cream. EVER. 

It's about time I write a review for this place- it's incredible. My boyfriend and I order this at least weekly- we're straight up addicted.  

You can taste the quality of the ingredients- it's from organic and grass-fed cows, and it tastes so much better than factory-farmed abused cows. 

Everyone we've introduced Loving Cup to thinks it's the best frozen yogurt they've ever had- one person had a diet philosophy of not trying new categories of foods they might be tempted by, but froyo passed because she's already had it. But after trying, she said "this is a new category of foods because it's that good." And "I'm glad I don't live near one of these because I'd eat it every day." My family was obsessed as well. I highly recommend the house-made salted caramel mix-in. It's amazing. Nutella is also a must. I would say the chocolate base could be better; I love chocolate ice cream but never get it here. 

It's also very low calorie- a small vanilla is only 120 calories, and super delicious all on its own!! Add some sprinkles on top and you've got an incredibly satisfying dessert. 

Thank you, Loving Cup!! Now we can't ever move from SF thanks to you. ;)
author: Melissa C.

description:
Definitely one of the best frozen yogurt spots in the Bay Area! You literally get to create your own frozen yogurt containing fresh ingredients. I recommend the Vanilla base with Pistachios. It's the best Pistachio frozen yogurt in the universe! I also like the Vanilla bar with blueberries.

You really can't go wrong here!
author: Carlo T.

description: I came here after volunteering at a nearby workshop and was looking forward to trying the rice pudding. I was expecting the pudding to be warm but it was actually served chilled. I tried the Cinnamon Rum Raisin and the Coconut but ended up getting a small cup of the Cookies n Cream which is a safe but agreeable choice. My decision might have been influenced by a perception of the freshness of the batch. The flavor was good and it was quite fun eating the amorphous solid. I would go for a larger cup the next time around.
author: Lauren H.

description:
How does Loving Cup have such a high rating? Le bf and I came after having dinner nearby. We saved room in our stomachs for some froyo because I came across this place on Yelp and it looked good.

When we arrived, there was nobody in line. The place looked really clean. After studying the boards, you could tell that there was one board listing out the different flavors of rice pudding in the fridge (le bf made a comment along the lines of it didn't look very good), a board for their popular mixed flavors, and another board that lists out all the possible things you can add to either a base of vanilla or a base of chocolate. 

I decided to go for the mint cookie one. It was a vanilla base with oreos and Junior Mints (I think). It was very minty. It was alright, but there was no way you were going to pay me to stand in line for this, if there was a line. Nothing about it was made me go wow. The only thing I found interesting was the machine and how they actually mixed your mix-ins into the froyo.

It was cheap, but I'm not sure I would make a special trip just to come here. Even the small size of froyo was huge! If there is a line when you get there, feel free to come back on a later date, you really aren't missing anything.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
Nothing special except for the fancy froyo machine that whips everything together.

Service was half ass by the cashier - geeky looking guy with thick ass glasses and awful hair.

The guy who actually prepared our froyo was a smidge nicer.

The rice pudding was aight.

They need to work on their customer service!!!!!!!!
author: Jade B.

description: Unlike other ice cream shops, they blend in your toppings into your ice cream! I got vanilla base with oreo mix-in.
author: Renee W.

description: Hm, though I like the concept of being able to customize and mix your own ingredients into a soft serve, I wasn't quite blown away when I ordered it. I thought the taste was rather meh and didn't stand out very much. I ordered a large with raspberries, blueberries, and bananas. Maybe I should've have gone with chocolate or something but it tasted exactly like something I could make at home with my blender and not pay 7 bucks for it. I came in on a very not busy day, there were about 2 people besides my group but the service was still rather slow. Overall it was just an okay experience, likely a one time thing.
author: Ivy W.

description:
Decided to try our neighbourhood frozen yogurt place. Super DISAPPOINTED. 
They don't fill the whole cup! $5.75 for a medium cup and when you take the first spoonful you see it is hollow through the middle. Come on! Can you believe it? When we reluctantly said something, the kids running the shop that day told us "That's how it is made."
The frozen yogurt was made in 6 seconds from a machine and we didn't see any fresh fruit. Tasted good but wasn't any care in making it. 
The people there don't know how to operate the register. 
I tipped a dollar in the tip jar but at the end of this experience I want to take it back. Not worth the expensive 1/2 filled cup of frozen yogurt. 

Not good customer service, guys.
author: Anairam Y.

description: My friends and I each got a small frozen yogurt. We tried cookie dough, matcha and banana flavor. All were very good! The small cup was $4.50 each. It's not cheap, but I think worth the price. I was very full after the small cup - don't see any need getting the larger size. Overall - very delicious and a good experience!
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Been here twice and I love this place. The first time I came, I was debating between rice pudding and froyo. Ended up choosing coconut rice pudding, although I was very tempted to get the cookies n cream flavored one. Nonetheless, it was very good. The coconut flavor wasn't overwhelming. Tasted more like vanilla with some coconut flakes. 

Had to come back and try the froyo. I love how there are many options and different combinations that can be blended together. I chose vanilla base blended with blueberries and animal crackers. It was so good! Actually wasn't expecting it to be that great but everything from the presentation to the flavor was awesome. The animal crackers added a nice crunchy texture and sweetened it a little more. The size small for both the rice pudding and froyo was more than enough. Definitely coming back and trying different flavor combos.
author: Annie H.

description:
Pros: super fast service, friendly staff, can't go wrong with any of the flavors they have there

Cons: the location I go to is right next to the gym on Polk Street - making it irresistible to NOT go in!
author: Nicole P.

description: I used to work across the street from this frozen yogurt place and Ive spent probably  $100 here even with my neighborhood discount. I used to get the dirty hipster, mocha chip, and the cookie monster. You can obviously tell i lean towards the chocolate stuff but I miss working by this place. So, the price is steep just like annnnnnything else in SF, the line can sometimes be up to a 20 min wait, the employees were always changing so that was something we had to get used to ask i ask for the discount and they'd not know what it was or even if they should give it to us. When i say us i mean me and the 2 or 3 guys I'd go in there with while on lunch break. They had other things aside from froyo like rice krispy treats, rice pudding, and even cake.They serve  smoothies too my girlfriend tried one when I decided to bring her and her nieces here she didnt like it. But her 3 nieces loved their yogurt. Suggested that she get the yogurt which tastes like icecream but for calorie consumption she opted for smoothie. One of my old co-workers loved this place he'd get a large thin mint like once or twice a week and we'd always make fun of him because he was so thin. The reason im giving 3 stars is because it was somewhat inconsistant. Sometimes they'd put baby chocolate chips on my froyo as like a garnish, sometimes I'd have to ask where are my chocolate chips? Sometimes the workers wouldnt be friendly, sometimes they'd be super friendly. They used to run out of junior mints for my coworkers favorite and then he'd have to choose another flavor. One other thing I'd like to mention is you have to have a strong arm to work the machine that processes the yogurt and there were multiple times that we've had to tell them "hey can you run this through the machine again we know its supposed to go through twice" for the right consistency which is why people actually like this place. Otherwise its fairly small place with a few tables that you may or may not be able to sit at depending on the day and time. It ususlly looks clean and the music is usually decent. I would love to return to loving cup if im ever in the area again.
author: Adriana B.

description:
This review is solely for the rice pudding. Upon seeing that Loving Cup had the option for rice pudding, I was so excited because this is a dessert that I always look forward to. I thought that the rice pudding would stand out in one way or another due to the high reviews here. My cousin ordered the yogurt and seemed to enjoy it more than I did. Perhaps, if you are visiting, choose the yogurt over the rice pudding :)

This place is good for a sweet treat if you happen to be on Polk!
author: Grace Z.

description:
OMG found this little spot on yelp and it's a gold mine! You know when there's a long line you're in for a treat!
The yogurt is smooth and creamy and you can create your own blend or flavor. 
I chose their chocolate base with junior mints and coconut mixed in and it was amazing! 
I can't wait to visit SF and come here again!
author: Ingrid F.

description:
i enjoyed loving cup
I like that the toppings are actually blended into the frozen yogurt
this made it super easy for my friend especially who had just received braces that day
the flavors were good
the atmosphere was fun
we made it in just before closing and they were still happy and willing to serve us
author: Tabitha D.

description:
DOV: 11/12/16
6th stop | 1:30 PM-2:15 PM

With creameries (over)hyped, people forget the lonely froyo and rice pudding. Loving Cup is super memorable, thus my 5 stars rating!

+1 Price:quantity:quality ratio is hella worth it! TBH, if you weighed the froyo at Yogurtland or Menchies, it would probably cost you around $5 or more just for the froyo. AND if you wanted toppings...that price range goes up. 

Step 1: Decide between froyo, rice pudding, fruit smoothies, or fro-yo shakes. (OR JUST GET EVERYTHANG!!) 
Step 2: Feel free to sample rice pudding! 
Step 3: If you feelin' like a no-brainer, you can choose one of the "favorites" OR look to the big board by the window and customize your own.  
Step 4: Pick your size, pay, wait and ENJOY! 

RICE PUDDING: 
S: $3.75, M: $4.75, L: $6.75, Pint: $7.75 / Add a topping for 75 cents
+1 CINNAMON RUM RAISIN. My favorite of all the ones they had today! 
+Flavors change daily, but the set ones are: cinnamon rum raisin, vanilla, bittersweet chocolate chip, coconut 

FRO-YO: 
S: $4.75, M: $5.75, L: $6.75, Pint: $8.75 / Add additional toppings for 75 cents (or was it 50?) 
+1 Texture is delicious! Not soft serve ice cream texture, but definitely firmer than your typical froyo (so it doesn't melt all over you...) 
+1 NO SYRUPS used at all! They use frozen fruits to bring out the real flavors and you might even taste the seeds of strawberry or raspberry. Perfect! 

Pros:
+Great service. Not super energetic, but this girl knows how to make a mean froyo! She's also hella efficient when the line got super long. 
+Great menu. I want to try all the combinations possible! 

Cons:
-Nothing! Except maybe menu was quite overwhelming with deliciousness....

Tips/Observations:
-What if they sold waffle cones?! I think that would be pretty awesome to go with your froyo. 
-Stamp card available! It's not per order, but per item. Buy 9 and get a small free! ($3.75 value)
-They accept credit cards, despite how small the store front is. 
-If you're a cinnaholic like me...you can get additional cinnamon (and nutmeg) for free! 

Overall, coming here again! Ample seating, great menu, awesome prices....I want some now!
author: Hurjane V.

description:
If you've never tried rice pudding before, you should definitely try it out, even if it's a one-time experience. I would recommend trying the oreo rice pudding, they give you a hefty portion in the cup but it's yummy!

Who doesn't like oreo?!
author: Eva O.

description: Cute little shop. Unique ice cream idea. Very good. Friendly service. A little bit crowded with only one worker but other than that it was a great experience. Would definitely return here.
author: Molly F.

description:
Found them through the help of Yelp and decided to give them a try on Sunday night of Labor Day weekend! 

The store is small and parking can be a hassle if you drive here because it's right on Polk. We walked from our dinner place, so I provide no help in parking assistance. The later it is the better chance you'll have for parking. 

There were a lot of options for us to choose from, rice pudding, frozen yogurt, our own toppings or a suggested combination. 

Both myself and my friend went with froyo although I will probably want to come back and try the rice pudding. 

Sizes are generous in my opinion, we both got mediums because smalls looked too small and I didn't finish! Me? Not finish a dessert? It's unheard of. I have a second stomach that's saved for dessert, but it was too much. 

Prices are cheap. I paid 5 bucks for a huge medium that I didn't even finish, so I'd say you're definitely getting your money's worth. 

Service was really friendly for us. I was helped by a lovely older women.  Very sweet and very patience with us deciding on what we wanted. She also offered assistance with the menu and what to choose. I saw other reviews about service, but they mentioned a guy so we must have gotten lucky. Service can make a huge difference on a night out so I'm glad we were helped by this older woman. 

Flavors: Cookie monster and the cinnamon toast crunch

These flavors tasted a lot more healthy than a normal place you would go to, but it was kind of refreshing.  The cinnamon toast crunch had a very strong cinnamon taste that went well with the subtle taste of the vanilla base. It's definitely not as sweet as a regular ice cream or frozen yogurt, but it's very satisfying for some reason. I think because the vanilla is a lot lighter you don't feel weighed down by this heavy dessert. 

The cookie monster was basically cookies and cream, although I could have sworn it was supposed to include cookie dough. Regardless, it tasted good as well. There was a nice texture to the yogurt and the consistency is much thicker than a regular froyo.  Again the flavors are a little more on the subtle side and it's not as sweet, but I appreciated that. It lacks the richness of ice cream, but it's a very light dessert that won't make you food coma immediately after you finish. 

I'm a fan, it was a good experience with good service and good dessert. I'd certainly come back to try rice pudding!
author: Jay K.

description:
I ordered the Dirty Hipster simply because of the name.

It was a tasty vanilla custard with Nutella and Oreos. The Nutella flavor was the prominent one. It actually tasted more like ice cream than the thick custards I'm used to. Tasty treat after a night out or dinner on Polk!
author: Connie M.

description: If you enjoy frozen yogurt, you should definitely try them. They use good quality ingredients and use a unique way to mix them to make tasty and custom frozen yogurt recipe for you.
author: Ujjwal K.

description:
THE BEST frozen yogurt I've ever tried. I got to try the MOCHA CHIP and COOKIE MONSTER, both of which were creamy and very tasteful minus all that sugar overload sweetness you get from overly sweet yogurt. 

PROS:
-Healthier than ice cream (though..I love me some good ice cream)
-Cheaper (+much much better) than pinkberry or any other over priced shop
-HUGE portions (um, win)

CONS:
-Parking around this area might be tough....but keep at it!!! I was lucky enough to park right in front during my first visit (=

EDITED 2018: after trying several locations, this one is the best! 

----
For more food tips, follow me on Instagram @munchieswith_m
author: Mary L.

description: This used to be our favorite spot back when they had the non dairy plain flavor without chocolate or vanilla. Now they pulled that away, or at least half of there staff thinks they have, my gf and I used to love this place but won't be returning unless that hanged. The worst part is I'm pretty sure they still have it and the staff just doesn't know because it varies based on location -- terrible management and/or understanding of the customer, tough to know which.
author: Zach H.

description:
So I love the concept of this place and while it's pricey, I do think the quality of ingredients and the manpower used to make each cup makes it worth it. Unfortunately I'm giving it 3 stars because the vegan base fell short of the mark for me. I was really excited about a froyo base made out of bananas and that wasn't made with a ton of fillers and additives but my 'vegan base with strawberries' tasted like an expired pint of Strawberry Halo Top(diet ice cream). It was almost too fluffy and light - didn't taste like bananas. But because I was out $6 with that cup, i didn't order anything else. 

The sample of the rice pudding was awesome! Not sure I could eat a whole cup. 

I will say that my boyfriend's vanilla with cookie dough, peanut butter, and oreos was excellent! $10 for the pint size. Overall really worth a try if you steer clear of the vegan base!
author: Samyutha R.

description:
Loving Cup is so good OH MY GOD. I love this place. If you've got a sweet tooth, definitely check out Loving Cup.

I've been here a couple of times with friends and it's usually not too crowded. There's plenty of seating and the line generally moves pretty quickly. The interior is quite large, well-lit and very bright. There are large tubs of Nutella that line the walls -- yum. You order at the cash register and then you wait until they call your name with your delicious froyo. It generally takes a few minutes. You can order from the menu or create your own, or a combo of both if you're feelin adventurous.

I've tried the Dirty Hipster and the Thin Mint. The Dirty Hipster lives up to the hype! FOR SURE. It's so good. It's not overwhelmingly sweet and a small size is definitely a good portion. They accidentally added pretzels to mine, which I didn't mind. It added a nice saltiness to the froyo. The consistency of the froyo is unlike any other I've tried. It's not exactly ice cream and not exactly froyo -- it's somewhere in the middle. I don't feel as guilty eating it because it's not straight up ice cream, ya know? It's a treat without being too harsh on the waistline LOL.

I can't wait to come back to try other flavors! I LOVE LOVING CUP.
author: Amy T.

description:
Loving Cup is a great little dessert spot and a decent study spot. Came here to wait for some friends and to get some work done. Only one guy was making the desserts + at the counter and people came in waves so the service was a bit slow (plus I felt bad for the poor guy). Luckily people mostly came and went so despite the limited seating I was able to get a bench seat next to the outlets. Throw in some wifi and this place was perfect.

The dessert was solid. I got the Dirty Hipster and it's about as good as I imagined oreos, nutella, and vanilla to be. It's very rich and creamy but I can't say it definitely worth the $5 price tag. Since it's nothing particularly new, I'm not sure if I'd come out of my way to get it again but I definitely enjoyed it. If I'm in the area looking for a place to kill some time, I'd definitely consider coming back.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Dirty hipster - nutella and oreos blended into vanilla froyo, made by order. 

Such a great concept of being able to blend toppings into your froyo. Tastes just like a frosty from Wendys or a blizzard from dairy queen but feels a lot healthier and lighter on the stomach. 

It can be a wait because there's usually 1 person working a shift. The employees work hard and the quality of the froyo makes it all worth while.
author: Jessica L.

description: I was walking by and tried their cookie monster flavor. It was a little disappointing and too sweet for my taste. Not sure if I would I back.
author: Van D.

description:
Upon their opening on Union Street SF, I walked in to congratulate them! It's a big achievement opening a new location, and I simply wanted to say congrats! I live literally next door and work in the customer service industry as well. The staff asked me why I came in to simply say Hi & Congrats and then started laughing in my face. I told them that I lived close and that it's rude to act so immature. 

The yogurt is mediocre at best. It's probiotic which is a huge plus but for 2 small 2 toppings, it's over $10. Not a bad price point just not worth it for the quality. 

The motto is "yogurt that's healthy", which I think they achieve but it's nothing special. 

The main improvement needs to start with the staff. I mean, you work in hospitality....
author: Clara D.

description:
I'm a self admitted frozen yogurt addict, so when I moved to the hood 8 months ago I told myself to steer clear, lest I wanted my wallet and waist to expand. 

I finally gave in this weekend and let's just say I see a bigger pants size in my future. I still love the concept of fro-yo where you can put your own toppings on and aren't limited on toppings but this place is still great. 

It's kind of like the mcflurry grew up and this is the end result- you either pick a preset combo (I went with Cookie Monster- vanilla with Oreo and cookie dough) or can pick your flavor and mix ins. 

Everything gets run through this machine so the result is that the toppings get blended up pretty fine and mixed throughout the yogurt. Obvious pro is that there's a bite of topping in every bite but the con is that there's no chunks of toppings like normal fro-yo. 

A small is a pretty generous serving and under $5 so that's a pretty great treat!
author: Elliott W.

description:
Wow!

Finally a fro-to place that tastes like regular ice cream AND is wayy healthier!

I came in to test the waters and was pleasantly surprised. The service is wonderful and the people there are really down-to-earth.  I wanted the peanut butter cup but the lady accidentally made Party in My Mouth.  She was about to
Make the Peanut Butter Cup but I just took it cuz t was basically what I wanted but didn't have chocolate chips; it had PB and Oreos.  I told her I would take it if she could just top me off with chocolate chips and she was so sweet about it.

As for the taste, wowza! It tasted like regular ice cream but I didn't feel overly full after eating, which was fantastic.  Definitely will return, especially because it's next to my favorite coffee shop, Saint Frank :)
author: Monica J.

description: This is a cute shop serving amazing rice pudding and frozen yogurt. I always come here after my dinner in the area. I really like their vanilla bean as well as the cinnamon rum raison rice puddings. They are rich in flavors but to my standard, not too sweet. I usually get a small one since that's the perfect amount for me. Once I tried size-medium, and I could not finish cos it was too rich in the end.
author: Clare L.

description:
Could I file a complaint here against an employee who was rude, unprofessional and maybe racist? 
I was refused by the staff from sitting and eating in the shop. Came in at 8:54pm tonight and ordered a small rice pudding. I asked for half and half and was told cup was too small so that wasn't possible. Had it done before but ok. Pudding was slapped into cup very sloppy with pudding spilling over. No wiping or apologies. 
Never said I wanted the rice pudding to go. The lady at the registered assumed and when I proceed to take a seat to enjoy my rp, she told me I couldn't sit and eat because they were going to clean up and close at 9:30. Mind you it's only 9pm. I stated that and all she said was they were cleaning up. Again no apologies. If it was 10 min till closing, I would understand. Would have made a bigger deal but didn't want her to ruin my night. No one should tolerate this kind of behavior from a staff that is being paid thanks to consumers! 
Manager, please take corrective action and re-train your employee on business and serving etiquette.
author: Hanah P.

description: Loving Cup is my current froyo go-to spot until I find a place that serves regular tart yogurt (proving to be quite difficult for some reason). I always go for a small Peanut Butter Cup because it reminds me of Moose Tracks ice cream. It's delicious and the line goes by fairly quickly!
author: Sarah B.

description:
Ok, I am OBSESSED with this place. 

The frozen yogurt is amazing, they make the mix on the spot and it tastes so natural.

The place is small, it has a few chairs but it doesn't bother me because I usually grab Raspberry vanilla frozen yogurt and then I go to Saint Frank coffee that is right next to Loving Cup.
author: Nathaly M.

description:
I only tried the Cinnamon Rum Raisin rice pudding, and I thought it was amazing. In fact, it was everything I expected AND MORE! Creamy, rummy, raisiny, and not overly sweet - my dream come true. 

If you like rum raisin ice cream from Häagen-Dazs, you'll LOVE this rice pudding. And don't forget to add extra rum-soaked raisins!
author: Cora L.

description:
I've tried rice pudding before from Rice to Riches in NYC and wasn't a fan. So forgive that for all the years you've existed in SF, I had no urgency to give Loving Cup a shot. 

Finally walking by, I decided to give it a taste - the Cinnamon Rum Raisin was a winner. Not too sweet, or too much cinnamon. Texture wasn't too thick or watery! The Cookies and Cream one tasted exactly as per titled too. 

I'm glad Loving Cup was able to change my mind about rice pudding. I'd come here again for a another little treat, post gym haha.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Loveeee this place for their rice puddings! :) Specifically, their lemon vanilla rice pudding which is just faintly sweet - just as I like! The lemon flavor isn't overpowering and the rice gives it great texture! 

Also love that you can customize your frozen yogurts and they have stamp cards!
author: Leilani Y.

description: So delicious and not too expensive! Anything with Oreo is a winner! I love their creative combos. Great for an inexpensive date night!
author: Amanda A.

description: So this is a low 4-star review. I thought about making it a 3-star, and it would solely have been for one reason: because I waited almost 20 minutes for my froyo. Don't get me wrong; the flavors and the options here are great. I ordered the turtle chocolate ice cream, and I sampled the mint chip, dirty hipster, and the Oreo options from the people I was with. Every flavor was great. However, having to wait that long in an uncomfortably narrow hall almost made it not worth it. At one point, I was so annoyed by how many people kept trying to shuffle past me that we talked about leaving. Great food, but definitely not strong on the business side. This place needs to get much bigger, or hire a few more people to handle how crazy long the lines are. I won't return again unless it's in the off-hours (but, I will return).
author: Saira R.

description: I stumbled into this place when I took my daughter up to grad school in SF. We were looking for dessert near our hotel and just got in under the 9 pm closing. I had the Brian Boitano, which is a vanilla base with blueberries and coconut mixed/swirled in and now I have a hard time not going there if I am in SF! Please come to Southern CA!
author: Brooke A.

description: Simple and delicious! The store is super cute and modern. Although small, it is cozy and the staff are friendly. I ordered a raspberry froyo w/ vanilla base and a topping of oreos to share with my boyfriend. You start off choosing vanilla or chocolate base, then what you want to add in, then what toppings you want (either mixed in or on top). They also have premade combinations for you to try out. Everything is made fresh on the spot and they use fresh fruit instead of random syrup flavoring! I really loved my cup :)
author: Alicia W.

description:
I'm amaze because they have different flavors rice pudding. From rum and raisin to coconut and cookies and cream. You can create your own yogurt. You add whatever toppings you like. They have sitting area so you can chill with your friends. 

Food:4/5
My cookies and cream rice pudding was amazing. I'm not a big fan of rice pudding. But I really like this one. It's not too sweet and have a good amount of flavor. Taste fresh and they use natural ingredients. My friend got chocolate yogurt with jr. mints and chocolate ganache. That taste pretty good too. He complain that everyone got bigger portion because everyone's yogurts stands high and his looks like it got cut off half way . 

Service 3/5
Not sure if they are being racist. Every non-Asian got help quickly and the yogurt looks amazing . My friend and I had to wait to just order. One of the person who making the yogurt had to come and apologize because there were no cashiers when I was ready to order. The person who apologize was Asian too. Little iffy about coming back now. Maybe bad timing but still. You can't step away when we were in back of this White couple. 

Food was ok but service seems terrible. Don't think I will come back unless my friends never try it before.
author: Miri L.

description: Very inconsistent. If is a long line and the employees are rushing so you get a pretty bad product and half of it stays in the machine because they don't have time to get everything out. Also very inconsistent in the amount of "toppings", of course when they put more is more tarty. They should use some kind of measuring tool to incorporate the same amount of fruits, peanut butter or whatever it is every time. Not so clean eather
author: Patricia W.

description:
First time trying Rice Pudding, the medium size was way too much for 1 person. I ended up having the other half for breakfast. 

Tried the smoothie, very nice n not super sweet at all surprisingly 

On my next visit, I tried the froyo dirty hipster. Hmm Abit too sweet for my taste ..
author: Hester D.

description:
Loving cup is a cute little boutique dessert place. They serve hand mixed frozen yogurt, rice pudding and smoothies. They have seating for five on these small stools- hilariously, only comfortable for four to sit at a time. They also offer water in snow cone containers so you can't put it down anywhere (easy clean up for them?). 

Boyfriend ordered a mango tango smoothie. It had potential, but was made from a very green unripe mango, which we could taste (and feel the fibers). It was kinda gross, but cool that it was a fresh mango. If they used a ripe mango it would have been perfect! This coupled with an already sour/tart pineapple juice, probably wasn't a good idea. 

The dude at the cashier was really nice, though, and let me try all the rice puddings! Lemon had a very strong lemon flavor, which I like, but it was so sweet- I really can't take more than a bite! Then the other flavors all melded together for me. I couldn't really taste the Madagascar vanilla after that. The bitter chocolate was nice, but not enough for me to want a whole cup of it. I think my favorite flavor would probably be the cinnamon rum raison, but they were nearly out. It was really cool of them to let me try them all- the rice pudding just wasn't my thing. I would have probably liked a tiramisu flavor if that were available. My friends each got a cup of the cookies and cream. 

Tips: They have a punch card if you go often. Also for parking, there are two 30 minute parking spots right in front of the store, so hope one of those is available. Consider if the fruit smoothie you are ordering is in season before ordering.
author: Tiffany W.

description: So yummy! I want to try everything! Just a little pricey (understandable, because you get to customize it and they make if for you). Otherwise great!
author: H K.

description:
This place is amazing. Probably one of the most unique and delicious frozen yogurt/dessert shop that I've been to (and I've been to a LOT). I love the uniqueness of swirling toppings into frozen yogurt in order to customize your treat. I didn't try the frozen yogurt when I went, but I will have to come back and have some! I heard the small size is plenty. A super good deal for your $3.75.

What I'm really raving about is the rice pudding, which is just fantastic. I love rice pudding, but in the past, I've only really had rice pudding at Indian restaurants, which don't include much customization. I will say though that if you're not a fan of typical rice/tapioca pudding consistency, you'll probably won't like the rice pudding here either. There were six flavors of rice pudding when I went on a Friday night, and all of the flavor combinations sounded so appetizing. I wound up sampling the Lemon Vanilla, Coconut, and Cookies & Cream and loved all of them. The Lemon Vanilla reminded me a lot of a lemon yogurt, while the Coconut had delightful coconut pieces mixed into the pudding. 

I was in the mood for something more flavorful, so I bought a small size of the Cookies & Cream rice pudding, and my cup was overflowing with Oreo-cookie-goodness. The rice pudding itself has the most perfect texture - not too creamy but decadent enough to feel like you're indulging in a delicious treat. I also feared that the pudding would be too sweet if I got the a flavor like Cookies & Cream, but I was surprised by how refreshing and light this pudding was. Ideal amount of sweetness that isn't too overwhelming. I absolutely loved the little pieces of Oreo cookie that weren't completely blended into the pudding.

I will definitely be back to Loving Cup if I'm ever close to Polk St. If you are a fan of rice pudding, this place will be heavenly.
author: Sheila D.

description:
The yogurt is OK. It's not my thing, but I know when it's OK... I wish they offered some non-fat. I mean, why else have frozen yogurt 'cept to fool yourself you're making a healthy choice?  And by the way, just because they didn't take out the fat doesn't mean it's gourmet either. It's just a bad choice for an indulgent moment. But I'm never coming back here, so it's OK. You go for it...

It's worth checking out the major attitude behind the counter. I asked for toppings, pointed to the toppings, and the girl said there were no toppings. Apparently that's not what they're there for. What? LOL. She said they only use toppings for the "base". So I opened up Yelp, pointed to the photos of their yogurts with toppings (at this point laughing in disbelief and anger) and she looked at me blankly. Seriously she was in a coma after that. I asked for a napkin and I thought she was going to cry or fall down and take a nap. It was weeeird.
author: Pamplemouse L.

description:
Oh my oh my oh my ... soooooooo good and definitely exceeded my already ultra-high expectations! Had this place bookmarked for the longest time before leaving for our SF vacation.

If you plan to walk, be in for a hilly hike. It definitely justifies the dessert consumption haha. We ended up splitting a small of their coconut rice pudding and semi-sweet chocolate chip rice pudding. Both complimented each other well, one being added texture the other more flavor. If I had to choose though, the coconut would be my favorite - light, smooth, soft, and addictive. Seriously I'm still thinking about it right now. It does not have that grocery taste of coconut or rice pudding. Rather it's refreshing and will put a smile on your face.

Why can't you be in Southern CA ... more secifically SD!
author: Carlin T.

description: I do not like yogurt, however Loving Cup is just amazing. My husband and I will come here when we feel like splurging on something sweet, but healthy. Because we have our own differences with flavors, I tend to always go for a small cup of vanilla mixed in with peanut butter chunks and blueberries. Prices are a bit high for what you get, but at the end of the day your body will thank you for this healthy and tastey option.
author: Tracy C.

description:
Closes 15 minutes before 930pm. Honestly used to be a place to frequent, but now just kinda sucks. 

Workers were very rude as well.  The two workers from a few months ago were much better.
author: Jay S.

description:
This place when it first opened had stellar service and tasty products. It was the first place that converted me into liking rice pudding. But service got increasingly rude. Really rude. I live around the corner and frequent the coffee shop next door and the gym two doors down. All but one of the employees taking the order never (that is not an exaggeration) say, "Hello, how are you? How can I help you? What can I get for you today? Thank you!" I have been there every week lately and these common expressions of courtesy are just not said. I'm always polite (also having worked in service) and while I finish each transaction with a thank you to the cashier and the froyo maker, they do not say Thank you in return. The froyo makers SLAM or downright TOSS your food onto the counter. 
A few days ago, I got another winter spice froyo which is their current promotion. I asked the employee making it if I could get the spices as a topping (he was not making any other orders, no one was behind me in line), he responds "What?!" I repeat my question. Again he goes, "What?!" I repeat again. He gets the cinnamon and slams it onto the counter.  Way to go for customer service for people who spend their $ here.

The formulations for the rice pudding have also changed. Less spices, raisins if the Cinnamon Rum Raisin, less flavor.

Some time ago, I got my fave flavor and the ladles were laying flat in the dish. The employee took my cash, made an ick face, having to grab a sticky ladle handle and then returned it to the dish. That's a health code violation and I decided to throw away the medium size rp. Not worth getting sick over.

Also, what happened to the compostable spoons? Why aren't they using compostable lids? It's unethical for businesses to open with greenware and then downgrading to disposable plastics once even consumers enter. (I leave spoonless and use a spoon at home, tho that's not an option for most guests.)

I still like the froyo. I'll still come for evening desserts. The place does well bc there are no other dessert spots in either direction open late, the closest being the boba tea spot on Polk/Broadway. But the declining flavors and horrid, rude, ungrateful  customer service and ungracious social behavior take away from the potential goodness and one leaves feeling less satisfied.  This is not a place that offers service with a smile or thanks.

I thought a lot (for a few years) before writing this review. I didn't want to post for each rude encounter. I even took a break from here for about 6 months due to everything above before I succumbed to my sweet tooth for carbs and dairy. I can't resist when it's nearby and open late. While I try hard to not write negative reviews online bc everyone is out trying to create success, the ongoing behavior here will hopefully be rectified someday. 

ps. The matcha froyo is good thanks to the powder.
author: S L.

description:
I can't eat dairy, so unfortunately I couldn't try any of their famous fro-yo.  Plus, their dairy-free fro-yo is made with frozen bananas, which also upsets my stomach!  So sadly I couldn't try that either.  Also I think all their rice pudding is made with milk... I wish they could have made their rice pudding with rice milk or almond milk!

Instead, I just got a frozen strawberry lemonade, which was tasty.  Just basic lemonade blended with frozen strawberries.
author: Mia N.

description: I'm obsessed with Loving Cup. I live in the South Bay so whenever I go up to SF, I always look forward to eating frozen yogurt from Loving Cup. My brother and I love the Dirty Hipster which is vanilla yogurt with nutella and oreo as well as the Cookie Monster which is cookie dough and oreo.  We always struggle with which size cup to get because we don't want to hate ourselves for eating too much sugar but we just end up regretting not getting larger cups (there have been many times we have considered buying more through delivery). If you haven't been to Loving Cup you are doing yourself a disservice so definitely make this a go-to place as soon as possible :)
author: Radhika G.

description: I got the dirty hipster, it was so good. Shout out to Joey Li, best employee there, if you ever see her there remember to tip
author: Donald C.

description:
I enjoy those build-your-own type of eateries, which is exactly what Loving Cup is. I also like how it's a healthier alternative to ice cream or any other dessert for that matter. As advertised, their froyo are "all natural, fat-free, and made with live active cultures".  

The toppings or blend-ins rather that are available are different to what you usually find at most froyo joints. I ordered the vanilla + salted caramel, which I really like. Unfortunately, I do not recall what my other two friends got, but I do remember trying their's and liking it. My one friend was not in the mood for froyo so she ordered a smoothie instead, which is nice to have as an option as well. 

The line can build up pretty quickly but moves pretty quickly, too. The workers are friendly and do give their suggestions when asked. There are limited seats. So, best to just grab and go and enjoy your froyo while walking the streets of SF.
author: Heather S.

description:
For years now, I have grown out of my frozen yogurt phase. 
I used to be obsessed with self serve frozen yogurt but my heart had eventually moved on. 
Therefore, when my sister suggested going to Loving Cup, I can't say that I was super excited. 
However... this yogurt is so good! 

I got the Vanilla frozen yogurt with bananas and pistachio mixed in. 

First of all, I love bananas. 

Secondly, the yogurt was so creamy! A lot of frozen yogurt places have bits of crystalized ice in it, which keeps it from being a smooth consistency. 
Loving Cup's yogurt was perfect.

If you're in the area and you're craving ice-cream but looking for a healthier alternative, Loving Cup is your place!
author: Kelly C.

description:
I've been to Loving Cup for their bread pudding, but this was my first time trying their frozen yogurt - and I have to say, it was amazing!

I haven't been to the typical froyo, self-serve-and-add-toppings places in years, so this was was a refreshing twist: choose a base, choose toppings, and they blend it all together for you on the spot.

Loving Cup has a board of recommended flavor combos, but I decided to do my own thing with strawberry and Oreo (because cookies and cream foreverrrr), medium size. Bonus points (not really) from the employee who helped me, as she said that was the first flavor combo she tried before working there ;)

Within a couple of minutes I had a fresh cup of frozen yogurt in my hand. Not only was the color gorgeous, but the flavors melded so nicely together and it wasn't too sweet! It certainly explained why I've passed on regular froyo for this long, so many places have that artificial taste and colors that make you wonder in what country do neon pink strawberries grow.

This was exactly the opposite: REAL fruit (freeze dried strawberries) meant real and strong flavors. I could easily taste and see the bits of Oreo mixed throughout the frozen yogurt. Texture was good, but a bit icy at the beginning, which I think was from the strawberries.

A gem of a place and I'll definitely be back!

Notes:

- Healthy portion sizes! Prices include 1 topping, with $0.75 for each additional - and there's 25 to choose from. With two toppings, it was $5.50 for a medium size.

- They have a rewards system/stamp card! 10 stars gives you a free small rice pudding or frozen yogurt ($3.75 worth).

- According to the sign, their frozen yogurt is pro-biotic, and I'm all for helping my gut while eating dessert.

- They have a rotating flavor of the day, if you're feeling adventurous.

- Yes they accept credit cards, and use Square.

- A few seats, but seems like mostly a to-go spot. Saw a few customers come in and order a bunch of rice pudding and/or frozen yogurt to take on the road.
author: Vicky F.

description:
If you're ever craving rice pudding this is the place to go! I absolutely LOVE the lemon vanilla rice pudding, the combination of the two is perfection.

I've been coming here for close to 2 years now and I've tried a bunch of things. The frozen yogurts are good but I still prefer the ride puddings. Lemon vanilla and Madagascar vanilla bean are my go to. The place has long lines but it's totally worth it. If you plan on visiting this place post dinner be ready to wait a good 10-15 mins in line to get your order. The line often goes right out the door while people wait in the freezing cold for some frozen yogurt, sorta ironic.

The place is super cute but a little tiny. You got to single file it while waiting in line and often bump into people while trying to leave the place. I do often wish they had more than two people serving all the customers would make the line go much quicker!
author: Manasvi S.

description: This place is perfect for a date. Just imagine eating a bowl of Cinnamon Toast Crunch cereal and the milk is formed into a froyo that you and your date gush about how this place brought back childhood memories.
author: Monica Colleen D.

description: I'm not a huge fro yo person, but I LOVE LOVE LOVE loving cup! Vanilla with toffee and nutella is my go to. I also love that their fro yo is made from grass fed milk, that's  hard to find and SO much better than most typical modern dairy.
author: Kim B.

description: Oh em gee. This frozen yogurt. Incredible. Try one of their Fro-Yo favorites. I got lucky and this place was within a block of my hotel while in town. It's the perfect cool treat after walking SF's hills.
author: Olivia D.

description:
I really like this idea. I'm a huge fan of rice pudding, so when I was yelping desserts in the area and saw a rice pudding shop, I knew I needed to go. 

There are a bunch of different flavors -- coconut, chocolate chip, vanilla, lemon, etc. I tried a few flavors and asked if I could get more than one in a cup. I saw a picture from another yelp user with multiple flavors sectioned out. The guy said that I could.

I meant to choose lemon, coconut, and chocolate chip, but I mistakenly said vanilla instead of lemon. I know, I'm a freak. That was probably a good thing, though, because instead of portioning them out side by side like a pie chart, he piled the flavors all on top of each other. In the end, they all mixed together and it was hard to differentiate. I got vanilla, coconut chip. If I had gotten the lemon, that might have tasted strange as a mix.

The guy helping me was also acting as if he wouldn't be sad if I jumped off a bridge either, so I have to say, customer service is not exactly friendly. 

I came and tried, but I probably won't return.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Rice pudding and ice cream wasn't anything special. The dirty hipster was a blend of vanilla ice cream with Oreos and Nutella: it was pretty good but couldn't it started getting really heavy halfway through. Furthermore, couldn't taste the Oreos so it ended up tasting like Nutella ice cream. 

Cookie and creme rice pudding was an interesting concept but I realized it's just not my thing. It tastes like cold porridge with mushy pieces of Oreos. Not sweet at all. Maybe worth a taste but not really my cup of tea.
author: David H.

description:
Just thinking of Loving Cup makes my day. It is always a perfect treat after a healthy dinner on Polk St. I go way too often....so much, that the staff now knows my order. If I wasn't at work, I would probably walk there right now!

I mainly now get the frozen yogurt with mix-ins after learning that they do not make their rice pudding in house. 

They also come up with really fun seasonal specials. 

Love this place!
author: Laura D.

description:
My friend asked me to join Whole30 with her. 30 days of no added sugar? No thanks. 

Despite my lactose intolerance, I'm an ice cream addict. And I live only a few blocks away from Loving Cup. Dangerous indeed.

I've got nothing but love for Loving Cup. Last night I got to try both the cookies & cream rice pudding and the vanilla soft serve with Nutella and English toffee. (Not by myself, I wish.)

And it was so good. I couldn't decide which one I liked better! The rice pudding rocked my boat because it wasn't too sweet, but the soft serve quickly became addicting too. The consistency was awesome: thick and creamy. There are so many mix-ins (I'm glad they have almond butter!) and flavors to choose from, so you can customize your own delightful treat. :)
author: Valerie L.

description: I got the coconut rice pudding - so yummy! The ambiance is pretty cute and well and people are friendly. There was a bit of waiting on Friday night, but not too bad.
author: Namrata J.

description: Growing up Nica-Irish American in SF, I was practically suckled on rice puddings. It was nice and rich, but not crazy thickened like my grandma's. It was made from Arborio rice (different than my granny's) and was not starchy but still sweet. It had the nutmeg/cinnamon flavoring that made it wonderful, although it was cold, rather than warm. This is necessary. I really liked it.
author: Kevin F.

description: I don't even like froyo and this is amazing. Doesn't taste like froyo but like GELATO. I don't understand how it's nonfat - I've tried all sorts of combos but nutella & pretzels is my fav. And coconut rice pudding is SO GOOD. Been to loving cup like 200+ times by now. LOVE IT SO MUCH.
author: Arla x.

description:
I came here to eat frozen yoghurt. I might not be used to it that they mix the toppings with the frozen yoghurt. I did not like that a lot, to be honest. 
Besides that, the quality is great.
author: Victoria G.

description: This place is insanely good. Quite possibly the best frozen yogurt I've ever had, and I've had a lot. They can make just about any flavor you could want, it's quick, and it's delicious. My personal favorite is banana and peanut butter with the vanilla base. Perfection.
author: Iris M.

description:
Nice place. Cozy. Good fro-yos. 
Workers are friendly- especially Justin. He was very patient while I was trying to choose what to order. 
Everything is great here except for the customers. Many snobby and rude gals walked in throughout my visit.
author: Stormtrooper N.

description: Loving Cup has a menu of classic favorites, as well as a list of ingredients you can choose from to blend into your treat. I'm one of the weird ones - I like to mix gummy bears and toffee with my froyo. I was so excited to order my usual, and I wasn't disappointed. The vanilla frozen yogurt is sooo good, without the sticky sweetness that most places serve. They blend the ingredients right into the froyo, which made it taste much better than having separate chunks (my gummies were topped on after the blending). Our server was the only one working when we swung by at 5pm on a Sunday- he was very friendly, patient, and efficient. There isn't much seating inside, but Polk St. is so charming so I recommend strolling down the street with your treat and checking out the bookstore and just people-watching. I'm kicking myself for not trying the rice pudding, so I'll be back soon!
author: Tanya B.

description:
Love the concept - 

I was watching Girls on HBO and they were at some rice pudding place in NYC that served like 25 different kinds of rice pudding - sounded amazing. So then I looked at this place and wanted to go.

In a total fluke I was with some girlfriends the very next night who wanted to have dinner on Polk street a block away so BAM, I knew what we were having for dessert.

Sadly this place only has about 4-5 kinds of rice pudding, the gal let me taste 2 of them, they were okay, but my girlfriend really recommended the Yogurt sundae things where they mix them to order. now this WAS intriguing.  I got oreo and salted carmel with peanuts and pretzels I think.  (we had a few cocktails at dinner).  Of the 3 we ordered, everyone voted mine best, and it was good. But for my money the absolute best frozen yogurt in the city is at Souvla with those baklava crumbles and rose syrup.

They are opening a Souvla on Divisidero soon! hurrah
author: Amy W.

description: It's expensive but the flavors are so good esp with all the different toppings you can mix in. It's a bit far for me to get to but whenever I come to this area I get froyo here, I've also tried their smoothies. Cute place and the people who work there are really nice :)
author: Alison C.

description: I've had Loving Cup three times now and it has never tasted good. The frozen yogurt is overpriced and the service is HORRIBLE. I asked for a sugar cone on top of the froyo and the worker gave me (at max) 6 sprinkles of a sugar cone. The worker also made me pay an extra dollar for that.
author: Allyssa B.

description:
Perfect little afternoon treat!

Popped in here once and there was no wait. The staff was friendly and recommended the Dirty Hipster, which is their vanilla based froyo blended on the spot with nutella and oreo. Really yummy! The texture was smooth and the consistency of the froyo was pretty firm (which I prefer!) Not overly rich/sweet so you feel a little less guilty about indulging ;) Only con is that parking is pretty impossible in the area.
author: J C.

description:
3 stars for the fro-yo, 2 stars for the ridiculously long time it takes to actually get it.

They need to come up with a better way of getting this stuff made and it customers - it looks labor intensive and we waited literally 28 minutes, far longer than it took to eat it. When we got it it was half frozen, probably because the girl was rushing through it since she had 20 orders waiting and it was already past closing time. 

Wouldn't come back
author: Sarah G.

description: I decided to visit the Polk location after trying it in the marina. I was very disappointed to see the attendant put my cup upside down on top of the register then again upside down on the counter. Really? Take some care and use some sense. Of course both locations does not fill the cup. A lot of air gaps
author: Constance M.

description:
Minus 1/2 * - Vegan Option: Sub in frozen bananas in lieu of the frozen yogurt.  As you can imagine, it tastes like slimy banana paste and only compliments select mix ins.  A soy option would make more sense.

Minus 2 * - Loyalty Program:  After purchasing 9 desserts, you get a small one free.  Caveat: it's for a small cup with ONLY ONE mix-in.  Thus, there is a charge for ALL suggested options listed on the menu.  It is a very insincere expression of gratitude to their regulars.

Loving cup is at 2.5 *, which rounds up to 3.
author: Amy J.

description: Took a stroll from FiDi to Loving Cup and it was worth the walk! I tend to be plain Jane and stick with the coconut or Madagascar vanilla bean, both great choices! They may have seasonal flavors as well. This evening I saw, pecan praline, cookies and cream, bitter chocolate chip (basically rice pudding with mini chocolate chips mixed in) and cinnamon with rum. If you're feeling adventurous, go ahead and try out their selection of flavors but if you want to stick to something simple, coconut and Madagascar vanilla bean will satisfy that sweet tooth craving.
author: Diana L.

description:
I tried their pudding. The coconut is perfect with just the right amount of flavor and texture. The flavor comes from the coconut shavings (a warning for those who aren't a fan). It's not too sweet which I enjoy.

The cookies and cream one tasted a lot like oreos with a squishy texture if you're okay with that.
author: Monica V.

description: Really unique!  Choose a base flavor, choose your toppings and they blend them together.  Tasty!  Small size is big!
author: Jonathan R.

description: As a ice cream enthusiast and frozen yogurt hater, I have to admit that Loving Cup is so tasty and worth the long wait in line. I was skeptical at first given my preference for ice cream, but the way Loving Cup blends the toppings into the frozen yogurt truly creates something remarkably delicious. You can't go wrong ordering from the menu. I've been slowly trying to make my way through their list. My favorites that I always return to are the Cookie Monster and Thin Mint. So tasty!! Thank you, Loving Cup, for changing my mind about frozen yogurt.
author: Frances V.

description: Ahhh...found this place on yelp while driving through SF. Had the banana bread frozen yogurt and it was hands down the best froyo I've had!!! Wish they had locations closer to the east bay!
author: Joleen D.

description:
I try to avoid negative giving negative reviews and instead just stop going to businesses, but I still very much enjoy the yogurt at loving cup. That said, consistency of "service" and the end product have been really spotty lately, so providing some feedback for the management/owners. 

Firstly, I live just around the corner and there have now been a couple occasions where I'd show up ~30m before they close and I'm "the last one for the night." While I'm happy that I've made the cut every time, it's ridiculous to be turning people away 25m before you close because you don't want to stay a little longer to finish the job. The first time this happened, I estimate they turned away ~12 people, which is probably only ~$75 of revenue that night, but this isn't an isolated event and lot of those 12 poeple won't be back. In my opinion, it doesn't matter what the queue is at that point. It's frozen yogurt and you can handle it. If this is a directive from management to cut it off to avoid overtime, then that's on them, but I highly doubt it. Totally understand this isn't so black and white and a large group coming in 5m before they close is not cool (turn them away), but this was way ahead of schedule and it's not like they're firing a grill back up to cook something.

Secondly, I'd never noticed in the past how they'd put the yogurt and ingredients through the machine twice to fully mix everything until they stopped doing it regularly. About half the time I go now, they dump everything in and put it through once, so all the ingredients are concentrated at the top of the yogurt. This would be fine if you were ordering actual toppings or wanted half of what you ordered and half vanilla, but the whole point of Loving Cup is to mix everything and it does change the flavor profile. Feels ridiculous even complaining about it, but its such an easy thing to prevent and takes another 10 seconds (that they had the last two times I'd gone as no one else was in line). It's a simple product that's pretty hard to screw up, so please stop being lazy :-).

Also, FYI as of my last visit yesterday, they are no longer giving out stamp cards. I don't really care and am not complaining about this, but still found it odd.

Normally: 5 stars for the smiles and simple and tasty product
Lately: 2 stars for lazy service and 3 stars for the sub-par product
author: David N.

description:
