I came here on a chilly SF winter night because...why not?  At first glance, this place seemed like a cool concept.  You can choose your own frozen yogurt and toppings and they will mix it for you like Cold Stone, except with a machine.  If I do come back again, i'll probably opt for that option.
 
This review is, however, for the Land of Milk and Honey Shake.  I ordered it because its one of my favorite ice cream flavors but the shake did not resemble any of the words in the name.  It tasted exactly like a banana protein shake and I ended up throwing most of it away because I was THAT DISAPPOINTED!  What a waste of $6!
author: Dean W.

description: Wow. The cashier at Loving Cup added her own tip to each of our purchases, and signed for them herself... which was later realized upon checking our bank accounts. This has never happened to me before! Would not recommend going here, unless you're using cash, very disappointed because the ice cream is delicious.
author: Molli W.

description:
I love this place! Such a great neighborhood gem. I love their frozen yogurt, especially vanilla, raspberry, coconut.  It's not always consistent because with different staff making it.  I do prefer my yogurt with all the toppings well blended smoothly together. Overall it's still super yummy.  I even got my friends hooked on it as well. Staff is nice and they would recommend you their best combination if you want something different and new. 

Also their coconut rice pudding is delicious. Yum!
author: Sandy B.

description:
If you're looking for a sweet, rich, and decadent pudding then come to Loving Cup. They also served custom blended frozen yogurt that is made to order. What not to love? 

I ordered myself the Madagascar vanilla bean and coconut rice pudding. My oh my was it incredible delicious. As for the frozen yogurt, I decided to go with vanilla base; mixing it with almond butter and raspberries. The result, a lively purple/red frozen mixture ready to be devoured. 

I really hope you give this place a try. It's really really really good. Trust.
author: Owie N.

description:
I'm a fan for sure! I was in the mood for rice pudding the other day and naturally, yelped it,

Yelp led me to loving cup and I was not disappointed. Froyo that you can customize and rice pudding that didn't give a lactose intolerant person a tummyache. 

I was so happies, the most popular froyo according to the cashier was nutella and strawberry (we got one). I got the mint chocolate chip nutella mix and loved it. Also got the oreo rice pudding and it was sooo good! 

We will def. be back, it's a tasty healthy treat for those who have the time to make it to the location. Also this was relatively close to Lombard street touristy spot!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
I'm in love! What a cute little store with some bomb ass rice pudding and froyo! Service is friendly and they put up with our group's needs to try every single flavor. They're known for their coconut rice pudding, so I got a small cup. They overflowed my cup! SO MUCH PUDDING, SO MUCH GOODNESS. It was incredibly filling and didn't feel like I was getting a sugar overload. My friends got froyo which I thought was pretty awesome to see that they mix the ingredients in instead of having the toppings right on top. I don't like my sweets having a salty flavor, but the caramel & sea salt worked well! 

I will be back for some more lovin :)
author: Denise L.

description: It's not bad, but it's basically a Cold Stone with frozen yogurt. They're not very generous with their portions, as the frozen yogurt barely breaks the plane of the cup (that might only bother me...oink oink). $4.50 for a small.
author: Annie L.

description: I'm really not that big of a fan of cold fruit desserts...but this was THE BEST STRAWBERRY slow-churned yogurt I've ever had. I was uncomfortably full from dinner and still enjoyed a taste of this! (Maybe I'm just fascinated by everything in SF since I'm from SoCal where I prefer fatty custard over normal ice cream) But it was soooo good when I got some during my visit! SUPER creamy and FRESH tasting [:
author: Diana P.

description: My friend kept on telling me how delicious this place was, so I finally gave in and tried it.  She was right! It was one of the best frozen yogurt places I've had, BUT I thought it was a tad bit pricey for my liking and if I remember correctly I paid around $6.  I do love though how you can customize what you want in your yogurt and how specialized this place is.  I got the vanilla base with espresso, english toffee, and pistachio and my friend got the chocolate base with espresso, english toffee, and pecans.  This was the perfect treat for a rare hot San Francisco day.
author: Breanne H.

description: Their Frozen Yogurt was fantastic, and we loved that the toppings are blended in! A hidden gem and we will definitely be back!
author: Melissa K.

description:
I noticed lots of people coming from the same direction all holding what looked like cups of ice cream. Intrigued, I followed these like a bread crumb trail and found Loving Cup. What a cute name! Loving cup is a fro-yo place but it's a bit different from other fro-yo places. 

The first step, you pick either a vanilla or a chocolate frozen yogurt base. The second step is you choose your mix-ins. The first mix-in is included, but after that there's a small fee. I was in a more fruity mood, so I decided to pick mango for my mix-in. I placed my order and paid with credit card - they use Square. The guy who took my order was really nice and he even asked me if I wanted a stamp card (buy 9 and get a small cup free!). 

So here, they use some kind of machine to really mix in your mix-in into the fro-yo. And the guy making it really had to press hard on the lever to make the yogurt come out! He must have a really strong right arm! Next to the machine, I saw all kinds of mix-ins in mason jars (cute!) and the guy would add in the mix-ins based on the order that came in. So it's kind of like made-to-order, instead of the flavors being pre-made. 

I thought the process was really cool, but my mango vanilla fro-yo didn't have a very strong mango flavor. I think he used real mango, but maybe it wasn't enough. The flavor was really light. The texture of the fro-yo was good though. 

They also sell rice pudding here - that also sounded really good and seems really popular. If I'm ever back I want to try that!
author: Sylvia K.

description: Rice pudding?!?! So unique. I tried it for the first time today, and I'd give it a 3.5/5. The sweetness is definitely more subtle and the texture is simply a hit or miss. If you like a pudding/porridge-like texture, then maybe this is your new go-to dessert. However, I didn't find it so appetizing. The frozen yogurt on the other hand was pretty good! I'd get that over the rice pudding.
author: Ranice L.

description:
With a name like Loving Cup, I couldn't resist walking in here. Something about frozen yogurt that always makes me feel as though I haven't completely annihilated my "diet" (I like to think I eat healthy for the most part...okay, I don't eat healthy at all, I just tell people I do, which is half the battle anyways), yet I still manage to cure my sweet tooth.

Honestly, I wasn't "wow-ed." I got the vanilla base with nutella and pistachio. I love the concept of mixing the frozen yogurt with the toppings, like Cold Stone, but it didn't hit the spot for me. The flavors were wonderful, but they didn't pick out the shells of the pistachios, so every couple of minutes, I'd be chomping on shells and would have to pick it out. It just made the experience unpleasant and a lot of work. Every other bite, I'd be particularly paranoid that I'd hit another shell and chip a tooth or something. 

I also tried the coffee shake, which was terrible. It was watery, yet unbelievably strong. I expected a thicker consistency that was fully blended, but it wasn't :(. Needless to say, I'm glad I only tried it and didn't get it. Love the flavor, just wish the texture was smoother, creamier, and thicker. 

I might give this place another shot, but I'm definitely steering clear of the pistachios and all the shakes next time around! However, I sampled their rice pudding and that was fantastic! Wish I got that instead after I got my fro-yo :(.
author: Vee B.

description:
Who doesn't love frozen yogurt blended with a variety of tasty toppings? 

For those of you who have a tough time making decisions, I recommend looking at the menu in advance. There are so many yummy combos to choose from! The first mix-in is on the house and after that each topping is 75 cents. I went with the vanilla base swirled with strawberries and Nutella. It tasted like fresh strawberry yogurt with a slight hint of Nutella. The combo was delicious and perfect for an afternoon treat. I did not have the chance to try the rice pudding, but it looked amazing. 

I'm happy to report that Loving Cup uses real organic yogurt, which they freeze in house. I only know of a handful of shops in the city that make their yogurt. Crazy right?! Surprisingly enough most frozen yogurt shops use a powder mix that doesn't even contain yogurt. I'm always happy to support a company that uses real ingredients over chemicals. I will definitely return!
author: Rachel S.

description: Went back a couple more times and tried some other combinations. FroYo was still good, but nothing like the combination I was lucky enough to stumble on in my first visit.
author: Peter M.

description:
A long line outside on a cold, Sunday night probably says it all already. Loving Cup is sublime!

What's good here:
-Make your own frozen yogurts
-Pre-designed frozen yogurts
-Rice pudding

My bf and I were waiting in line and wanted to do a create-your-own froyo. We decided on the Vanilla base, oreos, and nutella, and turns out, it was already pre-designed by them - also known as the "Dirty Hipster"! I loved the dirty hipster. All of ingredients are mixed in, to create a smooth froyo. It is simply sublime!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Loving cup is my new addiction! 

Whenever I'm in the area, I can not NOT stop by. You can add whatever you want, be creative, and get a frozen yogurt that still tastes good. 

I've had a raspberry + blueberry vanilla base yogurt which was splendid. It was really refreshing and you could taste bits and pieces of the raspberry. 

The other night I had the strawberry shortcake yogurt. It's mixed with strawberries and graham crackers. I was expecting it to be on the sweeter side but I was pleasantly surprised. It was perfect! 

Their rice puddings are undeniably on point as well. Get the bittersweet chocolate!! Usually there is only a couple of options unless you buy that party tub. And I was just looking at their website.. They have frozen yogurt pies?!?! Now I know what I HAVE to get for the next potluck. 

I want to try every single combination possible with the frozen yogurt. And now I also want to try every single rice pudding. Thank goodness I don't live near Loving Cup because otherwise I would be coming everyday.
author: Ingrid C.

description:
Such a great place for a treat.  Their hand mixed  yogurts are delicious.  I also recommend the rice puddings.  I know it sounds old fashioned but try it you'll like it!  
The owner (I think) Des is very friendly and keeps all three locations going a flowing.  Thumbs up!
The only thing is where are the red velvet cupcakes you used to sell?!?
author: Robert H.

description: I visited San Francisco for the weekend and I came across this lovely gem! Jeanette helped me out with sampling the rice pudding. They all tasted sooo good! I was surprised to find a place that sells all natural rice pudding and frozen yogurt. I had the Cinnamon Rum Raisin and Cookies and Cream pudding and I loved it! Jeanette was super friendly and genuine and I had a nice talking to her and learning about how they make their frozen yogurt! I'm so jealous we don't have a place like this in OC!
author: Camille P.

description:
This place is my favorite spot for dessert!!

Two words: RICE PUDDING! I have never found a dessert shop that served rice pudding before which is why Loving Cup is #1 on my list! They have about 4 or 5 rice pudding flavors and they are all sweet and creamy and fresh!

You can also create your own ice cream/frozen yogurt combinations which is so much fun! They have multiple and delicious flavors and toppings. Or you can choose creations from their menu!

The only thing they could improve on is the service. The staff isn't very friendly at times. The most disappointing moment was when I literally ran over there to try and get a cup of rice pudding before they closed. I got there 1 min before they closed, and they wouldn't let me come inside! I told them I just wanted rice pudding (which takes 5 seconds to put into a cup and give to me) and they still said no. I couldn't believe that they turned away a (loyal) customer for such a simple and quick request. If it was for their create-your-own-fro-yo, I would have understood since that takes more time and effort. But all they had to do was literally scoop rice pudding into a cup for me. Very disappointing.
author: Chisholm T.

description:
I came back to try their rice puddings, and it did it not disappoint. How do you do it Loving Cup? You guys hit the dessert category out of the ball park! I sampled the coconut, oreo, and cinnamon rum raisin. I personally liked the cinnamon rum raisin one best but the other flavors were delicious as well. What I loved about the cinnamon rum raisin was the combination of the comfort I got from the taste of cinnamon, the plumpness and burst of sweetness from the raisin, and the smooth texture of the rice pudding.

The whole thing was so thick and creamy and delicious that I was actually licking the bottom of the cup with my tongue down polk street. Weird? Maybe. But if you had the rice pudding from Loving Cup in your hand you'd be doing exactly the same thing. You can't go to polk street without stepping in here. Seriously.
author: Hana K.

description: Perfect end to a meal with friends. I mixed vanilla with salted caramel pretzels and gummies (because who eats ice cream without gummies). But the perfect salt and sweet to satisfy any cravings.
author: Lena N.

description:
"Mini me" wanted frozen yogurt, so I took him straight to Loving Cup!

Super cute spot, very friendly staff & really good frozen yogurt!

Love the creative names of what we ordered:
-Dirty Hipster: Vanilla Yogurt + Oreos + Nutella
-Monster: Vanilla Yogurt + Oreos + Cookie Dough

Will return to try more, including the rice pudding!
author: Geraldine R.

description:
I was looking for an afternoon snack from my visit to Saint Frank's and stumbled into this place. Loving Cup isn't life changing but DENG it's still pretty good!

Both the Vanilla Rice Pudding and the Vanilla Froyo with Oreos were both legit. That drill bit looking thing takes Froyo to a whole new level! The prices are a little on the high side but deservedly so. The Vanilla Rice Pudding was balanced and had a VERY NICE consistency (great body - not too thick and not to thin / liquidy). 

A must try if you're in the area but not exactly a destination location. I suggest grabbing brunch on Polk and swinging by here for some afternoon dessert. You won't regret it!
author: Chris W.

description:
I was told about this place but I never went because I thought "how good can frozen yogurt be?"  Ive had the frozen yogurt that comes from the machines before and it always tastes the same. 
I decided to drop by after lunch during a weekday so there was no line. Oh My God!!! Their frozen yogurt is soooo good!!!! I don't know what they put in it, but it doesn't taste like the machine yogurts. The frozen yogurt is refreshing, yummy, and doesn't make you feel like a fatty like ice cream does. Oh and the guy helping me was super nice as well! I saw they had a few other things there like rice pudding and I hope to try that in the future! Great place!
author: J C.

description: Favorite great in SF. I come here everytime I am back in the city still. The Dude Abides is heavenly!!
author: Add A.

description:
Menu was confusion to a newbie here. And it's not my first time here either, but maybe my 3rd time. Menu says the yogurt base is chocolate or vanilla so I thought those were the only ice cream flavor and u had to add the toppings and such, I was wrong. I picked chocolate and strawberry on a cone. It came with no visible looking strawberry but seemed like it was chopped up as part of the ice cream, very interesting. I loved the texture, it was very firm and well made. Many yogurt place served yogurt that are way too soft and I didn't like. Love the firmness of this a lot. The waffle cone was so fresh and crunchy, loved it. If I knew I would've added more toppings to my ice cream. 

The best seats would be the bar table up in the front. Great place for couples to come here forum engagement or wedding photo j was thinking. The name is cute "Loving Cup". Highly recommend.
author: Jenny L.

description: Amazing Froyo!! Lots of options, and ability to mix/match. They do rice pudding too, which is a nice alternative.
author: Jack B.

description:
This is probably my favourite place for frozen yogurt within the city. The fact that they actually mix everything up so you don't have to spoon the toppings off before getting to the bottoms of the yogurt like other frozen yogurt places! 
Choices are great! 

I always go for butter finger or simply pick out any toppings.
I do love picking banana and English toffee though!

They have amazing rice puddings too. Just delicious!
author: Alui L.

description:
Recently moving to Russian Hill, one of the main draws in the apartment listing was "is close to Loving Cup." I thought this was a silly thing to specify, but then I tried their froyo for the first time -- and I'm hooked. 

A great concept; they will blend basically whatever you want into delicious soft-serve froyo. There are tons of options of what types of fruit/chocolate/candy/etc you want to blend in. I was honestly overwhelmed by the vast selection of "choose your own" mix-ins, so I have tried some of the combinations that they recommend, and so far they have all been just superb!

Would highly recommend the Dirty Hipster (nutella and oreos) or the Cinnamon Toast Crunch (Cinnamon and graham cracker). 

Highly recommend, and will continue to be a regular customer here for as long as I am in the area!
author: Abby B.

description: This is my favorite thing. I'm obsessed. I've recently been having the vanilla with rainbow sprinkles and frosted animal crackers, but the "dirty hipster" w/ Nutella and Oreos is bomb as well.
author: Ana M.

description:
Finally some real frozen yogurt!
I tried lots of different places, and this is the real old style! Love it
author: Micol R.

description: I went here after Lemongrass and this place was a great post dinner dessert. Cool spin on soft ice cream and a great selection of add-on ingredients. I would recommend the cookie dough.
author: Andrew X.

description: I always thought rice pudding was super unhealthy but a small is a cute 195 calories. I came here around 3:30pm and the oreo cookie rice pudding was almost out but thank goodness I snatched some of the goodies cuz it didnt look like they were going to refill it. It was quite yummy so no complaints here. The rum raisin was good but not as good as the oreo. They also have some froyo that you can create and mix which also looked bomb but I thought only one fatass moment was good enough for the day.
author: Amy H.

description:
Loving Cup is my FAVORITE frozen yogurt place of all time! Very refreshing and the perfect texture because the ingredients are blended in! I wish all frozen yogurt places did that too. It makes a huge difference in taste.

This Loving Cup has less space than the one in Hayes Valley - there's only a few seats to sit at and no spots when I visited but the area is nice for walking around. There was no line on a weekend afternoon and like the other location the service was very friendly.

Ordered a small special mix they had for the day - vanilla yogurt with blended blueberries and banana ($4.50). It was AMAZING I should have gotten the medium size. Do yourself a favor and check this place out there's a reason they are so popular!
author: Linda X.

description: Terrible customer service. Hottest weekend of the year and I go running over to get there before they close. I got there with six minutes to spare and they refused to serve me because there were a few people already in line. Closing hours are when you close--not before. No apology and no accommodation even when I explained I had run over. Woman working there was super rude and unapologetic.
author: Ray M.

description: This place is really cute. We wanted to come in for the rice pudding but hated it. It was too sweet and definitely didnt appeal to us. The four stars are only for the frozen yogurt. It was absolutely delicious and perfect. Had the mocha chip and it was so so good!
author: Ashmita V.

description:
I got the cookies & creme pudding and the vanilla bean pudding! Goodness these were so delicious. They are really similar to Kheer (rice pudding). Kheer is a Pakistani dessert and it is literally the same concept. I love how they have different flavors. Next time I would go with the vanilla bean pudding just because the cookies & creme one got a little too chocolatey for me. 

Definitely going again next time I go to the city!
author: Saad A.

description:
Being in San Francisco there are alot of choices. We were craving something cold so we decided to go get ice cream. 

We ordered the medium vanilla with strawberry, chocolate chip, and pecans. Very refreshing and great strong flavors. We also got the medium vanilla with banana,  peanut butter, and granalo. A bit on the heavy side but very good flavors as well. Total for both was 12.50 which wasnt too bad

When you watch them make it its pretty entertaining. Will deff come back when Im back in the area.
author: Natalia R.

description:
I'm simply not "loving" this "cup" of rice pudding.  

Truth is I KNOW I CAN'T make a decent batch of rice pudding, that's why I came here so that they could help culinary challenged people like me by doing all the work so that I can hand over my hard earned money and be fed rice pudding.

Another true fact is that I like coconut almost as much as I like Horchata, and yet their coconut pudding just tastes like they dumped a bunch of dry coconut flakes in it.

You know the Asian dried coconut that you can get at any Asian Supermarket?

Yeah, that's the type of coconut they mixed into the rice pudding, with a touch of coconut milk.

Now I'm no Joel Robuchon or James Beard but heck, give me recipe for rice pudding and the ingredients, and I'm sure I can do the same if not better than this place.

That my fellow Yelpers, is not a compliment about this place.
author: Jack R.

description:
Say what?! RICE PUDDING?! Only 195 calories per small cup. Not bad! I love the rice pudding. Love the decor. The service is nice as well. This is my go-to place for rice pudding. I like the make your own frozen yogurt as well. It's nice. 

Cons: 
Trying to find parking
Trying to find a place to sit

but very worth it :)
author: Josie W.

description:
There aren't many places where you can find rice pudding but if rice pudding strikes your fancy, check this place out!  It's just the perfect consistency where it's not too runny or thick and the flavors don't overpower the actual dessert itself.

Rice pudding not really your thing?  It's okay, make your own frozen yogurt cup!  Mix and match flavors to your own liking and they'll mix up that delicious frozen goodness for you to enjoy right there on the spot.

Prices are slightly on the higher end of what you'd expect to pay, but it's definitely worth it~
author: Rica M.

description:
They have a unique way of making frozen yogurt that just makes you feel good about eating it! I opted for a small froyo, with a vanilla base and mango flavor -- but it's not an artificially flavored mango yogurt they mix in. In fact, they toss in chunks of fresh mango and mix it together with the vanilla yogurt base a few times using a special machine, and out comes a sorbet-like mango-vanilla froyo! Getting to the mango bites while eating is also a notable highlight. Also, you're allowed to choose one add-in (topping), and I chose gummy bears -- but, rather than putting the gummy bears onto the yogurt, they put the toppings in a separate cup for you to do so yourself. I think this is a great idea, because it reduces mess and gives you more freedom to snack the way you like. 
The service is also friendly and quick, though parking may be a bit tougher in the area, as it is near the popular Lombard Street.
author: Angelina H.

description:
Tried the coconut and vanilla rice puddings. Ended up splitting a vanilla rice pudding with a friend. It was good in the beginning, but ended up tasting a little bland near the end. 

I was just really in the mood for rice pudding, but will try their frozen yogurt blends and report back!
author: Michelle K.

description: AMAZING! The girl working was just lovely. The Organic Red Velvet cup cake is to die for. They don't have any flavored syrups but they make up for it beautifully with natural and organic ingredients!
author: Megan M.

description:
I unfortunately don't get the hype on this place. It's not terrible but was pretty unappetizing for my boyfriend and I. Sister said it was just "okay".

I really like and appreciate the concept but their frozen yogurt is just waaaay too dense and thick for my tastes. Usually when I think of frozen yogurt I think of a nice light and creamy texture but was not the case here.The flavor is lacking as well, I think they rely too much on mix-ins to compensate for bland yogurt.

While I'm not a fan of their frozen yogurt I'd still be open towards trying their rice pudding.
author: Melissa C.

description:
I came into this place expecting it to be like those yogurt joints that you find all over the bay area. However, this place is way cooler!

The instructions on the frozen yogurt is on the wall but I didn't know what tasted good together so I opted in to get one of their favorites; The Dude Abides (chocolate yogurt, almond butter, English toffee with bananas for extra cost).

The cost was about 3-4 bucks for a small. When my order came out, I was wondering where the bananas and toffee went. It turns out the toppings get incorporated in the yogurt! Good thing I didn't get gummy bears in there (my friend wanted gummy bears, gross). 

The frozen yogurt doesn't look like much but it packs a punch when you taste it. All the ingredients that go into it, you can actually taste in each scoop. As for the texture, it doesn't taste your regular frozen yogurt since everything gets blended in. It had a buttery and rich texture to it. 

I want to go back here NAO!
author: Anna H.

description: yum yum yum. great froyo, i love that you can get your toppings mixed in. there is usually a line though, be warned.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Absolutely delicioso. Recommend the dirty hipster which Oreo, Nutella, and cookie dough. This icecream is the bomb. They blend/press all the into their soft, creamy soft-serve ice cream
author: Kevin K.

description:
Strolled here with the family after an early Saturday dinner!

The frozen yogurt swirl looked so colorful and good, we had to stop by. I was also happy to see that it's made from organic ingredients.

For the yogurt, you choose a vanilla or chocolate base and then you add two other ingredients. I liked that they have a variety of ingredients and you can play around with it to get the texture and flavor you like.

We got the vanilla + strawberry & Nutella and it was pretty good. The texture was good, but I didn't think it was sweet enough (probably a good thing). It was good but it didn't wow me. I still liked it!

The place doesn't have much seating, there are 4 stools by the window, so you should take it to gom

I think I would go back to try other ingredients.
author: Sera P.

description: LOVE this place. Different flavors of rice pudding may seem unusual,  but they're great. My favorite is the lemon vanilla rice pudding, but all the flavors are good: chocolate chip, heath bar, oreo, etc. Their frozen yogurt is also scrumptious. I tend to get the vanilla base with Nutella, but smoothies are good too.
author: Ana G.

description: Loved the froyo. I had strawberry mango mixed in vanilla. So goood! Wanna buy a whole pint later.
author: Erika S.

description: I would never go back to this place. This is a late review, maybe a few years in the making, but I felt so strongly about hating this place That once I remembered the name I felt compelled to write a review.  The staff was super unhelpful. Basically we were looking at the menu and not one person bothered to ask if we needed help. And then they brought ice from next door and walked outside to inside the store with the ice fully exposed. It was just very unsanitary. But mostly the staff was just so  not about helping anyone. And it took FOREVER to get our order. Would definitely not go back, would definitely not recommend. I hope they go out of business.  Serves them right.
author: Am W.

description: I really liked my mocha chip fro yo but my small size was really skimpy and full of air pockets.  Really??? For 4.75!
author: Doreen F.

description:
5 Stars because..there's just nothing quite like it. The FROYO is good but the  rice pudding is THE BEST.

The rice pudding is unique and not heavy surprisingly. They offer many flavors and you can also ask for samples before making your purchase. 

Highly recommend it... it's a delicious, refreshing and hearty snack :)
author: Veronica S.

description: Today, I gave Loving Cup a second chance after boycotting my last experience that involved some of the worst customer service I've ever encountered. Today, will also be the last time I ever give this establishment my business. After spending a ridiculous amount of money for frozen fucking bananas, the incompetent girl working the machine dropped half of my dessert on the counter and just wiped it in the trash and gave me a half-empty (definitely not half-full) cup of frozen bananas. I asked them to re-make it and the man working was at least willing to do so, while the girl just stood around looking completely undeserving of a paycheck. That's what I get for trying to be healthy... From now on, I'll be having regular ice cream and bank my $2 up charge for bananas for my new, larger, pair of pants!
author: Sarah P.

description:
Honestly, this place was a little too hyped for what I got.
This place is a cute little shop and SF and i was really excited to try it.
I went kind of basic and just got the vanilla base with chocolate chips and sprinkles but I was just trying to get the feel and flavor of this place.
Now when I said it was basic, it really was just that.
It was a bland and basic flavor and that was it. I was really bummed out!
For the price I payed I would have much rather gone to my local shop or somewhere to get more quantity and better quality :/
author: Alexis B.

description: It's both fortunate and dangerous to live so close to the Loving Cup! I never actually liked rice pudding until I tried the Loving Cup - now the Oreo rice pudding here is one of my favorite sweet treats. I also love the frozen yogurt with all the mix in options, especially the vanilla with Nutella. The line can be long, but the staff are always friendly and working hard. A great addition to Polk Street!
author: Rose J.

description:
Vanilla with toffee.  Done.

So good it's not right.
author: Jessica F.

description:
I used to live around the corner from this shop and would walk up and down Polk almost daily, so I'm not sure why I never bothered to drop in. Clearly, I was missing out because I just tried the cinnamon rum raisin rice pudding tonight and it was delicious! Too bad I had just eaten Swensen's ice cream beforehand or I also would have ordered a cup of blended froyo, which looked incredible.

Despite the ridiculously long line, I'll be back to get my fat girl on and try the coconut rice pudding and froyo.
author: Suany W.

description:
I'm really confused how I've lived in SF all of my life, am in this area quite frequently and only today found out that this place exists! 

I was a little confused about the ordering process. Initially, I thought you pay per topping (or filling in this case), but you don't. You can chose either vanilla or chocolate and then add as many things as you want. I chose vanilla and added granola, cookie dough and Nutella. I wanted to add fruit but decided not to when I found out the fruit isn't fresh. However, my final product was delicious! I loved and finished every bite of it!

Service was great, the girl was very sweet. They charge a quarter if you're using a card. 

I'll be back!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
Pumpkin Pie seasonal flavor!!  Immediate 5 stars.

And WHAT??!! I just discovered they have frozen yogurt pies.  Ice cream cake is probably one of the best inventions, so frozen yogurt pie is easily up there as well.  I didn't know this existed 5 minutes ago, and my life is better now that I know this is available.  Definitely ordering this for my birthday and sharing it with everyone!

I always pick up a cup of rice pudding to share with a friend too - make anyone's day with a quick cup as you get your froyo fix =)
author: Ben K.

description:
Just like what they teach you in elementary school, reading really is a fun(damental) skill to have.  Whether you're reading up on a new travel destination, a DIY project, or yet another awesome Yelp review from that Mike L. guy (who I hear is pretty damn cool...), reading is quite handy.  That is, assuming you take advantage of it.  Unlike me...

At Loving Cup, customizing your order of frozen yogurt is really quite simple.  After choosing the flavor of non-fat frozen yogurt you want (vanilla or chocolate), you then pick whatever toppings for them to blend in with your froyo.  Easy enough.  Sadly for me though, I didn't see/read "blend in" on the wall and assumed the toppings were just lightly mixed in.  Whoops.  It wasn't until I saw my choices getting swirled together in their machine that I realized I had chosen a fairly random combination of ingredients - chocolate froyo, strawberries, and cookie dough.  I know, right?

Amazingly enough, my odd concoction turned out okay...which speaks to how good Loving Cup is.  Sure, my friend's more traditional combination turned out better (vanilla & strawberry), but I like to think of mine as being avant-garde (and not something a 12 year old would have ordered).  The chocolate flavor was nice and creamy without being too sweet, and the strawberries made for a natural match.  And the little bits of cookie dough?  Not bad, but I won't be repeating that particular mix of flavors again.

If frozen yogurt creations aren't your thing, their rice pudding is just as good, if not better.  Although I only sampled a bite, the Espresso Rice Pudding was terrific.  What's more? I'm not even a fan of rice pudding!  While it does suck how parking in the area can be pretty scarce, it might be a good thing for me.  If it was easy, I might come back a lot more often than I should.
author: Mike L.

description: Halleluja!! My prayers have been answered; the perfect yogurt shop has now been discovered. All the concoctions created here is sheer heaven. The menu can be pretty confusing.. First you select the base of your yogurt; either vanilla or chocolate. Did I mention that they're both NON-FAT?!?! Yes, guilt free...kinda. Then you add your guilty pleasures/mix-ins. They pretty much have everything your heart desires. I've tried vanilla yogurt with blueberry and banana....WINNER! Also the "Salty Dog" vanilla yogurt with salted caramel sauce and pretzels....WINNER!.  I can't wait to go back and try more of the combinations because the creations are endless...Oh joy,  I love loving you Loving Cup...
author: Caye Q.

description: I love that you can mix your own custom flavor! The frozen custard here is delicious. And when you mix in things like strawberries and Oreos and pretzels.. good things happen. Just watching them make it is a treat. It would be even awesomer if they let you do it yourself cause it looks fun. Was kind of disappointed that mine didn't come out as grand looking as other people's, but it tasted amazing so can't complain
author: Nina S.

description:
Ok after reading all the yelp review, I realized that I got the completely wrong order. I mean, who in the world would get mango + blueberry +vanilla back ?! That would be me, suggested by an employee at Loving cup. 

I really wanted someone fruity & maybe it was a bad idea to come here for it cause it had NO taste of fruitiness but purely sweetness. I think banana with nutella & chocolate/vanilla would've been the better choice.

+1 for the friendly staff :)
author: Tiffany T.

description:
My friends and I each had a different flavor and all of them were good. 
There are lots of combinations you can do with various ingredients, and having options is never a bad thing for me. 

I got the vanilla base + almond butter + walnuts and you can really taste the walnut bits in it. Super flavorful! 

Workers are extremely friendly and the shop itself is super cute, would definitely visit again :D
author: Shelly L.

description: It's okay. I don't why I'm not super crazy about the pudding and Strawberry vanilla frozen yogurt. Maybe i'm spoiled by LA stuff
author: Rita L.

description:
I haven't seen a place that makes the yogurt their fresh in a looooonggggg time so it was a nice treat that this place does!

Simple menu with big results :D pick a base, add your toppings and enjoy! My friends all enjoyed the yogurts they got and i got to taste some and it was creamy and sweet. The texture was more thick but still smooth, and unlike other froyos you get.. you can feel this was just made fresh. They have a machine that lets them mix what you want and crank out the yogurt. I got a coffee shake made with the yogurt and added some english toffee. I enjoyed it but I felt like my drink was too sweet. The yogurt was a nice add though because it kept my drink creamy and a little thick. They don't add ice! so your drink doesn't become diluted :)

They also had rice pudding which looked good and perhaps next time I'll get that. Prices here are more than your typical froyo place but the quality of the froyo here is better so you're paying the difference. Their servers were friendly and they made our yogurts pretty fast. So if you want a cup full of love, come here!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
This is one of my favorite dessert places in the city!  Although their menu is limited to rice pudding and frozen yogurt....oh they are soooo good!

My favorite rice pudding is the coconut flavor.  It has toasted coconut on top that pairs perfectly with the rice pudding.

My favorite frozen yogurt is the Vanilla froyo + Oreo + Toffee ...delicious!

The frozen yogurt here is unlike any other that I've had.  It's somewhat similar to a McFlurry but better.  They have this huge screw machine (literally a gigantic screw), that mushes the yogurt and toppings together so that it becomes 1 consistency rather than places like yogurtland where you spoon the toppings on.  I prefer Loving Cup over all the other froyo places because I think the ending flavor is better.  It's a must try if you haven't already!

The only downside to this place is that there's hardly any seating.  There's often a line but it moves pretty fast. Normally by the time you pick out which flavors you want, it'll already be your turn to order.  There's 1 small counter that can seat 3-4 people.  There's also a small bench outside that can fit ~3 people.  

Parking is tough on Polk Street but I always somehow find a spot even if it takes 10+ minutes of circling around.

I believe they accept credit card if the bill is over a certain amount.  If it isn't, they charge a small fee.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I can't stop raving about this place. Has to be my absolute favorite dessert shop in SF!

So far, vanilla ice cream with mango and animal crackers is my go-to.
author: Linda X.

description:
Three and half stars for Loving Cup's good frozen yogurt.

They have a few base yogurts, plus a wide variety of mix-ins that you can combine all sorts of different ways.  Lots of interesting combos on the menu, or you can choose your own.  

I had the 'Dirty Hipster' (OK, they get bumped up to four stars for the names alone):  vanilla frozen yogurt with Nutella and Oreos blended in.  Mmmm good.
author: Scott H.

description:
Since trying rice pudding in New York's Rice-to-Riches, I've been searching for a comparable place in San Francisco. While Loving Cup does not have the amazing selection that Rice-to-Riches has, the quality of their eight-rotating flavors is definitely on par.

I sampled both the Lemon Vanilla and the Madagascar Vanilla Bean and chose a Small Lemon Vanilla for $3.75. I was not told that you could have two flavors or I probably would have done half Lemon Vanilla and half Coconut, which has toasted coconut mixed in.

For a small, you're given a very large portion (but who's complaining there?)

I'll be back to try their other flavors and their custom-froyo! Ask for the frequent buyer card, because they don't seem to offer it off-the-bat.

Minus one-half star for seating (I swooped in before someone and got a glare... Hashtag: sorrynotsorry)

Minus another half star for customer service. The woman who waited on me was courteous but did not crack a smile or act like she really wanted to be there.
author: Gabriela K.

description: Possibly one of the best frozen yogurts I have had! It's better than Pinkberry, Blush, or Fraiche. I would take off one star because they don't offer any fresh toppings, but honestly you don't need any. My friend and I shared a vanilla banana pistachio frozen yogurt. They make it fresh on the spot and mix it in with any toppings you want. The cinnamon rum rice pudding is also unique, so it's definitely something to try too. Loving Cup is a great refreshing snack/dessert place to go with friends. It beats ice cream in my opinion. Definitely will be back when I'm in the city!
author: Angela L.

description:
The rice pudding was 5 stars but the frozen yogurt was meh.

I'm Egyptian, so I've had a lot of rice pudding in my life, and in many parts of the world. Loving Cup makes some of the best rice pudding I've ever had. I would highly recommend it.

The frozen yogurt was nothing to write home about. The concept of pre-mixed yogurt is cool, but flavor-wise, it's not even as good as frozen yogurt chains.

The wait was long and some of the staff members were cranky. But some were nice.

I think they should give the option of getting rice pudding with fro-yo on top.
author: Omar A.

description:
MMMMM FROYO :)

This froyo place is pretty unique! You choose a base flavor and some stuff to mix in which means you have lots of options. They have this cool machine that blends everything and creates the froyo right there! So fresh!! I chose a vanilla froyo base and blended it with almond butter and espresso. It tasted sooo good! There are so many different combinations to try that you'll probably never run out of yummy flavors :) They also have rice pudding here and shakes!
author: Sandra N.

description: All these hills in SF and you need some Froyo from Loving cup. I had a small froyo which Is by no means small but perfectly sized. I struggled with what flavour to choose from as I wanted them all. The sales lady recommend the salted Carmel pretzel one... And she was not wrong it was insane. It was $4.50 and worth every $$. I shall be back to work my way through the menu!
author: Nicola T.

description:
Yes, yes, yes, yes, yes.

I am picky about my froyo. Extremely picky. It's hardly ever that a froyo would win me over, but damn... LOVING CUP. I DO LOVE THE CUP HERE. Dare I say I prefer this place over Bi-Rite???!

It was Yelp and my bf's interest in checking this place out that initially drew us here, and now we go here at least every other week to fulfill our Loving Cup needs. There's so many combinations to choose from in terms of mix-ins, but my favorite is a vanilla-nutella-toffee-pretzel, or chocolate-almond butter-toffee-pretzel.

If you're gonna get a vanilla-fruit concoction, you're better off hitting up Pinkberry for some serious yogurt. If you're a rice pudding lover, there are options here for you as well (and supposedly people like it a lot, but rice pudding ain't my thang).

They also have frozen lemonade and other drinks here, but I haven't tried. Just don't visit without getting a froyo cup. I believe they make their own froyo too, so it's extra creamy/tasty.

They charge you a little extra for using card, so bring cash if you don't feel like paying the extra cents. Also, don't forget your punch card and go ahead and splurge on that Medium or Large for yourself... you're going to want it!
author: Joanne Y.

description:
"Can I get a party in my mouth?"

By a lucky chance we came across this super delicious froyo right next to Leopolds where we had dinner. Bf and I got the dirty hipster and party in my mouth flavours which were like oreo mcflurries (+ nutella or peanut butter) on steroids - so good! These are apparently the most popular flavours; I can see why! :)
author: Kathy L.

description:
Probably the best frozen yogurt i've ever had. Unfortunately i've only had it twice because it's pretty far from my neighborhood. :(

My friend took me here for the first time a couple months back. I was so amazed how they actually mixed the ingredients in! I got nutella and strawberry and it was delicious! I also had the chance to try pistachio and that was really good as well, so cool how it had pistachio chunks, yummm! The yogurt is perfectly creamy and the ingredients really pop with flavor cause they're thoroughly mixed in.

One thing I don't like seeing is when there's leftover yogurt in the machine and it just gets washed down when cleaned instead of getting put in your cup! :( I know I ordered a small but please... please just give me the extra yogurt. I'll eat it instead of it just going to waste D:
author: Tara A.

description: Love this place! It's a cute little froyo/dessert shop. I planned on going in to share just one thing with my boyfriend, but came out with two things anyway. Narrowing it down to two was hard enough. I decided on the cookies and cream rice pudding & vanilla yogurt blended w/ banana. The rice pudding was DELICIOUS! I have never tried rice pudding before but I have seen it as a popular must-have dessert in SF so I had to get it. As for the frozen yogurt, I had trouble deciding on things to add in! You get one topping added in for free, and then additional ones will cost extra. I just decided on the banana, but next time I'd like to try cookie dough mixed in. If you do get frozen yogurt, watch them when they make it! The machine is pretty neat. They should put it closer to the front as something for visitors to watch :)
author: Ashley C.

description: Loving Cup has always been my to go place right after a nice dinner. I never had anything but pleasant things to say about this place. On this particular night there was one thing that infuriated me. The amount of disrespect that was given to their employees. I stood by watching an older lady (that I can only guess is the manager) yelling at these two kids. I really like this place but I'm gonna think twice next time I come.
author: Loanne T.

description: we got Dirty Hipster and Cookie Monster, and both tasted good! personally, i liked dirty hipster better than cookie monster because it wasn't too sweet. I was surprised that many people ordered rice pudding. I actually don't like rice pudding because of the weird taste and texture. But, when I tried at here, it was really good! I liked it :D
author: Erica Y.

description:
I came here on a hot day before work since I heard great reviews about their ice cream and smoothies. 

I came in and was little confused by the whole one flavor a day thing, but I was also tired and derpy. 

They usually have pudding apparently, and other things in the case (since someone else came in and asked for it) but they were all out and the case was empty almost completely besides a couple fizzy drinks. 

I wanted the espresso or mocha smoothie but they were all out, so I opted for the mango smoothie. It was good, but nothing special. 

The girl behind the counter seemed tired, or just not very happy to be there since she didn't seem enthusiastic and didn't smile. 

I'll be back to try it again, and I'll change my review based on that time.
author: Shira S.

description:
Absolutely the best frozen yoghurt place I have ever been to!!!!!! At first I was a little sceptical of the concept of blending the fresh fruit into the yoghurt, but I have no words. You have to try vanilla base with strawberries and Nutella which was the one the staff recommended = BEST THING EVER. They have a lot of different fruits and nuts etc. for every one in the group.
I'm seriously daydreaming about this cup throughout the week until me and my friends go there. We love this place!
author: Jasmine A.

description:
I'm a big sweet tooth so when a friend suggested getting dessert, I was so down....even though parking was impossible.

I had no idea what kind of dessert place this would be so when we walked in and read the menu, I was so stoked. 

Made to order fro-yo flavors, rice puddings, and smoothies! My friend and I split a small size of rice pudding and fro-yo. 

Small size rice pudding cost about $5. We asked to have two flavors and we were obliged. We chose to get cookies&cream and coconut flavor. We wanted to add whipped cream but they ran out. Both were delicious but pretty heavy. I loved the delicate flavor of the coconut and I loved the sweetness from the cookies&cream. I preferred coconut but my friend preferred cookies&cream

Small size fro-yo cost $4.75. I think the topping/fillings they blend in are unlimited, but we chose to get two: animal crackers and English toffee. That with vanilla flavor fro-yo? THE BEST. I swear this place gave me the best fro-yo of my life. 

Other friend ordered Mango Tango smoothie. I don't remember how much that cost but the size was huge and the flavor was indeed very mango-y. 

I would LOVE to go back to this place!
author: Sofia R.

description:
Pros:  friendly service 
           Rice pudding in different flavors were good 

Cons:  yogurt wasn't bad but it was like any other.
author: Bayarea K.

description: Only had the fro yo here so can't comment on the supposedly delectable rice pudding. I'm a huge fro yo fan and found their fro yo to just be alright. Maybe I'm strange but I prefer my toppings to be on top and not mixed in. I ordered vanilla fro yo with cookie dough and Oreos and simply didn't taste either topping. Kind of disappointing. I think I will stick to traditional fro yo places. Line gets long and they're slow just FYI.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
I want to give this place a one star so you people will stop coming here, especially the tourists who stumble in and take 10 minutes to decide on 1) vanilla or chocolate and 2) a yogurt topping.  

But that would just be unfair.  I love this place and I hope they never change.  The flavor of the day is always on point and I think it has something to do with the enthusiastic and hardworking employees.  

Favor to ask if the owner is reading: 1) please use smaller spoons, we are eating yogurt and not cereal.  Saves you money and saves the environment.  2) have the employes stop defrosting the yogurt.  I get that it saves time and makes it easier to grind up the discs, but it unnecessarily softens the yogurt and I feel like I have a milkshake for the last couple of bites.
author: Kelvin W.

description:
Excellent service on a crazy busy night. 

Neurologists are studying the use of probiotics to treat depression because the majority of your serotonin is stored in your lower intestines. The serotonin travels to your brain through your central nervous system. I am going to suggest Loving Cup to someone for every night to see what happens.
author: Bebe L.

description:
Absolutely looove this place. I love frozen yogurt in general but when I found out about this place and got to try it, I fell in love even more. 
You choose the flavor of your yogurt (choco or vanilla) which is all fresh and individually wrapped. Then you can add whichever and however many toppings you want, and all this is churned right in front of you, and out comes this thick delicious goodness. 
Only downside I would say is the wait. Came in on a Friday night and the line was loooong. There was one guy taking orders and another on the machine. I think it would help if they have another worker with a machine. However, I didn't mind waiting at all! I would come here weekly only if it weren't so far :(
author: Joanne L.

description:
loving-this-cup

very interesting concept. they throw in some frozen ice cream, and whatever ingredients of your choice and then blend it together to make a unique custom dessert concoction. the nice thing about the fro-yo here is that it doesn't even taste like yogurt. it definitely tastes more like ice cream. 

the staff is very warm & friendly (& has a nice sense of humor). 

the store has vintage/retro decor. 

the process is pretty streamlined, although there can be a bit of a wait sometimes (it's to be expected with something that's handcrafted). 

all in all, I'm hooked. it's nice to know that I don't have to feel too guilty treating myself to this b/c it's yogurt.
author: David Z.

description:
Definitely love yelp for recommending this place. Great, simple and cute place. I wish they had more than one worker in general because the time I went, it was just one asian girl by herself and I didn't like that she had so much pressure when the crowd started picking up. She did everything by herself, and she did great, no complaints to her even though it was in December when I went. 

The flavor I got was like the recommended one, and it was Birthday Cake flavor or something, and trying it was good but I don't recommend it a little too sweet for me and I have a mouth full of sweet teeth. Great Place, try it out definitely worth the try.
author: Jazmyne N.

description:
I've nothing but good things to say about this place! It's a small hole in the wall filled with delectable (yet not overly overpowering) sweets! 

The main fooods of this place consist of their unique frozen yogurt and rice pudding. For the froyo, you choose a yogurt base (chocolate and vanilla) and then you select single or multiple toppings to add into the yogurt base. Then, they use a cool mixer machine to blend the ingredients together and create a fresh yogurt flavor. My dude friend and I got a thin mint concoction when we came by, and it was p good dawg. P GOOOD. Creamy and flavor packed! BAM BAM. 

The rice pudding was cool too! We got the lemon vanilla with homemade chocolate ganache on the bottom, and it was such a yummmmy snack. It wasn't too lemony, however. I tasted more vanilla, but man oh man was the ganache yummy. 

Great stop for a quick, sweet snack that's not overly rich and filling!
author: Kim N.

description:
Rice rice Baby (dum..da.da .dum..da..da dum dum) Rice..rice Baby..
All right stop, Collaborate and listen
Rice is back with a brand new invention.

1) Vanilla Bean
2) Lemon Vanilla
3) Toasted Coconut
4) Cookies and cream
5) Cinnamon rum raisin
6) almond butter
7) pecan praline
8) pumpkin pie
9) English toffee
10) peanut butter
11)creamsicle
12) eggnog

Only 195 calories per small serving. But there's more. Non-fat frozen yogurt that you can mix with uhmazing add-ins, smoothies and coffee! Count me in. I love me some loving cup!
author: Michelle B.

description:
I'm a huge fan of rice pudding so no hesitation going to Loving Cup. On a Sunday night, street parking was horrible, but (spoiler) driving around was so worth it. 

The line went quickly and I got two pints - one Vanilla Bean and one Lemon. 

It was quite pricey - $15.50 ($7.75/pint) - but the rice pudding is so fresh, so flavorful. Staff is super friendly, I'm definitely coming back.
author: Doreen C.

description:
What's not to love about a place CALLED Loving Cup? The name of the dang place oozes with cutesy-cutesy cuteness. This little frozen yogurt, smoothie, milkshake, and rice pudding store has an adorable interior... rustic French meets classic American meets laid-back California. There are only several stools to sit inside and limited seating outside the shop. Most people just grab and stroll (not grab and go!) -- this is not the type of food to devour in a rush. You'll want to savor all the lusciousness of their frozen yogurt or rice pudding. I like their coconut rice pudding and MOST ESPECIALLY their plain frozen yogurt with strawberry and nutella. I've heard this is one of their most popular flavor combinations and why wouldn't it be? The sweet and tart strawberries juxtaposed against the rich and deep flavors of nutella enmeshed with the creamy frozen yogurt? This totally cools you down on a warm day and actually metaphorically warms you up on a cold night. I'm a creature of habit and have ordered his repeatedly because it's just too fantastic to not. 

What I also love about the Loving Cup is its unassuming nature. It looks like a very simple place, but produces some of the most mind-boggling street treats around. I also enjoy the fact that this is a locals' spot. It's not teeming with tourists and feels incredibly intimate because of that. I joked with my boyfriend that Loving Cup is reason for me enough to live in Nob Hill. He thought I was joking. No. I'm serious. If I can have easy access to the Loving Cup, I'll be a much happier person. Enjoy!
author: James Z.

description:
What a delightful little shop serving frozen yogurt and rice pudding in a novel and fun new way.

For their froyo, they offer chocolate or vanilla or swirl if you so desired. Your order also comes with one topping which they will twirl in right in front of you. The machine they use is pretty damn cool, something I've never seen before but I did feel bad for the guy who had to make my order. I wanted mangos, which turns out were frozen chunks so when he went to spin my order you could tell he had to exert far more strength to do so. Presentation wise, the combo flavor swirl isn't that pretty but the flavor is solid. 

The froyo was creamy with a good body with a touch of sweetness. This isn't like what you would get at say Yogurtland or Nubu, which was a pleasant change of pace. 

I also had a chance to sample their rice pudding and while I'm not a huge fan of rice pudding, I have to say they do a great job as well. 

Overall Thoughts

Loving cup is aptly named
author: Eddie W.

description:
I like the decor to this froyo shop and they have delectable flavors too!

The server must have been new because my froyo came out looking poorly presentable and not the pretty, typical swirl you would see for froyo.  It's okay.  I give you a break because I believe there was the supervisor that was watching everything he did at the time he was making up my swirl.  The coaching and pressure was clearly on for him.

Other than that, I like the toppings that they offer and they have rice pudding?!  Interesting concept to frozen yogurt.

This shop tapped my sweet tooth, indeed.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
In love with the concept of create-your-own froyo.

First, pick a base: vanilla or chocolate. Second, select toppings (there's a list on the wall) to be mixed in with your choice of base and BAM! Customized froyo. So simple and so clever. I found that a small cup (~$4) is enough for me. I always choose vanilla as my base and stick to one fruit topping (i.e. bananas or strawberries) and one chocolate topping (oreos or nutella). Toppings aren't free but I believe the first topping is free and the second topping and so forth is about $1 each.

So far, my favorite combonitation has been vanilla base + bananas + peanut butter + nutella. It's become a classic sandwich combo that I should've known it would've tasted amazing as a froyo concoction, as well.

Highly recommend this place to anyone who isn't afraid of being a little creative with their froyo!
author: Annie S.

description:
Loved this place!
The yogurt was so think it really seemed ice-cream. It was very tasty, not like regular froyo.

The only thing I would improve, is waiting time. There's only one machine (or at least there was only one operational when we were there) and that makes the wait a little longer.

I had the blueberry and coconut mix... hmmm sooo good!
author: Maggie J.

description:
The rice pudding and frozen yogurt (with blended add-ons) is quite good - not necessarily "wow" good in my opinion though. It's a cute little shop that adds character to a lively neighborhood. Service is friendly and there's a lot of flavors and combinations to choose from.

I like this place just fine, but I'm not necessarily raving about it. (For me, 3 stars is a perfectly decent "passing" grade.) If I'm walking past again, I'll try some more flavors and combinations and hopefully this place will grow on me as much as it has for all the other Yelpers here.
author: Vincent L.

description: They are famous for the rice pudding, and of course we have to give it a try. It's a small shop, their items were showing on the wall. Most people were ordering their frozen yogurt with adding some more items as you like. We tried the coconut pudding which was with real coconut inside. We like it a lot, plus it's not over sweet. The rice was mixed well with the cream, very smooth. The order one we ordered was the vanilla rice pudding, the vanilla flavor was not heavy, just slightly touch. Maybe we need to try their yogurt next time.
author: Karmen S.

description:
Love the concept here.. but as before, their flavors are a little TOO subtle for me. I only gave them another chance to try their seasonal pumpkin flavors, but it unfortunately didn't impress me too much. I don't think I'll be lured back again, no matter how sensational their flavors sound.

I still get the sense that their rice pudding just tastes a little old and has been sitting there for days and days.. especially since it never seems to be refrigerator-cold, always closer to room temperature. How could it possible stay good for so long without being kept at a colder temp??

* Pumpkin Pie rice pudding - 3 stars
The flavor is way too muted. I mostly tasted the cinnamon sprinkled on top!

* Lemon vanilla rice pudding - 3.5 stars
Thank god I paired the pumpkin pie with this flavor - this had a little more kick & zest to it and gave our pudding a nice tang that it needed.

* Pumpkin fro-yo - 3 stars
Better flavor-wise than the rice pudding.. but the texture was a little watery.

Photo of our selections: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/loving-cup-san-francisco?select=5SEbryF3tYXSq0Bm0lLywg#5SEbryF3tYXSq0Bm0lLywg
author: Ziyan C.

description: My go to fro yo / sweet tooth pick me up place - delicious sweet treats and friendly staff. I try something different each time and have yet to be disappointed. My favorites have been the Cookie Monster, Espresso Chip, and Almond Joy
author: Catherine H.

description:
HOLY MOLY. 

I have walked past Loving Cup SO many times and have never tried it until the other day.  While I am extremely excited to discover such a gem, my waistband is definitely not.

Loving Cup is unique because (a) it serves rice pudding, and (b) it blends your toppings into frozen yogurt, instead of just sprinkling it on top.  

It can be quite intimidating upon entering so hopefully this review simplifies your ordering process:

Step 1: Choose either the rice pudding or frozen yogurt route.
Step 2: If you chose rice pudding, choose a flavor and that's it. If you chose frozen yogurt, decide to either customize your own using their list of toppings, or go with one of their signature "fro-yo favorites". 
Step 3: Enjoy!

Tips:
 - If you want fro-yo, get one of their signature favorites (I got the Salty Dog, which is vanilla base with pretzels and salted caramel mixed in, and it was amazing
- They also have smoothies
- CALLING ALL VEGANS: They have a vegan "fro-yo" which is just essentially frozen banana and I hear it's good!
- You can order ONLINE. 

Can't wait to go back!
author: Juliana K.

description:
I used to live on the corner of Polk and Union, right above Tonic and right above Loving Cup. No joke, I used to eat Loving Cup on a daily basis. 

Frozen yogurt: you choose a vanilla or chocolate base and then you choose your mix ins. They'll have specials to give you inspiration in case you're not sure what you want. My favorites are coffee & toffee (plain yogurt with coffee grounds and Heath bar mix-ins) and strawberry shortcake (strawberries and graham cracker crumbs). For fatty days, I get an entire cupcake mixed in. Also anything with Nutella is amazing. 

The rice pudding is also amazing. It's homemade and by far the best rice pudding I've had in the Bay Area. Try some samples to see what you like--I'm partial to rum raisin, cinnamon, and toffee.
author: Sally C.

description:
Ever wonder what a piece of heaven tastes like?

Order the vanilla yogurt with oreos and cookie dough. YUP. That's exactly what heaven tastes like. 

I cant begin to tell you how many times I've been to loving cup (embarrassingly enough) and how many times I've postmated this to my apartment. I just can't get enough.
author: Tina J.

description:
How have I not heard of this place before?! Had dinner with a friend down the street at Leopold's, and she mentioned that she wanted Loving Cup for dessert. I was too full from dinner but I decided to join her anyways, and I'm so glad I did. What a cute little place! Ordering was easy: 

1. Choose your frozen yogurt base (vanilla / chocolate)
2. Pick your ingredients, which will then be blended in some wonderful machine contraption (1st mix-in is free)
3. Enjoy! 

I ended up ordering the vanilla with nutella, oreos and espresso. The texture of the yogurt was perfect, and my combination was amazing :) Will definitely be coming back!

They're also known for their rice pudding, which I hear is delicious as well.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: This place is literally the best. I moved to San Francisco recently and visited Loving Cup on one of my first few days, and have been hooked ever since. The froyo is incredible and tastes very different from your standard frozen treat experience. The staff is also amazing - Mia, one of the employees, is one of the most patient and kind people I've ever met who has given me awesome new froyo creation ideas on timeless occasions. Total staple of Polk St. Don't know how there isn't a line out the door every day!
author: Julia E.

description:
Cute small shop in nobb hill. I ordered the dude abides and it was delicious. Chocolate ice cream with almond butter and toffee mixed in. This place reminds me of cold stone in the sense that they do a great job with mixing in the toppings in. 

Naturally since I love cold stone but am all about the "healthy" alternative (frozen yogurt) this place was a hit for me. 

Portions are small if you order the small but it still hits the spot if you're craving something sweet and creamy.
author: Bianca L.

description:
Got the cookies and cream froyo, the cinnamon rum raisin rice pudding and the coconut rice pudding. Everything was good except the coconut one. Tasted like it needed to be mixed with something else too. But everything else was pretty damn good!!

Didn't wait at all in line. Service was quick. Place is a bit small tho. When a group of 5 came in, I knew I'd get in someone's way and feel a lil claustrophobic so I left and ate my deliciousness in my car.

Definitely would come back!
author: JG I.

description:
Pros: the "party in your mouth" (vanilla blended with peanut butter and Oreos) stands true to it's name!  Sooo good!  Of course you can make up your own flavor, too. LOTS of options.

Cons: I wish this place was staffed better. I came on a Sunday afternoon and it was about a 20min wait to get my order. Granted it was extremely hot out, so I expected this place to be packed. But they had only ONE person mixing the froyo. It just didn't seem right. 

Also, it was hotter/stuffier inside than the 80-something degrees outside, so a 20min wait at the counter was kinda unbearable.  It would have been five stars if they could've gotten people out quicker.  

Conclusion: I'd definitely come back and recommend this place, but probably not on a hot day (even though that's when you'd want froyo the most).
author: Riz W.

description:
I've been meaning to write this review for a few weeks and kept forgetting.  The rating is based on my most recent experience, Monday night, March 21st.

I've been here a few times and LOVE the frozen yogurt magic machine that turns already delicious soft serve fro-yo into a DQ blizzard-esque concoction.  Once I discovered it, I told all my friends about it and try to stop by for a treat when I'm in the area.

On that fateful Monday night, I had a fantastic dinner with 3 of my girlfriends and we decided to skip the dessert menu and head to Loving Cup for some of the good stuff.  This was a big deal as 3 of the 4 of us are QUITE pregnant and dessert is basically the best part of our day :)  

We pulled up to LC and couldn't believe our luck: a parking spot right out front and 20 minutes until it closed!  Sweet!  We piled out, lined up and started picking out what yummy treats we were going to order.  I noticed as we waited that there was a line of about 6 people, and the 2 girls working there seemed a bit overwhelmed.  One girl kept looking down at the ground and then called the other over.  The other came over, looked down in horror, then looked at us and announced "we're closing.  we're not taking any more orders."  Apparently, the drain on the floor was backed up.  I peered over to see and couldn't see any water on the floor so assumed it was perhaps on the verge of backing up?

My friends and I looked around - we were the ONLY ones in line as the other customers had already ordered and paid and were just waiting to get their fro-yos.  So, there are 4 more customers, the store has 20 minutes before it closes, and now we're being kicked out? Even though they are going to continue to make the orders they've already taken (there were 6 cups lined up to be made), they wouldn't take ours?  I was thinking maybe we could just order some rice pudding when the girl who made the initial announcement started yelling at us - in an extremely hostile manner -  "we're not taking any more orders.  We're closed. We're closed."  We couldn't believe the way she was talking to us - we hadn't even argued with her, we had just kind of stood in shocked silence and then started to laugh with each other about telling pregnant ladies they couldn't have ice cream!  

We went to Yelp to figure out where to go from there and decided on ice cream at Over the Moon on Chestnut.  The ice cream was delicious and, what's more, the employee didn't yell at us! 

In all seriousness, I totally appreciate that the workers were overwhelmed and perhaps panicked when they saw  impending drain problems, but they way they handled themselves and the situation was beyond unprofessional.  It seemed to me that they could have easily closed the doors and not taken any additional customers but still taken our order, or if they really couldn't handle making four more cups of fro-yo, they  could have offered us something else on the menu that takes less time.  At the very least, the employee who yelled at us should have spoken to us in a respectful manner - if she'd calmly explained the situation, she would have gotten the same results (us leaving without ordering).    The experience was so unnecessary and unpleasant and I certainly will be taking my business elsewhere from now on and encourage others to do the same.
author: Jessica G.

description:
Their rice pudding is impossible to replicate--believe me, I've tried. It is so thick and creamy, and the texture is perfect. 

I'm not a huge fan of their healthy shakes, but maybe that's because I love sugar a little too much.

But go for the pudding; it will change you're mind about rice pudding.
author: Ashley E.

description:
I really like this place.  The yogurt that is.

The rice pudding is good but they have some odd flavors. I just can't understand putting toppings in the rice pudding.

Things like this upsett me and make me lose sleep at night.
author: Alexi T.

description: It takes a while to get your ice cream here but it's worth the wait! I always get the salty dog and it never fails to please me. Also, their Rice Krispie treat is delicious! Definitely get one for the road!
author: Courtney C.

description:
Froyo and rice pudding...score!!!

So they have this random top 50 sweets in a San Francisco article, and this place was ranked #16. They're known for their different types of rice pudding and their most popular is the coconut flavored one.

So I ordered that one. And I must say, it definitely is worth the drive, worth the 15 minutes or so trying to find some random parking, and they also have some candy inside (specifically some eye). So yah...pretty good stuff. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/8LEnV8Z0-YKPWb1nLKgQHQ?select=eqkl59bskkftnu7fY8d-YQ So yah, come for some frozen yogurt and/or some rice pudding. And stay for the candy. Yum Yum!

Tip: Use your yelp check-in and you get a free topping for your froyo.
author: Mike C.

description: The frozen yogurt is mixed with chocolate or vanilla. It doesn't taste good. And the service is not good either.
author: Chiahui H.

description: Best fro-yo in the city!  No question.  This is like a Dairy Queen Blizzard but with fro-yo.  Great selection of toppings.  My favorite place to go on a warm night.  I don't usually have the pudding, just the fro-yo.  It is not super fast, but worth the wait as everything is made to order.  Try the espresso beans in your fro-yo!  This is a must-go place for everyone in SF.
author: Elise G.

description: This place has NEVER let me down... Not once out of the 7 years I've been here. The workers are always smiling and always kind. Always go for the yogurt and some times the rice pudding! They used to have blue bottle hot cocoa but I believe they discontinued that.... If you get yogurt, just don't expect it to be ready right after you order. Since it somewhat custom and made on the spot, it'll take some time.
author: Yvonne N.

description:
Delicious! Who would ever knew that rice pudding tastes great. It doesn't taste like rice at all! 

I came here with my little sister and we were the one ones there for the first 5mins. The lady behind the counter was rude. She was on her phone (prob texting) while helping us. Yeah, she's great at multitasking and I wouldn't have mind if she had at least said "hi" to us. Oh wells, it's not utopia.

We got a small with two flavors: Cinnamon Rum Raisin & Cookies and Cream. It came out to be one of the best combo. If I had stuck with one flavor, I would've gotten tired of eating it halfway. (Last few visits I ordered just one flavor) And a small cup is actually more like a regular. 

The Cinnamon Rum Raisin wasn't too sweet, but the Cookies&Cream were. So, this combo came out to be the perfect balance. The Cinnamon Rum Raisin had bits of real raisins and it was sprinkled with cinnamon powder on top. The Cookies and Cream had actual cookies bits in it too! Hands down it's the best rice pudding in the city!
author: Jane C.

description: My all time favorite treat in SF. The vegan banana base they recently created is terriffic!
author: Della T.

description: I love Loving Cup with all my heart. I really do. But the people who work there are pretty blah. Like, I know you work at a yogurt shop, but are you truly that miserable?
author: Christa C.

description:
Blends and rice pudding.  Something you would think is common, but isn't.  I had the cookies n cream rice pudding.  To the outside eye, you think its just rice pudding with oreos, but they actually add some of the cookie-ness to the blend.  It was pretty great.

My girlfriend had the nutella blend with toffee.  A bit on the too sweet side, but nonetheless delicious!
author: Andy V.

description: absolutely LOVE. yes it can get a bit pricey, but I think it was so worth it. so cool how they mix in your toppings. I already can't wait to go back. they have really fun add-ins, and you can easily use the vanilla ice cream as a base to mix in a fruit and bam you've got a more interesting flavor (i did raspberry). best yogurt experience i've had...probably ever.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
Loving Cup in a nutshell: wait in line for twenty two minutes so that I can order overpriced cookies and cream froyo that tastes like toothpaste. 

I'm not joking. Don't believe me? Order it. Toothpaste.
author: Steven B.

description:
If I was about to die and could only have one more dessert before I went, I would have the  Loving Cup's Cookies and Cream Rice Pudding.

That is the best way for me to explain it.  How can something so simple be so good?  I have no idea.  If you figure it out please let me know.  I would drive the 400 miles from Las Vegas just to have this wonderful peace of Heaven and then drive back.
author: Joshua S.

description:
A few friends and I decided to walk all the way from North Beach across the Golden Gate bridge and back so needless to say we were hangry, tired and suffering from low blood sugar afterward. Someone in the group recommended that we try Loving Cup as it had been recommended to them before and we went ahead and grabbed an Uber there. 

Totally the right choice! The shop is small and luckily we got in when we did because there was a huge line behind us out the door while we were waiting for our yogurt concoctions. They use this machine that swirls your toppings into frozen blocks of chocolate or vanilla yogurt which is definitely a cool/different take on fro-yo. Most places are dime a dozen but this one definitely has cool/different vibes. 

Unfortunately he only con in my opinion comes from the cool process (although it's totally a matter of taste). I prefer my toppings to be chunky and if I get something like cookie dough mixed in I really like having little cookie dough pieces to unearth. Because of the grinder all the topping become really fine and well mixed into the yogurt so it comes out a little bit grainier/mixed in than I would prefer. The thin mint was delicious but the junior mint pieces were ground into a pepperminty pulp. 

That being said, definitely check it out and get one of the pre-selected combos to save yourself from not being able to choose from the huge variety of toppings!
author: Hailey H.

description: I found this place on my friend's Instagram and couldn't help but want to try it because of how cutesy the yogurt looked. I was pretty surprised when the yogurt had a more ice cream like consistency, in comparison to other yogurts like Pinkberry or Yogurtland, which are more liquidy. I remember getting the mango flavor (although I'm not sure it's been a while!) with walnuts on top. It was good, but nothing crazy in my opinion.
