It's a little pricey but since I'm from San Jose and just wanted to try something new in SF I decided to give it a go. Nice to try but I wasn't very crazy about it.
author: Bonnie T.

description: Strawberry, animal cracker froyo and cinnamon rum raisin rice pudding :) my goodness the froyo was so good, must keep eating... My rice pudding was good, very nice texture and flavor, just a little too sweet for ME. :)  . I still ate it for breakfast the next day, lol.
author: Kimmie L.

description: Good service.  Friendly staff.  However at certain times it gets too crowded.  There is a line out the door.  They really need an extra employee during crowded times.
author: George P.

description:
I'm not sure if this is the case all week long but if you're there on a Wednesday night, park on Van Ness.  I circled around the neighboring areas for 20 minutes, couldn't find a spot, decided to leave since the shop would only be open for another 10 minutes, but then found one!  So I raced back up the hill only to catch the last couple batches of rice pudding they had left.  

My friend and I had literally ordered rice pudding for each of us and then they didn't have enough for the little rush that came right after.  Luckily I got to try the rum raisin and the mocha chip.  The rum raisin has a LOT of raisins in it... you'll get at least 5 with every spoonful.  The mocha chip had a thick texture which I really enjoyed and wasn't overbearing with the chocolate at all.

For $3.50, they overfill the cup for you.  It's totally worth it.  If you've gone to Rice to Riches in NY, this is unlike that.  Loving Cup is an all inclusive rice pudding/froyo/drink shop whereas rice pudding is Rice to Riches' specialty.
author: Shannon L.

description:
I really felt the L-O-V-E...all up in my rice pudding cup! 

This was such an interesting experience for me since I've really only had rice pudding in the context of a chinese restaurant serving it to you after your meal.   Yelper friend Natasha H. convinced me to go with her, and boy, I am glad I did!  

I tried a small coconut and madagascar vanilla rice pudding with black ganache bottom.   was amazed by the consistency and the flavor, not too sweet and not too overpowering. Perfect.  Next time, I want to try their yogurt blend.  

I scraped my cup clean and ate all the love.  I will be back for more! 

Oh and if you get the yogurt, don't forget to unlock your check-in offer and get a free mix-in!!
author: Gloria C.

description: Endless combinations you can experiment with! Sometimes you can end up with odd flavors and textures, but if you know what you like you'll end up with a tasty frozen yogurt in your hands
author: Sui N.

description: Ok I love this place but nobody makes a smoothie like my girl Emily ! She's amazing with everyone that walks in the door . I just love her she's amazing. I will say thought that the manager .. wow she's pure evil . I witnessed her yelling at her employees in front of customers . SUPER UNPROFESSIONAL . If Emily wasn't so bomb with her creations and wasn't sucha kick ass girl I would never come back in. FOREAL . Keep up the hard work Emily!
author: Coryne N.

description: Not just another frozen yogurt place. Very nice combinations. Lovely people. Only problem not  enough seating.
author: Tarik K.

description:
Awesome frozen yogurt place! You pick your flavor then mix-ins, and they blend it together for you. Rainbow sprinkles don't count as a mix-in (fun fact). There's also rice pudding which you can sample.

One downside - when they serve the fro yo into the cup after they mix it, they leave a huge hole of air, even when there is yogurt left in the blender :(
author: Lauren G.

description:
This place is super yummy, they make fresh tasting froyo that is blended before your eyes.

It's super cool watching them make the froyo. Starting with a flat circular chunk, they throw it into the spiral machine along with your choice of toppings. The drill then mixes all of the yummy goodness together to create your one of kind master piece froyo!

You really can't wrong with anything here so go crazy with your toppings! No one is judging! =]
author: Kelly L.

description: I came to visit San Fransisco and my friend suggested to try Loving cup. Well I am glad we did! Loved it!! My husband tried the vanilla strawberry and I did vanilla with pecans walnuts and coconut. Both were great!
author: Edilia D.

description: Fun place. Always a line, but moves very quickly. Several flavor toppings and different variations.
author: Nathan L.

description:
Loving Cup you are always and forever my favorite frozen yogurt place on the planet. I have moved states, traveled far and wide, and you will always be the best.

I have strayed before but my go-to 99% of the time is vanilla blended with nutella and oreos. You seriously cannot go wrong with this combo... basically anything with nutella here is bomb as the nutella adds so much flavor. The consistency of the yogurt here is great too as it is not too icy but not as creamy as ice cream.

Everyone must go!
author: Chelsea M.

description: This was my first time visiting loving cup and was astonished by how nice the workers were. The young asian gentlemen who looked like he was in his mid twenties helped me. He was excellent in his customer service as he let me try the different rice puddings and giving me his opinions. In the end, try chose to get a large thin mint with gummy bear toppings. I absolutely loved how it tasted and how quick it was served! Overall, I am a satisfied customer and will definitely come back for more!
author: Thien H.

description:
Seriously, the BEST frozen yogurt I have ever had! 

First, choose your yogurt flavor (I believe either vanilla or chocolate).  Then, you choose the mixers, ranging from peanut butter to Nutella to fresh fruit. Finally, watch the magic happen as they blend everything together perfectly!

My suggestion: vanilla frozen yogurt mixed with Nutella and strawberries. Delicious!
author: Cammy G.

description:
I was not a fan and consider this to be a 7x7 fail.

The rice pudding is "good" but nothing I'd recommend a friend go out of her way to try here. Froyo, also meh.

It bugged me that their smallest size was still HUGE - hello, can we TRY to promote healthy living a little while people are trying to get their sweet tooth on? I'm just saying - this is what you give kids?? Where are the kid sizes?

The place was EMPTY when we went after lunch during the workweek, yet the lady working there was still incredibly impatient with us sampling and deciding what to get.   

Sorry that we were customers, giving you business... we know your preference was to talk to your friend who came in to chat, but do your job .. preferably with a smile??!!

Not impressed and will not be returning.
author: Melody T.

description:
Delicious sweet spot where you pick vanilla or chocolate frozen yogurt and then add mix-ins to create your perfect flavor. 

I wanted raspberry and cookie dough, but the raspberry was very overpowering. I'll choose another mix-in next time!
author: Meg R.

description:
Honestly, I wanted to like this place, but when it comes down to it, it's just a fancied up froyo version of Cold Stone. 

What brings the rating down is the service. My sister and I came in around six o'clock, so granted everyone is ready to head home; the employee was no exception and she sure let it show. She wasn't very welcoming & literally just slid our cups over the counter as she slumped back to the cash register. For a creamery with "Loving" in the title, the atmosphere was pretty sad. 

The first time I went, I tried "The Dude Abides" (chocolate base with english toffee and almond butter) which was rich but good.

This second time I made my own mix of a vanilla base with strawberry and nutella, reminiscent of a crepe. It was subpar. My sister tried the Strawberry Shortcake (vanilla base with strawberry and animal crackers) and said the taste did not match its price.

Overall, I don't think I'll come back, but then again maybe it's my fault for even crossing over into this part of town...
author: Sophia W.

description:
The fro yo at Loving Cup is toooooo good. How it works: you pick a flavor (vanilla or chocolate), then choose your goodies and they are blended in to the yogurt.

Chocolate + Nutella + strawberries
Vanilla + mango + gummy bears
Vanilla + banana + Oreo 

Yum NOM! I want more. Go and you will be addicted like me!
author: Kirby T.

description:
5 star Coconut rice pudding- heavenly, just the right amount of sugar and coconut taste
1 star Lemon rice pudding- did not like the taste and I am a huge lemon fan (lemon bars, lemon cake)
5 star customer service- super sweet cashier, offered to give me samples (wish I'd taken her up on that) and filled my medium half-and-half cup to the top!!
3 stars -pricing is a bit on the high side considering the ingredients and portions.
author: Jenny L.

description:
This is MY FAVORITE FROYO PLACE, HANDS DOWN! I could seriously eat this everyday, but I must restrain myself. If I decide to go, and there is absolutely no parking, I drop my friend off in front and make him/her order for me. Girl's gotta have her froyo! 

My favorite froyo combo is the chocolate and vanilla swirl with junior mints. YUM! 

You'll keep coming back for more and find that you've punched the crap out of your frequent buyer card, and ALAKAZAM! You got yourself a FREE small froyo!
author: Shannon L.

description:
Stopped by here because of it's location next to Tonic.  Why not try it?

Loving Cup is San Francisco's equivalent to NYC's Rice to Riches.

I have to say it is good for what it is, but I'm not a huge fan of the product itself so my review might be biased.

It is a tasty treat if you're into rice pudding.  I have yet to find a flavor that would make me crave loving cup.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Trust me when I say I'm a frozen yogurt connoisseur. How do you know this? Because, first of all, I refuse to call it "fro-yo." THAT is proof. But really, I used to work at a frozen yogurt shop for two years in high school, tried all flavors, multiple combinations, and even checked out competitors. Plus, I'm from Orange County where Yogurtland emerged. Okay, enough uptalk.

I adore the Loving Cup. I can't even tell you the number of times I've been here. If I checked in as much as I visited, I'd probably singlehandedly crash the Yelp app.

How it works:
1. Pick a base - vanilla or chocolate.
2. Pick your toppings - they range from candy to fruit to sweets and more.
3. If you don't want frozen yogurt, the rice pudding selection is ace.

The machine the employees use essentially mixes the topping(s) you selected into the yogurt base you chose. Example: if you pick vanilla base with strawberry topping you will then have a pink strawberry yogurt! I  made the mistake of picking blueberries with chocolate base the first time because I didn't understand this concept and in return I got a blue/purple yogurt with seeds all over it. Fortunately, I've matured in topping selection since then.

Customer service is always friendly and I like the cute interior of the shop. On weekends it can get a bit crowded late-night but it's never been a huge problem or slow when I'm there. 

Be sure to get a stamp card and remember they charge a small fee ($0.25) if you don't hit the minimum credit card charge.
author: Salma R.

description: Came across this place after dinner and decided to give it a try. I wanted to sample the rice pudding before committing to the familiar froyo. Unfortunately, the cashier said they ran out of tasting spoons and while disappointed I went ahead and ordered a froyo and got a spoon with it.
author: W A.

description:
I found this place when I was craving ice cream and searching for places around town. I found this via Yelp and am so glad I did! It's a new experience, as I got the mixed yogurt (java chip, yum!) and also the cookies and cream rice pudding...yes, you read that right. Cookies and cream rice pudding - it was delicious!

The pricing was normal for around the Bay Area, and it was definitely something unique. A sweet treat for a cool afternoon!
author: Anton E.

description:
If I could use one word to describe this place it would be "NOMZ." No, that's not a word and no, I don't care!

I came here with a friend expecting the typical Yogurtland self-serve but it takes fro-yo to a whole new level. They have a huge selection of mix-ins to choose from and then they grind them all up into one scrumptious mountain of happiness. I got a small sized vanilla-chocolate swirl and mixed in pretzels and nutella, per my friend's recommendation... And thus, the NOMZ.

The small was a perfect amount and was less than $5. The prices can get a little ridiculous if you like a lot of mix-ins (I think they are $0.75 per mix-in after your first mix-in), but if you are looking to treat yo'self after a week of going to the gym and eating healthy, this is the place to do it.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I reviewed earlier that I got the rice pudding, but I can't wait to try the frozen yogurt here!

Going to try on Friday hopefully! :)
author: Mabel Y.

description: I lived two blocks from Loving Cup for one year and probably averaged a visit per week, sometimes two! I absolutely love their toppings here and each ice cream is made fresh. It's my go-to frozen yogurt place in San Francisco.
author: Samara C.

description:
I prefer Bread Pudding over Rice Pudding but Loving Cup's Rice Pudding is pretty good.  

They had 6 flavors: Lemon Vanilla, Cookies n Cream, Cinnamon Rum Raisin, Almond Butter, Coconut and Madagascar Vanilla Bean.

We tasted the Lemon Vanilla (tasty but the lemon was very light) and Cookies n Cream (pretty tasty).  My husband got the Almond Butter, which if you like almond butter, tastes just like it but lighter & creamier.  I chose the Madagascar Vanilla Bean and added Nutella to mix in (loved it).

Like I said, I'm not crazy about rice pudding but if I'm ever in the mood for it, I'd come here for it.
author: Rose A.

description: I guess they have a variety of rice pudding you can choose from, and their smoothies are not bad. But I'm not too crazy about this place.
author: Ying Z.

description: Walking by this amazing frozen yogurt every day is really hard!! Once you have tried it, it's hard to resist. I know how vanilla base with nutella and cookie dough, nutella and strawberry, and mango and raspberry, taste like and they are all so good. You can mix and match whatever you want and if you need help the staff are awesome and will gladly help you! So the next time you want awesomeness, PLEASE check out this amazing place, you won't regret it!
author: Victoria V.

description: This review is only for the rice pudding. Yum. There's a big variety of flavors and they're all pretty good, although veryyyy sweet. It's a fun place to go in a great neighborhood, and will definitely satisfy your sweet tooth.
author: Kristina K.

description: Amazing frozen yogurt, the chinese guy is very nice and greets you right away also he makes the yogurt very fast. Loving cup #1 for frozen yogurts.
author: Aaron C.

description: The frozen yogurt here is so unique and delicious. I don't have much of a sweet tooth and I love this place. Almond joy and mango pistachio are my favorite.
author: H K.

description:
I was craving Swensen's and walking to it when I saw Loving Cup. The reviews were really great and I didn't want to go the last 2 blocks up the hill so I decided to give it a shot. Definitely did not live up to its hype. 

I got the raspberry with vanilla yogurt thinking I'd have a good punch of raspberry (or even vanilla). Instead I got a bland icy flavor in my mouth. Yes its cool they can mix the two the way they do, but it would be even better if it actually had flavor.
author: Analisa S.

description:
Service is extremely slow. I get that the yogurt is made 'fresh' but it is unbearably slow. Don't come if you expect to leave within 15-20 minutes.

I got:

Vanilla Base + rain bow sprinkles and Salted caramel.

it was ok.
author: King H.

description:
You choose the base (chocolate or vanilla), then choose your toppings. With Nutella, espresso, coconut, and peanut butter flavors, you can't go wrong.

They're not toppings, by the way. They don't go on top. They're mixed in, with this intimidating-looking drill diddly-do-dat. (I believe that's the technical term.)

It's delicious, by the way. And so are their smoothies. Oh, and that rice pudding. The service...

I could go on.
author: Adena B.

description:
This is an update:
I am changing my rating to 4stars because the owner Liz reached out and addressed this hiccup in Service. Also I would like to state that they do have fantastic yogurt and rice pudding. 
------------------
Prior review:
I live in the neighborhood and come into Loving cup for a sweet treat here and there. I went in last Friday night to get something sweet and the guy behind the counter ( dark hair, with glasses) made my small yogurt and my husbands which honestly seemed like a XXS size and threw it on the counter ( literally). I then asked if he could clean the yogurt that was dripping off the side and he rolled his eyes. I am very disappointed with loving cup - Word of advice get people who actually want to work in a customer service
author: Jenn J.

description:
love love loving cup! HUGE portions (small is big enough for two. but I still finish all of it myself anyways). 

I haven't even tried the rice pudding yet, but keep on going back for the froyo.  Strawberry + toffee on vanilla = tastes like strawberry shortcake. YUM

my friends who live in russian hill love it so much that they've even taskrabbitted delivery from Loving Cup when they were too lazy to walk 2 blocks there.  it's THAT good. 

Bring cash. credit card transactions less than $10 costs $0.25 extra (thanks to Square).
author: Alice Z.

description:
I have lived in the city for almost 5 years now and have never been here! How is that possible! Walked her recently and fell in love with all of the delicious smells. The have 2 base ice cream flavors(chocolate and vanilla) and then you pick how ever mix ins you want. My go to(i have been back several times since), is vanilla base with peanut butter, oreos and rainbow sprinkles on top.  They also have shakes and rice pudding.The only reason this place is getting 4 stars instead of 5 is because
1. my husband ordered strawberries in his ice cream and you can taste the freezer burn. So my advise, don't get fruit
2. Wish they had a few more mix ins. but that's reallly more of my selfish reasons. My favorite combo is coffee and brownie but i really do like the combination of peanut butter or almond butter with oreos so it works out :)
author: Whitney S.

description: AMAZING frozen yogurt and very good rice pudding. Went here on a sunny day in SF and enjoyed the PB&J frozen yogurt special -- peanut butter and strawberries mixed into vanilla. It was delicious, pretty much tasted like the best PB&J I've ever had. My friend had vanilla yogurt with mango and it was very fresh, creamy, and fruity. I love that they mix fruit into the froyo - it's so much better than a flavored frozen yogurt. I also tried the lemon rice pudding, which was definitely interesting. I'm not sure I could have handled a whole cup of it but it was pretty enjoyable.
author: Riva L.

description:
What a cool little spot!

I had the coconut rice pudding and the Madagascar Vanilla rice pudding in a cup. There were 4-5 kinds to choose from in the display case. Flavors were good but I can make just as good at home with coconut milk. When paying $4+ for a small cup of rice pudding I expected it to blow me away. Don't get me wrong though- it was yummy.

The girl at the counter said it's the only rice pudding shop in San Francisco which is pretty awesome. 

Cash only I believe.
author: Chelsea J.

description: I had the cinnamon raisin rice pudding and my man had the chocolate chip as well as the strawberry shortcake froyo. My rice pudding was tasty but having been to Rice 2 Riches in NYC, nothing can compare. I'll give it another shot whenever I'm in town again. Parking is non-existent...take the BART or Uber. We're out-of-towners so we didn't know any better.
author: C. J.

description:
This review is for the Rice Pudding - I can't say it was my absolute favorite ever but it was quite possibly the best I've had in the Bay. Loved the chocolate chip rice pudding - so vanilla-y, yummy and flavorful. 

I also tried some of their yogurts and had I not already eaten yogurt, I would have definitely indulged in that as well. 

THEY HAVE A WALL OF NUTELLA - PHOTO OP PEOPLE OF THE WORLD. 

Our server was patient - letting us try and make our decision without pressuring us into buying anything.
author: Radhika P.

description: The Loving Cup is super cute! The cookies and cream rice pudding was really good and creamy! Along with great food, the customer service was awesome.
author: Gail N.

description: On the evening of Labor Day, I visited loving cup with a friend, the wait was longer than usual due to a huge crowd of customers which was understandable (Since I've worked at a similar job). What really got me was the older woman who was helping customers at the register. She seemed friendly towards the customers, but she would turn around and give the two younger workers a lot of attitude and being quite hostile. I don't know if this is a normal on going thing, but it makes me want to take my business elsewhere... If the management is this poor.
author: Irvin H.

description:
A good place for dessert.

A variety of mix and matches to your preference. I felt rushed as I didn't know what I actually wanted. Just ordered off the menu on the wall. It was great! I ordered a small size and a mini would've been perfect.

I will be back again, but this time READY To make my own concoction.
author: Mel L.

description:
I must have caught them on a bad night the first time I went there. I was really displeased with the attitude I was given when I walked in and left a 1-star review. The owner reached out to me and offered a free cup of yogurt. 

As nice of a gesture as that was, I didn't want to take her up on the offer. Instead I came back on my own and had one of the best yogurts I've ever had. They have an amazing variety if toppings and it's blended to perfection. I now understand why there is a line and the reviews are so stellar. If definitely recommend this anytime!
author: Joustin C.

description:
Today I got to finally try this dessert spot I had book marked for months after meeting with a new client in the area. My hubby and I decided to go here after having brunch at Leopold's across the street. 

They really are known for thier rice puddings and they come in several flavors, including vanilla, rum raison and coconut, all of which I got to sample today. I ended up getting the coconut in a small, which was more than satisifing and filling. It was perfectly thick and sweet, with a mild coconut flavor and texture. My hubby got the coffee shake made with blue bottle coffee, he said was just OK and didn't have enough coffee flavor for him.

Anyway, do try this place if you're a rice pudding lover such as myself and don't be afraid to sample beforehand, as the staff are more than happy to assist you!
author: Petra S.

description:
Cute little shop with super friendly employees. Parking in the area around dinnertime is an absolute nightmare. Luckily, I got a tasty cup of rice pudding to make me feel better. 

Warning: this stuff is dangerous. I was getting the munchies in the early evening, and had some time to kill before work. I got my small cup of rice pudding, ate it, and decided I didn't really feel any less hungry. Meaning that the pudding is a great choice when you're craving something sweet but don't want to make much in the way of a stomach space investment. if you're curious, their website says that a small serving has 195 calories and 3.5g fat.

As for the rice pudding itself, if they wanted to go an Italian route, they could easily call this a dessert risotto. It's made with short grain rice and has more ooze & flow than I'm accustomed to with rice pudding. Not that that's a bad thing. The texture of the pudding part is fantastic - not too rich, doesn't leave a starchy/chalky/gummy residue in your mouth, lightly sweet, and pairs well with the al dente grains of rice.

Since I now work in Russian Hill, I know for a fact that I will return. Probably next week.
author: Amanda S.

description: soooo good. best frozen yogurt I've had in a really long time. great set of toppings and the frozen yogurt itself is incredible. must try!
author: Kelsey K.

description: Hand pressed and blended frozen yogurt that is simply amazing! Never seen it made this way but the consistency, texture and taste are simply incredible! The variations in flavors and ingredients are limitless, but I stick to the favorites list and have never been disappointed. Try the "salty dog" and or the "dirty hipster", simply wonderful. Must try for the yogurt fan.
author: Richard H.

description:
I always get the rice pudding. The regular vanilla kind. You just can't beat the original. 

However, I get the best of both worlds since my boyfriend tries different convos of the soft serve and I get to try them. The soft serve here is special because they don't just throw the ingredients on top like most places - they PRESS the ingredients through it to make the flavors become one. It's simply delicious. We like the thin mint and Oreos. 

Perfect for date night. Or after the gym. Or by yourself. Or right now, whatever you're doing.
author: Aggie N.

description:
Unlike the billion frozen yogurt shops that are in the Bay Area, there aren't too many rice pudding shops. Probably because everybody would go to Loving Cup anyway. Their rice pudding is so simple (only 6 ingredients they say!), yet so delicious. I love the fact that it's not very sweet, which also means I could shovel down a pint of it in one sitting if you let me.

Best flavor hands down is cookies and cream, but the pumpkin was excellent as well and tasted like pumpkin pie. 

They also sell froyo. You can watch them make it, which is pretty cool. But definitely don't pass up on getting some rice pudding when you are in the area.
author: Tim W.

description: Great combinations and a friendly environment. It was a perfect late night treat that hit the spot. I'm a big peanut butter fan and they knocked it out of the park. I preferred the ingredients and taste much more than similar franchised venues.
author: Judge D.

description:
This place has some of the creamiest, smoothest frozen yogurt I've ever had! YUM. It's also located in an area that doesn't have a lot of frozen yogurt places (that I know of at least) so we were happy to stop in on Saturday given how amazingly warm and beautiful it was outside!

Their featured froyo of the day was "thin mints" which we got, as well as a vanilla based yogurt with nutella. The nutella one was perfectly smooth and delicious without being overwhelming, I could actually taste the vanilla yogurt underneath. The thin mints one was *exactly* like eating thin mints out of the box. Talk about flashbacks to going to the movie theatre back in the 80s. 

Interestingly, they also double mix some of their concoctions. I've never seen a place do that before. I think it's part of what makes their yogurt so smooth and delicious.

Fortunately they're far enough away from my apartment that I won't be going every day, but I'm glad they're nearby. I can see myself stopping in often enough when I need a treat!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
I applaud any small business for trying to make it in this crappy economy. That's why this place gets 4 stars. 

This is a frozen yogurt shop that also sells rice pudding and smoothies. The line was long so I assumed this was something special. It's basically a run of the mill fro yo shop. You pick a base (vanilla or chocolate), pick add ins like fruit, Nutella, toffee, etc.. and they swirl it all together using this contraption that kind of looks like a turbine. 

The end result was basically a very bland tasting fro yo. The add-ins end up really broken down so you can't even taste them really. I got vanilla with fruit and toffee and I couldn't taste the toffee, just the fruit, which wasn't fresh. I know this place is busy and the employees are friendly but I've had a lot of fro yo and this place just doesn't measure up. I do love any entrepreneur and will always give props to people that have the guts to open a business, so I will always give them a high rating. So, 4 stars for service and location.
author: Sam W.

description:
In search of a great dessert in the neighborhood, we located Loving Cup on yelp and were amazed by the great food, wide selection and amazing service. It was hard to choose between so many great options. I don't usually order rice pudding over frozen yogurt but the cookies and cream rice pudding was amazing! They also made the rice pudding from just a few fresh ingredients.

The frozen yogurt is offered in a blended form, meaning that you choose vanilla or chocolate and then choose from tons of flavors to blend into the fro yo. They also have a banana base for a healthy and delicious choice. 

The staff was also so friendly and patient while we chose our order. I will be back!!
author: Rachel C.

description: I'd give this place a one star, if they didn't have expertly churned froyo that is ALSO fat free (non-fat for laymen), and enough toppings to make me question my entire existence up until this very moment in time as I take another bite of this vanilla, Oreo, and English toffeeeeeeohmygah just take me froyo. Just take all of me. Because all of me loves all of you. And there will soon be more of me, because I ate all of you.
author: Alex L.

description:
OMG! Some of the best frozen yogurt I've ever had! 

Everything about Loving Cup was awesome - service, food (frozen yogurt!), and store/environment. 

They offer non-fat frozen yogurt and rice puddings (cookies n cream, cinnamon rum raisin, chocolate chip, and more..) For the frozen yogurt, you first pick the base (vanilla or chocolate), and then you add the "blends", toppings that get blended and mixed into the frozen yogurt with cool mixing contraption. The first blend is free and additional blends are $0.75.

I had vanilla blended with almond butter and oreos. It was sooo good. I highly recommend adding almond butter. Almond butter gave it a bit of saltiness and made the frozen yogurt very thick and creamy. 

I love you, Loving Cup!
author: Monica T.

description: First time at Loving Cup today and I've been wanting to try it forever. For being a Sunday afternoon, there was about a 10 people inside this small shop. Unlike most fro yo places, you choose between vanilla and chocolate frozen yogurt and then choose from a huge selection of topics for them to mix in. Kind of like cold stone, but with frozen yogurt. I got the vanilla yogurt with blueberries and toasted coconut mixed in. It was so good, very fresh ingredients. Next time I'll definitely try one of the chocolate combinations.
author: Allison D.

description: Passed by and was entertained by the menu. Went with Froyo and got the Dude Abides (Toffee, almond butter, chocolate). It was too sticky and sweet for me and I had to spread one cup out out over a few days, but it's ok because I spread the Love.
author: Shelley C.

description: Didn't try the fro-yo but had the coconut rice pudding and the mocha shake. The rice pudding was very good and the mocha shake was just okay - the coffee flavor was very good but not quite enough chocolate yogurt flavor and they didn't blend well - much stirring needed to be done. Bonus points for Ariana Grande piping through the speakers, as I was with the 14-year-old girl :-)
author: Laurie H.

description:
My favorite ice cream joint!

My receipt for success: 
Vanilla
Banana
Strawberries
Cookie dough

To die for! This place has such a unique taste - like nothing I've ever had before.

Come find your own creation!
author: Heather H.

description:
Have my prayers been honestly answered? I couldn't believe a shop could exist that serves homemade rice pudding and survive the current economic malaise. And yet here it is on Polk just a belch away from Miller's East Coast  Deli. It's a sweet, compact place that serves bowls of rice puddings with different flavors mixed in...coconut, pumpkin pie spice, lemon. I went with a small cup of the peanut butter for $3.75.

Ambrosia. Well, a tad too congealed but ambrosia nonetheless with chopped peanuts on top. Jamie W. decided to go for a small cup of their frozen yogurt (also $3.75), and he also went for a peanut butter flavor to go with his chocolate base. I've never seen one of those machines that cranks the yogurt out after sifting it twice for the right texture.

The result was worth it, as it had a creamy consistency with just a bit of lumpishness to make you know there's real peanut butter in there. Rice pudding. Hand-cranked frozen yogurt. It was enough to make me cry. But I didn't. I was strong as I aggressively licked my spoon with the dexterity of Monica Lewinsky or at least Larry Craig. Gee, I have to update my pop culture references.

TREATS - 5 stars...really good stuff here and organic, too...and I loves me some rice pudding
AMBIANCE - 4.5 stars...old-fashioned vibe if a bit tight considering the numbers that stream in here
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...a very nice owner...she does need an assistant
TOTAL - 5 stars....come fill your loving cup here...my name is Puddin'tain, ask me again and I'll tell you the same.
author: Ed U.

description:
The good: the ice cream and the amazing machine they mix it in.
The bad: it's one block down from where I live which makes me crave it every day.

With so many combinations, you can go a few months without having the same flavors. Unfortunately after the first time i got vanilla frozen yogurt with pretzels and Nutella, there was no turning back to any other flavors.  The ice cream is amazing and Bertha (the machine they mix it in) is enjoyable to watch while you wait in line. I also recommend the chocolate chip rice pudding. I just wish they would bring the cones from the Hayes Valley location up to Polk.
author: Steven G.

description:
Oh hello Loving Cup. You're almost as delicious Rice to Riches in NYC!

Great little spot in Russian Hill to grab some awesome rice pudding or frozen yogurt. But I've never even gotten to the froyo because the rice pudding is so amazing. 

Wish there were a few more flavors, but definitely worth a visit.
author: Lynn C.

description: Butterfinger FroYo is sooooo good. Wife had the banana FroYo it was fresh and delicious.
author: Tony M.

description: Everything it is delicious! Make it your own and enjoy. It's healthy without tasting too rice like, and in a super great location.
author: Alanna P.

description: They have some awesome favors, we got the dirty hipster which is vanilla, Nutella, and Oreos.  But it was way too sweet.  My gf and I ended up only eating 3/4ths of a small cup before we lost our appetite and threw rest of it away.  I wish they'd make less sweet version.
author: Charlie B.

description: Loving cup has the best rice pudding and fro yo that your taste buds will evahhhh experience. The rice pudding flavors are constantly rotating,and you can create whatever combo of fro yo that your little healthy heart desires. Ca$h only, I've seen many people bolt to the Bank of America across the street because its so damn worth it.
author: Court S.

description:
This place's concept is pretty cool. Custom froyo? Yes please. 

You pick your base (chocolate or vanilla) and your mix ins, and they put it into a machine that whips it all together. Is that machine proprietary bc I want to buy one for my house.

My fav combo is Raspberry and Nutella with vanilla. They also have rice pudding but I'm not sure if anyone actually buys that. 

The fact that this place is right next to my house is a little dangerous, but it's getting colder now so maybe winter will curb my addiction.
author: Michelle A.

description: Organic froyo? Definitely got my attention. I got the vanilla strawberry and it was probably one of the best froyos i have ever tasted. It tasted very natural and had a great texture! I really like how you are able to make your flavor and the price is very reasonable for the amount they serve. I'm definitely coming back :)
author: Samantha T.

description:
Definitely the best tasting frozen yogurt I've had in the city. However, unlike other places, once you select toppings they will blend it into the yogurt. This creates a different consistency which some people may not like. E.g. if you order oreos, you will not get chunks of oreos, it will be tiny pieces blended in. 

Cost & size:
Sizes are relatively big - a small is approx $4.50 and could be shared between two (just ask for an extra cup). It's an extra 25c for credit card. 

My favorite yogurt:
Vanilla flavor with pretzels and oreos

Staff:
Hit or miss - sometimes they are super friendly and will let you sample the rice pudding. Other times they clearly dislike their job and want to finish the shift.
author: Amy M.

description: Yum! I'm missing the plethora of froyo choices on the east coast, but loving cup helps fill the void. Very good yogurt, and nice variety of toppings.
author: Therese M.

description:
Cute little rice pudding / make-your-own frozen yogurt shop. =)
Favorites were cookies n cream & Madagascar rice pudding!!

You can have half /half and they also do samplings of their puddings -- 
toffee, peanut butter, cookies n cream, etc etc. =) 

Parking is pretty bad .. best thing to do might be to do a quick drop off (if you have someone driving you). Otherwise.. walk walk walk !!! =)

** a friend told me there are two hot guys working here.. haha I didn't see them though =P
author: Mimi C.

description:
The best frozen yogurt I've ever had, ever. EVER
I prefer loving cup over ice cream, even talenti ice cream. 

I've had pinkberry, red mango, tutti melon or whatever, and every other froyo place under the sun--except fraiche, and LOVING CUP WINS buy 2 million points.

There isn't any of that weird "froyo" aftertaste, and the froyo is actually frozen solid everytime, the texture is so creamy and perfect, helps that Loving Cup makes their own homemade froyo, so you know the mix isn't coming out of a plastic bag--cough cough pinkberry.

My go to is the "butterfinger" it's vanilla froyo base, with peanut butter, and toffee. SO . GOOD. I crave it so often, I find myself here every week.
author: Alexandra C.

description:
If they ever have the red velvet special, DON'T MISS OUT!

They mix in a full red velvet cupcake with frozen yogurt within a big swirling/blender type machine...What you just imagined in your head does not even come close to how good this treat is. Red velvet swirled frozen yogurt goodness. Swirling different ingredients into frozen yogurt as opposed to just putting them on top is a novel idea.

Not an expert on rice pudding, but it was good as well and I'm a fan! Very tasty. Lots of variety to choose from.
author: Brian L.

description: AMAZING.. On vacation and was told to go here. Neat concept of picking a chocolate or vanilla base then your toppings then having them blended together.. It's still chunky and very flavorful! Neat compared to normal froyo places where toppings are put on after. Employee was so friendly and made us feel very welcome!
author: Jessica P.

description:
This place makes me want to cry. I'm just a food fanatic trying to lose weight and Loving Cup is just making it so hard. 

In reality, the yogurt at Loving Cup deserves a full five stars. The idea is genius - choose as you like. Depending on whether you like vanilla or chocolate, you can add whatever toppings your stomach desires and VOILA, heavenly creamy froyo. The thing I love most, alongside with the personalization of flavors, has got to be the texture of their yogurts. Its fresh; meaning you'll never get it melting like many self-serve yogurt shops. Secondly, despite the abundance of flavors you can possibly incorporate into your yogurt, its never overwhelmingly sweet! I love how you can taste each and every flavor you add on. My favorite so far is the vanilla base with nutella, strawberry, and banana. I can't wait til my next visit to start playing with more of the add-ons. 

Aside from the yogurt, I would probably pass on the rice pudding. I sampled a majority of their flavors and none of them particularly stands out. It's worth trying, but I'd stick with the frozen yogurt! 

Maybe it's not a bad thing I live so far away from Loving Cup (bye bye summer bod). Your yogurts are so addicting!
author: Regina C.

description: I hate rice pudding, unless it is from here! Cinnamon rum raisin rice pudding is the best.
author: Jenn T.

description:
The name says it all. This place is heavenly. You can't go wrong with vanilla, Nutella, and banana. Magic every time. 

Bring cash.
author: Malea B.

description:
Am I the only one who craved rice pudding after the Rice to Riches scene in Hitch? You know, "Hitch" featuring Will Smith and Eva Mendes? Most importantly, "Rice To Riches" and their variety of rice puddings for dessert, or for me - anytime! No? Just me? Goood- more for me! 

Vanilla or Chocolate rice pudding with the Black-bottom ganache reminds me so much of the Filipino rice pudding, Champorado - especially made by my grandma! Creamsicle, Vanilla Lemon with strawberries for topping and Coconut are all just as yummy. Mocha is good but rich in flavor - I like to top it off with some steamed milk or fresh whipped cream. I've yet to see the Nutella or Pecan Praline flavor, but I will keep returning! 

Loving Cup also serves NON-FAT frozen yogurt, vanilla or chocolate. But what makes them stand out are the toppings you can choose to have mixed in. From fruit, such as strawberries and blueberries to creamy, Nutella, Almond Butter and Peanut Butter. The crunchy, animal crackers, graham crackers to sprinkles and gummy bears! The Vanilla with Nutella and animal crackers for crunch I had has been on mind!

The rice pudding hits the spot when you want more than just ice cream or cake for dessert. The non-fat yogurt with mix-ins is great for a healthy treat with a touch of sweetness! So try to leave a little more room for this stuff, cause it's quite filling!
author: S Y.

description:
This place is amazing. 6 different flavors of rice pudding and a bunch of different toppings to choose from! I came here for my first time yesterday and the available flavors of rice pudding were pumpkin, cinnamon rum raisin, mocha chip, madagascar vanilla, and coconut (can't remember the other one!) I sampled the mocha chip. It was smooth and perfectly sweetened with mini chocolate chips in there. I opted to go with the classic vanilla. I decided to be naughty and get it black bottomed, which is a layer of thick chocolate ganache on the bottom. The girl serving us did not skimp on anything. She topped the pudding with cinnamon. Not only did it look beautiful, but it tasted wonderful!!! I also got a Cubano latte, which is when they add brown sugar to the pulled espresso. Yummy! 

I will definitely be back to try the frozen yogurt.
author: Olivia B.

description:
I'm a bit of a fro yo addict and I have to say this is some of the best fro yo I've ever had. They have the standard flavors (chocolate and vanilla) and then usually one or two other flavors of the week -- my favorite is when they have peanut butter flavor. You pick your yogurt and then whatever toppings you'd like to add in. They have a solid selection of toppings and their fruit is fresh which is a big plus. They also blend your topping into the frozen yogurt which makes it taste even better.

It's become my go to when I am craving frozen yogurt!
author: Lizzy U.

description: Just go here, you will love it, guaranteed. Try the rice pudding (coconut is to die for if you're into coconut...) otherwise can't go wrong with a vanilla base and fruit of your choice. Also don't be afraid to go animal cookies. Strawberry + animal cookies...it's like a shortcake explosion of happiness in your mouth.
author: Ada K.

description:
I'm, admittedly, not a fan of rice pudding, so I won't comment much on that aside from saying that it seems like they carry up to five varieties (of 15+) at a time in their display case, which you're allowed to ask for samples of.

I instead opted for one of their small, but very hefty, blended frozen yogurts for $3.75. The idea is simple: choose either vanilla or chocolate froyo, then select from a list of ~30 toppings (first is free, with an additional charge for any extra) that they'll blend straight into your flavor of choice. 

Not bad, but my decision to get vanilla and granola was a poor one, as granola doesn't work too well blended into froyo (texture-wise). And personally, their froyo reminds me of soft serve: thick, creamy, fairly sweet, and lacking the tart flavor I usually associate, and prefer, with froyo.

Keep in mind that the space is small, and indoor seating is limited (I counted five bar stools), so I wouldn't count on being able to lounge indoors. Also, they do have a stamp card for froyo here via Stampt (buy nine get one small free), so make sure to get in on that. For those who lack smart phones, like myself, they also carry traditional paper punch cards.
author: Johnny W.

description: This place is mediocre. I was hoping to have a great experience here based on what everyone is saying but it was the complete opposite. The employee working today at 2pm was charging her phone on the wall and texting on her phone while she was taking my order. Super unprofessional. The yogurt I got was okay.
author: Jack K.

description:
Unlike our visit and my "kinky" purchase at the Fashion Exchange, now this a shop definitely suitable for my daughter. 

The tiny shop serve coffee/espresso, fresh pastries and other tasty treats. But the shop is definitely best-known for it's hand-made flavored rice-pudding. My daughter and I split a small Madagascar Vanilla Rice-Pudding. For a item that is hand-made and made continously, the $3.50 treat was sweet and creamy with a nice and thick texture. Just by seeing the glaring smile on her face, this treat is an instant favorite of hers. 

And since my niece is entertaining my daughter that evening, I also bought a $5.00 medium bowl of Key-lime pudding. Since my daughter loved that pudding so much, I'm not too sure if that Key-lime pudding made it to my niece's crib. 

Just kidding; it did and they enjoyed the sweet treat too!

This shop is cash only and has a Yelp-sticker too. And since this shop is close to my crib, my family and/or I will definitely be a regular here and come here at least once or twice a week.
author: Matt G.

description:
Word to the wise: Go hungry.

The frozen yogurt is ginormous. Yes, even the small. Basic vanilla or chocolate with your choice of frozen fruit blended in.

The rice pudding is awesome and possibly healthy? Skeptical, but still loving it, loving cup.

Rotating flavors keeps you coming back (if only they offered some warm options). There could be nothing better on a chilly day. Comfort food to the max.

Espresso to go with that pudding? You bet. Just make sure you order that shot of Blue Bottle a half hour or more before they close or you'll be SOL.

Oh, and for those of you too-cool-for-(birthday)cake, they do fro yo pies. Just sayin'.
author: Alissa A.

description:
Two Years ago I went to Rice to Riches in New York. Therefore, I was surprised my intern didn't know of this place (just Yelped it during our walk in SF) even though they were a native in the city.

'Lo and behold SF had their own Rice Pudding spot and it they called it loving cup. According to one of their highlighted articles (circa 2005), their Coconut Rice Pudding was to die for (at least for Bay Area standards).

I didn't try that one only because I wasn't in the mood for Coconut, said I opted for their most basic and foundational flavor, Madagascar Vanilla Bean Rice Pudding.

Definitely flavorful and lots of Vanilla throughout the tasting. Usually vanilla takes a back seat in most desserts or as a supplement, however you can really get the sweet taste and fragrance from the rice pudding. The texture of the rice has a nice suppleness to it, not too mushy whatsoever.

We also got a fro-yo affogato and it was alright, nothing amazing about it. The overall experience and customer service in consideration, gotta give this place a 3.5. Haven't really found a rice pudding that really stood out in either coast. Cheers.
author: Ryan M.

description:
In my wildest dreams, I live next door to Loving Cup and gorge on their delicious froyo and rice pudding daily to my tummy's full content.

However, since I live in reality, and must battle 5.8 miles of SF traffic and tackle unfavorable parking to get here, I attempt to come as often as possible instead. Lucky for me, my friend works nearby, and visiting him at work has become a great guise for trekking out here as much as I do. 

Initially, a Scoutmob deal brought me here; however, my inaugural cup of Coconut and English Toffee rice pudding has kept me coming back. The only rice pudding I'd eaten prior was of the Kozy Shack variety, and in a battle to the death, Loving Cup would definitely reign as survivor. They offer a variety of mouth-watering flavors that change daily; however, coconut and rum raisin (and maybe a few others?) are permanent fixtures to their delectable offerings. Fortunately, coconut also remains conveniently undefeated as my #1 flavor. The creamy consistency of the rice pudding coupled with the extra depth of flavor the coconut imparts gets me everytime. 

And the love doesn't stop with the rice pudding. The froyo is equally delightful! It starts with a choice of chocolate or vanilla base and proceeds with the selection of "mix-ins" to really add that extra pizazz. My favorite concoction is vanilla froyo with nutella and Oreo, a combination no taste buds should ever be deprived of. Also, don't forget to unlock the check-in offer to get a mix-in for free! 

The only thing I actually dislike here is the chocolate froyo. And unfortunately, it's sometimes all that's left if you come too near to closing.

Regardless, the little cups of love this place doles out has still managed to capture this girl's heart. 4 stars!
author: Natasha H.

description:
Hand mixed fro yo and fresh rice pudding with various flavors! I got my fro yo with toffee and it was a little sweet but the coconut rice pudding was actually really tasty. 

Don't forget the stamp card if you want to come here frequently!
author: Betty C.

description:
This is by far the best frozen yogurt shop I have ever been to, and I've been to my fair share of yogurt places. The consistency is so rich and creamy that you'd never even know it's frozen yogurt! I ordered vanilla froyo with Nutella and salty pretzels, but I went with someone who tried the Butterfinger mix-ins, and that was even better than mine (which was very good)! The portions are also very filling, so don't go too crazy with the cup size!

When you want to order, I recommend asking for the secret menu that they have for inspiration.
author: Chloe T.

description:
I'm not usually a sweets person (I prefer my meat!) but I find myself craving Loving Cup from time to time.

They're known for their rice pudding, but I decided to get their blended yogurt instead.  You get to pick your flavors and toppings (fruit, oatmeal, gummy bears, chocolate, lots of choices!) and then they pour everything in a machine and blend it all together.  It was very yummy.  I was able to try a little of their rice pudding also and I DEFINITELY want to get that next time I go.

Now I'm always down for dessert as long as it's Loving Cup!
author: Jane N.

description:
No matter how many times I come to this amazing fro-yo place...I will never truly understand how they create such magical-ness from that hand cranked machine.

I just watch the young hipster good looking gals and perfectly coiffed hair men dump a cube of fro yo, drop in a handful of amazing toppings and then pump up and down.....ta-da!!! amazing-ness just oozes out!!!

In my head it just gets smooshed and pressurized into greatness. 

I use to work at a fro yo joint and was so jaded with the whole fad. Then I gave this place a try and literally when I put the first spoonful of Loving Cup in my mouth I closed my mouth and had to wire the thoughts into my brain not to freak out.



My Loving Cup loyalty card (1)  is in my pouch that I carry my Drivers License (2), credit card (3)  and cash(4) . yes those 4 things. the essentials. 

love this place!!
author: Selina W.

description: Great customizable Froyo place that is not the same as your typical Froyo establishment. You pick a base (either vanilla or chocolate) and then pick however many toppings you want them to mix in. The first topping is complementary and then additional ones are $0.75. There was a wide array of toppings to choose from including a variety of fruits, toasted coconut, peanut butter, nutella, Oreos, pretzels, animal crackers etc. They also provide a list of popular combinations like The Dirty Hipster (vanilla base with nutella and Oreos). I almost got that but decided it might be too much of a sugar overload for me so I opted for vanilla with almond butter, nutella, and pretzels instead. Ah-mazing. When they prepare the Froyo, they actually thoroughly mix in and blend the ingredients together which is pretty unique. I think I prefer this kind of Froyo to the typical ones where you add as many flavors and toppings as you want because I usually get too many flavors/toppings and end up with a vat of Froyo that is overwhelming in taste and size.
author: Jenny B.

description:
Hands down the best frozen yogurt, chocolate w Nutella, I've ever experienced. I've also tried chocolate w peanut butter and chocolate w Oreos and peanut butter. I'm seriously considering hypnosis to quit. :/
Only frustrating bit a large is sometimes a medium cause it dosn't get fully pressed, please don't leave yogurt in funnel that I paid for guys!! Thx! Thx!
author: M M.

description: Really cute shop, amazing smoothies! The "Blues for banana" smoothie is incredible. The only thing that I would possibly change about the place is to make the straws a bit bigger, takes forever to drink a smoothie through them. So yeah, 6/5 if possible.
author: Daniel L.

description:
I love their frozen yogurt! I know it's known for their rice pudding, but I think I'm just not that much of a fan of it. 

Frozen yogurt:
I like that you get to create your own flavor by adding in your own mix-ins. 
Step 1. I like to choose vanilla as my base frozen yogurt flavor
Step 2. I pick nutella and raspberries as my mix-ins
They don't just put the mix-ins on top of the yogurt, they actually put it into a machine and mix all of it up!

It's like a little tornado looking machine, very cool.

Rice pudding:
they have different flavors everyday. I didn't know which one to choose, so I like that they will give you samples to try it out before you go crazy and buy a cup full that you don't like.

I've had their orange creamsicle, that was good.
vanilla bean is always a good one that won't disappoint.
pistachio was a pleasant surprise, I'll have to get it when i go back.
coconut is alright, but i don't think i can handle a whole cup of that.

TIP: you can do 1/2a cup of one flavor and 1/2 of another flavor. the only thing that might go wrong is that they look the same once it's in the cup.
author: Leanne K.

description:
This time I got to try their Frozen Yogurt and, wow, it's great!

I'm usually not a frozen yogurt fan but what I like about this spot is that they mix items into the yogurt and it really makes it a much better experience.  I had chocolate with Oreo cookie and chocolate chips mixed in and it came out so flavorful.

Highly recommended!
author: Ken G.

description:
What do you get when you combine Cold Stone's hand-mixing ingredients, DQ's Blizzard mixing machine, and fro-yo's fresh ingredients? Loving Cup.

Choose a chocolate or vanilla base fro-yo, choose your ingredients, and the friendly Loving Cup staff will mix it up by hand and then let their mixing machine do the rest of the work. This place takes the best qualities of all your favorite ice cream/fro-yo places and mashes into one uniquely delicious dessert. 

I had the vanilla base with strawberries and nutella. You could taste how fresh the strawberries were even after they were sort of blended into the fro-yo. I've also heard good things about their specialty rice pudding. Next time I'm in the city, I'd love to come back and try something new!
author: Stacy H.

description:
I would give this place 4.5 stars but since you can't, I don't want to give it a full 100% A+

However... this place is pure GENIUS. They have delicious rice pudding (a favorite of mine) which you can put toppings on. AND they have organic frozen yogurt which they blend with a topping so the end result is creamy and delicious.

The staff is also super friendly and helpful. 

They are a tad expensive, $3.75 for a small of yogurt or rice pudding. 

I am so excited to go back and get rice pudding! 

Tip: Cash only. And they have 3 stools inside + a bench outside.

Definitely worth checking out. ENJOY the blended creamy goodness.
author: Allie E.

description: The best frozen yogurt in the city.  I would work out at Crunch  Gym and then treat myself to a Chocolate and peanut butter frozen yogurt.  The creamy consistency and crunch of the peanuts is incredible.  I would battle the parking situation any day for a single cup of this tasty dessert.  They also have rice puddings which seem popular.
author: Erika A.

description:
All in favor of a community fundraiser to buy Loving Cup another fro yo magic machine say aye. Aye! 

Love this charmer on Polk. It's a great alternative to neighborhood favories Yoppi and Swensen's.  Haven't tried the rice pudding, but the fro yo with mix ins are great. My personal favorite is vanilla base with nutella and pb. Love that you can have your toppings on top vs mixed in.

The only thing about this place (which as you can see does not influence my star rating) is that it can be very slow. They only have one machine, and, stealing a line from the Blue Barn book - good food takes time. Very worth the wait!
author: Brianna M.

description:
I have random rice pudding cravings in the middle of the night thanks to this place (and Rice to Riches, but we don't have one in the area, so this will do). :) 

Ordered half lemon cream and half almond butter topped with granola when I was here. The lemon cream was bomb.com (drool). As for the almond butter...ehhh...I wasn't a fan. I think it tasted more like toasted almond shells (the owners should consider changing the name). 

Anyway, I absolutely adore this place, the location, and the cutsie little shop it comes with. I'm looking forward to my next visit!
author: Jasmin W.

description: My fiancé (now wife) stopped here to have a sweet snack after walking 10 miles throughout San Francisco.  This is place is truly amazing. We are finally going to be back in the San Francisco area and cannot wait to stop by for some more deliciousness...and we'll be with our 9 month old daughter in tow!!!
author: David E.

description:
Nummy nummy.  I didn't order anything but I was able to bum off a couple of bites from some cups that my friends got.  If I wasn't so full from my dinner, then I would have for sure got some yogurt or rice pudding.  They have some really creamy yogurt that they blend twice in their machine with your choice of flavor.  I got to try peanut butter and nutella.  Both were good.  The portions are kind of large, but hey you are paying starting $3.75 for a small, then they better give you nice portions.

I intend to come back her and get my own loving cup.
Ca$h only.
author: Michelle M.

description: Love love the smoothies here. Organic , no ice and just perfect for a hot summer day.
author: Priyanka P.

description: Whipped creamy goodness! Vanilla base with strawberries and bananas. Every time. Never fails to touch my soul. No matter what size you order, they always give you what seems to be 3x your asking amount. More than a little pricey if you order through Postmates but I won't front like it's not worth it.
author: Katie V.

description:
I wanted to like this place, but I didn't and i"m sorry about that. Maybe I ate too much on my prior visits to other bakeries before coming here. Maybe I should have gotten ice cream. Or maybe it was the bland rice pudding, I don't want to point fingers.

With all the rave reviews I was thinking this place was going to be the bomb. But it wasn't that good to me. I mean they do give you a lot of rice pudding in the small cup, but it was too much for me especially since it was pretty bland. I got the madagascar vanilla rice pudding, meh :/. My brother got the lemon rice pudding and it wasn't that great either.

I should have gotten the ice cream :o
author: Denice D.

description:
This place offers both froyo and rice pudding. I have only tried the rice pudding here and I must say its deelicious! There aren't really many rice pudding places in the city so it's nice to come where when I'm feeling a dessert that's more unique.

The cookies and cream flavor is my favorite. They also have great portions so it's also good bang for your buck. Can't wait to go back!
author: Pamela H.

description:
Damn those s.o.b's @ McDonald's for trademarking the phrase "I'm LOVING it" because that is exactly how I feel about the Loving Cup. 

Went in here with a Groupon. Not @all a rice pudding fan but I'm all about some soft served frozen yogurt. Their frozen yogurt is probably some of the best I've had in a long time. You can really load it up  with a lot of love (toppings) or you can be totally vanilla like me and just get a pineapple based yogurt. 

Word on the street is the rice pudding is the cat's pajamas if you like rice pudding or cat's pajamas. 

Definitely a place to put on my go-to list for soft serve frozen yum-yum.
author: Troy R.

description: Best frozen ice cream ever! A must have. Worth the hike. All kinds of cool flavors. I had the party in my mouth flavor ( peanut butter and Oreo). It was awesome.
author: Dad2Twins J.

description:
pudding here is to die for. I loved the peanut butter rice pudding, it's not too sweet, and the consistency is just right. After the first bite, I just can't help it but wanting more and more. the small size comes hefty, they don't skim on the portion at all. I can't wait to get my hands on other flavors as well. 

While I was there, a lot of customers came in for the frozen yogurt. Too bad the Loving cup is not around the corner, otherwise I will come back more often.

This is a good place for grab and go, not a good place to hang around and have a conversation, because there are only a few seats available throughout the store.
author: Denise N.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!  I'm lucky enough to live fairly close to Loving Cup but don't come here as often as I would like.  My favorite combination here is the vanilla frozen yogurt, strawberries, animal crackers, and almond butter.  I think they had once advertised this with a slight variation as Strawberry Shortcake and it's pretty spot on.  The machine they use to blend all of the toppings and yogurt is incredible and it comes out perfectly blended.  I highly recommend Loving Cup!  It'll be interesting to see how this works out with Yoppi opening down the street.
author: Lisa I.

description:
One cup of vanilla rice pudding to go please!

Ps. It's realllyyy sweet, so prepare for a sugar-rush and most likely a sugar-crash, but it's oh so good! It can be a bit of a dilemma if you're trying to stay healthy.
author: Jeanette Y.

description: This review is based on the rice pudding only. My brother ordered the yogurt and has already been back a second time. The service could be a little bit more welcoming. When we arrived it felt really cold, we asked for a sample and it seemed to be a hassle to the staff. None of the rice pudding stood out, so I opted for the coconut rice pudding (I love coconut). It was good, but it felt like I could have made it at home.  For me the cup of rice pudding wasn't so loving. I am going to give this place another try, maybe it was just an off night.
author: Victor W.

description:
LOVE Loving Cup:)

So yummy! Perfect dessert spot. The coconut rice pudding and vanilla yogurt with blueberry and chocolate chips are my favorite. 

I can't wait to go back and try them all! ... Goal.

Parking kind of sucks, but what's new in SF.
author: Chrisy Y.

description:
Loving Cup. What an adorable cute name. The place itself fits the name. It is cozy, welcoming, and just adorable. I've never had rice pudding before and was a bit skeptical. I sampled some of their flavors and decided that the chocolate chip rice pudding was THE one. I ordered a small cup and boy, it was filling. It wasn't too sweet  and it was a great healthy appetizer for me before heading back home for dinner. 
This place is definitely worth the experience and I would love to come back to try their frozen yogurt.
author: Eileen Z.

description: Coconut rice pudding and cinnamon rum raisin hit the spot after hard liquor festival drinking. It's refreshing and good. But also easy to make yourself. Service was quick.
author: Jonathan l.

description:
My husband loves rice pudding! This place has a great selection of rice pudding but each time he has to get the vanilla rice pudding! 

We love coming here after a good meal at one of the nearby restaurant for some yummy dessert. 

I love all the different flavors of rice pudding and frozen yoghurt. Haven't had the opportunity to try the frozen yoghurt yet but will definitely be back!
author: Vickie Z.

description:
3.5 stars rounded up

As if our day wasn't indulgent enough, Asian Sidekick Friend suggested one last pit stop before ending our Sunday Funday together--Loving Cup!

The three of us sampled rice pudding flavors (orange creamsicle, almond butter, etc.) I haven't seen a joint dedicated to rice pudding (and fro yo!) since trying nyc's Rice to Riches, so was surprised to see such an offering right here in SF. 

ASF decided on a small cup of madagascar vanilla rice pudding & BFF & I ordered the flavor of the day: The 49er (super bowl-bound! Holla!)...vanilla fro-yo (sweet, not tart) SWIRLED with fresh raspberries & toffee ($4.50 for a small.) A pale pink mountain of dessert goodness! This isn't fro yo *with* toppings; the two co-mingle harmoniously via a special machine. Crunchy toffee pieces, tart from the raspberry, melted slowly...not my usual sweet, but a lovely cup from Loving Cup!
author: Fancypants X.

description: I never knew rice pudding could be so good. It was a Sunday night around 9pm and there was a line. The line wasn't too bad. We got Cookies n cream, lemon vanilla, madagasgar vanilla bean, and a cookie monster froyo. Everything we got had the perfect amount of sweetness. If you're a big fan of dessert that isn't too sweet I highly recommend this place! I can't wait to go back!
author: Regina S.

description:
I thought the froyo was alright. The shop is very cute looking and the idea of custom blended yogurt is really cool and all, but overall the taste of the mango in my froyo was pretty faint. I think if there was less of the vanilla froyo it would've tasted better... because the serving size was kind of big, but the amount of mango in it wasn't very much. Also, they didn't have strawberry :(.

My boyfriend got banana and walnuts with vanilla froyo as the base. It tasted pretty good, like banana bread! It's too bad that after the first thing you mix with the froyo, it's .75 cents extra for another add-in. It's a little expensive for all of that in my opinion. However, I'd say that the small cup was more than enough for one person.

Pros is the the serving size is big and the froyo is very natural - it doesn't get all liquidy like other froyo places. Cons.. on the expensive size and skimpy on the add-ins. 

I also sampled a bit of the cinnamon rum raisin rice pudding which was not bad, but the rum was too much for me. I'd try the other flavors if I go again, though.
author: Mary X.

description:
Who doesn't love a great cup of rice pudding? If you said, not you, then you must've never had a cup from Loving Cup. They display the special flavors they have in the cooler up front. Try the English Toffee, rich and creamy, so delightful. Not to mention you get a heaping cup full that you can't finish in one sitting and that's the small size.

And I guess if rice pudding ain't your thing, then pick a flavor for your frozen yogurt and what you want inside of it (notice I didn't say topping, that's because Loving Cup has this amazing, one of a kind machine that makes your frozen yogurt right there in front of your eyes. With a little bit of arm strength from the lovely worker, watch as the "toppings" you choose and flavored froyo gets pressed not once, but twice to through the machine to form the most creamy, cold, dreamy frozen yogurt you've ever had.
author: Anh P.

description: Their homemade caramel sauce is just beyond description. Get the Salty Dog, it made our trip.
author: Amber A.

description:
WHO ARE THE RICE PUDDING GODS? I want to give them praise.
(4.5 stars)

Flavored rice pudding?! Really!!! wow!!!  I love healthy treats!!!! So i've skipped the gym after work to devishly treat myself to something new. Never knew rice pudding went beyond the grocery store kozy shack brand. Does SF have everything? 

- rice pudding, sooooo good
- prices, fair. pricy for rice but fair for rice pudding.
- service, very friendly staff
- ambiance, small cozy space

A little dessert shop that serves all kinds of flavored rice pudding! THIS PLACE IS MY HEAVEN. I've always been teased when opening my fridge there would be containers and containers of plain store brand rice pudding and nobody understands my love for rice pudding. 

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

There's about 17+ different flavors but only six seem to be served a day. After eyeballing the website all afternoon and sending out FB status of which one i should try, Without a hesitation, I sampled 4 of the 6 (i'm such a heffer) and got me a servering of the one that caught my eye and palate the most.

Tried:
Lemon vanilla (rice pudding)
Pecan Praline (rice pudding)
Coconut (rice pudding)
Nutella (rice pudding)

All were SO good but i had choose to have a big serving of Nutella Rice Pudding. 

NUTELLA ($3.75 small cup) - I love nutella and i love rice pudding. It definately had a subtle chocolate taste, easy to eat and not too sweet but sweet enough. i can't even explain how much this hit the spot for me. all day i was craving chocolate but refused any temptation of sweets until I came to this place. creamy nutella + rice pudding = O.M.G. delicious. And you can tell the rice puddings are freshly made; they use arborio rice in the pudding. The other flavors, were all good but I thought about which one I woudn't get sick of after 5 bites. it was a toss up between lemon vanilla OR nutella. I wonder if there is a possiblility of getting half and half.

I'm am definately buying a PINT of Nutella rice pudding tomorrow =X

Will I be back? This has to be a routine for me, its so yummy.

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description: I love lovingcup so this review is only for the service. The two Asian girls that are always working at night are so slow! The line is always super long when they're working and they leave the yogurt out so it melts to make it easier for them so the quality goes down. Not even half way through its already melted and liquid so much so that my boyfriend won't even go in if they're are working. Whenever I go during the day or weekend and it's not those two working the quality is so much better and the service is way better.
author: J E.

description:
Despite the nice location and the cute decoration of the store, I didn't find their rice pudding very appetizing.

They're on 7x7's "The Big Sweet-50 treats to eat in SF before you die" We went in with the idea that rice pudding might be the next Froyo. Not even close!

I remember eating rice pudding when I was younger and I remember liking it, and although the taste in flavor is similar, the texture isn't. After a couple of bites, the dessert just became too sweet and too rich for me to ingest.

I'm bummed that it didn't turn out to be as good as I expected, but I will go back next time to try their froyo.
author: Jenny K.

description:
"Local - Organic - All Natural" ... uhhh, which category does Oreos fall under? Maybe local, because I can buy Oreos in many San Francisco establishments. Ah, you're SERVING them in San Francisco, does that make it local? They're here NOW, so they're no local.
Mmm, maybe "organic". I hear they are using organic hydrogenated oils in Oreos nowadays.
Perhaps "all natural". Oh wait, on second thought, the words "artificial flavor" are right there in the Oreo ingredient list. As well as high fructose corn syrup and enriched flour. Of course Oreos are just the most immediate offender on the menu, then check this out: gummy bears? animal crackers? junior mints? This is total mainstream American candy JUNK! Your website says you use "the best local and organic ingredients", are you kidding me? You should be ashamed.
Why lie? It's fine to serve the food you want to serve, but to mis-educate and misinform your customers and dupe them into buying something they think is one thing and isn't, that's simply wrong. What's more, you charge 4.75 for a medium? Which is the size of a small most other places. For those kinds of prices I expect a product that is ACTUALLY local, organic, or at least all natural.
I'm disappointed, in San Francisco of all places. Needless to say I'll never be patronizing this business, and if you're just a regular consumer and don't care about all natural or organic or any of that, save your money and patronize an old-school San Francisco establishment like Joe's in the Richmond, or Mitchell's or Swensen's or even Ghirardelli for that matter, hell, at least they're not lying about what they sell. And if you DO care about your food being organic, there are platy of great options there too: Smitten in Hayes Valley, Ice Cream Bar in Cole Valley, Birite Creamery, etc etc.
author: Brian B.

description:
Do yourself a favor and try their Cookies & Cream rice pudding. My housemates and I absolutely love this place, there is almost always a line but in our opinion it's well worth the wait.  

They offer customized frozen yogurt and have a bunch of toppings, including fresh fruit and the more regular choices like oreos, rainbow sprinkles, junior mints, etc. 
They advertise the frozen yogurts to be all natural, fat-free, and probiotic. 

Their amazing rice puddings are made with non-fat milk, arborio rice, eggs, sugar, salt, and vanilla bean...it's basically healthy for you!
author: Tina F.

description:
Yay! I love this place. :) My boyfriend and I came here on a Tuesday afternoon at around 6pm. It wasn't crowded so that was definitely a plus! The decor is very old fashioned, clean, and super cute! They had oldies music in the background which was a real treat. The lady who was working that day didn't tell us that you could sample the rice pudding, so we had to ask for a sample which was a bit of a hassle. Oh well! I tried the Madagascar Vanilla and the Creamsickle one. Both were very good, but I wasn't in a rice pudding kind of mood so I decided to skip on that. My boyfriend and I opted to share a vanilla based frozen yogurt with English toffee and Nutella. Yum!

First off, let me say how COOL it was to see the cashier actually making the frozen yogurt right in front of you. They used a vanilla based yogurt, and added the Nutella and English Toffee. According to the cashier, everything's fresh and the reason why they like their method of making frozen yogurt is because you get your topping in every bite. Nice! A small cup with two toppings came out to be $4 and some change.

I highly recommend and I will definitely be back! They also have healthy options such as granola and fruit for those who are trying to stay healthy but also want to indulge in something sweet. :)
author: Joyce E.

description:
NUTELLA IN A FROYO!?!? Those are like my two favorite things in the world, combined! Used my Scoutmob discount. I also tried the rice pudding and it was good but I'm not sure if rice pudding is really my thing. I wanted the nutella froyo too much.
It's a bit pricey at full-price...3.75 if you only get 1 add-in...but it is delicious.
Only thing is, parking is an absolute b*tch.
I ended up getting both nutella and oreos in my froyo..to take full advantage of the discount...it was delicious! :) Also, the guys who work here are cute!! Added bonus.
author: sigourney w.

description:
I. LOVE. THIS. PLACE. I could eat here every day for the rest of my life and be so happy. Home-made rice pudding and individually-churned frozen yogurt - you get to pick your toppings for the froyo. $3.50 is the base price for a small froyo and comes with one topping; additional toppings are $0.75.

Rum raisin and english toffee rice puddings are really good, but my personal weakness is their froyo. Any combination of banana, english toffee, almond butter, and oreo is guaranteed to be amazing. You're welcome.

Everyone who works here is really nice and it's in a nice central location on Polk, right next to Tonic. They take credit cards but charge $0.25 for purchases under $5, FYI. It's probably just easier to pay with cash.
author: Nicole W.

description:
I like on Polk now and I saw this place always with a line out the door. I thought ice cream can be that good? OMG YES. 

This place does ice cream and tapioca pudding. The way they make the ice cream is different. You pick either chocolate or vanilla as a base. Then you can add whatever you want but whatever you add it becomes the ice cream because they have a special machine they run it through.

So for example I like... vanilla base with coffee, toffee, and cook dough. When it comes out it's lite brown from the coffee and has small little chunks of toffee. OMG I want one now just describing it.
author: Jess O.

description:
I love this place. Every time I finish my cup of frozen yogurt I can't to go back again. My favorite recipe: vanilla frozen yogurt, oreos, peanut butter.

I could watch the contraption make blended frozen yogurt all day. It's fascinating. It must be a custom machine! Am I geeking out?
author: Conny W.

description:
If you're a fan of rice pudding, Loving Cup should be a good choice.
If you're a fan of the fro-yo that you normally self-serve at the chain fro-yo shops nowadays, don't expect something similar here.

Came with a friend armed with a groupon for three pints of rice pudding and fro-yo.  I personally chose the coconut rice pudding cuz I love coconut.  It was ok.  Coconut flavor wasn't heavy at all though.  

Their fro-yo, on the other hand...oh my.  I am NOT a fan.  Is this what real frozen yogurt is supposed to taste like?  If so, then I guess I like the fake versions better.  Their hand-churned fro-yo is SO thick and rich.   I felt like I was swallowing really thick cream.  Could not even finish a small cup of it.
