I will not judge though if you like it.  It's probably a matter of personal preference.  Just don't ask me to order that again please.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
**I love Loving Cup but I did have one bad experience that is not indicative of my experiences there in general. 

__________________________
Major service fail! After being there door person for 20 minutes, with 3 people left in line they told me no more yogurt. They said the machine was broken and yet I watch them continue making yogurt. 

The worst is that I'll come back because I like the product, the yogurt is the dopest!

Too bad the employees are really bad at being considerate to clearly dedicated fans.
author: Reed J.

description:
Hi, my name is Carrie and I'm a Loving Cup addict.

I was first introduced to Loving Cup by a Google deal about six months ago, and while I was first drawn in by the rice pudding, I now have a full-fledged addiction to the frozen yogurt.  It is hands down the best and also unique yogurt I have had.  My usual is now vanilla with oreo, junior mints, and rainbow sprinkles.  I'm slobbering as I type this and plan to get my third in three days later this afternoon.

Their rice pudding is also phenomenal with unique and well executed flavors.  I especially love their madagascar vanilla, coconut, orange creamsicle, and lemon vanilla.  I was a tad bit disappointed with the pistachio as a pistachio lover myself.

And when you find yourself returning to Loving Cup almost daily and convince yourself that it's okay to get both a frozen yogurt and a rice pudding, don't say I didn't warn you.
author: Carrie C.

description: Delicious! While it isn't the cheapest froyo option around, it comes with reduced guilt from the healthy and yummy options. It also doesn't hurt that the staff hand mix each yogurt with the toppings- pretty cool, I must say :) On a warm SF day, I pretty much always justify froyo from here! My favorite is chocolate with bananas (and nutella if it's for dessert!).
author: Caroline R.

description:
A little overrated.

This place is good and if you like everything swirled into your yogurt, this is your place. I wasn't inspired by the lengthy wait and frozen fruit.  Overall, it tasted more like a smoothie to me than frozen yogurt.  I'd go again but it's no Fraiche (on Fillmore).
author: Amy L.

description:
I don't think I have ever tasted ice cream and rice pudding as delicious and fresh...I think I might have been tasting all of the love they pour into each sweet treat they prepare or maybe it was the locally sourced and all natural ingredients.  Either way, this place is great!

Loving Cup hand makes each frozen yogurt concoction with a base flavor (vanilla or chocolate) and the toppings that you want added, ranging from gummy bears to Nutella to almond butter to a variety of fruit.  They have a board with a recommended flavor when you first walk in (the Almond Joy that was featured did sound delicious), but I decided to dream up my own flavor creation.  I had the chocolate base with cookie dough and Oreos and was very happy with my choice.  

In addition to delicious froyo, they also have some really incredible rice pudding if that is more your thing.  I tried the Cookies & Cream and loved that it had the perfect texture and was flavorful without being too sweet.  I also like that there were real large chunks of cookies included rather than just the cookie crumble.  

They also serve Blue Bottle Coffee, which is absolutely divine if you are a coffee drinker.  They initially forgot about the French press that I ordered (which is understandable because there was a lot of froyo mixing and rice pudding serving going on for only 2 people working), but were very apologetic when they realized the mistake and also offered a refill if I wanted it.

The space is pretty small, but there are some barstools at the window so you can sit and people watch while you enjoy.  We were lucky enough to grab a spot since we arrived fairly close to closing time one Sunday night.  The decor is reminiscent of an old school ice cream parlor that has been modernized.  I loved the chic look of the boards displaying the flavor options and the instructions on how to order any froyo treat.  

Since each frozen yogurt is hand churned through their magical machine, you will likely have to wait, but don't be too daunted by a long line.  Many of the people in line ahead of us were getting some rice pudding, so the line moved along fairly quickly.  Either way, it is definitely worth the wait and I can't wait to come back to Loving Cup to try other menu items!
author: Maria K.

description:
Rice pudding with chocolate chips is good and rice pudding with coconut flakes mixed it in divine. A great alternative to froyo when the SF cold kicks in! Service is friendly.

Warning: Parking here is terrible! Steep hills nearby + residential neighborhood = driving around for circles. Also be careful where you park... Apparently one of the parking spots to the right of the building can result in a fine for white zone violation.  :(
author: Emily C.

description: Delicious frozen yoghurt. I got the vanilla based with peanut butter and gummy bears mixed in it. Can't go wrong. Quick and friendly service. Yummy :)
author: Tegan S.

description:
My boyfriend and I were super excited to try rice pudding because:
1: the raving reviews on yelp AND
2: I absolutely love yogurt and rice pudding seemed pretty darn similar.

And the drumroll please ... No contest. Yogurt wins, hands down.

The server allowed us to taste all 6 flavors. To me, the rice pudding was a tad under-flavored. I had to focus really hard after each sample to really differentiate the puddings. Only pistachio and chocolate chips seemed original to me. The rest... honestly... is by no means worth it. 
 
I didn't try the yogurt which is a shame. Yelpers seem to love it.

Overall, sadly, not impressed. 

Credit cards accepted. Parking is a nightmare. Service is very courteous.
author: Sue T.

description:
Parking:  Another one where you just need to be dropped off or spend a good amount of time looking for parking. 

Food:  They have fro-yo which I have yet to try and about 8 different flavors of rice pudding which is what we usually come for.  We first found out about this place via a TownHog deal and have been coming back time and time since.  They rotate their flavors with my fave being nutella.  Unfortunately I've only gotten it once and haven't seen it on their rotation since.  Other recommended flavors are pumpkin, vanilla with chocolate ganache, and cookies and creme.  I wasn't a big fan of the coconut as aside from the coconut sprinkled throughout, the taste was too light.  

Note:  Bring a cooler so you can either get an extra flavor to go or the pint which is a better deal as it still tastes great the next day.  They'll let you sample the flavors so you can be sure you get a pint of something you'll enjoy.
author: Joyce Z.

description: I've never been a fan of rice pudding and I'm not claiming to be now, but after stumbling upon Loving Cup I can actually say that if I do ever feel like eating rice pudding I know where to find it.  I tried the chocolate chip and cookies and cream.  Both were delicious and EXTREMELY heavy.  A little goes a long way.  It's definitely different.  I don't know of any other places that specialize in rice pudding.  I took my Mom here and she loved it.  Some flavors can be richer than other flavors so taste before you place your order.
author: Christine D.

description:
Peanut Butter Rice Pudding: Anything peanut butter flavored, I must try! Honestly, when I put the first spoonful in my mouth, it was just weird. The last time, which was my only time that I've ever had rice pudding before this was when I was in like second grade so I was trying hard to get past the gloppy memory I had of rice pudding. Thanks to Loving Cup, I was able to do so. What began as an odd texture of rice became this comforting and peanut buttery treat. The peanut butter flavor was spot on and I loved the actual peanuts in the pudding. 

I also tried a spoonful of the cookies-n-cream rice pudding which also had yummy flavor. Service here was friendly and there's a small bar + stools by the front window, or a bench right out front. I'm hoping to try their fro-yo next time as it seemed like when I went to visit Loving Cup, everyone ordered the fro-yo with all kinds of toppings. Definitely a great place to grab something sweet.
author: Maya S.

description:
Great!  Get vanilla, oreo, and peanut butter.  You will not be disappointed!  

Brilliant.  Such a treat.  If I lived in san francisco I would go here once a week.
author: William M.

description: Sooooo good. Not exactly sure what the machine they use does but it definitely works. Oreo and vanilla was so delicious.
author: Yasi N.

description: I will drive half way across the city and deal with the horrendous parking on Polk street for Loving Cup! OMG may absolute fave is the Thin Mint! The best frozen yogurt ever...
author: Jane K.

description: I made a vanilla, animal cracker, strawberry, coconut frozen yogurt. Umm..too much coconut overpowered the whole thing and I was expecting chunks of animal crackers..nope! It was animal cracker crumbs you can't even see then or taste it. Bad flavor combo
author: Karen T.

description:
Finally got a chance to try the rice pudding at Loving Cup.   I chose the peanut butter one.

It was so good.  The texture was prefect and not overly sweet.
author: Liza T.

description:
A short walk from work after eating at La Boulange, I decided to give this quaint little shop a visit. I loved the little store. It is so cozy! I asked about the rice pudding and they guy gave me samples of the coconut, oreo, and this other flavor I don't remember and is not on the website. 

I don't like coconut so I went for oreo. The coconut is on the 7x7 The Big Sweet SF: 50 Treats to Eat Before You Die.  I "enjoyed" it on the bench right outside. What a nice day! The first couple spoonfuls were pretty delicious but then it got too boring. I think I enjoyed the oreo more than the actual rice pudding. I wouldn't mind coming back and trying their yogurt.
author: Sarah C.

description: I really like their customizable frozen yogurts. I've tried a vanilla base with Nutella and strawberry mixed in and vanilla with mango mixed in. The rice pudding is pretty good too, I would recommend the Oreo one. I like that their desserts I've tried haven't been too sweet. The only downside is the long lines that you may have to wait through.
author: Amanda R.

description: I love Loving Cup!!! Their rice puddings are all so lovely, a nice sweet low-calorie dessert. Their frozen yogurt is fantastic as well, you can get your yogurt and toppings all swirled together. Loving Cup yogurt is light and the perfect sweetness.
author: Mary N.

description:
+Fro Yo: I love that they blend in your desired toppings into their frozen yogurt machine

+Rice Pudding: reminds me of piyesh (bengali dessert) that my mom makes at home; *Cinnamon Rum Raisin and Nutella are my favs!
*They let you get two flavors in one cup too, so try different ones!
*They also let you sample, so try them all at some point!

-Frozen Yogurt Pies: ok this is not a pie with a crust, but just a slab of frozen yogurt put into a pie pan. I ordered one for my birthday and it was not pleasant to eat. Just big and awkward. Don't order this!

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
UPDATE (6/23/14): Upgrading my review to a 4 after yesterday's visit. It's been a while since the visit that prompted my first review, so I don't know if they actually changed their sizes or not. Either way, this time I found the small size very reasonably priced and appropriately portioned. I decided to embrace the texture they were going for (almost completely smooth, despite having toppings like pretzels) and enjoyed the experience much more. The yogurt itself is still great and I hope to go back again soon. The quality of the nut butters they use (peanut and almond) are way above any other yogurt place I've been too.

(Original Review)
I was honestly a bit disappointed with my first visit here. I got the day's special (forgot the name, but it was chocolate yogurt, peanut butter, and bits of toffee) and was excited to taste the results of the unique machine they used to combine the toppings with the yogurt.

At first, I was blown away by how creamy and light the texture was. Unfortunately, I think this particular flavor combination fell flat for me. The toffee bits were either too small to begin with (I didn't see them beforehand) or had somehow become so thoroughly incorporated into mix it felt a bit too homogenous. Totally cool if that works for some people, but my personal preference is to have toppings introduce little pockets of textural variety throughout the mix so that every spoon doesn't taste/feel exactly the same.

I was initially going to go with two stars because on top of the disappointment I expressed above, I wanted to draw more attention to the fact that the portions are a bit out of whack. I got a small and felt full about 60% of the way through. I'd happily buy a cup about half the size of the small even if they only knocked a dollar off the price tag. 

To be fair though, I have to bump it up back up to a 3 because the quality of the yogurt itself really was excellent. On my next visit (and I will be going back for sure), I'm just going to try out some different flavor combos and see if they're a better fit for me.
author: Asif S.

description:
I used to love this place, and I still really want to, but the last couple times that I've been, I haven't happy with my experience.

Today, in particular, I went to Loving Cup and found myself in a 30 minute line, which is fine on a weekend if the service is what it used to be.  Except this time, I ended up waiting in that line only to get a froyo that was made at an angle so half the carton was empty and the rest was about to fall out the side.  Meanwhile, I received an extra unwanted ingredient for free: instead of a strawberry banana rainbow sprinkle froyo, I got chocolate in there too.  Of course that would have been great except that chocolate makes me feel sick.  I always take my froyo home so I was more than a little disappointed when I opened it up later on and tasted bits of chocolate everywhere and couldn't eat it.

It's sad when places like this get so popular that they start to slack on delivering a consistent service.
author: Bryan F.

description:
Dear Cultive,

I cheated on you and now I'm officially breaking up with you. I don't need your punch card anymore just so I can reach the end of it for a free cup of Cake Batter with mochi. I've found something better and it's up a giant hill so I can exercise on the way up to it AND back down from it. And it tastes natural, unlike you and your ridiculously sweet flavors. I thought I loved you, I really did. You were my treat on warm nights this past summer and fall. And how is that I cheated and fell for something else on a frigid San Francisco evening like tonight? Because it's just THAT much better than you.

I'm with Loving Cup now. Specifically with Vanilla-Mango-Animal Cracker.

Meredith R.
author: Meredith R.

description:
good but not great.

I got the original and cinnamon rice pudding in a small cup. cup size is pretty big. Big enough to share between 2. It tasted good but wasn't not that great. You can't really expect rice pudding to be THAT good.

I definitely want to try the yogurt next time, mainly because you can mix in fruits into the yogurt.
author: Angela W.

description:
At some point, I became worried that I was spending too much time agonizing over the choice between the nutella rice pudding and the famed coconut rice pudding.  So much so, that I apologized to the lovely lady patiently waiting behind me.  

I had to go with yelp's recommendation.  Dayumm!  The coconut rice pudding is absolutely legit, probably the best I've had.  I can't wait to go back to try the nutella, and perhaps their extensive selection of froyos as well.  Loving cup is fantastic, a definite candidate for a five star upgrade.  One warning, though, the cash only payment is a little irritating.
author: Angel S.

description:
So 9 months after I first checked out this place for it's rice pudding, which was way less than stellar (and not made onsite), I was back to eat some frozen yogurt! That is most DEFINITELY what Loving Cup is known for.

I ordered a chocolate yogurt base with animal cookies and coconut. Sounds odd, but it was damn good! I highly recommend this spot to make unique frozen yogurt concoctions with the various ingredients they have. It's definitely on the pricier side at about $4.00 for a small-sized cup, but they pack in the quantity, so more than a small size order isn't really needed.

My 2-star rice pudding review moves up to a 4-star yogurt review. Check it out!
author: Mansi A.

description:
you guys...if you haven't been here before, you need to run to loving cup immediately. 

this place is like the coldstone of frozen yogurt. you choose your mix-ins, yogurt base and the next thing you know - you're the owner of a cup of vanilla, circus animal, rainbow sprinkle, strawberry frozen yogurt. 

their rice pudding is also better than your great aunt's. it's perfect and the offering of flavors is appealing to any rice pudding lover. 

i just don't know how anyone could be less than pleased with loving cup. my roommates and i may or may not be weekly regulars.
author: Mandy A.

description:
Not that big of a fan for their rice pudding, but I think their mix-in style froyo was great! I had their vanilla w/ nutella and strawberries. The fruits are frozen so there were a few icy clumps. The machine they used to mix everything together was quite amazing. It even had water supply that rinses the inside after each mix! (it's quite easy to amuse me if you havent already noticed)

$4.50 for a small
author: M W.

description: Went here with my family and we all enjoyed our dessert! Three of us got different varieties of rice pudding and all were great! I got rum raisin, my mom got coconut, and my husband got Madagascar vanilla. My dad and brother each got fresh made frozen yogurt!
author: Whitney L.

description:
AWESOME dessert place in SF.

The first time I have ever been IN LOVE with rice pudding.
Random, I know.  My fiance and I were looking for something different but something delicious. Glad we found this, thanks to Yelp. We took a cab up but it was well worth it.

The vanilla bean rice pudding is to die for. Esp. black bottomed (with dark chocolate underneath)... YUMMMMMMY in my tummy.

The frozen yogurt was awesome too. You get to mix-in toppings, like Cold Stone, but better cuz it's not too rich and hundreds of calories less in guilt. 

The staff is great too, and though they were ready to close, they let us sit at the window and watch the others trying to get in. Haha.

That's a lesson, get there early enough to enjoy your fab dessert. 
I wanna go to SF just to eat more rice pudding!!
author: Kim D.

description:
So I saw that everyone raved about how great this place is so of course, I HADDDD TO TRY IT! Made the boyfriend drive all the way from home across town, through crazy rush hour traffic and find parking for 20 minutes then still had to walk a few blocks to get to this shop. And boy was I disappointed. I didn't get the hype. Its just pudding with tapioca balls?! I had a choice between the flavors for the day: Chocolate, vanilla and coconut. It was in a big bowl and they jsut scooped it in a cup for me. BAM! in the cup, thats it. Plastic spoon and HERE YA GO. 
I had the coconut one. very BLAND and nothing that made me go "OMG!" at all. I could of just bought this at Safeway or Luckys. And it costed wayy more than those packaged ones. I am NOT coming back. Thanks.
author: Linda N.

description:
Caveat: this review is based on the level of customer service (or lack thereof), and not food quality. 

If I am to pay $6 for a cup of rice pudding, I expect great taste as well as a welcoming environment. The latter was far from what I experienced this morning. The cashier was straight up rude when I asked a question about the types of pudding on display and almost threw a plastic spoon my way when I asked for one. She didn't even thank me after I paid. I felt rushed and unwelcome in the store because of her. 

I won't be coming back unless you fix your customer service approach. No comments about the food, which was in fact delicious.
author: Alex L.

description:
It was rare that SF is hot on a summer day, so it was most definitely ice cream time. 

They MAKE your froyo in front of yo face.  It was like WOWWWW!

I had their flavor of the day Almond Joy, and it was just a cup of happiness.  She put real almonds and i think almond butter in the froyo, then smashes it out of this machine.  It was sooooo good.  I liked their rice pudding too, i think the key to good rice pudding is being fresh.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/8LEnV8Z0-YKPWb1nLKgQHQ?select=aPyaHtZq8VXOlKcgbn6lKw

I just had to try some since I was all the way out here.
author: kim w.

description:
Forget creating your own ice cream; this is San Francisco, lets create our own frozen yogurt!

And..we're not just talking toppings folks. This is honest to goodness 'flavor-making'. I didn't know that was a thing or even possible, but with Loving Cup, I guess it is! 

With a wealth of mix-in ingredients to choose from, after ordering, you'll get to actually see them mix your yogurt flavor together in a strange little mixing machine they have in the back. If you haven't seen this process before--be prepared to be amazed--or at least blurt out the thought 'well THAT's interesting..'

The Goods:

English Toffee Yogurt--YUM; I love toffee so this one was great. The mixing machine breaks them down a bit so they come out as tiny delicious flecks of goodness.

Chocolate Chip Rice Pudding--So-So; The chocolate chips are a little harder than usual from the refrigeration. So mixing it with something that is as smooth or soft as pudding doesn't really throw me. Honestly, those little suckers kept getting built up and stuck in whatever teeth I'd use to chew them with. But that's just me; to each his own.

Rice Pudding--Good but nothing extra special; Pretty good but not something I would come here especially to buy unless i was in the area and felt like some rice pudding.
author: Vanessa M.

description:
I've only had the frozen yogurt here, but it always seems to do the trick. The toppings are blended right into the yogurt and my favorite combination is vanilla with oreos and crunchy peanut butter.

My only complaint is that they don't accept credit cards. Cash only in this day and age? Somebody introduce these guys to Square.
author: Steve V.

description:
YUM!!!!!! Some friends and I went in, hoping to sample some of their rice pudding (I've tried it before and I really liked it!) and then we saw some guys before us getting the frozen yogurt! 

The frozen yogurt = ORGASMIC
It comes out in a perfectly swirled shape and you can mix all sorts of toppings with it!  I guess that would be my one complaint: there's SOOO many toppings to choose from!! Guess that just means I'll have to go back and try a different one! haha
I got a small size and I thought it was a good!  It wasn't overly filling, but I still felt satisfied. 

If you're in the neighborhood definitely check it out! :)
author: Kei H.

description: Putting pretzels and salted caramel in with vanilla yogurt is genius. Staff is very nice and considerate. Especially if u have a allergy. Love this place!
author: Karine G.

description: Based on the rice pudding I give this spot 2 stars. My preference for amazing rice pudding still resides in New York at my favorite spot called Rice to Riches. I thought the rice pudding here was too milky. I didn't like the consistency of the pudding and the flavors I tried (pecan and orange creamsicle) simply didn't measure up to other places I've been. The workers were semi friendly and eager to sell. The venue itself appeared clean but I thought they could have displayed the pudding to look more appetizing instead of simply putting them in large bowls in a nearly empty display case. Overall I won't be back for the rice pudding but I may try something else.
author: Kristy F.

description: The frozen yogurts here are very tasty, but the coffee shake I was served last night was warm, and had no consistency to it-  an epic fail.  Stick to the basics of the frozen yogurts and you will do great here!  I won't make that mistake again.
author: Andy S.

description:
I confess, I have had thoughts scheming on how I will steal their tubs of rice pudding at the most opportune time (i.e. their bathroom break or distract-and-dash). Limited seating, but it's ok because you feel like you're on clouds when eating that pudding.

They have many rice pudding flavors to choose from: vanilla bean, coconut, rum raisin, cookies and cream, and some seasonal flavors. I've tried the coconut and rum raisin - can't decide which one I like better. Coconut shavings mixed in adds texture that complements the chewiness of the rice. Rum Raisin is subtle but not lacking in flavor, dashed with cinnamon. Rice pudding is creamy and smooth, and the rice is cooked al dente with a chewiness / bounce to it. 

They have frozen yogurt as well - chocolate or vanilla base - with a long list of flavors / toppings to choose from.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Delicious and quick.  It's just a small spot on Polk, but so delicious.  You can pick from their menu (cinnamon toast crunch is great!) or ale your own frozen yogurt mix.  They all have this all fruit smoothie which is great!  A great stop when your sweet tooth is calling.
author: Keshia H.

description:
Had the cookies-n-cream and the almond butter rice puddings. First of all, the place is cash only. Imagine my mortification when I realized that I had no cash monies when I got up to the register. Had to run back to Green's with my tail between my legs and get a line of credit from the bf-unit. Thankfully, he didn't make me work too hard for the $5.

I thought the texture of the rice puddings were on point, but the flavors were pretty blend. Maybe I'm used to eating middle easter/Indian version with the cardamon, pistachios and saffron, but the Loving Cup just didn't do it for me. I also wish they had the nice, congealed crust like the ones from the ethnic places.

I love the novelty of a place that specializes in rice puddings, one of my favorite desserts. I just hope they would branch out into more exotic flavors. I'll keep checking back to see if they have something more unusual. Also want to try out their fro-yo.
author: Alice W.

description: Even though I absolutely LOVE ice cream and hate froyo, I love Loving Cup - there's something for everyone because you get to customize the flavors yourself, so if you don't like it, you have nobody to blame but yourself. My go-to is Vanilla w/ strawberries, salted caramel, and toffee OR chocolate w/ salted caramel, toffee, and pretzels. I'm so glad they put salted caramel as a permanent topping because before it was on their "Secret menu" based on whether or not someone decided to make it or not. I would come here twice a day if it wasn't looked down upon.
author: Sandy T.

description: Walked in and this Caucasian emplyoee was charging her phone in a corner and she seemed very miserable. Like wtf? Can you at least pretend like you want to be there??? Damn!
author: Michelle K.

description: Life does not get better than the Thin Mint frozen yogurt here.
author: James S.

description: I love LOVING CUP! It also helps that I live about 2 blocks away from this establishment. Anyway, I never really understood the true power of this place, until my girlfriend kept forcing me to go every week. But, now I have become a regular, and I must say every visit is a happy visit. I love the way they power drill my ingredients into my frozen non-fat yogurt. The non-fat yogurt part always makes me feel like I'm getting a healthy option... but not really. The reason, this place is not getting 5 stars is because I wish they had other base flavors aside from chocolate and vanilla, maybe mint, coffee, strawberry, etc. I like to always get a chocolate base with strawberries and chocolate chips. It is a bit pricey, but let's be honest everything is pricey in SF, so I guess it is about the average price to get your frozen treat fix. Definitely check this place out if you are in the area!
author: Alex L.

description:
I went jogging around the city and passed this cute place. I knew I had to ruin the point of working out for this delicious looking dessert. I'm from SoCal, but every time I visit NorCal, I can be guaranteed all food spots are AMAZING. Loving cup surely did not disappoint. 
Any who, I had the almond butter rice pudding, with chocolate ganache at the bottom and frozen strawberries. This was one of those things I could of kept eating cartons full of this stuff. Can I have some more please?
My friend got the chocolate frozen yogurt that was double churned with add ins of gummy bears and berries. It's pretty cool because the nice lady mixed the ice creams it's add ins twice in a metal swirl looking contraption. Super cool.

Rice pudding preferred over frozen yogurt

But hey, both were still really freakin good. 

My yumminess rating? 1-10
9.2
author: Melissa N.

description: The wait is atrocious now that they are accepting Postmates orders. The wait tonight was estimated as 60 minutes. There were for Postmates deliveries waiting ahead of everyone. I was formerly a very loyal customer, but I won't be back unless they find a way to deal with Postmates.
author: Zach P.

description:
Three large sized cups of rice pudding was all I needed to make a group of friends happy campers. Since I've never been here, I got their three most common flavors- vanilla, raisin cinnamon, and coconut. I liked it in that order. The vanilla was very similar to a dessert called 'arroz con leche' which immediately brought me to my childhood years! It was light and wasn't too sweet either! The raisin flavor had chunks of raisins (yum) and definitely had more flavor than vanilla. The coconut had bites of flakey coconuts. I'm not a huge fan of coconut flakes... But this was an exception because the rice pudding had a nice texture with the flakes. 

Such a light and satisfying dessert. I took the three flavors to share with a group of friends. Great for parties. Everyone was able to try a little bit of each flavor!
author: Kathy Y.

description:
CASH ONLY.  I don't like rice pudding, but I told my friend D. that I remember this place just opened up and happen to be on Polk St.  I pointed it out to him, and he rushes across the street before I could stop him.

He remembers a place in NY that has all kinds of different rice pudding.  He loves anything coconut & saw Coconut rice pudding, but I somehow got him to pick Vanilla.  He got a small $3.75.  He said it was really good & creamy.  I thought it was just ok - took 2 bites.

S $3.75
M $4.75
L $5.75
xl $7.75

Flavors I saw: vanilla, coconut, cinnamon raisin, peanut butter, & mini chocolate chip.

They also have cupcakes, froyo, coffee, & tea.

Not my thing, but if others like rice pudding go ahead & try it.

CASH ONLY!!
author: Ann L.

description: Frozen yogurt so thick and well swirled it tastes like ice cream. The base is really high quality and the toppings are basic and good. I got vanilla mixed with raspberries, which was really very fresh. Husband enjoyed toffee and pistachio in vanilla, which was also well done. Machine churned x 2. The price was a bit steep - $3.75 for a small, comes with one mix-in - but I suppose it's worth it for the quality.
author: Debora L.

description: I love froyo but Strawberries and Nutella mixed into my vanilla froyo?! This takes froyo to a whole other level! This combo is heavenly.. its really unique how they blend the ingredients into your froyo. Definitely worth a try!
author: Kathleen Y.

description: I came to visit SF last year and I stumbled upon this place. Now I can honestly say that I won't eat frozen yogurt anywhere else! My frozen yogurt standards are outrageous and I'm never going back. Thank you for my delicious espresso vanilla frozen yogurt. I will be sure to stop back in next time I am in the area!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
I LOVE this place. 

If we are talking about a cup of delicious love, we are talking about Loving Cup. It's strange to admit this to myself, I'm not a huge fan of desserts or sweets. If I do end up getting somethng for dessert, it would have be fruits or anything fruity.... Well there's a little tidbit about myself if anyone wanted to know. 
ANYWHO, this place is what got me loving rice pudding. I never realized how good rice pudding could be until I came here and got the Vanilla Bean. Whenever I do come, I always debate on whether I should treat myself and get the largest size or I could save a couple bucks and go down a size. I always end up getting the biggest size. I know that if I get the smaller size and reach the bottom of that cup, I'd be sad. 
The pudding itself is so creamy but not heavy, sweet but not too sweety, and ricey but not too ricey. I love coming here at night with a couple of friends and it's like our little to-go dessert place. The ambiance is cute and the servers there are really friendly. It really looks like someone's kitchen. I love it here and I think everyone should try this place at least once.
author: Lina L.

description:
I got a vanilla frozen yogurt with peanut butter.... WOW!!!  I am so tired of the proliferation of low-quality soft-serve people are calling frozen yogurt.  What a breath of fresh air!  Thank you!!!

My wife had the rice pudding - of course.  Very good.  If you love rice pudding - this is your place.  If you are just on speaking terms with it, you have to go once just for the novelty. :)

What a gem - I live in Palo Alto or I'd be the Duke of this place!
author: Brian K.

description:
Yesterday, I used my facebook to bitch this town has "no good fro yo." But due to the magic of the internet, one of my friends sent me here. I went this morning. Hallelujiah. 

Strawberry and vanilla yogurt. DELICIOUS.

Also got a small vanilla rice pudding with cinnamon - hey, it was breakfast, and I walked 4 miles roundtrip for this stuff. SUPER delicious and apparently really healthy. God it was good.

Do I dare try their chocolate with real peanut butter? Maybe if Anti-breakfast boyfriend breaks up with me or I get cold called and my professor makes me cry. Time will tell. But I'll be back. Like my TLoin neighbors, I'm hooked on the goods. And this stuff is excellent.
author: Emily D.

description: So simple yet original and tasty.  They mix frozen yogurt with whatever ingredient you desire using a powerful drill.
author: Taejo K.

description: I CAN'T get enough of this place!! I discovered it a while back, and now it's become my guilty pleasure. Not only do they perfect rice pudding, but they always have delicious and fun flavors of it to choose from. My favorite is the coconut by far. The frozen yogurt is actually made in a traditional manual machine and they have so many delicious combos/toppings, it usually takes me a while to figure out what I'm actually going to order. The staff is friendly and the place is super clean and cute. Hmm, maybe I'll go there after work today...
author: Regina L.

description:
I came here because I had a Groupon. The place is very cute. The girl that helped was very nice and patience since I wasn't sure what I wanted.  I eventually ordered the Coconut Rice Pudding (delicious), All Fruit Peach Smoothie & Frozen Yogurt (Nutella & Toffee). 

Everything was so good. I have to go back for the Coconut Rice Pudding. This is the best Rice Pudding I've had!!!  NO JOKE!! I am SO serious when it comes to rice pudding because some places can't make it right.  

The Frozen Yogurt was really good too, She sorta made it by hand, if that's what it is.  She used this machine and mixed the yogurt with the ingredients I picked. OMG, was it good!! The best Frozen Yogurt I've had, and it's all Natural!!! YUM!! 

We are going back soon!!!
author: Ginny S.

description: HIGHLY recommend this place. Both their rice custard and froyo were awesome. I love the various pre-made options they have with the froyo, as their creations taste way better than anything I could make myself.
author: Veeral S.

description:
It's delicious. 
I opted for a small coconut sprinkled with nutmeg and cinnamon.
And a small froyo with almond butter.
My mom and I were in sweet heaven.
It wasn't cheap, there weren't enough places to sit. But we were blissful.
author: Andrew K.

description:
pretty tasty.  just happened to find this spot when waiting for our table at La Folie.  I got a small (which was more like a large!) vanilla rice pudding.  Fail to the lady working when I told her to pick the best flavor available.

It was good.  Lots of rice, just sweet enough, a bit on the expensive side, but a generous portion.  Kidn of wish I had a chance to try their other flavors aside from vanilla... but it definitely hit the spot for something cool and sweet.

would probably come back if i were in the area.
definitely would try another flavor aside from plain jane vanilla (which wasn't bad -- but probably not the best representation of what this place was known for)..
author: Kimmy C.

description:
Loving Cup: I have fallen OUT of love with you. So far as to say you are now HATING Cup in my book.

Here's why: 

I spend days (sometimes weeks) pining over my favorite Loving Cup combinations. Then when I finally convince myself that I'm worthy enough, I enter your froyo mecca, having carefully selected whichever ingredients I will be mixing in for my special treat, only to leave absolutely and utterly crushed that ONCE AGAIN, you have left out ingredients from my extremely simple, two-ingredient frozen yogurt. You may argue that "everyone's prone to make mistakes sometimes!" but no. Not when it comes to two/three topping froyos. Froyos that have the included ingredients written on the bottom of their cups when they're ordered. There is NO EXCUSE. The fact that I have now had ingredients left out of my orders FIVE TIMES (at least) is completely unacceptable. The fact that it is the same guy who leaves things out every time and then treats you like you're a horrible inconvenience for asking for the proper ingredients, is even more unacceptable. 

Loving Cup management: you have a lovely shop and a brilliant idea but please, please take note of the extremely incompetent and rude employee of yours that makes many of us go from Loving Cup to HATING Cup. In the meantime, I will not be wasting my 5 bucks on you anytime soon.
author: Rachel L.

description: I got the vanilla with cookie dough frozen yogurt. It tasted like heaven! So flavorful! Yum! Me and my friend sat on the bench that was outside since the seats inside were occupied. I will definitely be back here.
author: Lesley M.

description:
The only place you can find rice pudding here in California?? WHAT? Well, whether it's a true statement or not, that's what one of the workers promoted.

This place is very small and quaint, but big enough to get a good size crowd in and out after getting their sugar fix.  The way it works is that you get to choose a base, either vanilla or chocolate, and add your choices of topping from there.  

We opted out and decided to try out the pre-made options:
- Pecan Pralines 
- Coconut
- Cookies and Cream

All were very delicious. The perks of going in a big group - you get to taste a larger selection! I'll definitely be coming back to try the 'make it yourself' option.
author: Patricia T.

description: EEekkk!!!! I'm obsessed!!!! The frozen yogurt is so so good (my non dessert loving boyfriend even commented on how good it was).  I love that you can create your own flavors.  Have yet to try the rice pudding, but it always looks phenomenal.
author: Raina D.

description:
I created a Yelp account specifically to rate this ice cream/smoothie shop, Loving Cup. I went there for the first time today with friends who swore by it and it did not disappoint. 

This is a MUST GO for anybody that likes icecream (aka everyone). I suggest the chocolate ice cream with peanut butter and cookie dough. Be prepared for your mind to be blown.
author: Garrett R.

description: LOVE. Better than any ice cream I have ever had. Loving Cup has the creaminess of ice cream and the lightness of fro-yo, plus you can tailor every scoop to your liking. I like to go for the chocolate strawberry coconut, or chocolate blueberry Nutella. They blend the toppings you choose with your yogurt flavor on the spot!
author: Lauren L.

description: Best. Concept. Ever. Here's the rub: you choose a base flavor (vanilla or chocolate) and then various add-ins/toppings (coconut, almond butter, chocolate chips, cookie dough, sprinkles, nutella, fruit and more) and then they are blended together to make one delicious custom cup of froyo. I got vanilla with English toffee and nutella and was 150% satisfied.They also serve Blue Bottle coffee and are famous for their rice pudding, but were out when I went. Can't wait to go back for more.
author: Elena K.

description:
This was amazing. The rice pudding was quite good, especially the coconut and vanilla. 

But, that fro yo. Best I've had. I got the special which had pretzels, salted carmel, and added English toffee and cookie dough. Freakin' amazing. Expensive but so good and the portions are very generous!
author: Madeline S.

description: Can never go wrong with what combination of toppings! I've been there dozens of times for dessert or a quick snack and still haven't gotten the same thing twice. Friendly staff, great neighborhood gem.
author: Shafaq A.

description:
I love Loving Cup but I do not like the name. There - I've said it. I'm sure it's just me. The thing is...it doesn't matter. Oh - I also don't like rice pudding (well, generally speaking). Again, it really doesn't matter. 

Thing is - their frozen yogurt - hmm yogurt?? I think this needs a new name as well. Twice as thick as childhood Carvel soft serve - truly unctuous with a texture too thick to drip if turned upside down (well in cold weather anyway). Get it? It's THICK. Vanilla or chocolate, choose a base, add some stuff - may I suggest chocolate base with coconut and English toffee? It's just so - damn -  good. My cup runneth over. Yuk. Still...it just doesn't matter. 

Five - super-thick, not too sweet, you are worth eating even when I'm freezing "froyo" stars.
author: wendella a.

description:
My absolute favorite - BEST FROYO. best texture omygawd. My go-to dessert whenever I'm nearby in the city. I highly recommend any combination that involves Strawberry and Almond Butter. OR-GAAS-MIC.

Their rice puddings are good too!!! Definitely ask for some samples - some of them (esp the ones with toffee or coconut pieces in them) are to die for.
author: Mona W.

description: I'm surprised I haven't written a review for this place yet.  It's like coldstone but for yogurt.  Just get this combination: vanilla base, junior mints, and oreos.  That's all you need for a refreshing party in yo mouth.  I would come here more often but it's so far from where I live.  Maybe it's a good thing I live far from this place...
author: Tori Q.

description: I tried the cinamon rum pudding.Really unique place to provide so many wonderful flavors.
author: Priyanka L.

description: The best froyo/ice cream I have ever had! The employees are so nice and you get your custom froyo made in no time! The vanilla base with peanut butter mix-in is awesome. I highly recommend it!!!
author: Julia M.

description:
Frozen yogurt, rice pudding, blue bottle coffee.... ALL SOUNDS GOOD RIGHT?!
IT IS!

Went to Leopold's for the BF's birthday and a friend showed us this great little dessert cafe. We tried the Rice pudding and it was AMAZING!

Not to starchy, just the right amount of cream.. Cinnamon Raisin was our fave, but we tried the coconut and it wasn't bad either.

Such a nice, light and refreshing dessert after all the meat we had.
author: J-nine I.

description:
Do you like rice pudding? Have you ever had pistachio, rum-rasin, coconut, orange creamsicle, toffee, or almond butter rice pudding? Well they have them here, and they are superb! Rice pudding is a great alternative to ice cream if you are looking for a different dessert. Their pudding has the perfect texture, not too thick and not too watery. I also like how the pudding isn't too sweet. The flavors change all the time, and you can sample every single one before you decide which ones you want to get. The portions are large and filling. 

Their frozen yogurt is delicious as well. You chose between a vanilla or chocolate based fro-yo (the texture is closer to ice cream than the regular self-serve fro-yo and it is bomb), and then you decide on your toppings (fruit, candy, chocolate, sauces, etc.)., Then, like Dairy Queen, they mix up the toppings and yogurt in a machine so in every bite you have the goodness of your toppings. One of my favorite combinations is vanilla based with peanut butter and toffee.
author: Amanda K.

description: So cool to watch them personalize your yogurt. Yum!
author: Stacey A.

description: So yummy! All of the rice puddings are delicious and not an insane amount of calories. The rum raisin rice pudding is my favorite. The frozen yogurt is also good, but you might have to wait a while for them to make it if the line is long - but it's worth it. Everyone was super friendly as well.
author: Olivia M.

description:
Most flavors of the rice pudding are delis, minus a few like the pistachio which I really wanted to love, but unfortunately couldn't because the flavor was too "fake." The vanilla and oreo are my favorites.

The yogurt is my favorite. They hand churn/mix in any toppings you like and the consistency is wonderful, smooth, and creamy. One of my favorite combos is vanilla and pumpkin, a better and healthier version of pumpkin pie in my opinion.
author: Misha Z.

description:
I am *loving* Loving Cup!  On a sort of warm Friday evening, we ventured up Polk Street for an after-dinner stroll and some rice pudding.  :)  We had the pistachio rice pudding - yessss!  I can't wait to go back and try their other flavors.  

Hi, Brian Boitano - apparently, he lives in the neighborhood and has been to Loving Cup.  I love his cooking show!  

Medium cup of rice pudding = $5
author: Maile N.

description: Delicious.  Affordable.  And they have non-dairy fruit based options as well.
author: Matt C.

description: Great options made fast in front of you with amazing service from Shaun and Karlie
author: Rob B.

description:
Came here on a cold weeknight and it was relatively empty. This place is like a TCBY meets Coldstone. It is frozen yogurt that you pick a base with and then add toppings. They mash it together with a machine that resembles a Blizzard machine and there you have it. The staff is super chill and friendly.

I got the flavor of the day that day called the "Dirty Hipster.' This was a vanilla base, with Oreo and Nutella. Perfect! The small size was plenty big for me.
author: Steve V.

description:
I don't know if I buy into the idea of charging for rice pudding BY THE CUP, especially since it is so simple and inexpensive to make at home. I guess what you are really paying for is the different exotic flavors that you probably can't get at home--like the tiramisu, nutella, cinnamon rum raisin, etc. I tried a couple of different flavors and went with a small cup of the nutella. I eat nutella straight out of the jar, I just love the stuff! I wish the nutella flavor was a bit stronger, but the rice pudding is good for what it is, and the portions are larger than I expected. I remember going to Rice to Riches in NY (much the same style, but they offer a large variety of toppings as well) and they're portions were smaller and more pricey! I thought the same thing then, that it was GOOD but it didn't blow my mind away! I'd say the rice pudding at LC is comparable to RTR, but the consistency at LC is thicker, which I like.

If you're looking for a good alternative to the usual ice cream or frozen yogurt dessert places, then rice pudding at LC is a nice after dinner treat, but probably couldn't eat it every day.
author: Cammy C.

description:
La La La means I love Loving Cup. 

You know why I love Loving Cup? 
I love it because I finally found a dessert place that offers something more then fro-yo (although they do sell it). 
A dessert that I believe is way better then fro-yo, I'm talking about rice pudding, and not just plain rice pudding, I'm talking about flavored rice pudding. 

Madagascar vanilla, rum raisin, coconut, pistachio, and even pumpkin pie rice pudding (which was not yet available when I was there) are some of the flavors they offer daily. 

I decided to get a medium cup of their coconut rice pudding with fresh granola and whipped cream topped with cinnamon. 
The coconut RP was so delicious. It was ice cold and packed full of coconut shavings. In fact it was so good that the next time visit this place I will get my RP without any toppings. Don't get me wrong, the granola and whipped cream were very tasty but they kind of took away some of the flavor of the coconut shavings. Their coconut RP may be the best RP I have ever had in my life. My friend got a medium size cup of their rum raisin and he loved it as much as I loved mine. 

Besides rice pudding this place offers fro-yo, cupcakes, candies, coffee, etc. I heard that their fro-yo is really good but since I'm not into fro-yo that much I did not bother to try it. 

The prices and service here were great. I don't remember exactly what I paid for my RP but I know it was under $5 dollars. 
The guy who was working that day was really cool. He gave me and my friend samples of all their flavors of RP and told us about their other flavors that they have but were not offered on that particular day. 

If you like rice pudding then I highly recommend you check this place out.
author: Craig R.

description:
I think most people come here for the rice pudding, y though its good, it doesn't even begin to compare with my grandmother's so I cannot judge whether its that good or not :P BUT the frozen yogurt is INSANE!!! 

In my opinion you really can't go wrong with any of their frozen yogurt mixes but my recommendation is to for sure come here in the fall to try their pumpkin yogurt! It is divine!!! Real pumpkin chunks mixed into smooth creamy goodness...I can't wait for September :)
author: Maya-Luisa G.

description:
I don't often throw 5 stars out, but this place has the BEST froyo in the city. Even distribution of toppings and a firm texture/consistency.

My go-to: Oreos and junior mints w/ chocolate froyo.

Parking sucks, but I'd easily walk halfway across the city to tame an LC craving.
author: Brian B.

description: While in town on a tour of the area my host recommended this place for the rice pudding. Rice pudding, how random and delightful! We popped in and was debating between a few flavors, they offered about 8 and I finally decide on a mix of the peanut butter and chocolate chip per the server suggestion. My oh my was it lovely. How have I not encountered this earlier. I would definitely return and now plan to do some of my own rice pudding concoctions...beware.
author: Nicole Z.

description: This place is great. The guy who waited on me gave me his recommendation and really cared about helping me decide. Good experience overall and the frozen yogurt was awesome. (Peanut Butter/chocolate/banana btw)
author: Joshua L.

description:
the yogurt is probably good, but the costumer service not so much... the guy ringing me up was on his phone and when k asked how the rice pudding was he said "good".. thanks for the awesome help.. not very professional, I just wanted to know a little bit about there product!  

After all this happened, the business owner got back to me and sent a very professional apologetic message! It's too bad when some employees ruin such a cute shop! But id like to give them another chance and a new review.
author: Ali F.

description:
I change my mind. Loving Cup gets 5 stars! woohoo! 5 stars!!

Dropped by the other day and ordered a small vanilla bean rice pudding with a black-bottom. Black-bottom means they coat the bottom and sides of the cup with house-made chocolate ganache! I thought it would be too decadent, but it was PERFECT. oh so perfect. scoop a little ganache on your spoon, then a little bit of vanilla rice pudding  = perfect bite.
author: Krystle I.

description:
Without a doubt the BEST frozen yogurt I've EVER had! So many great options, but banana+chocolate+peanut butter for the win. High quality, real frozen yogurt. 

- New Yorker sick of seeing Pinkberrys and Tasti Delites.
author: Sarah M.

description: I swear they mix in crack in their yogurt and I bet even their crack is fresh and organic.
author: Andrew K.

description: Pricey, but their frozen yogurt and rice pudding is delicious. They make the classic cinnamon raisin rice pudding (it's fairly simple to do at home as well), but it's delicious. They also have an incredible range of toppings for their fro-yo (super pricey). I got a medium-sized vanilla fro-yo with almond butter (who allows for almond butter?? that's awesome!) for $4.75. A delicious dessert for a sort-of steep price, but whatever. It's 10:30 at night, and you need something sweet, but not too heavy, and this does the trick.
author: Danny C.

description: Good pudding, but was left a little shocked by the rudeness of the blonde server. After kindly asking if she could warm up the pudding, she offered a "no", with no explanation. After asking why, she said "because that's not how its served"...so much for a "loving cup"!
author: Noor G.

description:
I want to love this place!  Had Gotten 2 Groupons here to try it out.  New customer as I have told the owner/worker.  I mean I would have totally gave them a 5 star for the food tastes/flavor and service I receive for the rice puddings I had here, but I gave a 3 because for the 2nd groupon we used it on a PIE.  

First of all lets talk about the rice pudding: We had 1) Coconut (sweet and creamy -strong coconut smell with tiny bits in there too - its' pretty good 2) Rum raisin (My favorite- the rum taste with a cinnamony feeling it's like Halloween/Thanksgiving and Christmas in one package)  3) creamsicle (creamy and good sweet too u guys gotta try it out)  Loved it , the box was generously filled to the rim.  As long as you have it within the 1-3 days it's all good :)  Sho yummy loved it.  

Now for the part where it was -2 stars.  :(  THE PIE: 

Okay, I'm new here, so to me Pies are baked warm and sits in a box, you take it home (long downtown drive and parking) and put it in THE FRIDGE when you get home.  NOPE not this PIE... So my significant other brings our PIE home, puts it in the fridge... (funny thing is he told me that it was frozen) So i just thought.... okay they made it and then froze it to keep it fresh... 

Guess what??  The next day when we were going to eat the pie, *Opens box* Pie was entirely melted LOL??!! We were both looking at each other shocked like what da heck? It was in box just the crust filled with liquified innards.  SO i looked at him and said... What kind of pie was this suppose to be??  like frozen?? He's like.. i guess so??[Basically nobody had told either of us-that this was suppose to be some type of frozen or ice cream pie???].  I'm not sure if this was our fault or anyone's but  I don't remember signs or  messages while flipping through their Pie catalog seeing any indication that the pie was suppose to be an ice cream or frozen pie?!!  Maybe I'm just ignorant, but shouldn't they have a note or message on the box or a verbal reminder to the person that picks up the PIE to keep it in the freezer?  Or even tell us when they were describing to us how the PIE works?  They just told us flavors, but not that their pie was different from normal pies.. LOL  There goes that groupon down the drain :C

We ended up just tasting the flavor of the liquid (nice and sweet mocha pie)  Not sure now how the pie would have tasted originally but we tried to refrozen it (of course it's not going to be the same)  - Not sure why there's no mocha flavor after refrozen :C  but it was nasty and I was very disappointed since I was looking forward the whole week to having that PIE.  The thing basically hit the trash 

Oh and since we're getting so updated to using internet on phones now a days it would have been great if they had wifi so I could show them my groupon easier.  I have 3g on my android but the reception in there was so poor I couldn't connect well, had to run in and out the shop to get connected- Just a suggestion in case the owner reads this review ;)
author: Juila L.

description:
I really like this place! With the few times I have been in here, I have never been disappointed. I am not crazy about there rice puddings however, there frozen yogurt is a winnner!!

I have tried samples of most of there rice puddings, not all have been to my liking- though tasteful and unique in flavor. Though I am definitely a fan of there hand made frozen yogurt Yum!!! 

You have a choice between Vanilla or Chocolate yogurt along with a wide variety of toppings to blend in with your yogurt - all the way from fresh berries to a nice selection of candies.  My last visit I had the vanilla with coconut!! Mmmm....Sooo amazingly good... rich and creamy in texture and you can certainly taste the quality.

They also have a selection of cupcakes in glass jars that look temtasiously good that I have yet not tried.

They are a little pricey I believe $3.50 for a small yogurt (I'm not sure if that goes with the rice puddings as well) though its quality and made right in front of you which is nice. As for everything else the pace is cute and cheerful, service has always been extremely upbeat and friendly and I would definitely suggest stopping by if in the neighborhood
author: Shannon H.

description: Without a doubt the best frozen yoghurt ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Went twice in two days and it was just not enough!!! :))))
author: Mits M.

description: If you've never tried rice pudding, or never had it cold, really give it a shot. I tried the cookies and cream a few months ago and it's my go-to. In terms of the blended ice cream, be careful with your combos or ask for ideas. It's blended so it's almost like a smoothie. For example, Junior Mints and raspberries with chocolate ice cream may be fine but blended is horrible.
author: Emilia S.

description:
If you want dessert, this is the place to go! It's right next to the gym so it's perfect as a little treat after a workout.
They have froyo and rice pudding. This place is the cutest yummiest little hole in the wall on polk st. This place is pretty popular so the place gets quite busy.
I got their vanilla froyo with nutella and strawberries. But they have so many different options and combinations you can create! You pick a base for the froyo, either chocolate or vanilla and then you pick your toppings and they blend it for you in this really cool machine. Each order is made separately and they only have one machine so it takes a while until your froyo is made. But it's way worth the wait! What's nice about them mixing it for you is that you get a taste of all your topping in every bite. But just for warning, if you order a fruit topping it can become overwhelming. For instance, the frozen strawberries and vanilla base basically made strawberry ice cream. Just don't expect to taste too much of the vanilla base.
I've tried their cookies and cream rice pudding which melted in my mouth! I've never been a real big fan of cookies and cream either. I thought it might have been too sweet, but it wasn't. It was perfect.
They also have shakes on their menu, which I'm dying to return and try.
They take cash, but their prices are very reasonable! A small froyo or rice pudding is around $5. From what I remember they also take card, but with a fee.
I also heard they had punch cards for frequent visitors, but I didn't get one when I was there. So I must ask when I go again.
Parking is street parking and is pretty hard to find. So cross your fingers you happen to come across someone leaving at the perfect time.
Their service was awesome too. They're very nice about giving suggestions and giving samples of their rice pudding.
I'm definitely coming back to try all the different combos they have to offer. Let your creativity run wild!
author: Stephanie L.

description: This place is THE BOMB for rice pudding. I had the vanilla rice pudding, just keeping everything really simple, and it was insanely good. I cannot wait to go back there. It wasn't too sweet, the consistency was perfect, and they have a really simple all-natural recipe. Absolutely worth it, $3.75 for a small and the prices scale really nicely as you go for more. But for me, the small was the right size. Enjoy!
author: Amaresh S.

description: The line for this place is super long - I guess people love these kind of pop up places, It's definitely unique in that you can choose your toppings and flavor and they'll lovingly put in all together for you. Scalability wise? It took about 20-25 minutes to get my strawberry froyo after we ordered it since there's only one guy making it and cleaning it after every different flavor he makes. It's good though because it isn't that sweet and the pudding is also not too sweet. We tried the rum raisin cinnamon rice pudding. If the wait weren't too long, maybe it's a go again!
author: Jamie T.

description: I have dreams about Loving Cup's fro-yo. Happy, awesome, great tasting dreams. Word of the wise about loving cup, they take time and care mixing each and every fro-yo concoction that the masses come up with. This is awesome, but can make a bit of a wait. Completely worth it. Best combo. Vanilla base, nutella and banana. BOOM. You'll thank me later.
author: Melinda S.

description:
I love the frozen yogurt! The ingredients to mix in are fresh and delicious and they do a great job of really mixing it all up. Personal favorite is the vanilla yogurt with raspberry and Nutella. 

They also have rice pudding. I don't love every flavor but have enjoyed the coconut and a couple of others.
author: Jaedra D.

description: They do not have the hugest selection of rice pudding flavors to choose from; however, the few flavors that they do have are pretty good. I think they offer a total of eight or so flavors, but there is typically three to four flavors available at a time. The time that I went they had: Madasgascar Vanilla Bean, Toasted Coconut, Cinnamon Rum Raisin, and Pumpkin Pie. I got to taste all the flavors, and the ones that I liked most were the rum raisin and toasted coconut. The pudding was fluffy, creamy, and extra thick. The flavors were good, but they were so rich that I got tired of them fairly quickly. The beau really loved his pumpkin pie though, so perhaps it's personal preference.
author: Lien T.

description:
i like rice pudding. i like frozen yogurt.

tried:
-coconut rice pudding:i like coconut.. i loved their coconut rice pudding. it had toasted coconut mixed throughout the pudding which i enjoyed.

-cinnamon rum raisin: this was good but i prefer their coconut

-choc based frozen yogurt w almond butter and toffee: had a few spoonfuls from my friend.. this was pretty good and i'd go back for more flavor combos
author: Raquel T.

description:
- Chocolate Yogurt w/ English toffee and PB. Solid choice! Like a Butterfinger. Yum!
- Chocolate Yogurt w/ English toffee and banana. So-so with a strange, "eggy" consistency.

Set at the hem of the active and tranquil parts of Russian Hill, sits "Loving Cup". The quaint style of this place brings me back to my parents childhood. You're given two main choices; award winning rice pudding or delicious frozen yogurt. I've only tried the yogurt so far.  

They mix up a custom frozen yogurt starting with your choice of chocolate or vanilla. Add 2 toppings and it's taken back to their old-fashioned mixer for a perfect blend. It's then eclipsed by a dusting of topping goodness.
author: Aaron W.

description: We dropped by here for frozen yogurt and ordered one with banana, vanilla, and cookie dough. Sadly, the whole thing tasted funky and was waaayy too "wholesome" tasting for us. We are not ones to turn our noses down at healthy dessert alternatives but not when they don't taste so good. On the plus side though, the small size was huge and it was fun to watch them make the fro-yo.
author: Amy D.

description: When I ordered a vanilla base with strawberries, I thught the strawberries would be on top of my vanilla fro yo! They were swirled right into the soft serve and created a fresh tasting, very strawberry intense frozen yogurt! Gummy bears on top made for a delightful but light dessert. At $4.50 for a small, it was a bit steep, but it was definitely very yummy. Looking forward to trying other flavors now that I know it's not just vanilla and chocolate with fruit toppings.
author: Marilynn L.

description: love this place!  I live right next door and go there almost every week.  I have celiac disease and I had an incident once when they didn't clean the froyo machine very well because it was so busy and I got some english toffee from previous person, but the owner responded quickly to my review and also gave the feedback to the staff.  If you don't mind waiting in line for a few minutes, it's def worth it. My fav are chocolate- raspberry froyo and the coconut rice pudding!
author: Mariana V.

description:
very original. Went here while we were staying in town nearby.

I got the vanilla frozen yogurt mixed with nutella and peanut butter. Delicious!

 Love this place. Will try their rice pudding next time!!
author: Eric I.

description: Nothing but love for this place! The service is great, everyone's working hard to get everyone's order right. It has it's busy moments, which makes it hard to figure out where the line starts. Otherwise, the rice pudding is so good, the frozen yogurt is amazing. Worth the wait if it's crowded!
author: Miriam K.

description:
I am lovin' on some Loving Cup! Three words: oh. em. gee!! After being intrigued with rice pudding for so long, I was so thankful to Living Social for introducing me to this gem in Russian Hill. It's definitely out of the way for me but worth the visit. I think I'm gonna be a regular! 

I tried the vanilla yogurt with hazelnut and espresso mixed in. It's not like all the other trendy tart fro-yo joints which I'm a fan of. But delightfully so, this is a return to traditional creamy and rich yogurt but still nonfat! I loved, loved, loved the mix-ins I got. They have a wide variety to please the palate. 

Now for the main attraction: the rice pudding. Oh rice pudding. I had the black bottom which is a chocolate ganache that covers the bottom and sides of the cup then topped with rice pudding. Oooohhhh myyyyyyy... so rich, creamy, full flavored, and probably a thousand calories but sooo worth it! I will definitely be having that again. Just like the frozen yogurt, there are many options to choose from and you can get creative with the different flavors of rice pudding and various mix-ins. 

It's just as well that Loving Cup is not nearby and requires a drive to get to. Otherwise, I would be in this joint daily!!
author: Anna R.

description: loving loving cup! they toss a disc (aka a puk) of fro yo into the blender then let this drill like tool do its thing. then repeat. so delish! yam yam!
author: Jan Y.

description:
dropped by here with my sisters one Friday night for a late night coffee. hard to find parking around the area... esp for Fri night.
I can only review their Cuban coffee which was really good. I'm a coffee drinker and like mine sweet n strong but their coffee doesn't need extra sugar. I love it I recommended it to hubby who works nearby.
author: Learnee L.

description:
Loving Cup is great! I have tried both their frozen yogurts and their rice puddings, and both options are delicious. The food is healthy, natural and freshly made. If I am craving something sweet, but don't want to go all out with an unhealthy dessert, I often stop in here and get a frozen yogurt. You can choose from a variety of mix-ins with a nonfat Vanilla or nonfat Chocolate base. One of my favorites is vanilla or chocolate with espresso and graham crackers or chocolate sprinkles. 

The rice pudding flavors are good, namely Madagascar Vanilla, Chocolate Chip and Pumpkin Pie. 

I have tried the shakes but they are not the best. They aren't "extra thick" by any means, but I guess that's understandable considering they're made with frozen yogurt and skim milk.  I have yet to try the frozen yogurt pies, but they sound amazing; I'm waiting for a good event (birthday?) to buy one!
author: Katelyn B.

description: Loooove this place! The workers are really nice and the quality is very high. It's the best yogurt in the city!
author: Carolyn H.

description: This place is awesome for dessert. The rice pudding was delicious. Also I enjoyed the music that the staff was playing while we sat and ate rice pudding. The rice pudding is definitely something to try when coming to this shop.
author: Jason L.

description: Toffee rice pudding is a win. I seriously don't understand how this store can sustain itself but it's definitely a nice afternoon snack
author: Diana Y.

description:
Lord, this place is good! Having moved in just a few blocks away, I've passed the Loving Cup a few times but wasn't overly drawn in based on its facade. After having dinner with my boyfriend a few blocks away, we decided to find a nearby yogurt shop with Yelp's help. We immediately decided on Loving Cup after seeing its incredible reviews and we were NOT disappointed. Granted, I haven't tried their rice pudding (though it looks pretty delish if you're in the mood for rice pudding!), but their fro yo is phenomenal! 

You get a choice of nonfat vanilla or chocolate fro-yo as a base and then get to choose your 'toppings' (better described as mix-ins). From there, they take your goodies and whip them up with a blender (think Blizzard/McFlurry-esque) and pipe it into your yogurt cup. It's soooo creamy; I honestly had my doubts about it being either non-fat or fro-yo. I opted for the vanilla base with Junior Mints and Oreos and don't know that I could have made a BETTER choice. Tasted like a Thin Mint! My boyfriend went with a chocolate base with Nutella and toffee mixed in and was definitely happy with his, too. Keep in mind, the portions are pretty huge. I got a small and couldn't finish all of mine. This will definitely be our go-to yogurt spot for the rest of time. While rice pudding is rarely something I crave, I'm actually really excited to give it a whirl during my next visit!
author: Shannon E.

description: It was my first time trying rice pudding. I had no idea what to expect. It looked like chinese jook but dessert style. I wondered if it was savory or salty, but it's a dessert so of course it'd be sweet. My friend and I had trouble deciding which flavor to get so we ordered half coconut and half cookies and cream. Boy oh boy, it was delicious! It tastes exactly like pudding but with little tiny soft rice. It doesn't taste like rice but almost like jelly? I really enjoyed eating the cookies and cream. The next time I come here, I'm definitely getting cookies and cream!
author: Vicky P.

description: Yum. The blending of toppings is pure genius and makes for a unique and interesting treat. Different then other fro-yo spots which makes this place fun by keeping you thinking of all the different combos you can come up with. My husband had the rice pudding and it was delicious and I don't even like rice pudding!
author: S. M.

description:
Having had an awesome time at Off the Grid, we knew we had to finish it off with coffee.  It was a journey to look for one since it was around 9pm.  We ended up in Polk St. and found this cute spot!  
They had coffee and more!  I tried the Cuban coffee and that was yummm.  I also got the coconut rice pudding but didn't eat until the next day.  That was yummm too.  I was intrigued by the way they make their frozen yogurt so I said I'll be back.  

Well... 2 days later, I was back!  I tried vanilla froyo with nutella and banana.  It was yumm although the froyo turned icky coz of the bananas.  T'was still good.  I tried my husband's froyo which was vanilla with peach/mango and it was good too.  Not sweet at all.  My only thing is it didn't taste like yogurt, lacking the tartness.  

This place is clean and has good stuff.  Sunday we went, parking wasn't a problem.  Too bad this place is far, but would go there again!
author: Claire J.

description: Been a regular since December 2009.  The rice pudding is out of this world. My favorite combo is half coconut, half chocolate chip, but the vanilla is top notch and I am even tempted by the cookies and cream, almond butter, chai, and pumpkin flavors on occasion.  Once when I was recovering from surgery I even treated myself to a black bottom rice pudding (chocolate ganache - YUM!). Barely even noticed the pain after ;) Parking is pretty atrocious so try to get someone to drive you and you can hop in and get them one too while they circle the block. It's worth it, I promise!
author: Noelle F.

description: Just had the Vanilla based frozen yoghurt with raspberry and oreo.  Best frozen yoghurt I have had in a long time. Staff behind the counter was also super friendly.  Thumbs up!
author: Roman K.

description:
Was on the way to Swensen's when the words "rice pudding" caught my eye and I veered into here instead. Saw a long-ish line and charm home-y decor, and decided to pivot.

I got a coconut rice pudding with rum raisins. Delicious at first, but towards the end it was a bit too much. I would recommend going with smalls ($3.75). I went with a medium ($4.75) for my coconut pudding and it was too much after a meal. Even without the meal, I think I'd have been sick of it by the end.

Ironically, I was drawn in by the rice pudding, but the fro-yo was the real star. My accomplice went with vanilla fro-yo with Junior Mints. Fabulous and I was entertained watching them make it. They mix all the ingredients on the spot and some minion has to man the machine to pump out the ingredients right there. Finally product tasted like a high-class McFlurry, would love to come back to sample it with fruit.

I'd appreciate if they had a second machine, though. Probably takes the froyo-minion around a minute to make each order, and the stack of cups waiting to get serviced was probably 10-12 deep. By the time we got the froyo, I was well and done with the rice pudding.
author: David C.

description: Forgot to come back here and thank them for contacting me and offering me a free one as an apology, they also acknowledged the mistake happened and didn't make excuses. Good customer service amends all. Enjoy your fro-yo in peace!
author: Therese H.

description:
Cubano cubano cubano.
While every one else raves about the pudding, I'm going to do what I'm good at, and talk about coffee. 
Thank goodness for the cubano. Espressso pulled with brown sugar is wonderous. While the place is not open as early as I'd like (early riser here) I loved sitting in the window and watching everyone else with their lattes/dogs/jogging gear. A great little shop with a hidden gem on the coffee menu.

Oh, and the lemon blueberry biscotti I had set the bar for all other biscotti.
author: Leah Q.

description:
I've never had rice pudding and decided to give it a try. It's not what comes to mind when I think of dessert. (if it's going to be dessert, let's go for indulgent, right?) 

A friend and I stopped here after dinner on a busy Friday night, and although there was a line, the man at the counter patiently gave us samples of the flavors and we got a small of the coconut rice pudding and the vanilla bean rice pudding. Both were so delicious, and the portion was generous for a small. I was pleasantly surprised and will definitely be back when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Leigh H.

description:
When your tummy wants a little something something and you don't want to over indulge, Loving Cup is here for you.

I like that it's a very casual but cool place to stop by on a Sunday afternoon after a hearty lunch.

I like that they have rice pudding with gourmet flavors like Madagascar Vanilla, it's a purist's dream. That's ingenius, to sell Asians on fancy rice pudding, and YES, I bought it and enjoyed each spoonful.

Also, to the cute couple on a 2nd date that were here last Sunday afternoon, I apologize I totally butted into your lovely date with some nonchalant talk. You guys hurried off in a flash to spend some alone time together. Just to let you know, any guy that is willing to spend time seeing a girl just after finishing the Escape from Alcatraz triathalon, means he is really into YOU so don't let my friendliness with strangers get into your psych and make you insecure. Go on that 3rd date with him. 

Now back to the rice pudding, it was yummy, so go try it!
author: Jackie G.

description: My friend and I were just walking around checking out the neighborhood and we came across Loving Cup.  Looking through the store windows from the street it looked like a very cute place so we decided to go in a check what this place had to offer. Their specialty was rice pudding that's made with simple ingredients. I heard their coconut is the best. They make their own yogurt and mix it with any toppings you prefer. It is very creamy and totally does not taste like yogurt, but more like ice cream. Oh, and it was fat free. It's a really cute shop for desserts. I highly recommend it.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Cupcakes and froyo places are starting to become too redundant so if you're wanting to try something different I promise Loving Cup will be sure to satisfy. Just like cupcakery's its store front is super cute and the inside is decorated with pastels and adorable pieces of art. I never knew I loved rice pudding until I tried theirs; the lady offered us samples of each flavor which was cool, and immediately I knew I needed to indulge myself in a full cup of the Madagascar Vanilla flavored. It was a bit annoying to hand over $3.75 for a cup of rice but I did it anyways and left quite satisfied. I think they offer 4 different flavors a day, rotating based on the season. 

My friends ordered the yogurt, this is different from those Pinkberry yogurt type places because the toppings are blended into the yogurt for you resulting in a custom flavor. It works like this chose a base yogurt (choco/vanilla) chose the toppings you want, up to 4 I believe. Then they put it into this cone where it get's mixed like a McFlurry until your toppings are blended in, quite clever I must admit. 

Tip: If you have a DoYouViv card, every so often  they have days where you can get 45% off a cup of pudding.
author: Nicole L.

description: I was really excited to try this place out since I am a big fan of rice pudding. Ultimately, I was disappointed because the only flavor that I enjoyed was the Madagascar vanilla bean - and let's be honest, it doesn't have any sort of outstanding flavor.
