With additional cinnamon, it was pretty good. I sampled the creamsicle, cookies and cream, and pecan praline and none of them appealed to me. I also wouldn't recommend getting the "Black bottom" topping, it is way too rich in comparison to the rice pudding. It's like eating fudge and it really doesn't mix well in consistency. I tried the oreo frozen yogurt, that was good. I also tried the mango tango smoothie, the orange juice was particularly tart but it was definitely refreshing.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Tried this place on a whim the other day and I thought it was a very cool concept! Like others have said, you pick the base (vanilla or chocolate), then you pick the topping (which is blended to the point that it really becomes the flavor.

I tried the cookie monster (vanilla with cookie dough and oreos). It was good but I couldn't really taste the cookie dough once it was blended. I'm so curious to make other flavor combinations though so I definitely will be back!
author: Jenny A.

description: Number 15 on "The Big Sweet SF: 50 Treats To Eat Before You Die" list, was coconut rice pudding... and I CONQUERED it!  Along with the cinnamon rum raisin, but what should be on the list is two rice puddings one cup!
author: Alan B.

description: Today at Loving Cup, I may have accidentally reverse-engineered the Wendy's Frosty. Order a vanilla base with Nutella, and tell me if you agree. And it only costs 4x what an actual Frosty costs ;-)
author: Adam D.

description:
Short and simple. 

XL cup of Madagascar Vanilla Rice Pudding. 



*Carlos A., Im waiting for the exchange!*
author: Juliane N.

description: My favorite place to go for yogurt!!!! You choose either Chocolate or Vanilla and add your toppings and It comes out blended!!! My lovely creation is Vanilla topped with Animal Crackers, Oreos, & Toffee!!! Absolute Bliss! And the staff is always friendly!! I wanna try their rice pudding next! I've heard great things!!!
author: Yan N.

description:
I had the coconut rice pudding! It was really good, but I personally can't finish a whole cup as it's too heavy (creamy). 

My friend got the thin mint frozen yogurt which was wayyy better than the rice pudding. There was literally thin mint cookie in every bite of the yogurt. It was sooo good!!

I also love the decor, everythings very old fashion!!
author: Priscilla W.

description: I really love this place!  It's a bit far for where I normally hang out in San Francisco, so it's kind of a special trip to Loving Cup / Cow Hollow. but I love the variety in the rice pudding, as well as the service.  Have tried rum + raisin as well as coconut rice pudding, so curious to see what other flavours are available on my next trip!
author: Deborah C.

description:
must get the coconut rice pudding!!! be warn, this place is not diet friendly but it will definitely be worth it. I was lucky enough to sample all the flavors before ordering my rice pudding, and lets say the coconut and cookie and creams were my top favorite. The rice pudding had a very creamy consistency but I didn't feel too guilty eating it because it was not too sweet. If you have never try rice pudding before, DO IT NOW!

PLEASE OPEN UP A STORE IN OC!!
author: Valerie L.

description:
After turning in the computer bag, PDA, random peripherals, and a couple USB drives back into the office, I waved my goodbye and hopped into the car headed for Russian Hill. It's one of those neighborhoods that I rarely wander around in, but I know where it is geographically and have a mental picture of what all the buildings in the neighborhood look like. So we decided to take a field trip and walk around this hilly spot. Loving Cup caught our eyes as we wandered down Polk with its cute little sign and storefront. 

We were offered tastings of the various rice puddings, but after just trying the Key Lime flavor, I knew that was what I would be ordering. He had the Mocha Shake. The rice pudding was light in flavor, but still quite filling. It wasn't too sweet! The shake was thick and tasty. Both were made of local and organic ingredients [only six in the rice pudding!].

There's a lot on their menu, even frozen yogurt for those frogurt fanatics and smoothies/shakes. So much to try! Guess we may be visiting this neighborhood more often now that we know that this is here. That is, until the rest of the city gets with the program, and we have rice pudding [RyPud for short] shops all over the place.
author: Tinna H.

description:
simple but great concept, rice pudding joint. I've been in here many times and always experienced fresh, tasty puddings for the price of frozen yogurt....
many thanks..
author: Lyra S.

description: The rice puddings here were extremely tasty-especially with the addition of boozy rum raisins!
author: Dominique D.

description:
It is as good as it gets, really!

If you like rice pudding, try it out!  If you don't like rice pudding, try it out.  If you've never had rice pudding... live a little.  Jeez.
author: Stephanie F.

description: They make the froyo in front you! It is kind of expensive but it delicious, I had vanilla, oreo and banana froyo. BEWARE, the cups are bigger than they look. I could barely finish the Medium cup.
author: Victoria L.

description: The yogurt is wonderful but every time we come the employees seem SO MISERABLE its almost embarrassing. Except this young guy from the UK who was super pleasant. Otherwise it's always really awkward - like are you mad that I'm in here ordering?
author: Katy M.

description:
The yogurt here is incredible. Just know what you want by the time you get to the counter because sometimes the people working there can be a bit curt. 

Also, the lines sometimes go out the door. A solid backup is the Yoppi near Polk & Broadway.
author: Paul C.

description: I've never really eaten rice pudding, the thought always grossed me out, until coming to Loving Cup. If you're timid too, try the Oreo, it's really delicious. If you can't get past the texture, they also have frozen yogurt.
author: Cary Elizabeth L.

description:
Love this place.

Rice pudding is delicious. The cookies 'n cream is a staple and the coconut is also a favorite.

I would always get the rice pudding so was late to understand how amazing their froyo is. Pick a base flavor and some add-ins and they blend it to make it a customized flavor! Vanilla with cinnamon and cookie dough...yum!
author: K C.

description:
I first heard about this place since my favorite Moonbaby Cakes owner sells her cupcakes here.  She told me it's a cute spot on Polk that sells rice pudding, frozen yogurt, and smoothies.  A shop blended with all the sweetness a girl can have, I'm all over that!

So...after dinner (we were already soooo full), I came here with E and our significant other.  Parking can be hit or miss in this area so the boys stayed in the car while we hopped out and got our goodies.  The guy who helped us with super nice and friendly, offered us samples of their different rice pudding.  

Menu can be a bit overwhelming since the concept is still so new and different in the city + they offer a lot of options (I'm all about variety!) and mix-ins.  We couldn't decide (didn't notice the sign until we were leaving, but they have a "flavor of the day" which can be helpful for people like us :P) so we just ended up ordering one of each:

**madagascar vanilla with "black bottom" (home-made chocolate ganache)**
**chocolate frozen yogurt with almond butter (you actually see them mixing the flavors together right in front of you!)**

Both items were very yummy, but I liked the rice pudding a little bit more since it is slightly more unique.  I grew up on the store-bought Kozy Shack rice pudding or the ones that I have had at Indian restaurants so this was definitely a step up.  This is a place definitely worth checking out and a new change from all the other fro-yo shops around the city.
author: Janetto L.

description: Not particularly huge difference between my friends and my froyos. Not sure about the puddings but done better with froyo at chains to be frank. Subpar customer service and attention. Attendant shrugged us off after giving us our orders. We basically had to remind the guy there that we had to pay and so he could show us to the spoons. Slightly overhyped.
author: Vatche A.

description:
The frozen yogurt is quite good, which I wasn't necessarily expecting since I thought the focus was on rice pudding. I liked the rice pudding - after trying key lime (better than I would have thought) and cinnamon rum raisin, I picked the latter. From the sample, which had no raisin, I thought the predominant flavor was just cinnamon, which I liked. Then I realized the raisins were the rum-containing component, which I found noxious, but it was easy enough to avoid them. 

2 women were working at the counter. One seemed quite pleasant, but unfortunately the main counter person seemed pretty unhappy to deal with customers. I'm sorry I interrupted her afternoon, but I'll try to avoid doing so in the future.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Ever since my friend came back from NY she couldn't stop telling me about her experience tasting her first rice pudding cup. She said it was the best she's ever had. So, with that said from that point on I went on my own journey to find a great rice pudding spot in SF. 

I came across Loving Cup here on Yelp and by the reviews it seemed pretty legit. My friend and I stopped by to see how they'd live up to her expectation. As a newbie, I sampled my first rice pudding cup and had a split mix of rum raisin and coconut. I must say it was a familiar taste. It was fairly similar to a Filipino breakfast dish called "champorado." Me being such an addict to champorado whenever my grandma makes it, I instantly fell in love with this new found rice pudding. 

What wouldn't you love about it? It's sweet, thick, creamy, and more than anything you could imagine. They're always having different flavors and I'm always in the mood for something new. So, every time I come here now I'll be trying a new flavor! An instant recommendation from me.
author: Cassie D.

description: This place is like a fancy place to get custom made McFlurry's! I love the vanilla with banana and toffee. However for chocolate lovers, they have tons of options for that too. Make sure to try this place, its awesome and they use yogurt so you don't have to feel that guilty about eating it.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Coconut rice pudding!

Yes just go for the coconut rice pudding is super delish - dont think this is healthy anymore if i eat a vat of it -_-
author: Christine W.

description: My daughter demanded rice pudding one evening, and happy to say since we are spoiled rotten San Francisco residents, there's a rice pudding specialty shop, OF COURSE.  Damn it was good, really good.  Can't give it 5 stars because prices are in line with every other specialty shop in town, and that's the fine line between access and exploitation that will doom us all into not being residents of our own town, but, that's a different topic.  But, bottom line, very high quality tastes and really nice folks working the counter. Glad it's there for the random rice pudding attacks.
author: Kurt S.

description:
First visit was last night and I really liked it! 

1.The people behind the counter were very friendly. No, 'im in HS/college and dont care what you want just dont bother me because im watching gossip girl on my phone. if i feel like it ill help you'

2.The selection here is pretty impressive. Lots of great flavors!

3.The portions are generous. I got a medium and that could easily have been a large.

4.Interior MUCH nicer than tutti melon down the road which always seems to have some weird odor in there.

5.Fantastic toppings available too!
author: Ash S.

description: If you're craving rice pudding, this is your place. They have several flavours to choose from. I ended up getting frozen yogurt which was decent but the flavour seemed a little bland. I went with raspberry and vanilla. You choose a base, a flavour and if you're feeling adventurous, you'll try some mix-in's as well. It might be because they actually use real fruit to make it though. Overall, they have a lot of yummy flavours to choose from and the staff are super cute and friendly. I'll have to try some mix-in's next time. The small size is just enough to satisfy any craving for a cold dessert.
author: Amy J.

description:
I'm a yuppie. 

I walked down yuppie polk street in yuppie Russian Hill while typing on my yuppy blackberry and happily forked over $4 for some damn tasty rum raisin pudding. 

As I hard as I try to deny it, I am a yuppy and this place serves my niche market very well. 

Who knew this place was even there? I've lived here for years and never noticed it. 

They had all kinds of tasty toppings as well. The portions aren't very big but they make up for it with taste. 

I am sad I hadn't seen this place before but I think I will be dropping by whenever I have a sweet tooth.
author: Carlos A.

description: Thanks to Groupon, I found out about Loving Cup and also found out that rice pudding is something you can actually make a business out of.  Of the six flavors they had on a Saturday afternoon, I took home three pints: Madagascar vanilla bean (flavor they have all the time), cinnamon raisin rum ((flavor they have all the time), and pistachio.  My preference was actually in the order I just describe as the vanilla bean was really refreshing and smooth and the cinnamon raisin rum was a great blend of flavors.  The pistachio was very "natural" and there was just something about the taste that just didn't go too well in a rice pudding in my opinion.  Would I pay $7.75 for a pint on a normal basis?  I don't know but if I was in the Russian Hill area, I would give some other flavors a try as Loving Cup's rice pudding is a really interesting alternative to yogurt.
author: Albie F.

description: Yum yum yum! I had the vanilla frozen yogurt with almond butter, nutella, and English toffee. It was delicious!! I like how they swirl your toppings together with the frozen yogurt so you get a bit of all your toppings in every bite!
author: Lynn T.

description: Yummy rice pudding...loved the multiple flavors..Will go back to try the frozen yogurt
author: Kay P.

description:
This place has the most unique and customizable frozen yogurt ever. Forget toppings, create your own flavor using top notch ingredients that are incorporated into your dessert with a machine that looks like a mini auger. 
All the flavors are delicious but take note that the peach (since it is real and unsweetened) has a very subtle flavor that is better on its own. I always get the espresso and peanut butter with chocolate base. Wow!

P.S. they also serve yummy home made rice puddings
author: Randy C.

description:
I've only been once but it was amazing!  I got the chocolate frozen yogurt and blended in bananas and oreos.  It tasted so wonderful.  My friends got chocolate frozen yogurt and blended in raspberries and another got the vanilla rice pudding.  Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their selections and we've already made plans to go back again.  I strongly recommend the frozen yogurt blends, but the rice pudding isn't too shabby either.  I tried the pumpkin pie rice pudding and it was yummy but I was in a frozen yogurt mood.  

My only gripe is that parking is HORRIBLE.  But it was Russian Hill on a Friday night at like 8pm, so you really can't expect much else.
author: Madeline W.

description:
This is my new favorite find, but I'm not so sure my jeans are feeling the same way. I think I've been here at least a dozen times in the past three weeks (seriously.) The only negative is that I can't ever decide between the rice pudding and the fro-yo. 

Oh, and for all of the "I don't like rice pudding" peeps out there - this isn't rice pudding, it's more like sweet crack. So don't knock it until you try it... :)
author: Christina S.

description:
Rice...normally an accouterment of a savory or saucy meal.

Pudding...a sweet treat that inevitably always evokes visions of Bill Cosby sucking on a spoon.

Not sure who got the grand idea to blur the lines between entrees and desserts (same dude who thought up shepherd's pie maybe?)...but when the combo of rice & pudding was fused...something magical was created (at least for my personal tastebuds).

Since my first bite of rice pudding a couple decades ago, I have seen rice pudding evolve from the garden variety vanilla tapioca flavors to variations now that would make 31 Flavors green with envy.

One of my all time favorite rice pudding spots is Rice to Riches in NYC...I'm in utter hyperglycemia heaven when I'm there.  Despite my intense fingercrossing, unfortunately no Rice to Riches franchise has found its way to SF.  In fact, for years I have been stuck with no go-to spot for quality rice pudding...that is until now.

Enter the era of Loving Cup.  Located in Russian Hill on Polk & Union, this place is officially on my sugar-high hit list.  Normally they have a rotation of 7 or so flavors...but bear in mind that this place actually sells out of almost all their pudding through the course of a day!  The last time I was there, I had to try a flavor (Creamsicle) that I normally would never imagine ordering...this wasn't because I was feeling particularly adventurous...but rather because I was faced with the no-choice theorem where it was the only flavor left.  Lucky for me that Creamsicle turned out to be perfectly delish.

So if you're a rice pudding fiend like myself...check out Loving Cup fosho.
author: Justin L.

description: I could've sworn i wrote a review for this place. I wonder did YELP remove it. I'm sorry Loving cup, but i don't find you too loving after all.   I had you rice pudding and it was only ok to me.  Maybe because i spoiled my tasting buds in New York's Rice to riches.  It taste ok, and it's not too sweet, but i feel it's not as thick as i like it. Please forgive me.
author: Belinda C.

description:
WOW! I am definitely in love...

While exploring Pacific Heights one sunny Sunday, I noticed a line forming outside this shop and just HAD to see what the big deal was... rice pudding and fro yo was the big deal! I got the cookies and cream rice pudding and my lovely companion got the frozen yogurt with peanut butter. You have to be there to truly understand, but the young lady working by herself behind the counter was literally putting her back into churning this frozen yogurt! It was quite the spectacle and she truly earned the tip I left her that day.

I can't wait to go back and try more!!

Oh wait... I've already been back 3 other times...oops ; )
author: Bernadette E.

description:
The best frozen yogurt place period!

The deal about this place is that you first pick either vanilla or chocolate yogurt base then add fruits or toppings. Some notable toppings include pineapple, blueberry, raspberry, peach, strawberry, toffee, oreo, nutella, animal crackers, cookie dough. You basically pick the stuff you want (I dont think theres a limit) and then using a DRILL like machine, they will mix it together into a rich and flavorful masterpiece. 

I personally got the vanilla, blueberry, toffee, nutella, and oreos. It was pretty rich for a frozen yogurt but wasnt too thick which was perfect for my taste. Not too sweet and the crunch of the oreos blended well in the background to the dominant blueberry flavor. 

What I like about this place is that you can be unique in making your own flavor in a sense. The only bad thing about this place is that they only have 2 machines and it takes about 3-5 mins to make your masterpiece so I imagine the line getting long quickly. CASH ONLY and parking could be a hassle around the area.

I also tried some of the rice pudding which wasnt bad at all but their claim to fame is their blended frozen yogurt.

Bottom line: its a must try as its quite unique and i guess the closest thing to compare it to is the coldstone creations but without regrets as I didnt get that nasty feeling you get after eating ice cream.
author: Robert Y.

description:
Great place to satisfy your sweet tooth AND stay health conscious (hello non-fat milk!) You won't feel too guilty indulging in Loving Cup's rice pudding or frozen yogurt. The small cup will get you a dessert under 200 calories. Not bad, but be weary of toppings like nutella or almond butter, which add more - but really, who's counting?

Rice Pudding:
It's delicious. Not too sweet, not too rich. Yet the flavors are very distinct. I enjoyed the cinnamon rum raisin & creamsicle (orange). The only flavor I wasn't a fan of is the coconut.

Frozen Yogurt:
It's literally frozen. As in, it comes in the form of a disc. Yes, it's odd but that's what makes it more appealing to me for some reason. The froyo is made to order so no sampling on this one, but there's really no need to because it's so good. They blend the froyo disc first, transforming it to the creamy base. Then, if you choose toppings, they are blended into the froyo ever so perfectly and adds the right amount of pizazz.

Love the feel of this place, love that all the desserts are made fresh & of course, with love. Can't say "love" enough when I'm talking about this place.

4 stars because they only serve a select number of rice pudding flavors daily and ran out of chocolate froyo very easily & early in the afternoon.
author: Colleen V.

description:
If I lived in the area, I'd probably come here all the time..but I don't.

If I liked rice pudding I'd probably like it here, but I don't.

But, their frozen yogurt is really interesting and good.  They have a block of literal frozen yogurt and blend it with what ever toppings you choose. Next time I'm going to see if I can just get it plain....that would probably be good too.

The best part of this froyo is that the consistency is thick and doesn't melt in like one minute! Yes!
author: Marisa R.

description:
My friend, Stacey C., is a fan of Rice to Riches and so I thought of Loving Cup's rice pudding when trying to decide on a dessert to bring over.  

I called ahead of time to confirm that they sell larger amounts, and ended up talking to Liz, who was incredibly courteous and helpful with my order.  She was patient and even managed to understand me despite my massive congestion issues and slow firing brain cells!

Since it was easier to process all the choices in writing, Liz immediately shot over an email with all the specs.  The following may be helpful if you're interested in buying more than a single serving size of rice pudding:

There are seven flavors available, which are rotated out with additional flavors depending on the day.  

Last Friday's flavors:
Peanut butter
Madagascar Vanilla Bean
Cinnamon Rum Raisin
Lemon Vanilla
Cream-sicle (orange vanilla)
Chai 
Chocolate Chocolate Mini Chip

Other flavors on rotation: 
Pistachio
White Chocolate
Cookies n' Cream
Pecan Praline
English Toffee
Espresso
Mocha
Mango
Strawberry
Vanilla Chocolate Mini Chip
Key Lime
Pumpkin Pie
Egg Nog
Gingerbread

Pricing: 
16oz (1lb)    $7.25      serves 3
32oz (2lbs)  $13.00    serves 4-6
64oz (4lbs)  $24.00    serves 6-10

For pre-ordering (even an hour or two ahead seems like plenty of time), you can choose any size of the flavors available that day.  If you'd like one that isn't on the menu, you have to order a minimum of 2lbs PER flavor.  

I ended up purchasing one pound of creamsicle and another of rum raisin.  I've never been to NYC so I can't really compare to the rice pudding that everyone raves about, but I enjoyed Loving Cup's.  I think everyone at dinner liked it too, especially the rum raisin.  I probably wouldn't order creamsicle again (tastes just like the popsicle), though I'm dying to try pistachio.  

Also, FYI, one pound isn't as much as you would expect.  

This store could be potentially addicting, considering I live so close by.  Thanks again to Liz for helping a last minute whim turn out so well!
author: Joanne G.

description:
I hate giving bad reviews, especially for a place that everyone loves, but what may be wonderful to some may not be wonderful to others? I hate to be the one that stands out, but Loving Cup wasn't all that to me. I'm sorry, Loving Cup fans.

I came here after dinner with some friends who were raving about this place. They said their rice pudding was really good. I've never had rice pudding so I thought to give it a try. They give you samples of each flavored rice pudding, so instead of going all in with an entire cup, I decided to try it first. It was thick, goo-ey, slimy, and tasted really heavy. It reminded me of baby food, but thicker and cold. It just wasn't my thing. I decided to get a frozen yogurt instead. You can get kinda crazy with what you mix into your frozen yogurt, so I got cookie dough and pistachios. Wasn't a good combo (probably my mistake). It also tasted really heavy. I finished 1/3 of my cup because I felt bad for wasting food.

I felt like I gained 5 pounds.
author: Rosie W.

description:
Rice pudding is weird to me because it makes me feel like I mixed my lunch and dessert like some toddler with a poor conception of what good food is.  

But, Loving Cup is successful in its endeavor to convince me otherwise.  The simple vanilla was boring as it offered nothing fun beyond plain vanilla pudding with mixed-in rice.  But the Coconut had great flavor and has me curious of what else they have to offer.  The texture of the puddings are great, and the ambiance is very cute and fitting.  The prices are also very reasonable, since they are generous with their servings.  I'd recommend Loving Cup the same way I'd recommend a scoop of ice cream in the middle of anything.
author: Diane N.

description: Super tasty flavors and overall really cool idea, i just wasn't impressed. I got the flavor of the day which was pumpkin and my friend got vanilla with salted caramel and choc chips. Hers was def better but still a bit too sweet.
author: Christie I.

description:
I loved the cup.

Great rice pudding, great frozen yogurt, friendly service and great location.

Great.
author: Assaf B.

description:
I love frozen yogurt. I love fruits even more, especially pineapples (I've eaten a whole pineapple in one sitting numerous times!). Loving Cup blends my two loves together. It's magical to me when I see them pull out a Ziploc bag full of fresh pineapple, place it in the machine with a cube of non-fat vanilla yogurt, and within a minute, turn the two into the freshest creation I've ever had! You can even still taste tiny bits of the pineapple chunks - definitely all natural here! 

The perfect treat on a sunny SF afternoon!
author: Carolyn W.

description:
Wrote them up in my blog, highly recommend banana + peanut butter mix!

Loving Cup: The New #1 Fro-Yo Jam « San Francisco, Southern Fried http://bit.ly/qckaXd
author: Morgan C.

description:
Rice pudding and fro-yo....

Came here to get our rice pudding on and it was a-ok.   I think if Loving Cup had more flavors to choose from it would be great, they only have 6.   The flavors were ok tasting too, out of them all I liked the cinnamon rum raisin the best.  Didn't try the fro yo but it looked good and they had a good selection to choose from.  

It was cool how she let us try the flavors as many times as we wanted.  I prob could've been full off of that alone and walked away :-)
author: Bernadette M.

description:
Wow.  I just happened to be walking by, and thought to myself "I want that."  

Next thing I know, I have a vanilla yogurt that has had real peanut butter and banana mashed up into it. 

Imagine Cold Stone Creamery, but fresher ingredients, higher quality, and based on real frozen yogurt.  Sooooooo tasty.

From now on, if I want frozen yogurt, I will bypass all of the establishments near me here in the Marina, and proceed directly to Loving Cup.  i recommend you do as well.
author: Jeff C.

description:
let me tell you a little something about myself. I love rice pudding. no, that's not right. I LOVE rice pudding?!!?yes, that's better. I usually get the señor reynaldo variety at safeway. look out for the mexican guy in the front. he's got quite the stache.

ANYWHO, i digress. So my friend had told me about this place, and when I heard they had rice pudding. i HAD to come. and let me tell you. I was not disappointed. 

I got the coconut with a black bottom (ganache at the bottom). I also tried the raisin rum flavor. So great! It was creamy and wonderful and everything rice pudding should be. I got a small (kinda pricey at 4.50, but it was more than enough of a serving) Oh, and they have organic frozen yogurt too. If that's yo thang.
author: Sandi V.

description:
Genius!!! 

I am in LOVE with this place...rice pudding in a plethora of mouth-watering flavors and frozen yogurt made in the most interesting contraption!

The flavors change often, and on my last visit, I sampled the toffee, as well as the toasted coconut. OMG both were so amazing! I wound up with a cup of the toffee and added a 'black bottom' to further enhance my eating pleasure.

Hubby wound up getting a frozen yogurt. They actually mix the favors IN the yogurt with this really cool machine. With so many different flavors and add-ins, you can really go crazy trying to figure out what you want!

The staff is so patient and helpful - generous with the samples and suggestions for tasty flavor combos.

Loving Cup...I LOVE YOU!
author: Christy L.

description:
Came here after dinner one night and decided to try out a new dessert spot. I yelped a few places and "rice pudding" came up. Not only was their rice pudding delicious but their main specialty, which is their frozen yogurt, was off the hook good. You can create your own by adding your own mix ins. You start off with either a vanilla or chocolate base yogurt and u can add fruits, candies, chocolates or nutts into it. I ordered the vanilla froyo mixed with bananas and oreo cookies. The frozen yogurt already came pre packaged and they put it into this machine which mixes it up with the toppings you choose.
The boytoy had the orange creamsicle flavored rice pudding and loved it so much he bought the large size cup and took home with him to savor it till the next day. 
 
Needless to say both of us will be back for more!

1 star taken away for not having a credit card machine. CASH ONLY.
author: Esther M.

description:
My wife is infatuated with this place.  Im not a big fan of flavored rice puddings so I typically only order a plain with some chocolate ganache.  the small size is good enough as they are quite sizable. 

If I remember correctly they are a cash only spot which I am not too fond of especially with new merchant services out there like Square Up.  

Parking around the area can be a little bit of a pain because its always packed - especially during the evening hours.
author: Joseph I.

description:
I've passed this place so many times, but it was always closed past 9. I finished a full meal at Bullitt and just decided to peek my head into the store and glance at their menu. Little did I know, I let with a small portion of half almond butter and half chocolate chip rice pudding. My fellow Yelp friends gave this place a lower rating than I expected because I thought it was tasty! I love rice pudding and find it more healthier than just any other desserts. It's low in sugar (except for the chocolate chips) and easy to eat. A bit ugly to look at since it's just a blob of white mush.

My boyfriend got an order of their Froyo. OOO, it was not like any froyo I've tasted. The make the froyo fresh with the machine in the back. I was very fascinated by the entire process. A block of frozen yogurt, fresh fruit, some graham crackers (he got the strawberry cheesecake froyo), and voila! Fresh froyo! The texture was light, slightly icier than the self-serve froyo stations, and refreshing.


Down side? Cash only.
author: Rosanne L.

description:
Frozen yogurt and cupcakes are old news. If you are a fan of rice pudding & different flavors, sweet & friendly service, and a local neighborhood vibe, then this is the place to go. (Note: I still love frozen yogurt and cupcakes.)

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: I have been going to loving cup for about 6 years now and it never fails to satisfy me. I love that they have rice pudding and that they let you sample it as much as you want. I usually get a chocolate base with oreos to mix and gummy bears on top, and my friend gets a chocolate base with toffee. Both are great to eat. It is a good place to have a date or just catch up with a friend. It also plays a cute background music.
author: Lawrence Y.

description:
Their rice pudding is amazing!  Their employees are friendly.   They have no problem letting you sample until you find exactly what you want.  If only this place wasn't so close to my house.  I crave it and it won't be so great for the waist ;)
I love espresso, rum raisin, chocolate chip, toffee...there are so many!
I wish they had more seating because the place is so small.
author: kim k.

description:
Chocolate Yogurt Base with Raspberries. This place was pretty cool because you pick toppings and they grind it into your yogurt with a machine. Much better than Coldstone in that sense. But I was definitely not a fan of the chocolate base because it was overly sweet and overly chocolatey. My friend did say their vanilla base is much better so maybe I'll give it a try when they have that. The chocolate and raspberries together just made it taste like a Raspberry Milano, but it was definitely too rich for me and I wish they had a smaller size than the "small." 

I had a taste of their rice pudding because my friend said it was so good and amazing. But I guess since I'm not really a fan of rice to begin with I didn't think it was that great and just tasted like mushed up grains of rice with a sweet coconut-y flavor.
author: Constance C.

description:
What's smooth and creamy?
Vanilla bean rice pudding
Perfect, not too sweet!
author: Jeanne L.

description:
Rice pudding is a certifiably old fashioned delight, which Loving Cup serves up in a sleek, modern setting. Yet despite the gleaming wood and sunlit metal stools, theres nothing modern about the five dishes of homemade rice pudding. I tried the coconut and the vanilla bean, both were excellent. The rice didn't hold its shape, which might turn off some purists, but the custard base and the flavors were creamy and delicious. 

Its a treat to find out-of-the-way niche offerings like the Loving Cup. So even though their pudding wasn't Julia Child's, I'd still recommend them for a special outing.
author: Mairead R.

description: OMG best froyo in the city!!! I am SO happy this place exists. The mixed in toppings into your froyo base is awesome. I've only found a few places like that. One in Boston and one in Hawaii. SO happy theres one here!!! I got vanilla base with strawberries and coconut. SOSOSOSO good! Will definitely be back. Wish there was one downtown by my apartment or closer to my work on Chestnut & Fillmore area. Oh well..
author: Natassia S.

description:
I'm a big fan of rice pudding AND frozen yogurt, so when I found out about Loving Cup, I knew I had to check it out. Today was my first time going. I got the madagascar vanilla bean rice pudding. I can't even decribe how amazing it was! My taste buds were definitely having a party. Seriously, I cannot wait to go back and try some other flavors AND the frozen yogurt. 

I better get started. I've got a lot of catching up to do!
author: Danielle D.

description:
When I was a kid I hated rice pudding and bread pudding. It was so disgusting to me. 20 some-odd years later, my feelings have changed and I love both!

Loving Cup's rice pudding is so good!!! The rum and raisin and the coconut rice pudding are my faves. The best part, it's nearly a guilt-free dessert. The small vanilla rice pudding is less than 200 calories. Crazy huh???

I've also had their frozen yogurt. Good but the rice pudding is my fave. 

The ladies that run the shop are very nice. Throw a lil love in the tip jar!

Plus:  If you download the Scout Mob app, you can get 50% off your order (with a minumum discount of $10 or something)!

Yummy, guilt-free treats at a discount.
author: Kiristen R.

description: Both the frozen yoghurt and the rice pudding here is amazing and well worth a visit. Go and enjoy!!
author: Greg B.

description: Had heard tons of good stuff about this place from a friend and decided to head over there w another friend after an OB bonfire. I believe it was around 10:15 pm and I believe they were starting to close up but loving cup was still full of 20-30 something's. I ordered the chocolate chip rice pudding which was delish! Sweet but subtle- I had never had rice pudding before but by all means this was great. What makes loving cup so awesome though is the custom froyo. You choose your base (vanilla or chocolate) and then several unique and gourmet toppings, which are thrown into a machine w your base flavor and mixed together. Beyond cool + so yummy. Definitely a one of a kind spot.
author: Ava S.

description:
Rice pudding on the go!
Espresso and Madagascar Vanilla were the flavors I decided to try. I definitely like the way they make their rice pudding - it's super healthy (at least more so than rice puddings at other places) and the rice itself has a very nice texture to it. It's not mushy like some places tend to make their rice because it's been overmixed and overcooked that the rice just completely breaks down and becomes baby food, literally. 

I opted to get the Espresso rice pudding just because it had much more flavor than the madagascar vanilla one. The vanilla just seemed to be nonexistent and it just tasted like I was eating some creamy thick rice soup. Definite No-no. Had to get the espresso and I asked for a dash of cinnamon on top. YUM.

My friend got the frozen yogurt - although the line for yogurt is long, it's worth the wait just because the yogurt is good and because the way they make it is such a novelty. A big frozen circular piece of yogurt is taken out of a freezer and stuck in the cup that gets mashed up by a drill machine! It's crazy! There's no real eloquent way of describing this. You'll just have to go and see for yourself!
author: Julia K.

description: I think I might be a purist. I like the idea of being able to blend two flavors into one for my frozen yogurt, but really, I would have preferred having my nutella and strawberry separate. Other than that, I really enjoyed the Oreo rice pudding, and would go back for other flavors.
author: mina y.

description:
I'm bumping them to 5 stars, because I've finally tried the fro yo and it was yummy!!! 

They only do vanilla & chocolate and then mix in the fruit, candy, etc....but that's the AWESOME part. They don't simply just add mangoes to your vanilla yogurt (that's what I got), but they have this really cool machine that basically pulverizes whatever it is your adding to the yogurt and the two (or more if you decide to go with more toppings) things infuse into one another. Basically, my fro you tasted like vanilla/mango yogurt and not vanilla yogurt with mangoes (if that makes any sense). 

I have to admit, even if the yogurt was just pretty good and not great (which it was) I probably would have bumped this place solely based on the fact that machine they use is so cool!!! 

Also, they now have pumpkin pie rice pudding for the fall, which I tasted and is ridiculously good!!!
author: George A.

description:
Got a groupon for $8 of yummiest for $4. WOW. 

I understand that frozen yogurt is big out here and I've heard myself say, things like: let's get some frozen yogurt and I need to go to yoga class. My friends back East would fall over from shock. 

I thought it would be no sweat to get eight dollars of eats but it really wasn't. The pricing was reasonable. For four dollars and change I got a small cup of yogurt with junior mints and oreo (you get to pick two flavors from a wall of options) swirled in and a coffee shake for about another four buck. I ran over by a fifty cents but it was forgiven. Sweet! And yeah in this weather, I had cold stuff Heehee. 

W.O.W. It tasted like the best ice cream. The swirl ins were uniformly mixed and crushed and the friendly, well-mannered young man behind the counter (I know I'm getting old when I can say things like that) even re-twirled the yogurt into the cup because the first one was not to his liking. I thought that was funny. I got a small, thinking it would be a light soft serving. It was rich. It's not like fraiche (brick-like) yogurt either. The serving utensils were all compostable which made it so much better. 

Note: the garbage is hidden in the cupboard. I wandered up the stairs and into the storage area like a tard looking for the trash. And I still have a hard time with compostable vs combustible but the compost is on the left side. This place is crazy hard for me to get to but SO WORTH IT.
author: lily l.

description:
Frozen yogurt is fine, cupcakes are average, rice pudding is alright, and the churro rice krispie treats are pretty good but the RED VELVET FRO YO is drooltastic!

When you're ballin and jonesing for sweet you have to spring for a vanilla yogurt with a red velvet cupcake mixed in.  It is a phenomenal combination that will set you back $11 but make you so happy!  The perfect ratio is a XL fro yo with 1 cupcake (small fro yo with 1 cupcake is too sweet).
author: Krystle S.

description:
I always come here for their frozen yogurt. You are able to choose your base - vanilla and chocolate - and then your mix-ins. I always get the vanilla with nutella and english toffee. Delicious! 

Also, the rice pudding is really good here too. I would say it is better than the famous place in New York (rice to riches).
author: Tif L.

description:
Froyo dude here.
This is Great home made Froyo.

My 1st review was flagged and removed because I wrote that how disgusting watching making the froyo. The froyo machine is very different.

I wrote graphic disgusting review.

But, they moved the machine in back, way back.
So, it is hard to see what's going on back there making froyo.
I think that is good idea.  
So, I don't need to see the water run threw the machine.

It still takes time making it.
But it's well worth it.

Oh yeah, I remember that my 1st review, I made a fun of the funky name as " 2 girls 1 cup."
Yoyo froyo dude.
author: Nobu K.

description: so delish.. vanilla, cookie dough, nutella, walnuts and nutella. MUST TRY!!
author: Mel R.

description: It's such a creative idea to mix the toppings in with the frozen yogurt, and it is DELICIOUS. Something about it feels healthier than normal frozen yogurt too--but this place is addicting so be prepared to return!
author: V H.

description:
Life changing. It's funny because you're eating this frozen yogurt (non-fat btw), and I swear it's got cream or whipping cream in it because it's so thick and amazingly yummy, but it doesn't! A friend compared the creaminess to Coldstone. I think it's better. Gourmet toppings to add, also- love it.

I'm a huge fan.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Was looking for an ice cream shop in the area open late, and McDonalds was nowhere to find.  That's right, McDs ice cream is the bomb, yo!

Anyways, came upon this place and while I usually find fro-yo so so, I went for it and got the Vanilla cream with Nutella and Oreos as mix-ins.  Very impressed!  The yogurt is 1) not tart (so if you're a pinkberry snob, this ain't for you), 2) not too sweet (but nutella and oreos added quite the sweet punch), and 3) tastes like quality fro-yo should be.
author: Vadim G.

description:
Loving Cup? More like Living End!

Bad joke. But that's really how I feel about Loving Cup. I love it. I love that they mix the toppings into the yogurt with a scary-cool metal blender thing, I love that they use fresh fruit and organic products, I love that they serve rice pudding, I love that they offer chunky peanut butter as an option, I love that they have churro-flavored rice krispies for sale. I love all of those things.

My go-to combo is chocolate yogurt-chunky peanut butter-banana, but it's hard to go incredibly wrong here. The nice people who work here have a great sense of what flavors mix well together, so they can guide you in the right direction so you don't end up with almond butter and pineapple or something. Unless you're into that. 

Anyway, please just go here. If you're like me, you'll end up finding an excuse to go waaaaay more than you should. (Frequent buyer cards FTW!)
author: Stefanie L.

description:
So you are thinking rice....pudding?? Hmmm-ew. Well maybe not but I was. Before Loving Cup I was not sold on the notion that rice could ever be made into a dessert that I would LOVE. So thanks to Loving Cup my list of dessert and treat options I love has lengthened. 

A few friends raved about this place and so finally I gave in and gave it a try. Epiphany! YUM! YAH!

I tried the almond butter. I was not disappointed. My only disappointment was related to the unacceptable-ness of my desire to then try ALL of them. Still not a believer? Then for you there is fro-yo with toppings galore! 
 
This place is yumm-o! Wish it was closer to my home I'd be the next Duke! ;)
author: Tuesday C.

description:
Great place for smoothies! 
Friendly and fast service, even with a long waiting lines.

Too bad they are not open in the morning. Could be the first stop before heading to work.
author: Stephen V.

description:
Two visits in two days should say something about this place! We tried the vanilla & fresh strawberry, vanilla/nutella/english toffee and chocolate/espresso and LOVED every bite. 
Reasonable prices, cozy ambience and a friendly staff made for a 5-star experience for us. Our toddler couldn't stop eating the strawberry yogurt and we didn't feel guilty one bit for letting him devour it. We'll have to visit again for the rice pudding!
author: Sarah L.

description: Absolutely delicious ice cream treats and friendly employees.  Each serving is prepared on the spot to order and the flavors are perfectly mixed.
author: Charles B.

description:
Okay...I admit, I was wanting to go to Icebee tonight and realized that it had already closed. : ( 
My friend had to convince me to go to the Loving Cup (I thought it was weird that they only had vanilla and chocolate base). But man, am I so happy I ended up going!! 

I got the vanilla froyo with nutella and walnuts---HEAVEN IN MY MOUTH, absolutely delicious!! 

We also shared the organic hot apple cider which was just like biting into an apple, tiny chunks of apple bits and all.  

It's amazing that they have all organic treats here. I am definitely going back for their perfectly mixed froyo combinations!!
 ^_^
author: Emilee G.

description:
Super tasty!  I had some frozen yogurt and it was delicious.  I liked the way it was all blended together right as I ordered it.  Definitely a bit on the unique side.  

I didn't try the rice pudding, so I have no idea how that is, but my friend liked it!

Employees were friendly and the shop was very cute.  Would love to revisit!
author: Emily V.
Greg P.

description: AMAZING! This is like exactly what I would want in a fro-yo spot. I got the special of the day flavor which was Butterfinger and added in cookie dough and chocolate chips. Perfection! And the staff was really nice.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
I was walking down Polk Street when I saw a new business with the words "Rice Pudding" above the words "Local * Organic * All Natural."  I stopped immediately in my tracks since RICE PUDDING is one of my all-time favorite desserts, and also because I've been exploring the world of local & sustainable foods.

At first I resisted the temptation to enter the store since it appeared to be "just" another coffee shop with yogurt.  But then I thought to myself "self, where else in the city can you find RICE PUDDING?"  After running my errand, I was drawn back and I had to check it out.

The store is pretty nondescript and there isn't any seating but the centerpiece of the store is really the display case with a variety of RICE PUDDING flavors.   I sampled the lemon, but purchased a small pecan & praline for $3.50.  It seems like a bargain to me!

The flavors jumped in my mouth.  I loved the added crunch of the nuts, and I like the fact that I can feel the texture of the rice grains amidst the creamy-gooey goodness.  There was also a chocolate variety but I unfortunately forgot to note the 2 other flavors available.  I figure I'll do a better job reporting on my next visit.

According to the 2 staffers, the store only opened up about 10 days ago (which would be approximately Nov. 24).  

When I asked whether the rice pudding was truly made from local ingredients (there aren't many rice growers in the Bay Area), they did not know the answer.  They did mention it was prepared in Berkeley, however, since the location is not equipped for on premise cooking.  I left my business card and asked if the owner could let me know how the pudding is either local, organic or all natural.  I hope I'll get my answer soon.

I suppose my only complaint at the moment is that the "local, organic all natural" claims are not self evident when you are in the store.  While I would love to see better execution of this, I don't think it will stop me from visiting again (and again?).
author: Gary S.

description:
Favorite flavors: Madagascar vanilla bean, coconut, rum raisin. Topped with their homemade chocolate ganache. 

The nutella was disappointing. I was ready to become addicted, but it didn't deliver. The cookies and cream was okay. 

Bonus: you can order half/half and get two flavors in your cup!

Can't wait to try their frozen yogurt.
author: Lily L.

description:
This place is a prime example of why I LOVE SF!

By far the best Froyo I have had in my life. Now I have to say that with some caution...if you are looking for tart froyo...you are better off at some other froyo spot. But if you are into some good ole fashion frozen yogurt (vanilla and chocolate) that taste natural and smooth..this is the place!

This was my first time experiencing this amazing Froyo, and it will definitely not be my last. Yelp came through with flying colors with their 4.5 star rating. This place is legit. They mix all their toppings together like a blizzard from dairy queen...but the taste is exponentially better. 

I noticed a bunch of people sampling their rice pudding...which I was not into...but decided to give it a try. I am so glad I did. I never would have thought rice pudding could taste so good. I mean when you think about it, it's rice...and pudding...but when you add fresh ingredients along with some creative flavor ideas...it is really good. 

As for the service, it could not get any better. The guy knew it was my first time here and he hooked it up, making sure I was a happy customer. Right on dude, major props to making me want to come back and treating customers the right way! 

Now the real question is...is this place worth going to even if you do not live near by and have to make a drive out here? DEFINITELY! Would I recommend this place to try if you are tired of the everyday froyo shops(Nubi, Tuttimelon, etc...) HELL YES! Would I recommend bringing a date here to end the night on a good note...possibly securing a kiss? MOST DEFINITELY YES!
author: Nick C.

description:
I love this place- and it's fat free and organic!
There are not many places you can find organic coffee and organic millk- and hey carry both.
Staff is SO nice!
author: Claudine D.

description:
Who cares about rice pudding when you have BLENDED FROYO?!?

You pick chocolate or vanilla (vanilla).  Then you pick one or more of a plethora of delicious toppings (nutella and banana).  Then, they throw that together in a MAGIC MACHINE that blends it all together.  Watch it, it is mesmerizing.  And what you get is an amazing banana-nutella-flavored cup of frozen yogurt.  None of that toppings nonsense...the ESSENCE of the toppings have COALESCED into a frozen yogurt CREATION that will make your tastebuds dance!

I can still taste it....
author: Cathy Y.

description:
I have been to numerous frozen yogurt shops (in socal and in norcal). The thing I love about this place/makes it stand out is the fact that they "blend in/mesh" the "flavor" (or toppings) into a vanilla/chocolate yogurt foundation or "base" (through this fun-to-watch process).

I have only been here twice so far. Both times ordered the vanilla yogurt base: once with the toffee bits and peanut butter blended in and the last time, with just mango blended into the vanilla base.

I liked the peanut butter/toffee bit combo better. The mango blend was just not sweet enough for me. As others have mentioned...they use REAL fruit so I should have expected it to not be that sweet. (I was just hoping i guess for more sweetness with the mango compared with the other fruits available because of a mango's inherent creamy/sweet flavor).

Love love the freshness of this place...just dont really like the price. It's $3.50 for a small with one free topping (and another free topping i think? if u do a yelp check in on ur phone...but i dont have a phone that can do that sooo) and 75 cents extra for each additional topping.  A bit expensive in my opinion (since I've been spoiled by socal's, "Yogurtland" which was 30 cents/ounce self serve...though I heard they've gone up to 35 cents/ounce).

*3rd check in as of 10/14...got the junior mints swirled into vanilla base yogurt....verry verry good. As a few others have mentioned, it tastes a lot like mint chocolate chip ice cream/froyo/etc (which was/is one of my ultimate favorites) 

CONCLUDING WORDS/ADVICE-choose a sweet topping if ur only going with one topping.
author: G L.

description:
Great frozen yogurt spot!  I got chocolate with peanut butter and oreos...delish.

Two options: 4-5 different rice pudding flavors OR chocolate and vanilla frozen yogurt with 20-25 toppings.

Window seating for people-watching.

Friendly staff with much patience for the indecisive.

Payment: cash or credit card with a $.25 fee.
author: Rachel C.

description: Best rice pudding spot ever! I purchased a Groupon and was able to get 3 pints of rice pudding or frozen yogurt at half price, so my friends and I came earlier this week to pick our flavors. They had 6 flavors available that day, and we sampled almost all of them (and split the samples, of course!). I thought the Pecan Praline and Chocolate Chip were too sweet, but enjoyed the Coconut and Creamsicle (had a surprisingly refreshing hint of orange). I didn't try the Cinnamon Rum Raisin because I knew I wouldn't like the rum or raisins in it, and ended up choosing the Madagascar Vanilla Bean because I liked the simplicity of it. However, if it weren't so cold, we would have chosen to go with the frozen yogurt instead because of their awesome machine! They have a machine that whips the topping into the frozen yogurt, so it is completely blended in versus just being sprinkled on top. I will definitely have to come back to check that out. The staff is really patient, and Loving Cup is highly recommended!
author: Amy D.

description: love love love the oreo cookie rice pudding!
author: Sofia M.

description: Only based on the hours since I did not try the ice cream. Closed at 4 on a sunny Sunday.
author: D F.

description:
This isn't your ordinary "come stop in and give us four dollars for a mediocre snack because our decor is pastel cute" type place.  hahah End rant.

Rice pudding:  Delicious and only 195 calories?! (for those who care).  That's kind of a steal.  All their rice puddings are made with the Madagascar Vanilla Bean base, so if you're like me and like yourself some good vanilla aroma & taste, mm mm, then you'll like it.  I sampled shamelessly and ended up with 1/2 nutella, 1/2 coconut (fresh AND toasted mixed in).  The pudding is just the right level of thickness and the arborio rice isn't mushy, holds its own. 

FROYO:  Even better!  Just watching them make it was amazing.  I thought they were going to do the mix-ins like Coldstone, with a spoon, not this high powered DRILL.  So pro.  We had Vanilla with English Toffee and PB mix-in.  holy mac it was good.  Froyo isn't too soft which I liked.

So in summary:  order what we ordered.  Nutella and Coconut Rice pudding.  Vanilla froyo with English Toffee and PB Mix-in.  

Treasure amid the gimmicky places.  They make their stuff with care and both rice pudding and froyo have delicious interesting flavor and mouth feel.
author: Tammy L.

description:
I love youuuuuuu!!!!!!!

My first visit sealed the deal-- vanilla frozen yogurt blended with Nutella and strawberries.  OH.  MY.  GOD.  I'd never had topping blended into my fro yo before, and I am CONVERTED.  Every single bit was the perfect balance of all the flavors.  It was beyond incredible.

My bf had the tahitian vanilla rice pudding and topped it with rum-raisins and granola.  It was good, the texture of the pudding was creamy and thick.  I wasn't sold on the toppings, but I think it's just personal preference.

I went back another day and had the cookies and cream rice pudding and was blown away.  It was silky and perfect, not too sweet!

I love that they have a punch card too!!!  The staff is super friendly and helpful when you need suggestions when deciding what to get.
author: Tamara N.

description:
Whenever I am in need of some homemade comfort, I am going to click my heels three times and hope that I get transported right to the counter at Loving Cup.  Because their rice pudding provides spoonful after spoonful of creamy, delicious goodness that soothes like nothing else.

On a recent visit, we tasted their Lemon Vanilla, Coconut, and Cinnamon Raisin - all delicious.  Next time I will give the Chocolate and the Peanut Butter a try.

They also make what looked like delicious frozen yogurt - custom blended before your very eyes!  and smoothies.    

I loved the giant jars of almond butter for sale in the back, too.

A must-stop place if you are in the neighborhood!
author: Liz S.

description:
Flavored rice puddings and yogurts. If you like them, they are good. Place is pretty small here. Only 1 server when I came here. So, expect a slow line.
Anyways, ordered the Toffee flavored rice pudding. It was pretty good. Good amount of flavor. I don't think many people likes rice pudding since the texture is like baby's food. The looks, lol, just say lucky it doesn't have a pink color in it, or else it look like vomit. But don't let the looks deceive you, it is actually pretty good.
Also ordered a vanilla pistachio yogurt. It is good. Not too sweet, not too bland. it is perfect, for me of course. Everyone has different taste.
Try it out.
author: Albert W.

description:
It was my first time here and I was overwhelmed with the selection... I pondered: 

Should I get their rice pudding they are known for?
 Or should I get some frozen yogurt that I was craving?

The owner Liz was sweet to suggest a mixture of vanilla&chocolate yogurt with Oreo crumbles and some ground espresso beans... 

After my first bite I instantly knew it was the right choice! 

If ur a choc lover (and not craving rice pudding) - this is ur new vice!

...

crap, now I want some.
author: Stormy M.

description:
How have I NOT discovered this until now???

Frozen Yogurt flavors made to order? Create your own froyo flavor? PURE GENIUS and DELICIOUSNESS in a cup!!!

I went for the first time last Thursday, and I already came back today for my second cup and brought my boyfriend, who I KNEW would love it.

Flavors I've tried so far:
Vanilla + mango + granola = DELICIOUS! Mango provides just the right amount of flavor and natural sweetness
Vanilla + mango + strawberry = really fresh, not too sweet, tasty
Vanilla + toffee + oreo = a little more on the sweet side, but OH so yummy
Vanilla + peanut butter + nutella + banana = Like a PB sandwich only cold and fresh and even more yummy!

I WILL be back. Multiple times.
author: Gina R.

description: I rarely leave bad reviews, but I've had consecutive so-so experiences at this place.  My mix-in tonight was super salty and borderline inedible.  Service is fine, and rice pudding is pretty good, but I wouldn't recommend the frozen yogurt.
author: Brett H.

description:
My friend made a mistake bringing me here. I LOVE Loving Cup!

This place closes at 9:30 on weeknights, so if you're having a Loving Cup froyo craving at night, get to Loving Cup quick! My friend was driving like a mad woman trying to get us there on time (we were stopped at a traffic light for 10 minutes by a VIP motorcade driving through the city and we were very upset and were yelling like crazy). We were even strategically planning how I was to hop out of the car and order everything for the both of us, and I've never had Loving Cup before so the process was new to me. Basically you choose a chocolate or vanilla base for your yogurt (we combined both chocolate and vanilla!) and then you pick your toppings. My friend had strawberry and peach toppings, and I had banana and oreos! The Loving Cup machine man sticks the froyo base into the magical machine along with your toppings, the machine mixes it all together, and out comes a perfect Loving cup full of perfection. So fresh, so clean and yum. We ordered smalls but the Loving Cup machine man stacked our mix into a beautifully swirled mountain of yogurt.

My friend and I sat in her car eating our froyos, and when Loving Cup closed their doors promptly at 9:30, we saw many who came too late and were denied. It was sad. Come on time, guys!
author: Andrea F.

description:
I tried their Madasgascar vanilla rice pudding and it was... mediocre. It was kind of like rice pudding out of one of those packs that you can get at a grocery store-- ok, probably not that bad. But not as good as I had expected.

The frozen yogurt that my boyfriend had-- chocolate with raspberry mixed in-- was very good. However, we were both disappointed that you can only choose either vanilla or chocolate for the yogurt, because we originally thought all the flavors on the board were fro yo flavors, not just toppings. 
The bummer was that they were out of vanilla! (Note to self: don't go late at night)

I have since gotten  vanilla with strawberry (frozen fruits) and I thought it was a "meh, i've experienced better". Good, but it wasn't how I expected it to turn out. It ended up all pink and tasting like diluted strawberry frozen yogurt-- not vanilla with strawberries mixed in. If I ever go again (not by my choice but someone else's) I will probably try vanilla with animal crackers-- then, perhaps the vanilla flavor will still be present??
author: Saori E.

description:
It's healthy. It's tasty. There are lots of toppings choices. They participate in Groupon. It's a bit pricey, but that's okay. They only have two flavors: Vanilla and Chocolate, but that's okay because really those are the two best flavors for frozen yogurt.

Most importantly: Kate (age 10) likes it! 

She says next time we should try the rice pudding.
author: Dennis S.

description: Trying the rice pudding and frozen yogurt here is a must. I didn't think I'd like rice pudding but the cookies and cream one totally changed my mind. The frozen yogurt is pretty much delicious no matter what you get. It's cool how you get to customize your own flavor. Their gummy bear toppings are so good. They have pretty much every flavor and they're soft, so you know they're not old. The atmosphere there is really chill and the workers are really nice. I definitely recommend that people try this place!
author: Cicily C.

description:
I stopped in this little place randomly as I walked down Polk St one day and it was one of the best decisions I've made on a whim in a long while. The girl working was very friendly and explained to me how their frozen yogurt menu worked. 

The overall amount of toppings is a little overwhelming, but I don't find this to be a problem at all. I stayed fairly tame and went with vanilla mixed with blueberries and raspberries. Delicious. It's was also very cool seeing how they go about mixing the ingredients. This place will definitely be on my list of places to go next time I'm in town.
author: Aaron R.

description:
AMAZING. 

I am  a total fro-yo connoisseur, and have tried ALL types of shops (make your own, numerous flavors, toppings, etc) but holy crap...this place is unreal.

For me, the catch is the epic swirl machine that gets all the toppings mixed into the yogurt. You end up with your own custom flavor.

Try this: Vanilla base, peanut butter, chocolate chips & coconut. To DIE for!

The only reason I can't give 5 stars is because it is quite pricey, and I can't always justify buying designer yogurt. Still super good!
author: Mimi B.

description: My girlfriend and I shared the peanut butter rice pudding and mango frozen yogurt.  Both were delicious!  Everything in this shop is freshly made including the peanut butter.  Mangos were sliced up and slow churned with frozen yogurt.  Will be back soon!
author: Andrew L.

description:
It's hard to detach my appreciation for this little place from my hatred for how difficult it is to find a parking spot in this area. I don't have to be concerned so much because I get around town by bus and on foot. However, PB Cat, who is a big fan of rice pudding, is a driver. This poses a problem when we end up spending 30-45 minutes looking for a spot. The puddin' sure does taste delicious, but there is a bitter note to it still, caused by our vehicular frustration.

That said, I am giving this a fair rating and NOT including my feelings on the cluster-duck that is Russian Hill. It's *not* the fault of this establishment. They are the purveyors of magic - fluffy, delicious rice pudding magic that comes in many flavors and can be garnished with such toppings as crushed almonds and house-made ganache. I think the only other place I know of that focuses primarily on rice pudding is Rice to Riches in NYC. That's because it takes mastery to make a good rice pudding and I think the Loving Cup is tops.

If only they had a delivery or curbside pick up service... sigh.
author: Tanya F.

description:
Despite my previous promise to never do it again, I bought coupons because it seemed like a good idea.  That means I had two coupons that expire today (9/30/10) and $40 to spend on rice pudding.  

In order to spread things out, I bought $20 last week and $20 today.  This place might seem expensive, but do you know how much rice pudding $20 can get you?  About 5 lbs of rice pudding.  It's enough to make anyone barf.  

Last week, i was able to give one container away.  Again, $20 = 5 lbs of rice pudding.  I got english toffee (too nutty), cookies and cream (gave away) and black bottom vanilla (PERFECT).  

Today, I got 2 black bottom vanilla (which I promptly swirled into "chocolate" as soon as I washed the muni off my hands) and a cinnamon rum raisin.  From the color, there may be too much cinnamon.

Last week a nice girl helped me out and she filled the cups to the brim and nearly overflowing.  

Today a guy helped me out who had too much will power and did not fill the cups to the brim.  He would make a very terrible Japanese person but I bet he could still get a lot of Asian girls.  

I think I like the vanilla best.  They always start with vanilla when making flavors, which inevitably has more added sugar.  This results in an english toffee that was nearly peanut buttery and much too sweet.  Think Skor bar dipped in rice pudding.  Disaster.  

Now, I need something to was the chocolate out of my mouth....Maybe some french fries.....Oh.....is that a pony?
author: Christina C.

description: Vanilla, Banana, Nutella.. Coconut. Try and beat it.
author: Danielle L.

description:
Love this place, you can custom your own frozen yogurt, choose the base flavor and choose your favorite topping, they will help you blend it.. they also have the rice pudding which is mix with milk, yogurt, rice..they have it in different flavor but I always get the nutella or the pistacho. 

This place is small, only 3 or 4 seats, accept cash only and It hard to find parking around the area. But thumb up for the yogurt and the rice pudding.
author: Angie L.

description:
My friend and I had never tried frozen yogurt with all the toppings mixed right into it, so for us, this was definitely a treat!! We were lucky (first of all because we had to sprint into the shop because we weren't sure if they were just about to close!) because our selections ended up being pretty much perfect.
My friend ordered the vanilla frozen yogurt with strawberries and Nutella mixed in (Divine!!) and I got the chocolate yogurt with Junior Mints (which makes the yogurt a bit more drippy, but it was still delicious!) Another great combo I've since discovered: Vanilla yogurt with espresso and animal crackers!

We stopped at Loving Cup on a whim after a big dinner out because, yes, we still had room for dessert. What a perfect way to end the night!
author: Ashley P.

description: Coconut rice pudding is to die for!  Yogurt is blended together with topping! Really cold like ice cream.  Kids had it and it was great.  Gluten free baked goods were a bit dry!  But service was wonderful!
author: Michaela T.

description:
I was craving a smoothie, but when I saw the menu here, I got excited and no longer knew what I wanted. I am a huge fan of frozen yogurt, and they make their own, complete with probiotics and all that good stuff. They have ton of toppings, fruit, nuts, candy and they swirl it all together with a fancy machine. They also make their own organic peanut butter so next time I am getting a shake with pb, bananas, and vanilla froyo. 
I decided on my original plan - I got a smoothie with berries, apple juice and frozen yogurt. It was so fresh and delicious and simple. 
At some point I will have to try the rice pudding also, since that seems to be the specialty, but I am freaked out by the texture.
author: Merrilee T.

description:
I came by this afternoon about 1:30pm to on Jan 13th to make a purchase. I was not pleased. I was standing at the counter for over 2 minutes or more. There was one customer waiting and myself.  Two girls behind the counter were going on and on about their "personal life".   They did not greet me or update me that  they will be with me. It was rude so I walked out.

Not sure if I want to go back there even if it was those two gals
 ignorance that represented their company.  That's why it is important
to acknowledge customers, it's common courtesy.
author: Maryann F.

description:
I am a huge frozen yogurt fan...but this place stands out for me amongst all the other joints in town! All natural, local ingredients, and not all melty like some fro yo places... Though I do love a big self-serve cup from Tutti Melon every once in a while, Loving Cup is where I go when I reeeally want to enjoy my frozen yogurt. Oh, and they have great rice pudding! I tend to go for the fro yo, but I took my family here when they visited and my mom was in love with the coconut rice pudding.

Some fro yo concoctions I have tried:
Vanilla+almond butter+animal crackers
Vanilla+coconut+oreos
Vanilla+nutella
Chocolate+animal crackers
author: Kristin S.

description:
My roommate will hate me for this b/c she loves this place. Anyway, I don't understand the rave reviews. I'm all for basic and believe that less is more, but I've been here twice now and there is simply no taste to the yogurt. 
If I want a yogurt fix I will stick with plain yogurt and strawberries which tastes 10X better than this place.
author: Tyler B.

description:
It was a cold windy SF night....

And what did I decide to eat for dessert?!

Coconut rice pudding!!

I had heard people rave about this place, so I decided to give it a shot since I am rarely around this area...

As it turns out, the coconut rice pudding was indeed great, not too sweet, and it made my tongue dance to its refreshing cool coconut flavor!

All of the ingredients were definitely fresh and as a customer, you have a plethora of flavors and toppings to choose from.

I'll go back one of these days to try some of the other flavors....maybe on a hot summer day this time around.
author: Albert L.

description:
There are two things I absolutely hate: Cloudy days and melted ice-cream. That being said, I absolutely love that loving cup mixes in toppings to their yogurt without sacrificing the texture! It's amazing! Flavors are completely changed with mix ins but the texture remains firm, no sloppy pile of cold mush!

Speaking of cold mush, I never would think rice pudding would be good. I was wrong. Hello heaven! I loved their Oreo rice pudding. I'm trying coconut next!

My bf bought a coupon online for $8 worth for $4. We then paid another quarter, bringing the total to $8.25 for a small cup of pudding and a small cup of frozen yogurt with two toppings. Yum. Totally worth the traffic and lack of parking!
author: Camille T.

description:
I love me some good rice pudding and that's what they got up in Loving Cup.

::Sampled::
Peanut Butter
Toffee

::Result::
A bit too heavy tasting... couldn't really enjoy the fact that it was rice pudding.

::Bought::
Vanilla with "Black Bottom" (home-made ganache on the bottom... I'm a sucker for home-made)

::Result::
Fantastic.  

::Wish::
Wish they had the coconut rice pudding... I'm all about coconut.
author: Dan M.

description:
I was looking for a dessert spot after dinner on Sunday and found Loving Cup on Yelp. When my fiance and I got there around nine o'clock, we were slightly disappointed to see that they had sold out of the Peanut Butter rice pudding, but at least they still had my favorite flavor Pistachio as well as Cookies n' Cream, Vanilla, and Coconut. Pistachio was delicious! I've tried Rice to Riches in NYC, but if given a taste test between the two spots, I would choose Loving Cup. The consistency is much lighter and the portion size is more reasonable than that served at Rice to Riches--a small Rice to Riches is a meal in itself. I also think it's so ridiculous how Rice to Riches serves each order in a heavy duty plastic bowl accompanied by an equally eco-unfriendly lid and spoon.

Extra info: Loving Cup is small and has chairs to seat four near the window and a bench outside. Get there early if you want a full selection of their flavors of rice puddings.
author: Carrie W.

description:
2 stops in one day and i don't even live in sf anymore!

1st stop pre-mani-pedi: 
devoured: fro-yo that tastes just like the girl scout's thin mints...i could eat a tub of that.

2nd stop post mani-pedi:
devoured: vanilla rice pudding.
they have a nice selection of different flavours, this one was almost gone so it seemed to be very popular.

i left with my enviro-friendly spoon and my frequent buyer card in hand (buy 9 get one small free) thinking that at this rate, it's probably better that i don't live here anymore!
author: Anh V.

description:
I just went there this weekend with a friend, who was raving about it. I have yet to find a yogurt place that I like partially due to the fact that living in SLO for 6 years spoiled me with Bali's Yogurt. You really cant go wrong with a 20 cent a quarter pound price, and their variety of toppings and flavors.

For you SLO/Cal Poly people, this place is NOTHING like Bali's. But for the price and what they offer you, this place is amazing!

You start off with Vanilla or Chocolate Yogurt. Want strawberry? No problem! They add in actual strawberries for that flavor. Same goes for Mocha (coffee flavoring). It is really cool how to they do it. You want toppings like cookies or gummy bears? Again no problem, they mix it in for you. And it tastes gooood. 

On top of their yogurt, they have homemade rice pudding. RICE PUDDING! I love rice pudding and the idea of having multiple flavors of rice pudding... well PARTY IN MY MOUTH!

Definitely a good substitute for me and my longing for frozen yogurt. Only complaint I have is I wished they put more gummy bears on my yogurt. But then again I like it packed with toppings.
author: Diana R.

description:
I prefer my own rice pudding but hey, when I'm not in the mood to cook it's some good stuff.  Also, I like that they have a few different types.  The english toffee is pretty good.  The rum raisin is yummy too.  Tried the ganache coating the cup BEFORE the rice pudding was plopped into the cup.  Like it but probably wouldn't do it again.  A little pricey, when you consider what it costs to make your own.  

Cuban coffee was good.  The rice crispy treat with cinnamon was VERY good!  Tasted like a churro.

Groupon got me here.  I'll be back.
author: Heidi T.

description:
I just finished my cup of fro-yo and already, I'm thinking about the next time I get to come back:( I haven't come across any place like Loving Cup where they blend the toppings into the frozen yogurt and the idea is just genius! 

I got the vanilla base with cookie dough and english toffee and it was just heavenly! The girl who made it sure wasn't stingy about the toppings either, thanks! I can't wait to come back already and try more genius concoctions. I'll be sure to try to rice pudding too. My small cup cost about $4.50 total and the portion was just perfect!
author: Connie C.

description: friendly staff & delicious yogurt that is mixed in smoothly and evenly with a machine. i dont even like rice pudding but wow the cinnamon rum raisin rice pudding is so delicious!
author: Sophia T.

description:
3/5 it is what it is.

novelty dessert, not bad. not many places do rice pudding, and it comes in a decent serving size.

i had a poor experience with their service though. when i got to the bar to pay, the girl had such a poor attitude. i guess she hadn't had any lovin in her cup in a while.
author: Alvin D.

description:
OK, I tried the FroYo and loved it!  I had the special of the day, which was Pistachio with Toasted Coconut.  I had no idea that each one was handmade to order in a machine.  There was a little bit of a wait, but it was worth it!  The small serving was large, the yogurt wasn't too sweet, and there was plenty of coconut mixed through it.

I'm sure it wasn't quite as healthy as Tuttimelon, but who cares, right?
author: Kimberly B.

description: Yes....yes.... YES their rice puddings are tasty.... But really overpriced for what you are getting.  Their location where there are plenty of bars around, this place for a quick sugar rush is good... But they nickel and dime you for everything, that the good taste of the pudding went from good to just ok.  And the service, though the ladies were kind - you left feeling like one of the many sheeps, that just got processed and counted in order for them to get your money.   I'll make pudding myself!
author: A. Marie L.

description:
I absolutely love this place. 

Loving up has: 
-rice pudding
-espressos
- frozen yogurt
-smoothies

My favorite part of this place is the rice pudding they have many flavors like:
-English Toffee
-Cookies and Creme
-Creamsicle
-Cinnamon Rum Raisin
-Vanilla
-Coconut
-Pumpkin 
-and many many more delicious ones.

I haven't had any of the frozen yogurt yet but you can mix flavors and topping and they blend/swirl the flavors you want together right in front  of you. It is really cool to watch. i also haven't tried the coffee or smoothies but they look delicious.
