The employees are very nice and willing to explain or let you taste any of the rice pudding. The prices are good as well and the products are pretty healthy. They say their products are local, organic and all natural, I believe it.
author: Jayne A.

description:
Saw this place featured by a local blogger and it reminded me of a yogurt shop I went to in Boston 20 years ago (and apparently never forgot!).  

They have 6 featured rice puddings daily - I tried their rum raisin and pecan praline; both were yummy but not exactly what I was looking for.  I decided to go for the yogurt.

You pick a vanilla or chocolate base, add a fruit, and then add any extra 'toppings' you'd like mixed in.  I went for chocolate with banana and espresso.  Brilliant combination if I say so myself (but ask me again when I'm a jitterbug at 3am).  May not have been my best decision today but it was oh, so worth it!

The folks behind the counter were so down-to-earth and friendly; I could have hung out and chatted with them all night.  

Two thumbs up!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Best frozen yogurt in SF!
A visit to Loving Cup is like a visit to Grandma's House.  The ambiance is cozy, comforting, and adorable and the staff is friendly, attentive, and they make your customized yogurt creation with TLC. 

Their rice pudding is fantastic and a good "healthy option."  It's made of just 6 ingredients-- rice, non-fat milk, egg, sugar, salt, vanilla.
author: Betty Y.

description:
Absolutely utterly great. I have sampled many many frozen yogurt shops around sf and sac, and I think this is the most unique.

Rather then just flavors, this place mixes in your ingredients with either vanilla or chocolate ice cream. This allows for an eclectic mix of flavors, as you can choose from a large variety of various toppings ( nutella, espresso, cookie dough, sprinkles, ect 26 in all). The only potential downside of this is that if you pick a poor flavor combination, there is nothing to save you ahead of time because its completely up to you to figure it out. So the rating of this place probably can sway a bunch because if you order an odd combo then it could suck. 

As far as the place itself, it was simple and clean, very inviting. Additionally, the staff is very friendly.  Finally, the serving sizes are very generous. Excellent. 

Highly recommended.
author: Tom O.

description: I had never before found a place that sold rice pudding!  I love it!  They have so many flavors.  It's a great treat.  The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is because they don't actually make their own rice pudding!!!  You would think a place that specializes in rice pudding would make it from scratch.  They buy it from the store and then add flavors to it.  I still really like it so that hasn't stopped me from going.
author: Dulce F.

description:
YUUUUUUM!! Spoon-licking good!
I had the vanilla with coconut, pineapple, and granola! I think they should have that combo as a permanent flavor and call it, The Christina.
The flavors and texture worked so well. I'm sad I did not get to have another cup before I left. I would come back to SF just for this.
author: Christina P.

description: I have been meaning to write a review for this place ever since I visited it by accident last November.  We were waiting for our reservation at La Folie and our group was haaaangry.  We noticed this little place open next door and decided to try it.  I love rice pudding and my husband loves yogurt.  We were not disappointed.  The rice pudding is delicious and their frozen yogurt is even better.  i'm not sure what machines they use but you get a vanilla or chocolate yogurt base and then you choose your mix-ins from there.  I went with a chocolate base with almond butter and almonds.  It was divine.  My husband went with a vanilla base with junior mints and toffee.  I was a little skeptical of his combination but it was tasty.  I just love how their little machine whips everything up and distributes it evenly within the yogurt.  This isn't like Cold Stone or other ice cream mix-in places where they mix it in by hand on a marble stone.  This little gadget really gets things 'ground' up so to say and mixed into your yogurt.  I will probably try and make a trip out to this place every time I am in the San Francisco area.  Please come to Colorado!
author: Lea B.

description: I've had this place in my Yelp bookmarks since 2009 but haven't felt the urgency to try it until after trying rice pudding in Portland, I wanted to come here and try theirs.  It was sooo hard to find parking, we drove around for a good 20 minutes before the hubby kicked me out of the car and told me to just go in to grab it to-go.  I went in and saw that there was only a few flavors... Coconut, Pistachio, Espresso, Rum Raisin and they had JUST ran out of Vanilla because the girl infront of me got the last scoop.  I opted for Coconut and Espresso.  Both were pretty tasty but they just weren't as good as the ones we had tasted in Portland.  They also serve froyo here and you can have toppings mixed into your froyo.  It's a cute little store but you can't really sit in there to eat your pudding.  Just a few stools infront of the window and a bench right outside.  We ate ours in the car after the hubby found parking as I walked out of the door.  The sizes are pretty big.  I got two smalls ($3.75 each)  and they were totally more than enough.  I think one small would've been good.  I don't know if you can mix flavors in one cup, but that would be a good idea if you could!
author: Kymberli C.

description:
5 stars for vanilla frozen yogurt with nutella and pistachios...  love it.. 
Make sure you got cash..
author: Y K.

description: I love their yogurt, perfect softness and sweetness and not too tart!  Endless possibilities with the wide selection of toppings!!!  :D
author: Mandy C.

description:
Hi, I'm Shelly and I'm addicted to Loving Cup's rice pudding.  Until about a month ago I'd never had rice pudding and had never been to the Loving Cup.  All that changed when I walked by there with a visiting friend who loved rice pudding.  He bought the vanilla and let me try it.  If he weren't in Australia now I would punch him.  Hard.  

I crave the stuff constantly now.  I've filled up a frequent buyer card in less than a week.  If I drive by and there's an open meter I take it as a sign I'm supposed to go in.  Oh Loving Cup, what glorious nirvana you serve.  See you tomorrow.
author: Shelly R.

description: YUM! This place is like a cold stone but for froyo and rice pudding. You can choose a base for either and then they'll mix in toppings. The rice pudding is really good. It taste fresh and has a great consistency. They have a ton of flavors like vanilla bean, cinnamon rum raisin, espresso, pumpkin pie, etc. Last time I was there I got the nutella and added in oreo crumbles. It was so delicious I got mad when my hubby took it upon himself to offer some of MY rice pudding for a friend to try. I can't wait to go back to try another flavor.
author: Alice J.

description:
The coconut rice pudding is definitely deserving of its spot on 7x7's 50 Treats to Eat Before You Die list. Such a simple dessert yet oh so "loving"ly delicious. It's just like a favorite homemade dessert that your mom makes and just speaks to the soul with its creaminess and toasted coconut bits. So good in fact that after finishing round 1 of pudding off I went back for a round 2 to take home...I mean this stuff is sort of healthy and good for your right? At least that's what I tell myself. On a side note, pretty ironic that this place is right next door to Crunch Fitness...what better way to finish off a workout then with "non-fat" fro-yo with oreo cookies, toffee bits, nutella, and sprinkles.

Not as in love with the fro-yo, blueberries + nutella = blah. But the whole concept is definitely cool and there something almost hypnotizing about watching the fro-yo get blended with the various mix-ins...the show alone was almost worth the price. 

I will definitely be back for more pudding and another fro-yo attempt.
author: David H.

description:
Charming.  Unique.  Quaint

it's cute
it's tasty
it's healthy (er than ice cream!)
it's 3.75 a cup (with one swirl in)

seats 4
earth friendly
great place to stop in on a romantic stroll down polk!

ps - the guy and gal working behind the counter are totally into each other....just SAYIN!  :)
author: Jane L.

description: So it's good rice pudding, it really is. It only receives three stars because Rice to Riches in NYC is better, and I wish they had more flavors. Other than that there was a nice balance between pudding and rice. Each kernel of rice was cooked perfectly. I had the cookies 'n cream which wasn't too sweet and full of flavor. Definitely would repeat if I got the craving again.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
My cousin made a rice pudding for Thanksgiving once, and I tried my best to be...well, polite.

Loving Cup definitely makes the rice pudding loads better.  I can see why the coconut rice pudding is on the 7x7, but hey, let's face it.  I'm just not a huge fan of the stuff.

Whenever friends want to grab some Loving Cup, I usually just grab the vanilla+toffee or the pumpkin spice, but it's not something I'd ever crave.

4 Stars for being a solid dessert joint and -1 for the extremely slow moving lines.
author: Nick W.

description:
I grabbed the Living Social coupon for this place a long time ago and finally made it here last week after using a Restaurant.com coupon at Sushi Rock (I'm being frugal after the holidays, in case you can't tell). 

Based on the Yelp review hype, I went with the rice pudding. They let me try quite a few of the flavors... the Madagascar Vanilla did not have any vanilla beans in it, and was a very very mild vanilla flavor. The Cinnamon Rum Raisin didn't taste like a cohesive flavor, so I decided to go with the Coconut and Pumpkin Pie. Both were tasty (but not in the blow-your-mind kind of way), and I have to say that the $4.25 Medium size was WAY too much. My friend Nikki tried the blend in Vanilla with Junior Mint - it was yummy and I liked the completely smashed mints, but it was all together pretty standard for FroYo.

Basically if you're in the hood and have a sweets craving, check it out. Otherwise, definitely not worth a trip.

Food: 3 stars
Value: 3 stars
Service: 4 stars
Ambiance: 3 stars
author: Shannon B.

description: I don't even like frozen yogurt usually, but I have to get a cup of this whenever I am in Russian Hill! I highly recommend adding Nutella for the creamiest treat on the planet. Yum!
author: Milla C.

description:
Rice pudding isn't the first thing I think about when it comes to satisfying my sweet tooth, but this place is amazing and the folks that work at the counter are so friendly and nice.

I admit, I am rather frugal at times and want great deals. I bought the $5 Loving Cup coupon from Living Social for $10 worth of desserts/drinks at this place. It was a bit out of the way in terms of my normal day to day, but the coupon instigated me to visit Loving Cup which is located along the end of the Polk corridor closer and within walking distance from the Marina. 

I sampled (without any evil eyes from any employees) two flavors before I picked out which rice pudding I want. They even offered to help me "maximize" my $10 worth there. I left with a vanilla rice pudding which was quite tasty and not too sweet and a mocha smoothie that left me wired for several hours that night (you can love or hate that but if you are a caffeine seeking fan, you'd quite appreciate this extra layer of spice to your drink compared to typical "frap" like smoothies). 

Transportation wise, I took the MUNI 19, but this place is literally across the street from MUNI 45. Also near lines like the MUNI 30 and MUNI 49. 

Tip: Get a carry out bag from them. Otherwise, MUNI will not let you on with it.

Great rice pudding and excellent customer service. I'd come back for more. Small seating space in the front of the store.

I wish it took credit card, but this place is CASH ONLY.
author: Tina C.

description:
Normally it annoys me when businesses do not take credit cards, but for loving cup, I DO NOT CARE! 

i don't care if it takes me hours to scour my purse to find all pennies, dimes, nickels, foreign change, I'm completely addicted.

only complaint -- you definitely need a medium frozen yogurt because it's very hollow on the inside.
author: Ellie W.

description:
Three words: Chocolate + Nutella + Banana


Two More: Bring. Cash.
author: Samantha S.

description:
My friend had his heart set on Tuttimelon after eating a nice hearty bowl of wonton soup at Tai Chi.  I had my heart set on Loving Cup, and since it was just another block and a half down, I told him that I would be walking down there, and he could either come with me, or stay at Tuttimelon to wait for me to come back with my rice pudding.  He came along.

Once inside, it was like sensory overload all over again.  All those flavors of rice pudding (that day, it was pumpkin pie, lemon & vanilla, coconut, vanilla and chocolate), yogurt and mix-ins, and smoothies made us want to order everything.  He decided on the "flavor of the day" froyo, which was vanilla froyo mixed with berries and granola.  They mix in this machine it in front of you to create a better-than-Coldstone-by-a-million-miles frozen concoction, and even though I'm not a granola fan, his mixture was really good.

I tried the Lemon & Vanilla rice pudding and fell in love.  My friend told me that the coconut was 10x better, but I'd just had coconut froyo at Tuttimelon a few weeks ago and wanted something different.  Two medium cups of dessert and $9.25 after, we were satisfied, and walked back up Polk Street with our yummies.

As always, the gals were super nice and helpful in explaining the different stuff and  helping us decide what to order, since that always seems to be a problem for me.  Next time, when I have on a warmer jacket, I'll opt for the froyo!
author: Tori S.

description:
There are some perfectly cute shops that feel familiar...like they've always been around the corner from your perfectly cute home. Loving Cup is one of them. This is why it gets the honor of being my first Yelp review. (cheers!)

Loving Cup serves mainly yogurt and rice pudding to match its pastel colored interior. It has some overpriced baked goods...but I won't make a big deal about that now. The important thing here is that the rice pudding is amazing! It really is. With six or so flavors a day, vanilla is the staple. The rest are wonderfully yummy. 

Parking can be a nightmare, making it the kind of place you want to walk into by chance. The place is cash only, another thing to be prepared for. 

Loving Cup, with it's modest goals, needs to just happen to you. When it does, I recommend getting a small coconut flavored rice pudding cup, making use of tax money by sitting on the bench outside and watching life on Polk St. pass you by. 

15 minutes well spent :)
author: Mercedes D.

description:
YUMMERS! 
Mr. V and I stopped by while we were out and about during one of our neighborhood strolls. Such a lovely place. Very clean, great counter service and they are a VIV (http://www.doyouviv.com/how-it-works/) participating business. You can't go wrong with any of the treats here. Lots of great hand blended froyo options. But, the true standout was the rice pudding. Thick and creamy deliciousness. . .
author: Kia B.

description:
That place is just darling, I know. But beyond cutesy typography and subtle yuppie design frills, is it really that amazing?

I understand the somewhat novel concept of almost exclusively serving rice pudding (gasp!) as dessert, and monopolize on that. But really, if you just forget the rice pudding part for a second, I cannot see how Loving cup is superior to any other gelato/ fro-yo/ creamery out there. 

Their flavor selection isn't spectacular. Their treats are good, but they didn't rock my world by any means, and I could name a number of other places that have impressed me much more, and -- can I just say this -- for less than $15 friggin' dollars. 

While I do appreciate the aesthetic appeal, I see no point in, essentially, paying for admiration of the interior with some mediocre rice pudding as a bonus.
author: Katia I.

description:
Where to start.... I KNOW! That friggin crazy drill that was ripped off Big Daddy's arm!  Pick your flavor of froyo + your random ingredients and toss it in and unleash the drill on it... TWICE! 

Result is a perfectly blended mix of amazing flavor and crunchiness.  I've always hated eating froyo and running out of the toppings, but you will never have that problem with this perfect mixture.  

The rice pudding is the best I've had.  Sample every single flavor! The rice pudding connoisseurs will gladly help you.  Coconut is my favorite! 

Eat everything they have here!
author: Max L.

description: I just moved to the city and am so in love with Loving Cup! They have the greatest employees and such delicious frozen yogurt! Everyone must try it in the city!
author: Heather D.

description:
. I was walking on Polk with a few friends and we were debating between froyo, ice cream, and pudding to satisfy our sweet teeth after breakfast. Since I was the only one who had never been to Loving Cup, we decided to have me experience it first-hand. Good to note that pudding is never something I've sought out specifically but at the same time I've never turned it away if it was offered to me

Out of the 5 or 6 flavors of the day, I chose a small sized cup with half coconut and half almond butter. I also sampled the vanilla. The small is actually quite large cause I was barely able to finish half of it.

The coconut was very tasty and had lots of strands of shaved coconut. The almond flavor was coated with fresh almond butter swirls (very creamy) on top. I also tried some of my friend's frozen yogurt but it was definitely the thickest yogurt I've ever had; almost an ice cream consistency.

Overall very tasty and I may stop by again if I'm in the area. PS- Cash only
author: Farhad M.

description:
I love custom anything, especially food and desserts as I can never seem to be able to find something I want on the menu. I'm that annoying person that has to tweak with everything, I'm anal, and I'm a perfectionist. Take those comments as you may.

Loving Cup has diversity, creativity, and is down right amazing on taste. Their rice pudding is fantastic. It's creamy, dense, and extremely flavorful. I felt downright wrong eating the rum raisin while driving, I was worried with that intense rum flavoring that I would be pulled over and written a ticket for enjoyment, and intoxification. 

If rice pudding isn't your thing (and this is one of the main reasons we aren't friends then) and yogurt is more your style, try their custom blended yogurts. Frozen fabulous yogurt is hand blended with a choice of your favorite nuts, fruits, or chocolates and goodies. It's way better than Cold Stone, and much better in  my eyes to support the "little" people like Loving Cup. 

The first time we went there was right after a frightfully disgusting and overpriced meal at Rex across the street, but Loving Cup soothed my broken wallet and heart right away.
author: Danielle S.

description:
loving cup's off white ambience is so soothing. they  offered a blending of either organic vanilla or chocolate  base  yogurt with a choice from frozen frutis or dry ingredients.  their version taste better than penquino's or yogen fruz. (is this because their yogurt is sweeter?)

blending ingredients"
-fruits(bananae, blueberry, mango, strawberry, pineapple, raspberry, coconut, peach,  all frozen)
-dry(15 kinds):nutella, peanut butter, oreos, gummi bears, pistachio etc.

pricing: (s) 2.75 (m) 3.75 (l) 4.75 no tax

menu: expresso, rice pudding, organic yogurt,

frodrips
-few chairs inside, a bench outside
-blend had an hole in th middle, not all yogurt mixed. some vanilla remained
-blueberry wasn't distinquishable, sweet taste was.
-parking avaialable on incline on sidestreet.
-loving cup claims yogurt is organic.  blending ingredients' status uncertain
-climbing up the hill (to my car) good aerobics.
author: Victor G.

description:
Rice pudding is good.

Frozen yogurt, even better!

Cookie Monster frozen yogurt = YUM YUM YUM!
author: Jay C.

description:
HOLY CRAP AND A HALF.... PUMPKIN SPICE RICE PUDDING!

nuff said!

yes....it was amazing.  also tried the vanilla bean.....meh, just ok.   but seriously......pumpkin spice is TO DIE FOR

oh yeah....get a small....big portions.  and yes, you can some how figure out how to drive and eat this while holding the cup with one hand, other hand on steering wheel as you drive down van ness, eating with your face, and hoping to holy hell that you don't have to stomp on the break and end up with rice pudding all over your face!
author: Q L.

description:
Hell the f' yeah! This place was introduced to me by what I would consider a connoisseur of fine foods! The Madagascar Vanilla rice pudding was out of this world kind of good. Sweet, creamy, and with the perfect consistency. I love how you can actually taste real vanilla and not that wretched imitation stuff! 
Such a cute little sweet shop that serves great dessert treats! Eating a cup of pudding and a Kara's cupcake while in bed is not a bad way to end a night! Crumbs be damned!
author: Stacy T.

description: Loving Cup has been a continuous hit in Russian Hill ever since it opened.  Although famous for their rice pudding, I go there more for their smoothies and frozen yogurt.  The smoothies are either pure fruit or a more creamy form with milk/froyo added.  I tend to get the former - they are delicious and I feel detoxed after drinking down bananas, strawberries, oranges, etc with no added syrups or sugars.  They cost $4.50-$4.75  The frozen yogurt is also delicious - they use the Cold Stone style where you can add your mix-ins (but the mix-ins are much better quality than at Cold Stone), and the froyo itself is delicious.  The interior is very 1960s with interesting cut-out artwork on the walls.   You can also participate in Stampt (smart phone app) to make sure you get credited for all of your purchases there.
author: Naomi P.

description:
I was skeptical when my friend mentioned rice pudding for dessert. I'd never really had rice pudding, but we split a half/half of pistachio and coconut rice pudding... which was delish. Pistachio was a little more overpowering than I'd hoped, but coconut was just as amazing as you'd think it be!
We also split a vanilla froyo with nutella and strawberry mix-ins. They grind it up and swirl it together, so this isn't your typical yogurt-with-toppings-dumped-on-top deal. Some of the best froyo I've had. (: My friend commented that parts of it tasted more like strawberry and some more like nutella.
They also have stamp cards (9 purchases to get 1 free small).
Both rice pudding and froyo are the same price at $4.50 for a small, which is more than enough. Kinda pricey, but pretty worth it.
Btw, loveee the decor and graphic design of the place. So quaint & vintage!
author: Jen T.

description:
Bit spendy for what it is.  I had a bit of the "Madagascar Vanilla" rice pudding, it was fine, but not the mind blowing concoction that you would expect for $5.  I suspect it was nilla extract.

Service was friendly, however I can't see what people are raving about.
author: Chris C.

description: My neighborhood, North Beach, is overrun with gelato (#firstworldproblems), so it's such a nice treat to go over the hill for some rice pudding! They always have multiple flavors, and they let you combine flavors into one cup. I've had the coconut, rum raisin, a nut version (pistachio?),  and vanilla--all deliciously creamy and not overly sweetened. However, as many people point out, it's very rich, and even the smallest size is very filling. Perfect end to a weekend afternoon: get a cup of coffee, sit outside on the bench, and share a rice pudding with a friend. (And then walk up and over hill again and pretend you burned off all the calories).
author: Alison S.

description: Ridiculous long line this Sunday evening and we can see why.  Very creamy gelato almost like ice cream.  We got vanilla base, peach flavor and pecans. Yums!  We are a fan and got a size medium which cost us $5.50.  It is pricey but supposedly organic so I guess the reason of the steep price.
author: Eating And Living Well U.

description:
Like the Rolling Stones' song, this Loving Cup is great time and time again.  

If you like chocolate, I think it's best to start with a vanilla base and add nutella.
author: Daniel H.

description:
3.5 stars

I have always been a sucker for aesthetics and I am newly a sucker for frozen yogurt. Loving Cup is a nice change of pace from all the fluorescent-white-original-tart frozen yogurt places popping up all over this city. Loving Cup's vibe is a little cozier (even though there's not much seating).

I know that rice pudding is there big thing, and hopefully I will be back soon to try it. I had frozen yogurt with fruit and coconut blended in and everything was just right. No one flavor overwhelmed the other and the fruit was nice and fresh.

Service was kind of blah. Maybe it was just a combination of the heat and it getting toward the end of the day? It wouldn't have killed the dear girl to smile a little!
author: Deborah H.

description:
I've never tried rice pudding before, but knowing what the texture of rice pudding is like definitely kept me away from it. My friend really wanted to try this place and I saw they also sold frozen yogurt so I thought I'd just grab that.

This Loving Cup had 5 flavors -- The Madagascar Vanilla Bean, Cinnamon Rum Raisin, Coconut, Mocha, and Cookies & Cream. We were able to sample so I thought i'd give rice pudding a try. I only sampled one flavor -- the mocha. It was actually pretty good! I stood there debating on whether I wanted a whole cup of rice pudding or if I should take the safe route and get some yogurt.

I caved and got a small cup of the mocha rice pudding. They really pack it in! The small was definitely more than enough. I barely put a dent in my cup and I was super full. My friends and I asked for caps so we can save it for later. I think they need to offer a smaller size because in my opinion, the small was pretty big for a small.

I'm glad I gave rice pudding a shot though! I'd consider coming back.
author: Justine O.

description:
Hype, thou art a cruel mistress.

I don't like to venture across the bridge too much, but I do love me some rice pudding!  Don't get me wrong, if I'm in the neighborhood I will stop by, but it's definitely not worth a toll.  

Flavors available at the time were: coconut, rum raisin, plain, orange creamsicle..... and that's all I remember.  They also serve frozen yogurt, but that's not what I was there for. 
I went with the rum raisin. The taste was right on, but the texture was kind of thick like custard that had been refrigerated a little bit too long. 

Nice people behind the counter, but I'll keep looking for more local rice puddingeries.
author: Gabriel T.

description: The staff can be either super sweet or super surly. Who cares...the ice cream is too good you won't care who hands it to you.
author: Heather B.

description:
Tutti Melon is closer to my house but I would walk the extra three blocks to Loving Cup any day! I mean hello, they BLEND your topping choice into your fro yo with this special machine. The girls working are also really nice, I get the feeling if you came in multiple times in one day they wouldn't judge you at all.
The only reason its not five stars is because its a little pricey. But its probably better that I can't afford it every day...
author: Kenzie P.

description:
I was not sold on this place after walking by several times. It seemed too organic/healthy/smart to be tasty.

Wrong.

Freaking delicious, I've been back several times with friends. It's so fun picking out all of your toppings and watching them make your dish. And it's really nice knowing that they use high quality ingredients. Every time I've gone, our whole party has walked away totally satisfied and trying each other's desserts. Not too pricey, considering how much you get, too. Very solid place, they've won me over for sure.
author: Nick B.

description: Very delicious freshly made frozen yogurt. They have other things on the menu which I am sure you can read about in all of these other reviews but I went for the frozen yogurt. They have many different toppings that they mix into your yogurt. I was very pleased with this place. Definitely going to go back.
author: Diego L.

description: Im not so into the ice cream but the rice pudding is great ! Try the cookies and cream it's amazing. Good service, always nice   people.
author: Valeria D.

description: I had been wanting to try this place for a while and finally got to go. The one other time we did was during Christmas and they were closed. I got the vanilla yogurt mixed with strawberries and it was DELICIOUS. I really like the fact that it is fresh and also nothing else is added. It was the right amount of sweetness and not overly sweet at all. I try to be carb free but I did try the Raisin Rum RIce Pudding which was also delicious. I am def going back for more yogurt and sampling.
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
Once upon a time ago...3 years ago actually, wow time flies!  I was in New York, tried "Rice to Riches" and was completely turned off to the idea of rice pudding.  Overpriced mush, as I recall.

Here I am on Polk, and I decide to try it again.  To my delight it was delicious!  I stand corrected!  Loving Cup has reformed my approach to rice pudding and each kind is uniquely flavorful.  

I am not, however, a fan of the yogurt here because it is so so heavy...almost like ice cream.  The taste itself is just fine, but if I want something that heavy, I might as well go get ice cream.  

Those mini red velvet cupcakes are also a delight.  

In conclusion when it comes to Loving Cup...Yay! I'm a fan.
author: Sarah Z.

description: Went into the Loving Cup for the first time yesterday, since my hubby and I were craving a sweet treat. Our pup was with us and there is a bench outside, so we decided to go for it. I must admit, we have walked past it before thinking, "how good can rice pudding and frozen yogurt be," but I am sorry we did! What makes the LC different from all the other froyo shops is, you pick a base (chocolate or vanilla) then add as many flavors as you'd like, and they puree it for you. They also serve hot beverages. Anyway, the rice pudding is a great alternative to a heavy and rich dessert. It was light with the right about of sweetness and very satisfying. The best part about it is, you can add delicious flavors to it, such as: pecans, pretzels, fruits, etc. We tried it with pecans and it was great. We also indulged in a vanilla base, with nutella and pistachios. How amazing does that sound?! IT WAS! I'll definitely return to the Loving Cup if I'm walking down Polk and craving a sweet treat.
author: Kelsey K.

description:
the frozen yogurt is the best in the city-- the whole technique, ingredient variety, etc,., makes for a unique taste far beyond what you have ever had when it comes to frozen yogurt.  

i started coming here when the store first opened.  now the crowd is often unmanageable, and some of the staff are incredibly annoying-- please stop saying "amaaaazing".  speaking of which, in a crowded store, customers need to get their order straight ahead of time to cut the delay.  i believe they only have one yogurt mixer apparatus, so that really hurts the throughput.  overall, issues in service has diminished the overall experience.   where we would have easily stopped by several times a month, we may visit 4-6 times a year.
author: eshwar k.

description:
My friend and I decided to give Loving Cup a try because Icebee was closed...and I'm SO glad we did! The frozen yogurt was delicious, and the staff was very welcoming and patient even though it was almost closing time.

I got the strawberry and banana vanilla frozen yogurt, which not only satisfied my sweet tooth but was refreshing and healthy as well. It was also perfectly mixed, so the flavors were very well balanced right to the very last spoonful My friend got the Nutella and walnut vanilla frozen yogurt, which I can only describe as sinfully delicious. It tasted like a really amazing candy bar in frozen yogurt form. I'm DEFINITELY getting that when I go back.

We also tried the hot apple cider. I live in Wisconsin, and our fall drink of choice is always apple cider. You find it everywhere that time of year, so I've had my share, but none of the cider I've ever had came close to this. It was fresh and even had little bits of apple in it. I will definitely be getting this again.

Overall, I was VERY impressed with Loving Cup, and I definitely recommend it to anyone looking to get their frozen yogurt fix.
author: LeeAnn L.

description: Omg!!!! Rum raisin rice pudding!!! Yummy!!!! Service is quick and efficient.
author: Kat N.

description:
I had the lemon and coconut rice pudding. The coconut was delicious with chunks of coconut in it. The lemon was light with just the perfect hint of lemon. 

A small is more than enough to satisfy your craving for something sweet.
author: Kamalpreet K.

description:
If you like rice pudding you will love this place. They had many flavors of which I tried the vanilla, rum raisin, orangesicle, and coconut. Maybe its my boring personality, but I liked the vanilla the best. I would advise getting a small just because, as you will learn, rice pudding is filling. If you're not really a fan of rice pudding, they've got you covered. They have amazing frozen yogurt. My friend ordered a berry yogurt which was amazing. They literally have a special machine that churns together the berries into the yogurt which was amazing!

Street parking only (this is Russian Hill) and they only accept cash.
author: John W.

description:
I just gotta say, I gotta lotta love for you, Loving Cup! 

After reading an article on the Daily Candy, I couldn't wait to check out this unusual dessert spot. My first visit was on both a holiday weekend and a hot day which accounted for the crowd of people hovering in the doorway. Loving Cup is a small shop that feels like a mix between a cottage kitchen and an art gallery. They individually swirl the non-fat fro-yo for each order. But, it's the work of only one machine, so it's one fro-yo at a time. After the rush of people cleared out, I got my first cup of Lovin' which was totally worth the wait. I prefer my yogurt to be a bit more tart and a little less icy, but I still enjoyed my cup nonetheless. I also like that they use real frozen fruit. 

My next weekday visit, I found rockstar parking right in front, and there was no wait at all. Let me tell you--if you were to taste their rice pudding blindfolded you would never guess that it was made from non-fat milk! It's the perfect blend of sweetness and creamy fluffy rice, just enough to trick the most diet-conscious dessert seeker. A few awesome flavors: coconut, rum raisin and key lime.

2 stars are just for their support of The Arts and their effort to encourage customers to be environmentally responsible. I visited them twice in a week and they had already rotated their featured artwork. Kudos for serving desserts with compostable spoons in paper cups! They also have bins for recyclables and compostables, which are neatly disguised in a cottage style oak cabinet. The signage needs to be a bit more prominently displayed for customers' ease of use, but hey--way to be forward thinking!

I do wish they could make some non-dairy options, which I was told is in the works. Until then, I'll just pop a milk pill cuz this pudding is dee-lish!
author: Kira R.

description: This place is fun! Try the delicious rice pudding or choose a fro yo base and watch as they mix in your favorite toppings kind of like a much more gourmet version of a McFlurry. The best flavor is vanilla base with raspberry and nutella.
author: Alicia D.

description:
A word of warning, the frozen yogurt was not the tart-yogurt experience that I had naively expected.  The yogurt ended up being pretty much like a good quality ice cream - firm and dense.  That being said, it was pretty darned tasty.  You go in, pick your frozen yogurt base and the flavor you want added.  They scoop the hard-packed yogurt into a machine that looks like a drill press, toss in the topping of choice, then press it all through the machine a few times in order to mix the topping in evenly.

For people who don't want to trek to the north end of the city to try them out, they also just opened a shop down in Mission Bay.
author: Kaman C.

description: A friend and I came here and tried the strawberry vanilla froyo with granola blended in.  A small was actually enough for both of us to share!  It was really good and the fact that they blend in ingredients actually makes a huge difference.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Christopher L.

description:
I went to heaven and died...and then un-died just to have another bite of my super yummydeliciouslyscrumptiouslycreamy serving of frozen yogurt. I'm a frozen yogurt-devouring machine--although being mildly lactose-intolerant does sometimes put a halt on my froyo-devouring abilities...I digress.

My close friend introduced me to this place and I'm in looooooooooove! The only sad part about it is: I live too far away and I'm too cheap to spend $5 everyday on frozen yogurt. ): So for now, I'll just... dream about the next time I come back to this place. 

Now, when my friend told me that we were commuting THAT far just for frozen yogurt, I thought she was insane...because seriously, we were in downtown and there were a handful of frozen yogurt places in the vicinity (Yocup, Pinkberry, Tuttimelon, Yoppi Yogurt, etc). All of these places pale in comparison. 

So there we are, sitting on the 27 Muni, riding to Polk just for froyo. We all know the sketchy reputation Muni has--or maybe it's the sketchy people that ride the Muni that give it such a reputation--so was the yogurt worth it? YES. 

I ordered a small vanilla-based frozen yogurt with peaches, mangoes and blueberries. The fruits were frozen, but it's okay! It tasted like the best smoothie ever and I say this because they blend whatever toppings you choose in a fancy machine with the vanilla or chocolate froyo base that you choose and BAYUM: your froyo. There's also the option of 1/2 vanilla, 1/2 chocolate. They pump it out into one big mountainous swirl, which my friend called a "delicious poopie."  Beware, the small is way bigger than a "small," so I guess it is worth the $5. They charge for any additional toppings after the first, so choose wisely! They also charge you if you decide to eat inside...

The place is spotless and very cute! The frozen yogurt is rich and creamy, and they have a variety of fruits, nuts, and sweets (nutella, gummybears, etc) that you can blend into the froyo base of your choosing. Prices can get a little steep, as they aren't at all like those $.45/oz, watered down frozen yogurt franchises, but the couple extra dollars definitely shows in quality of the product. 

There are also lemonades, and rice puddings and other sweets. You can ask to sample the rice puddings too, and might I say, the coconut rice pudding is divine! 

I'm only giving this 4-stars because the young lady working the counter seemed like she didn't want to be there. Maybe it was just an off day. She was nice, nonetheless--quiet, but nice. She also may need to learn some food safety and sanitation procedures because she not only touched her phone multiple times, but she also touched her face/fixed her hair without washing her hands and making our food/catering to other customers. 

Loving Cup on a sunny, yet breezy San Francisco day: PERFECT.  

Delicious poopie, I will be back for you.
author: Rebecca N.

description:
I'm having a love affair with Loving Cup. 400 miles away, and I still dream of it. I've just not had any ice cream that fresh before. It's a freaking puck of cream from a dairy drilled and mixed with whatever your little heart desires! And Nutella. Especially Nutella.

F I'm salivating. The place is cute, too. It looks like it could be someone's really bright, strangely decorated living room. There are a few seats inside to enjoy your tasty treat in any weather, or a bench outside for a nice day. Parking sucks, but hey, it's the city!
author: Cindy N.

description:
I don't typically latch on to fads, so I am pretty out of touch with what are the best frozen yogurt places in town. I was cruising around my neighborhood on a hot day, though, and discovered The Loving Cup. I've had a couple of flavors and like that they blend them into the yogurt. 

Mmmm--blueberry with granola! The flavors of the day look good too, but a little sugary for my taste. Oh, and this does not seem to be the tangy kind that everyone talks about. 

I like the atmosphere: it's just what a neighborhood sweet shop should be!

I'll have to try the pudding at some point, but for now I'm kind of digging exploring the yogurt.
author: N B.

description: It was good, but not at all noteworthy. The woman taking our orders was somewhat impatient and then left quite a lot of our blended yogurt in the machine, taking the cups away when they were only partially filled. Result:  Pricey, unspectacular, unfriendly- we'll be going elsewhere.
author: giselle s.

description:
This place is pretty amazing! Boyfriend got  the rum raisin pudding with a smear of the most rich chocolaty goodness ganache on top EVER! And then he got me the toasted coconut... it was crunchy, delicious and sooo fresh. Boyfriend said he got to "taste" the Key Lime Pie flavor, and said it was a-m-a-z-i-n-g.

We both got a small, the small is so huge that I worked on it for the next three days and didn't even finish it all! WHEW!!! Rice pudding OVERLOAD (but in a good way!)

Only reason I am knocking off one star is because it's cash only, and common lets face it...it's 2010...... time to get a debit machine Loving Cup!
author: Erin K.

description:
I'm writing a review based on two parts:  Customer Service and The Yogurt/Rice Pudding.  I went on 7/11/12 around 9:30 pm

First of all, I love food and have been to many dessert places across DC, NYC, LA, and most of the major cities and definitely understand what is out there.  I've done Napa food: French Laundry, Ad Hoc, and Jose Andres's food in DC and LA as well as sampling fair share of desserts and yogurts.  Take it as you will.  

Customer Service:
I'm generally not a hard person to please.  As an example, I'm not a person who writes a review based on whether or not the waiter comes over and refills water or doesn't get the check right.  To some extent, there's simply miscommunication and misunderstanding. 

This experience was, however, was TOTALLY different.  If you see the woman with glasses on who's hair is bleach blonde and in a pony tail, this is who I'm referring too.  I was with a friend and I ordered my ice as usual.  I'm coming from D.C. and of course, she took me to a nice place such as this.  Well, my friend all of a sudden snuck in front of me and paid for my icecream and gave the lady the credit card.  I was of course shocked that she did this because I'm staying at her place so I wanted to pay for her dessert at the very least.  So I tried to hand over my card to the cashier lady and even a straight 10.00 bill (because that's how much it costed) but she never took it because of course the decision was already made (even though she had trouble swiping and fumbling with the card that was given.).  I was being insistant that I should pay for about 5 secs but my friend declined and nudged me in kindness.  So then I said to the cashier later, "Ahh you're suppose to take the GUY's card!"  in jest.  I suppose she didn't see it as an act of kindess and me joking around with her.  She replied back in a RUDE and Disrespectful tone: 

"DON'T TELL ME WHO'S CARD TO TAKE!  YOU'RE SUPPOSE TO FIGURE THAT OUT WHEN YOU GET HERE."

"WOW!" I was thinking in my mind.  I really wanted to say, "excuse me? can you be a little light-hearted and laugh?  Or maybe say "Sorry" with a smile?'  I kept on thinking "WOW!"

So look, she can write a review back and say, "there's a line and I had to get things done quickly."  Look that's no excuse to treat a customer or even talk to someone disrespectfully to someone.  I'm sorry but perhaps you as a business owner should look into pleasing your customers first and maybe buying a second icecream mixer?

So of course, I left it alone and went an ate my icecream in sole disappointment all because of customer experience.  WORST I've ever been treated.  I had waiters miss water, the bill, food orders, and taking a while, but never had they ever talked to me in a disrespectful tone and manner.  Honestly, I'm not hard to please.  

Now for the Food Review:

Rice pudding is good, but if you've been to Rice to Riches in NYC, they're even better.  

Nothing really THAT special about the yogurt.  They simply just mix it with toppings and such much like you would get at cold stone or marble slap.  So what if it's evenly mixed.  I'd be much happier getting something as simple as Pinkberry or Red Mango.
Or should I even dare say, McDonald's McFlurry?  Look, alot of this is also the fact that it's in San Francisco and it's in a little cutesy neighborhood with nothing else around.  Great cute store, but honestly if you really think about the way they made the icecream and their ingredients, nothing really special.

All and all, horrible customer service, all because I was trying to be friendly and pay for my friend and the cashier couldn't take a joke.  Yogurt and Rice pudding...there's better and it's really the "cutesyness" of it all.
author: Gary T.

description: I love this place. Coconut rice pudding is my favorite. The peach fro yo smoothie is oh so good.
author: Monika M.

description:
Not too much of a rice pudding person, but this place offers great pudding and delicious, unique flavors. 

I've tried: 
-rum raisin--tasted just the way you imagine; slightly cinnamon-y, hint of rum and raisin sweetness.
-coconut-- not my favorite, but light and not too sweet.
-almond butter-- thicker in consistency than others; great, modest almond flavor.
-chocolate chip-- can never go wrong with anything chocolate.

A classic treat (pudding) with an interesting ingredient (rice). I'd like to try their froyo next time!
author: Karen W.

description:
I went here, after hearing my friends rave about their Rice pudding, and I am a big fan of rice pudding!

It defintely did not disappoint.  it was like a piece of heaven! I got a smal, Black Bottom with Madagascar vanilla rice pudding.  The rice pudding was good, but what really out me over hte edge was the black bottom.  they coat the bottom and the side of you cup with homemade chocolate ganache that is absolutely amazing! Now that was a truly loving cup! I licked that cup clean!

Now the downside, it is about $4 for a small cup of rice pudding.  i would still pay that much because it was soo good but we all know its not that expensive to make rice pudding.  Also, like everywhere else in SF that parking is horrendous!

So all in all, A Loving Cup is a cute small place.  They have good rice pudding, and heavenly ganache nomnomnom!
author: Roxanne E.

description:
i would like one of everything, with everything mixed in, for every meal.  That is how I feel every time I come here - although I resist and seem to always have about 10 samples of rice pudding and a fro yo.

I love me some sweet sweet loving cup....wish they accepted debit cards.
author: Colette V.

description:
So after having the Loving Cup bookmarked for months, I finally stopped by to try the rice pudding. I adore rice pudding and don't know why it took me soo long to stop by and try it!  The coconut rice pudding and vanilla were delicious! Coconut is deffinately my favorite. But let's face it, any place with 6 or more flavors of rice puding will get 5 Stars in my book!  I'm going back for toffee next time. 

LOVE that they use all natural ingredients making even puding and frozen yogurt seem not soo bad for you!
author: Marissa P.

description:
It was my first time here and I was overwhelmed with the selection... I pondered:

Should I get their rice pudding they are known for? OR Should I get some frozen yogurt that I was craving?

The owner Liz was sweet to suggest a mixture of vanilla and chocolate yogurt with Oreo crumbles and some ground espresso beans...

After my first bite I instantly knew it was the RIGHT choice!

If ur a choc lover (and not craving rice pudding) - this is your new vice.

crap- now I want some.
author: stormy s.

description:
Excellent fro-yo blended in a most cool machine right before your very eyes!  You choose chocolate or vanilla and the ingredients you want blended in and voila! it's time to enjoy.  Fast, fresh and the flavors were perfectly balanced.  

Asked for a quick taste of one of the rice puddings - a vanilla meyer lemon combo - and it was good too.  But on a rare hot, sunny SF afternoon, I'm sticking with the fro-yo.
author: Lxs S.

description: Very good and the first time I have see a rice pudding bar! We shared the cinnamon pudding which had raisins in it. The small size was big enough and we loved it. I will deff be back on my next trip to SF!
author: Aaron A.

description:
I LOVE rice pudding and was extremely excited to try this place out when I first heard about it on Groupon. It was a cute place just like the many cute creative places in SF and was so sure they were going to make the best rice puddings I've ever tasted. I ordered the biggest tub of coconut and Nutella which was about 3 cups worth for about $8. 

It was mush. It tasted like typical snack pack puddings with coconut shreds and the Nutella one didn't have any flavor at all.

I was really disappointed in the cute place and wont be coming back. I can make a way better batch at home that actually tastes like there's rice in it. I still give the Pudding on the Rice shop in Portland a 5 stars!!
author: Stacey P.

description: Stopped here for a cool treat after a very hot and sunny Pride day.  The coconut rice pudding hit the spot and I look forward to coming back for more!  I was afraid it would be too sweet, but it was perfect.  Can't believe it took us so long to make it here, but we were always too full after lunch or dinner, and we somehow forget about snack-time.
author: Darlene W.

description: My bf had been raving about this place, so I had high expectations. We finally went and we had a few yogurts and rice pudding. I liked everything, but I definitely wasn't in love. The coconut rice pudding sample I had was yummy. I'll be back to try more combos of the yogurt, for sure.
author: Sheeva G.

description:
How can you not adore a dessert that is local, all natural, and delicious? I had the chocolate frozen yogurt with strawberries mixed in, and it was delicious. Not too sweet, and very refreshing on a hot day!

I can't wait to stop back in and try the other flavor combos, and some of that amazing looking rice pudding!

FYI- It's cash only!
author: adrienne l.

description:
Warning: attempting to park on Polk St on a Saturday night is nearly impossible. Head down with a friend and have the passenger jump out and order the goods. Now, onto the goods...

He had a small chocolate frozen yogurt with an english toffee mix-in and a small cup of coconut rice pudding. She had a medium half chocolate half coconut rice pudding.  The froyo was the best we've ever had. It was so creamy - every bite was filled with english toffee. So good. The rice pudding was delectable. I enjoyed every single bite of my coconut/chocolate combo. However his cup of coconut had too much shaved coconut for his liking. I think it came from a fresh batch. He enjoyed it anyway!

Tab came out to $12.25 and it was worth every penny.
author: Joy L.

description:
Back in SF and visited Loving Cup again  -  Still super yummy!!
They have the most delicious rice puddings.  I could barely finish the very generous "small".  
My friend got the fro-yo, again a very generous size.
Service is friendly, store is inviting.
Love Loving Cup!
author: Sandy E.

description:
If you are ever craving frozen yogurt in the evening, with a great selection of toppings to choose from, you must make a stop to the Loving Cup.  I chose the chocolate frozen yogurt, with nutella and espresso and i must say everything blended together quite well.  

I recommend giving this place a try if you are ever in the area, not bad for the price and very tasty.
author: Darrell K.

description:
Loving Cup is exactly the kind of place you would expect in the neighborhood it's in. I got the impression that the lady who runs it dots every 'i' and crosses every 't' (Unless she types, then it's done for her. We're so lazy these days). Nevertheless the result is not only delicious treats, but a nice experience as well. 

Key Lime rice pudding - fresh, perfectly sweet and even filling. Mocha Shake - also quite delicious. And most ingredients are local and organic as well. 

So what's the deal - are we going to see rice pudding shops popping up everywhere? Not without a trendy acronym-fusing name! RyPo? The FroYo also looked quite delicious from its fancy, expensive-looking-topping-blender-thingy, but I didn't try it.

I can't wait to try more!
author: Ryan V.

description: Lovin', indeed. Tried the pumpkin (a bit too much cinnamon and spice) and coconut (enjoyed the shards of coconut), but the vanilla rice pudding is my favorite. Creamy texture with bit o' broken rice. Simple and satisfying. Took a little getting used to. It's almost like eating cold, sweet porridge or "jok". Got past it pretty quickly though. Definitely a dessert you savor and take your time with.
author: Peter D.

description:
I went to the Loving Cup for the first time today and have to say that it hit the spot!  Yum!    I sampled a few flavors and in the end went w/ the chocolate chip.  Great decision.  I came home, plopped my pajama-covered body on the couch and devoured it.  

The small was almost too big to finish - that never happens to me.

Their menu went far beyond just rice pudding.  It may even be my new coffee spot after seeing the Cubano on the menu!  Mmmm, espresso w/ brown sugar so it is like caramel!!  Smoothies and FroYo too.  How do you go wrong with that?!
author: Lauren C.

description: I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but I find myself coming here a few times a week.  Holy smokes the vanilla with double oreo is like the Super Bowl and Christmas morning in your mouth!  Weird comparison, I know, but it's legit!
author: Andrew B.

description:
When Joanne G. brought over rice pudding to my place after I raved about my love of rice pudding in NY, I was so happy.  She brought over Rum Raisin and Creamsicle flavors.  I thought both were decent, although I probably wouldn't try them again since I'm not a huge fan of those.  The Rum Raisin had so much rum, we ended up watching our friend get buzzed off of it and then try to balance himself in a yoga pose on our Wii Fit.

I finally went to Loving Cup to see what other flavors they had to offer.  They don't have many flavors each day like Rice to Riches so it was a bit disappointing.  However, I tried toffee flavor and praline pecan.  I loved the toffee flavor!  I was so content after that.  I think I would like the place more if they had more flavors a day and also if they added an almond flavor - a favorite of mine from Rice to Riches.  Then I would definitely go back more often!
author: Stacey C.

description:
Had a strange fixation on this place after reading Froyo Girl's review- probably because I love the idea of rice pudding and fro-yo together in one place, and also because I think the name "Loving Cup" is on the edge of being a little bit, almost too much of a porno type name (even for SF).

Friendly staff let us try chocolate chip and almond rice pudding but BF and I settled on small lemon rice pudding and small Party in my Mouth.  Holy cow if you're coming to the party in my mouth you better like peanut butter! There was so much mixed in that I was licking the top of my mouth like a dog.  Regardless, I love all things in excess, so it was a real treat.  The lemon rice pudding was delicious too and had real lemon rind throughout.  Total guilty pleasure because Loving Cup is located next to Crunch gym, and all the responsible gym-goers were staring at us chomping on our treats while they trudged to the gym.
author: Holly B.

description:
This is going to be sweet and simple:

I walked in to try their rice pudding and walked out with $15 worth of it! All the flavors are to die for but my favorites so far are the nutella, coconut, and pumpkin pie!

Prices are very reasonable: $3.75 for a small cup, $4.75 for a medium, $5.75 for a large, and $7.75 for a x-large cup

CAUTION: CASH ONLY!!!!!!
author: Corinna H.

description:
This place is cute. A little place a few seats and a bench outside. I had the vanilla frozen yogurt with the toffee. yum :) and I sampled the Madagascar Vanilla Pudding and the Pistachio Pudding.. both are decent.. but I'd rather have the frozen yogurt. I'll definitely go to this place again. 

In short... they use this device like a McFlurry Machine at McDonald's to get it all mixed together for the frozen yogurt and your one topping.. :)
author: Kristina L.

description: After trying a lot of fancy San Francisco ice cream places, and being kind of let down (ahem SMITTEN ahem BI-RITE), I finally got a chance to try Loving Cup and they are the winners of my love and devotion of being my favorite ice cream in the city, and they aren't technically ice cream. Okay, they're my favorite cold creamy fattening delicious comforting milk dessert in San Francisco. Last time I got chocolate mixed with almond butter and cookie dough. It's a good amount for what you pay for, and the staff are all super friendly and patient.  I don't live anywhere near Russian Hill, but I make the trip FOR Loving Cup. So hurry up and open in Hayes Valley!
author: Catface G.

description: I really like the rice pudding and the frozen yogurt. I wish I could find a smoothie or shake I like but have been pretty disappointed the last 3 times I tried to order one. The small and medium size portions ae pretty generous and enough for one person
author: Jeremy B.

description:
I was on the way to a friend's house and saw this cute little place that said, rice pudding.  I had to go in.   In addition to the Rice Pudding, they have yogurt, coffee, smoothies

What an old-fashioned and cute approach to healthy snacks & drinks.  I got a small cup of the vanilla rice pudding and had to clerk sprinkle it with a bit of cinnamon.  I love it.     They have coconut, run & raisin rice pudding. 

They are a bit pricey, the small pudding was $3.75 ouch . . .  I guess that means I'll eat less price pudding or go to Trader Joes and get their brand of rice pudding. 

The ladies that worked there were nice enough.

Gave it 3 stars because of the high prices.
author: Vanilla C.

description:
Who knew that heaven in a cup awaited just a few blocks from my apartment? 

Initially, I wasn't too impressed by the concept of mushing up a bunch of ingredients into fat free frozen yogurt, but my oh my, am I glad that I'm an eater and not a baker. My vanilla based frozen yogurt with chocolate chips and peanut butter was to die for. Basically--a frozen yogurt reese's peanut butter cup. I downed it in a couple of minutes. 

The small cup size is not that small at all (but don't be disappointed when you see the interior is hollow). And don't be alarmed if it looks like the guy is putting in very little of your ingredients into the magic mush machine. It's an illusion. 

The shop itself is cute looking and clean, the service is very good, and I've heard their rice pudding is excellent. I didn't try it, but samples of the varied flavors are available, and they sure looked delicious. 

I am definitely going back for more, and there are so many ingredient options to choose from, I've decided ahead of time what to pick for my next combo. Hopefully, the nutella and oreos won't overpower each other.
author: Larissa M.

description:
What can I say? This is a shop devoted to rice pudding, one of my favorite desserts ever. So of course I'd love it! I was so excited to finally come here. Enthusiam quickly faded as my bf and I circled around the block with no luck in finding parking. SIGH. So I had to be dropped off and I just went in myself.  

The flavors they had that day were: 

Madagascar Vanilla 
Pecan Praline 
Lemon Vanilla 
Peach Bouchon 

I tried samples on little spoons just like at ice cream shops and surprisingly decided on lemon vanilla. I don't love lemon but their lemon vanilla rice pudding was devine. It was smoothly sweet and refreshing because of the lemon. Sometimes rice pudding can get too heavy but I was not bogged down here. 

I also tried their frozen yogurt. It isn't the tart kind but not completely like regular frozen yogurt either. It's a little more icy but maintains its creamy and sweet consistency. You get to pick a topping and they blend it into the yogurt for you. I suggest blueberry. It was so good!

I'm now officially a fan of Loving Cup even if there is no parking. Don't forget the frequent stamp card! :)
author: Julia T.

description:
Cozy little place on Polk full of tasty things to ruin your diet: Rice pudding (6 ingredients only, as it should be), frozen yogurts and shakes, cupcakes..& a fine looking coffee menu. Cubano looked divine but we were already too caffeinated to try it.
We tasted the Coconnut rice pudding-tasty toasted shreds atop, but went w the basic vanilla rice pudding topped w strawberries.  Other flavors of the day included rum raisin, Oreo cookie, and key lime.  
Was it as killer to die for as Rice to Riches in NYC? 
Alas, no...but darn good and I'd come back yet again to try more flavors & buy one of those brick sized rice krispy treats to boot!
author: H H.

description: Really yummy rice pudding!  I had the pecan and coconut together and I can't stop thinking about it!
author: G R.

description:
We found this place by accident one night when looking for parking for dinner down the street.  After dinner we came in for some dessert.  I got the peanut butter rice pudding and my boyfriend had a Red Velvet cupcake made by MoonbabyCakes.  The rice pudding was so good.  The girl behind the counter let me try a few different flavors, which is nice so you don't get a big cup of something you don't like.  The cupcake was super moist and delicious.  I wish that Moonbabycakes had a store front of their own.

I had noticed that they also have frozen yogurt that you can add mix-ins to so naturally I had to come back.  On my next trip here we tried the vanilla frozen yogurt with Oreos.  Even though the Oreos are mixed into tiny little specks, it still has the same delicious taste you would expect.  We also got the cookies & cream rice pudding and vanilla rice pudding.  That was eaten the next day and it was still as good as fresh.  And of course we got another Red Velvet cupcake.  I like that this place offers a little bit of everything.
author: Lindsey S.

description:
I really took a liking to rice pudding when I was on a Kozy Shack kick a few months back.  And while I did get a bit into the frozen yogurt craze, I never became a slave to it.  Loving Cup, which also happens to serve frozen yogurt, has opened up to throw something different into the mix.

Flavors often rotate.  The Madagascar Vanilla Bean and Nutella (chocolate) were a lil too plain for my tastes.  And the Rum Raisin was loaded with raisins.  My picks are the Creamsicle--similar to the vanilla, but with an orange twist--and the Pistachio, which is always a favorite.  The Chai rounds out my top three.  

The price-to-portion ratio is reasonable, and on par for what you'd pay for frozen yogurt.  Rice pudding just happens to be a lot more filling.  In addition to their homemade yogurt are homemade pastries, dairy and non-dairy smoothies.  The ingredients used are mostly organic, and the containers and utensils are compostable.  The staff is also incredibly friendly.  Good comfort food and nice folks always brighten a day.  

They've got a hold on the market now, but I could see that changing.  I'd welcome any competition.  The more rice pudding, the better.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
WOW-o-WOWIE - they do the whole frozen yogurt thing with a *twist*....so I was walking by and noted that they had frozen yogurt on their sign on the sidewalk. I also noted that almost every single person I saw on the street had frozen yogurt.

I came today and had to check it out. I was thinking froyo like those other places (tuttimelon, icebee, jubili)...Wrong! It is totally organic and local here. They don't use mass produced items. They make everything in-house. Their decor is like sorta a modernized old ice cream parlor. They have this machine, where they insert the frozen yogurt. The swivel swivels it up. She put it back into the cup, mixing whatever you want in it, and it mixes and comes out in the most beautiful twisted swirled frozen yogurt.

The cool part is that with whatever topping(s) you want, it blends completely with the frozen yogurt. So, the vanilla becomes, vanilla with almond butter and pistachio (lemme say delicious) or vanilla with rainbow sprinkles, or vanilla with blueberries, etc. etc....there are so many options to choose from that it is actually good that you have to wait in line while they make your yogurt. It looks like hard work and I definitely think they earn their money for the yogurt. 

They also have the rice puddings and homemade cupcakes. Red velvet and today's looked like peanut butter oreo.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Had been meaning to go here ever since we heard about it.  The rice pudding was great.  Had a "small" cup of the lemon vanilla with the black bottom.  (I put small in quotes because it was enough that I wasn't hungry for hours;  Susan and I should have shared it.)  And the kids loved the frozen yogurt with mixins.

It's a really cute place in one of my favorite SF neighborhoods.
author: Paul H.

description: Nothing like popping into a rice pudding shop for some comfort dessert. Yummers! I tasted the cookies and cream, coconut, rum and raisin, and lemon. They were all great, but I went with the lemon which was just fantastic!  I have been walking by this place for so long thinking I just have to try it out.  Stop walking by like me! Go in! Order the lemon!
author: Elli F.

description:
The Boy is a huge fan of rice pudding, while I've always been pretty lukewarm on it. The moment I saw this place on Yelp, I knew that he'd love it and, because I love him, I decided to bring him here. Little did I know that I would soon be converted to rice pudding mania! 

Turns out the rice pudding I've been having all my life (i.e. Kozy Shack) was the reason for my not loving rice pudding. We had the Coconut rice pudding with fresh-cut strawberries and it blew my mind. So much so that we came back the next day for seconds and will probably go again tomorrow for thirds :). Light, creamy, fresh, and innovative -- these are all words that can describe the rice pudding.

I also got a cubano shot (where brown sugar is layered atop the ground espresso in the PF so that the resulting shot is slightly sweetened) and it was delicious. I can't wait to come back!
author: Annie M.

description:
I have been on the rice pudding kick for awhile now. Since moving here, I can't believe this is the only rice pudding shop I've found! Nevertheless, I am glad I found it.
The little shop is quiet cute and I love the little red pans they display the pudding in. I think its hard to make rice pudding look appetizing and they do a good job. I tried the Madagascar vanilla, it was good but I've been eating the vanilla Kozyshack brand for awhile now (even though loving cup's vanilla is 10 times better) and wanted to have another flavor. So I went with the toffee which was excellent. Just the right amount of flavoring added. 
I also love the fact that rice pudding has far less calories then other desserts out there. Just 100 something calories, 3.5 grams of fat for the small and I couldn't even finish a 1/4 of it (maybe cause I am sick).
I will def be back here often for my rice pudding fix!
author: Kelley D.

description:
Love Loving Cup!  

A great concept-- frozen yogurt that is natural but doesn't taste like the tart kind. (I so don't get this tart craze).  Also, you can add in anything your heart desires from peanut butter to pistachios and they blend it in right before your very eyes.  I used to go to other places for my fro yo fix, but not anymore....

Also, their baked goods make it a difficult decision: frozen yogurt or red velvet cupcake?

I went in this place on their first day of business, the day before Thanksgiving, and I knew it'd be a hit.  Sure enough, I see a line out the door every day.
author: Lauren T.

description: As an Inner Richmond resident, I couldn't be happier with my location for food, fun and anything else I desire. Except I wish I was closer to Loving Cup.  I can't get enough of this place, and find it hard to retrain myself from making daily trips here.  Obviously, their rice pudding is to die for (chocolate chip and english toffee are two of my favorites!), but their frozen yogurt is amazing also.
author: Bridget B.

description:
I usually eat dinner around 4:30pm. 

I order oatmeal for lunch.  Sometimes a soft-boiled egg.  

Occasionally I can be seen at the park on a warm summer day in a hat, sunglasses, and a trench coat enjoying a cup of applesauce or a nice tuna fish salad sandwich.

Yes.  I will be 82 years old this May.

Amazing, right?

I do Pilates.

Now, what 82 year old doesn't love a sweet, homemade cup of rice pudding?  Doesn't that sound delicious?  Some comforting rice pudding after a long walk on a warm day?  I know, right?  Rice pudding is god's perfect food.  And you don't even need your dentures to eat it!!!  It's 100% gummable.

Now, excuse me while I buy $240 dollars worth of pudding and kiss the sky.  

Well, after I take a nap, anyway.
author: Rachel G.

description:
Somehow you tricked me into saying "can I have a large party in my mouth?". 

5 stars for you! Because that was hilarious and the flavor suggestion of the day was amazing - vanilla fro yo, peanut butter and oreo cookie. 

They've got the good stuff. Frequent buyer card too. Cash only!
author: Lara M.

description: LOVE this place!! The coconut rice pudding is to die for, and the original rice pudding is always a safe bet.  I would go here every day if I could.  Totally recommend it!
author: Sintia M.

description: Their frequent buyer card is lame. At any other place, if you buy two items you get two stamps, right? Not here. Its one stamp per visit and after the 9th visit you get a small free. Okay, I get it you want people to come back and I wouldn't mind being a frequent buyer, but the rice puddings that we had sucked. And that was sad because a group of us drove out specifically for the rice pudding. The texture of the pudding was strange and the flavoring was off. I also didn't enjoy the snippy customer service I received. So now I'm left with a piece of paper that I have to recycle.
author: Theresa D.

description: Generally I stick with the vanilla rice pudding but there is a machine that takes frozen yogurt and mixes in goodies to make a sort of hipster Blizzard.  That actually looks quite tasty.  The organic cupcakes are not my thing but they look pretty enough.  The line can get long sometimes so don't be in a hurry.
author: Poppy C.

description:
The rice pudding craze never quite made it to California for some reason.  I was pretty excited to see this place open, as I love snacks.  There are several different kinds of pudding here, that appear homemade.  Some flavors, key lime (which is eternally popular), plain vanilla, pistachio, almond.  I love the semi sweet pistachio flavor, but it is a bit on the nutty side for me.

The great thing about this place is that it is open until 940 pm, which makes it a delicious after dinner or before bar hopping treat on Polk.  Most snack stores close early, so Loving Cup has cornered the market here.  There is also an eat in section with little stools by the window if you care to enjoy your pudding in the shop.  I would love to see some water pitchers as the pudding can be quite sweet.

One bite of a small pudding is very satisfying.  I love the way the rice dissolves deliciously into utter sweetness.  I can imagine keeping this in my fridge but that would make me fat.  Is there a secret rice pudding recipe?  I am tempted to try to make the rice pudding to see if there is nuance to their blend.

The pudding looks very homemade, as in DIY, and I cannot decide whether this is a good or bad thing.  I initially thought that at three dollars for a small and five dollars for a medium, that this place was a bit on the expensive side.  One can justify a five dollar yogurt, because no one is going to make yogurt at home, but rice pudding is fairly simple.

I tried to do an ROI calculation on how much it would cost to make rice pudding on my own, and I determined that for four servings it might be about fifteen dollars, which makes this store a good bang for you buck.  In a city like San Francisco where groceries are expensive, and time is more expensive, I love a cup of Loving Cup.
author: apple r.

description:
Did I say 3 stars? I meant 5.

I tried the flavored rice pudding and the vanilla yogurt with strawberries and I'm officially sold. The yogurt is AMAZING... made to order, blended by a hand crank, and delicious! It's distinctly different than the "tart fro-yo" craze and very tasty.

Only gripe is that they don't take cards. Who carries cash all the time?
author: Amanda C.

description: I thought Loving Cup was just A-Ok, but maybe that just means I need to go back? I didn't think the froyo was especially noteworthy, and I thought it tasted a little icy.
author: K. D.

description:
Rice pudding freaks me out.   Texture is very important to me.  I don't even like chunky peanut butter.  So, no rice pudding for me.

However, the frozen yogurt is awesome.  I highly recommend the chocolate with peanut butter and chocolate chips mixed in, or the vanilla with Oreo cookies.  Both are awesome.  Yes, the mix-ins sort of negate the psuedo-healthy nature of frozen yogurt, but it's probably still less bad for me than Swensons.  

I particularly like the drill machine they use to blend the fro yo.  Its very industrial and scary looking.  

Down a star for cash only.  I don't understand why we can't all get with the 20th century and accept plastic.
author: Amanda B.

description: i think it's more about the mixed in fro yo than the rice pudding.  the large size price is higher now.  something as simple as vanilla with strawberry mixed in turns out great.  thicker texture and sweet without any tart.
author: Rob C.

description:
The slow churned frozen yogurt here is phenomenal.  What is slow churned yogurt you ask?  I didn't know either, but to sum it up, each cup of yogurt is made with a lot of love. They individually churn each order with the mix-in toppings of your choice until everything fuses into one creamy mixture.  The process is more involved than the usual push the lever, watch the yogurt squeeze out, so the wait is longer, but it is worth it because the portions are huge and it truly tastes like a loving cup.

The best flavor i've had is the vanilla base with nutella.  You can see them put in liberal amounts of the nutella straight from the jar.  Almond butter is also interesting if you like almond butter.  Oreo and english toffee are also great.  I'm not such much of a fan of animal crackers or the fruit flavors.  The animal crackers kind of just taste like a powdery residue and the fruit is frozen so it doesn't have as much flavor.  I wonder how amazing it would be if they used fresh fruit though...

I'm not a fan of rice pudding in general so I won't really comment on that but  apparently the pudding is freshly made in Berkeley in an industrial sized kitchen and then delivered over.  

I've already brought 3 sets of friends to loving cup since I was introduced to it and they all rave about it too.  I hope this cute little store succeeds, rides out the yogurt craze, and invests in a couple more churning machines.
author: Andrea L.

description:
This. Is. Heaven. *





*don't just ask me- Brian Boitano is a regular! Heyo!
author: Kristina C.

description: I had raspberry and blueberry with vanilla froyo. It was not too sweet, and light and creamy at the same time. I really like how they blend in the toppings too- it's unique, looks cool, and tastes amazing!
author: Victoria K.

description: Yikes..who knew you could so many wonderful things with rice pudding?! Stumbled up on this place and was thanking my lucky stars that I did... wowza! I had to stop myself from getting a cup of each flavor cuz every one I sampled was better than the last! I eventually settled on the coconut and enjoyed every loving spoonful of it! :-)
author: Alma P.

description:
Ok, so in the interest of full disclosure, the owner is one of my best friends, so you'd think that would make me biased. Great thing is that i don't have to be biased, because from an objective standpoint (and as you can tell from the other reviews) her store really is awesome!

I was psyched right off the bat because I am a huge fan of rice pudding, and Loving Cup brings their own flavor to it - literally - by mixing in ingredients to make interesting flavors, in addition to standard vanilla, such as mocha, white chocolate lavender, rum raisin, and chai (probably my fave.) But what I wasn't expecting was how OBSESSED i was going to be over the frozen yogurt, since I myself am not a "fro-yo" junkie. I do love that it pretty much tastes like ice cream, and the mix-ins keep it creative. My favorite so far is chocolate with a mix-in of almond butter. In addition, they have delicious fresh-squeezed lemonade and homemade tasty treats like cupcakes and bread pudding.

Anyway, long story short, this place is the epitome of a quality, cute independent business. Who wants to go to a chain when this place exists? And the name is based on a Rolling Stones song, which of course is the icing on the loving cup (sorry I couldn't resist)...
author: Meredith M.

description:
I taught I reviewed this already? Guess not. So, here's the scoop on Loving Cup (that's kind of a pun since they serve rice pudding, I guess). This place is capitalizing on a trend that's gathered steam in New York, serving expensive and delicious pudding to the masses. But unlike some of the posh, blinged out pudding and froyo places on the East Coast, Loving Cup is down-home, neighborhoody and inviting. I'm a big fan of the vanilla bean and the pistachio. Unequivocally better than any rice pudding I can recall ordering at a restaurant. Also, the portions are huge! A small cup is plenty for one person, maybe even two people if you just ate dinner. An XL pudding is basically a bucket. Good friggin luck.
