Whoever owns this place must be a smart businessman/woman/thing because they've made sure to include the old standbys: smoothies, good coffee (cheaper than the Buck, I reckon), and froyo. So you can pretty much get it all. And they seem to stay open later than expected (I swear I've walked by at 11pm on a Saturday and they're serving to all the folks who just came from Tonic next door). 

This is a fine addition to Polk St. It's nice to see it gaining popularity and that it's managing to attract a consistent crowd. Hope it sticks around.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Perhaps the best froyo I have ever had (probably cuz it's full fat and mixed with NUTELLA). 

I got chocolate yogurt mixed with nutella (question: does anyone know if they make a "crunchy nutella" like they do peanut butter....if not they totally should) Anyhow...i got primo parking on Polk and J-walked into this quiet little shop. I tried to compliment the owner/cashier dude by saying that it was my first time there and they had really high ratings on yelp. He shot back that he is friends with the chick who created yelp...and that neither of them keep up with it at all... was difficult to segue b/c i was complimenting him and he was kinda making me feel too "mainstream" but whatevs, with that kind of high quality desserts, you could be a yogurt/pudding nazi (which he wasn't, obvi) and i would still come. I am looking forward to Crunch gym/Loving spoon trips in the future :)
author: Jess V.

description: This is such a great frozen yogurt place. It mixes all your flavors perfectly! I live in LA and nothing here comes close to this place.
author: Swati S.

description: This place is amazing! I love their frozen yogurt. The chocolate with peanut butter is to die for! A small is about 120 calories, perfect for your sweet cravings. I go here at least once a week, and it never fails to turn my frown upside down.
author: Natalie G.

description:
Organic, pro-bioitic frozen yogurt made by hand, in individual servings, while you watch, using obviously high-quality ingredients.  I ordered a vanilla with organic crunchy peanut butter and chocolate chips, and it was quite possibly the best frozen yogurt I've ever had.  The lines can get long, but you'll be rewarded for your patience.  

If you're a fan of rice pudding, you should try that, too.  Everyone was freaking out in line about how good the pumpkin rice pudding was.  In fact, they ran out while I was standing there.  I tried the vanilla bean, and it was outrageously delicious.  But I couldn't justify both the frozen yogurt and the rice pudding -- so the pudding will have to wait until next time.

A local business serving high quality stuff and employing friendly people who know their product -- what a great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Jeffrey S.

description: This place is pretty great and the girls that work here are lovely. Had a chocolate base & tried a vanilla base (there are only two bases that they mix with various fruits and candies FYI) both were delicious.  Also tried the rice puddings and they were delish!
author: Nick M.

description: Best dessert place ever! I've been to this place 4 weekends in a row because it was just so good! My favorite is the vanilla base and the mango topping. I always can't wait to get back for more!
author: Amanda L.

description:
On the second record breaking hot day in January I had it in my head that I needed to go back to Loving Cup and try the frozen yogurt from the mysterious yogurt machine. 

Surprisingly there was nobody in the shop. I thought for sure there would be hordes of people wanting a frozen treat on such an unusually warm day. 

I went for chocolate overload and decided on a chocolate base with Nutella. 

Contrary to what other Yelp reviews stated, it didn't take 10-15 minutes for the worker to master the crazy contraption that mixes in flavors with the yogurt. I was in and out in less than five minutes with a cup of wonderfully chocolaty, Nutella spiked yogurt in my hands. 

It's not the tart fro-yo stuff that everyone loves, so if you're into tart flavors, you'll be disappointed. 

Loving Cup's version of yogurt seriously could have been ice cream. I'm sure it's not fat free, but still, it probably has a lot fewer grams of fat than soft serve ice cream. Way to start the new year out right!
author: Lee H.

description:
The Loving Cup is a new coffee and dessert place in Russian Hill.  We were both greeted by the owner who is very friendly.  There is a selection of rice puddings, coffee, and other desserts.

We both order a small cup of pistachio rice pudding, and it was delicious.  This is the first place I know that offers rice pudding for dessert.  It's a great dessert if you do not want something too overly sweet and plus it's low calorie on the dessert scale.

We also order a couple of lattes which have a design in the steamed milk.  As an added bonus, we were given a sample of a ginger sugar cookie to try, and since we liked it, we ordered some to go.

Because it's brand new, seating for the Loving Cup is sparse.  Chairs and wooden stools are on order.  You can enjoy your dessert/coffee on the go and stroll Polk Street.  Thanks Loving Cup!
author: Janet H.

description:
Got my chocolate fro-yo with junior mints and cookie dough mixed in. When I got my dish I was shocked to discover the mix-ins had been completely pulverized. The point of cookie dough is to have chunks. Not undetectable microscopic granules. 

Otherwise it tasted Ok and was decently sized.
author: Eric M.

description:
Hard not to compare to "Rice to Riches" in NYC...that is the mecca of rice pudding! This place is like a miniature MINIATURE version, with only 4-5 flavors. I only tried English Toffee, and was pretty impressed. The other flavors though, seemed a bit run-of-the-mill. I'm sure they are good though.

The English Toffee had nice chunks of chocolate toffee throughout. Some chocolate flakes, some toffee nubs, nice rice pudding consistency. If you like rice pudding, come here and give it a try!
author: Carol L.

description:
I'm walking around to do some shopping on Union St., and on my way there I notice a place called The Loving Cup with a bunch of people standing outside.  I see that it sells rice pudding and nearly swoon from excitement!  I HEART rice pudding and always talk my mom into making it for me when I visit her.  I've never seen a rice pudding shop outside of NYC either!  So I walk in and check it out but my friend convinces me to hit it up on the way back so that we can take our treats into the movie theater with us!

So we head back after lunch and some shopping. Yup, still crowded.  Sat. was their opening day.  So the small yogurts and rice pudding servings were only $2.  I decide to go with the Madagascar vanilla bean and my friend opts for the Nutella.  I also get a fresh lemonade and some peanut butter chocolate drop cookies.  Everything was good.  And unlike Rice to Riches in NYC, I could actually eat the whole serving without feeling my teeth rot with every bite.  (R2R was incredibly sweet).

Still not nearly as good as mom's or as the one Zarzuela serves just up the street, but so worth it.  I will definitely be back to get more AND to try some of the yummy froyo swirls!

P.S.  I'm so glad I stumbled across this place!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Am I the only one who craves rice pudding from time to time? And sometimes kozy shack or jello does not cut it. So when I found out there was a place serving this delectable treat, I just had to try it! 

One thing though, parking sucks! I literally had to circle around 5-6x before double parking at a fire hydrant (I know, I know!) and forcing my bf to get it. 

Madagascar vanilla rice pudding with chocolate ganache was what he got for me and I have to tell ya, I was eating it while driving (I know, again!). I could not put my spoon down, it was so good! He had the same except with an espresso shot, it was crazy but yummy. 

While I finished my cup before entering the freeway, I don't know if I'd trek out there again. Parking was too much of a pain. But if you really, really have a hankering for rice pudding, I suggest you stop by! And if your partner is no fan of rice pudding they also serve fro-yo! Cash only, buds.
author: Neva R.

description:
I eat here all the time, probably at least once a week. Or every 2 weeks.  I'm not crazy about the rice pudding (sorry) but I do appreciate the samples.  The lady worker there is always very nice to offer them, and who could resist her offers?

The BEST thing here is a tie between the fro yo and the red velvet cupcakes. Always go with vanilla as a base; anything you add to it is amazing.  Avoid animal crackers because they just get all mushy.  Espresso also tastes like nothing when added.  Peanut butter (esp. crunchy!) and Oreos are a winning combination.  These two flavors make just about anything taste good.  If you're ever in doubt, just add Oreo.  Look out for the Pumpkin Pie flavor!  It's delicious.

They now have macrons, which are pretty good too.  If you go online, you can order pies!  Also: Blue Bottle coffee, smoothies, shakes, fresh-pressed apple juice, a clean bathroom, and that worker lady!  Go to Loving Cup!  Don't mind the wait!  It's totally worth it.

PS Parking is strict here in the daytime.  One minute over and the meter maid comes out with a ticket!  Just check your quarters.
author: Matilda M.

description: The ideal frozen yogurt place. So many flavors, great ingredients, and delicious!
author: Josh K.

description:
I just finished watching a rented movie with my sister and suddenly I had the urge to eat some tapioca pudding. So I hurriedly went on Yelp to find which places served rice pudding. Lo and behold---Loving cup was the first to come up. So I clicked it and the reviews were good!

So my sister and I drove to the place and it literally took us about 25 minutes to find parking---but hey, we live in SF so whats new. We rushed to the place before closing time. 

I was quite surprised that they didn't have more flavors or options, they only had four flavors, which for a place that bragged about having tapioca pudding should have more flavors.

But we still settled for two flavors: almond butter and cinnamon rum raisin.

Almond butter for sure hit the spot! It was delicious and everything that I was craving. Cinnamon rum raisin----it was allright. I like raisins but it was just too too soaked in rum. I thought I was at a bar (okay, maybe I'm just a little bit exaggerating).

But overall the experience, price, and taste were exactly what I expected.

They also serve frozen yogurt. But SF should have more rice pudding places----a place dedicated to solely rice pudding. Yum. But for now, Loving cup is the place to be to fulfill your cravings.
author: Carissa E.

description:
I've been here quite a few times now, but I'm not sure if I'll be a tremendous help because I order the same thing almost every time!  Hahaha..

SERVICE = Great..  Everyone that has helped me so far has been nice.. Liz is above and beyond awesome!

RICE PUDDING = Yummy!.. Granted, I almost always get the Madagascar Vanilla flavor; but it's my favorite!  Not all the flavors are up my alley, but the rice pudding itself is lip smackin good.

YOGURT = Good.. I like the process.  It's different from other yogurt places.  Don't get too crazy mixing flavors--I tried mango and coconut and it wasn't something I'd get again.  Pineapple and coconut on the other hand was yummy.  In general, the yogurt gets the job done flavor-wise.
  
PAYMENT/PRICING = Average..  They only accept cash which is not always convenient for me because I don't always carry cash.  Prices are reasonable.  I can't remember what pricing is off the top of my head because I'll always buy from here regardless.  


*EXPERIENCE* = *Priceless*..  My fiance lives around the block up the hill so we frequent Loving Cup whenever I'm around.  He knows how much I like the rice pudding so when we got engaged, he used it as part of the proposal.  Loving Cup will continue to be part of my dessert menu when I'm in the area.
author: Doreen M.

description:
I'm very sad I couldn't pack Loving cup in my suitcase and take them with me. They are PERFECT! 
I had the Rum Rasin rice pudding and I had to force my self not to go back everyday when I was in SF. all the flavors looked good and so did the fresh frozen yogurt! 
Oh loving cup will you move to Chicago for me?
author: Crystal P.

description:
I CONSTANTLY FIND MYSELF CRAVING THIS PLACE.
Whenever I come here, I get their hot chocolate, it's awesome. Another thing I love getting is their yogurt. They like, swirl their yogurt differently than most places I have been too. Their pudding isn't bad either! I don't know, I haven't found something that I didn't like here. Their service is excellent and    it happens to also be in a rather nice area.
 If only I could go there now...
author: Susie N.

description:
Recently I have been labeling the days of the week with something such as Sandwich Friday. I do not believe in Taco Tuesday but I would not be sad if a Taco Truck would park outside my apartment.

For the third Wednesday in a row I found myself in the Rice Pudding District on Polk Street waiting to go into Tonic. They are times when drinks are not that interesting and that was one of them but I am probably a price sensitive drinker (You learn economics reading my blog/reviews!).

A budweiser for more than $2 is not a special.

OK so I was in the Rice Pudding joint for the third time in three weeks. The music is always good. Spoke to the Rice Pudding opposite of fred and she said she was able to bring in her iPod. Good thing I was not working or we would be listening to the theme from the Mary Tyler Moore Show.
author: Marcus R.

description: LOVE this place. fat free frozen yogurt, thick and creamy like ice cream. they mix it up in this cool machine with your choice of any of their 20+ additions (toasty coconut, oreos, fruit, junior mints, etc), and it comes out like a mcflurry, only better for you. the rice pudding's pretty cool too and they have a nice selection of blue bottle coffee drinks & smoothies/ice cream shakes. never tried them but i assume theyre delish!
author: Amy F.

description:
Another reason to love San Francisco: There aren't many cities where you can just go get rice pudding (and a variety of it for that matter) if you just so happen to have the craving.  You can in San Fran.

It must take somebody who really knows and loves rice pudding to make a successful business out of such a thing.  It shows in the pudding :)
author: Jesse M.

description: Went here a few weeks ago after craving really good rice pudding! I haven't had good rice pudding since going to nyc. Went inside the store and asked for a small portion of the coconut rice pudding to go. As my husband and i drove off, i realized i shouldv'e asked for the biggest portion!!! Looking forward to definitely going back! :D
author: Mertani G.

description:
The People here kick Ass!! They remembered who I was (huge plus...and one of the best parts of living on Polk street I would say).

The gal who I believe runs the place makes some Crazy good scones/biscuits/muffins...light but still like grandma made em!  Though my grandma only ever made me spam dishes...

I for one LOVED the yogurt - its super different than any others i have had - not tart and definitely not too sweet.  They added extra berries and it ended up being a creamy cup o' Love..totally get the name!

Have yet to try rice pudding but am looking forward to it.  It will be my first rice pudding experience, and though Im a little nervous - I think im ready!  Thanks loving cup!
author: Melissa H.

description:
Walking the neighborhood with my friend the other day, we stumbled across this place and determined that we would have dessert here after lunch. 
The lady who worked there let me try the rice puddings I was interested in and then I decided to go with the almond butter rice pudding. Awesome. Creamy and sandy texture, from the almond butter.
I also tasted the coconut pudding, which I will get next time.
Great little place!!
author: Alexandra D.

description: The rice pudding here is amazing! My favorites are the lemon and the rum raisin. What I like about it (compared to other rice puddings that I've tried) is that it is not too mushy and the temperature they serve it at is perfect. Also, the employees who work here are really nice about giving samples, so definitely try a few -- though that'll make it more difficult to decide which you want a larger portion of b/c they are all so good!
author: Jessica W.

description:
A different twist on the froyo craze. The way things work here is you pick a base and then two mix-ins and they have a neato swirling machine that swirls your toppings in for you, allowing you to create all kinds of delicious custom flavors. I had a vanilla yogurt with peanut butter and english toffee. It was so delicious I haven't ventured into any different flavors. I love the swirling thing because it really incorporates your toppings into the yogurt and making it a cohesive flavor experience.
They have really delicious rice puddings, I've had the pistachio and creamsicle flavors. They are rich, delicious and creamy. I like to pick up an order of rice pudding and then take it home and microwave portions of it whenever I want a delicious, creamy and comforting snack.
author: Cathy T.

description: This place is incredible!  By far, the best frozen yogurt I've ever had.  It is so fresh and the blending machine is mesmerizing.  I am so lucky to have this place in my neighborhood!  Their no dairy, no ice smoothies are great too.
author: Britt B.

description:
That's right - when it comes to fro-yo places in the city, I've got to give it to Loving Cup. A dear welcome to the Russian Hill neighborhood. Its super cute, endearing, and classic decor make it that much more of a special place.

While Tutti Melon, Yogurt Cup, and all the thousands of other yogurt places are playin'-out the tart flavor, Loving Cup is bringing the love fo' sure. Think of them as the greek yogurt of these guys. They are all about the thick, rich, creamy, and truly satisfying yogurt. With add-ins like Nutella and coconut, in addition to the usual fruit spread, and the fact that they really mix it in - it's just a winner. 

To boot - they have fun rice pudding, which is a unique little treat. I've tasted a few of them - as good as the ones in Bangladesh. (where rice is king)
author: Erin M.

description:
Weird, weird name but the best rice pudding for miles.  And they don't just assume you're one of those weirdos who wants raisins in it.  But yes, if you're a weirdo you can still get your precious raisins in it.

They call their plainest pudding "Madagascar Vanilla," and also offer rice pudding with coconut, with raisins, and with other stuff depending on the day.

Anyways, the pudding itself is just about perfect.  Creamy and dense, but not too thick, and served nice and cold.
author: Suo L.

description:
I can only comment on the rice pudding, which is the reason I stopped by. (You can pretty much get frozen yogurt and espresso shots everywhere...)

I thought it was pretty good, although there didn't seem to be that much difference between the flavors. I tried a few of them, and they all basically tasted like the vanilla with an extra ingredient mixed in.

And there doesn't seem to be that much difference between good rice pudding and average rice pudding. It's not like ice cream where the super artisan stuff is miles ahead of the cheap supermarket brands.

It's worth it if you're in the 'hood, but don't make a pilgrimage or anything.
author: S R.

description:
2 stars only because this place shuns the traditional excellence of Oreo Cookie and Peanut Butter Cup toppings.  It's hard to find a flavor that can't be complemented by these delicious bits of High Fructose Corn Syrup.  

I will support you one day Loving Cup but you must embrace the traditional toppings.

the 2nd star is for having a Churro Rice Chrispy Treat...well done!
author: Joshua J.

description: Mobile website is horrible. Doesn't work right on Android or iPhone.  Please get rid of flash!  A mobile site should be lightweight and viewable on any platform.
author: Chris A.

description:
Where else are you going to find a store specifically dedicated to RICE PUDDING?!!!  
Madagascar Vanilla Bean
Chocolate
Rum Raisin
Chai
...just a few that were made fresh that morning.  Apparently the selection changes daily based on market freshness!!!

Staff is super friendly and will let you taste all of them if you want it.  You can even mix match the flavors to make something even more magical....might I suggest rum raisin/vanilla bean?  Yummmm!

The portions are quite big.  I got a small with 2 flavors and I had to get a lid to take it home.  There is only so much rice pudding I can eat in one sitting =)  All good...i enjoyed it for dessert the next night and it was just as good as the day before!!!
author: Tammy H.

description:
Oh my god yummmmmm...

Think of it as the cold stone of frozen yogurt..but better...

Yogurt is very creamy and fluffy. They have a special mixer for blending in many of their creative mix-ins.  I particularly like having fresh fruit blended with my vanilla!

Lately , I've been getting the rice pudding, which is to soo f-ing gooooddd.

My girl friend and I brought it to game night at my friends house, and it was a big success. Vanilla and Coconut are best!
author: Peter G.

description:
I came here for the first time to check out their ice cream....which was awesome...

...I now come at least once a week to get their RICE PUDDING.

It's a dream! 

My favorite flavors are Vanilla, Pumpkin and Coconut.

One big advantage to getting the rice pudding, is that it doesn't take 1/2 as long to get in and out  : )
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Loving Cup, look at what you've done.  How can you live with yourself?  As if my frozen yogurt addiction weren't bad enough on its own, you had to go and add rice pudding to the mix.  And all in the same venue with late hours?  You must really hate me, because now I'm really a goner.  But that's okay, I won't go down alone when I go to get my fix.  I'll always bring someone with me to share in the guilt of getting both froyo AND rice pudding.  I don't need you, you evil place, you.  See you soon?
author: Jenn C.

description:
when i found this place on yelp it immediately reminded me of NY's "rice to riches" sooo good. i havent had rice pudding since then so i had to give this place a try. half peanut and half toffee. peanut butter was disgusting, sorry but there were so many peanut bits in there and it was mixed with rice with additional peanut flavoring was just way too much even for a peanut butter lover. toffee on the other hand was better because it wasn't too much and it had the perfect amount of toffee. 

can't compare to the one in new york but its okay if u pick the right flavors.
author: Anita L.

description:
Incredible.  

I had the chocolate fro-yo with peanut butter ... OMG I almost fell over and died it was THAT effing good.  I kid you not.  A creamy, organic, probiotic reese's peanut butter cup.  It does not get any better than that.

The rice puddings were pretty good also.  Almond butter was my favorite.  I thought the fro-yo was better.  You won't be disappointed.

And the guy behind the counter was SO nice.
author: Kate R.

description: I tried unsuccessfully to try Loving Cup for the longest time and I finally did a few weeks ago! Unique twist on the usual froyo + toppings. Here you get them all mixed into one but still in delicious icy froyo form! I've tried the strawberry shortcake and peanut butter and both were great. I heard the rice pudding is also homemade and tasty as well; must go back there to check that out.
author: Joyce H.

description:
This place is awesome.

Amazing staff, super outrageous Frozen Yogurt and Rice Pudding.

I love the topping options on the frozen yogurt, hello peanut butter and chocolate chips....

Keep up the great work ladies!
author: Kevin G.

description:
Rice pudding here could not be more perfect.  I have no idea about the frozen yogurt, espresso or anything else here, but the coconut rice pudding must literally be from heaven.  It is divine!

I normally cannot give five stars to a place that is cash only (because that is so inconvenient) but for The Loving Cup, I will happily make an exception!
author: S B.

description:
I can't review the fro-yo (sowee!) but I am hooked on their organic rice pudding. How much healthier and yummier can a snack be?! SIX ingredients and I can pronounce them all. I've had the Madagascar Vanilla, Chai Spice and Pecan. So far, loved every single one. I'm not quite sure how they rotate the flavor schedules but I trust that whatever they have, it's good.

AND their business hours are super neighborhood friendly. Weekdays 7:30am-9:30pm. Cant wait to try their smoothies and cupcakes. Feels great to be snacking organically.
author: Ramona P.

description: Your basic rice pudding is enough to satisfy my perpetual sweet tooth, but when English Toffee chips are added, it's enough to send me into a tailspin.  Kudos to the staff for coming up with such a great creation.
author: Carlos C.

description: Big shout out to Vanessa the Loving Cup Girl who's pleasant disposition and excellent music selection tickles my fancy! She swirls my fro-yo like a pro! Whats that!? I can sample all of the rice puddings several times each if I'd like!? Never mind all the people in line, I'll carefully review the extensive add-ins list before choosing vanilla with pineapple, junior mints, crunchy peanut butter, and gummy bears. Don't mind if I do! Wait! Change my pineapples to blueberries. Can I get whipped cream on that? YES! Please tip your friendly fro-yo crafters. After all, they are making you custom treats one by one!
author: Andrew L.

description: I'm not a huge fan of rice pudding but either is my girlfriend and she had been here a few times and raved about it.  So after dinner a few weeks ago we went to try it out.  I tried a few different types of rice pudding but it wasn't for me.  However, I did have the frozen yogurt and it was fantastic.  They put real berries in the yogurt so it was very fresh.  The workers were very friendly and helpful as well.  I would recommending checking out the Loving Cup even if you're not a rice pudding fan as it just might surprise you (or you can get the frozen yogurt).
author: Blake B.

description:
Presentation is wonderfully done at Loving Cup. It feels light, airy, and precious; almost like you're walking on delicious rice pudding. They also currently have framed paper cutouts by a local artist that nicely fits into the shop's decor.

Loving Cup sells rice pudding, custom frozen yogurt, teeny weeny cutesy cupcakes, and other pastry goods. It's rare to find a dessert shop selling rice pudding alongside frozen yogurt, especially in SF.

From the various flavors I choose to play it safe with the Madagascar vanilla rice pudding. A small is a hefty $3.75, but the cup is also hefty. I felt so fat afterwards. Loving Cup is ironically located a short distance from a gym. I feel sorry for those guys. They grate cinnamon and nutmeg for free. It really adds something special to the pudding. I can't really back up the pudding with much enthusiasm. It's good, but I can't help but be reminded of the Cozy Shack brand when eating it. If you do get the rice pudding, try out some of the more adventurous flavors. The vanilla might bore you.

If I were to return I'd try out the yogurt because of all the reviews.
author: Michael H.

description: I am new to the rice pudding awesomeness but this place rocks!!
author: Brian C.

description: Thank you Loving Cup, your sheer deliciousness have truly redefined rice pudding for me. Also,  Loving Cup does not just serve your typical yogurt. I got their vanilla based banana yogurt with animal crackers, where the ingredients is mixed in twice through a unique machine. it was smooth, rich yet light, and simply delicious.
author: Hung F.

description: We got there too late to get the rice pudding, it was sold out! So I got one of their amazing fro-yos (vanilla with nutella whipped in). They had lots of great flavors and mix-ins animal crackers, what?!). I can't wait to go back and try the rice pudding.
author: Shannon B.

description:
Yummy yummy yummy. When I was looking for my most recent apartment Loving Cup sold me on the neighborhood. I love rice pudding and here was a shop dedicated to it!

Whether it is the rum raisin rice pudding or the mix-in frozen yogurt there is something for everyone. There are so many combinations you can't get bored. The only thing is that if there are a lot of people who all want fro yo, the wait can be long because there is only one mix-in machine. Hopefully that means it is not in danger of closing!

My favorite mix-in combo so far is Nutella and English Toffee in Vanilla. I'm looking forward to finding my next fav soon.
author: Katie W.

description: Loving Cup offers many different varieties of sweet frozen yogurt, which you choose for yourself by mixing any of a large number of toppings with either vanilla or chocolate. My favorite is Loving Cup's version of "mint" ice cream -- vanilla + junior mints. They take the toppings and actually grind them up and blend them into the froyo base so that the flavor of the toppings is really infused into the froyo. They also have rice pudding and are probably more famous for it; I've tried the regular rice pudding and it was too sweet for me. I've also had a strawberry smoothie, which was delicious.
author: Jackie C.

description:
My friend took me to this new found love of mine when I told her I was in the mood for some fro-yo--and now, I can ignore every other frozen yogurt shop in the city with their gross tart flavors. Not only is Loving Cup a cute little nook, but their yogurt is creamy (still fat-free) and customized. I chose vanilla as my base, and had nutella and banana mixed in--I was in heaven. And there are still a million other combos I want to try! 

Plus the small size is huge, while still coming out cheaper than those "make your own" places.
author: Rena Z.

description:
And now, a Saturday afternoon double haiku in honor of my new fave neighborhood place, Loving Cup, now serving crazy good rice pudding:

Lemon vanilla
Deliciously decadent
Bona fide rice dream

Vaguely healthy, right??
Back next week to try smoothie
(May get rice pud too)
author: Leela S.

description:
Awesome frogurt - you'd swear it was full-fat ice cream! Only two flavors to choose from: vanilla or chocolate, but there are many varieties of toppings to blend in! I recommend either adding the almond or peanut butter with something crunchy! Granola? Chocolate Chips? Nomnomnomnomnom....
The Medium size is more like a Large. Nice staff. Cute little shop. You can sit in the window and watch Polk St.
Rice puddings are pretty amazing too. I tried both the Vanilla and the Key Lime....whoa.
author: Barbara K.

description: Got the froyo with the sprinkles mixed in. Not the best... Couldn't believe there wasn't enough fruit or anything as for other toppings.
author: christine c.

description: Tasty rice pudding. A good reason to play hooky from work, some (the gainfully employed) would say.
author: Guillermo K.

description:
Haven't had rice pudding since a family dinner at this Indian restaurant in London, so when the boyfriend mentioned this place, I was totally excited for it.

The place was a lot smaller than I imagined but don't let the outside fool you. Their rice pudding was awesome! Everyday they make 6 different flavors and if you don't know what you want, you can always ask for a sample (kind of like Baskin Robbins with their pink spoons). 

Boyfriend and I got the cinnamon rum raisen and the coconut pudding and both were delicious. Though I had ordered the coconut, I ended up eating all the cinnamon rum raisen instead just because after a while, the coconut was a tad overbearing with the excessive coconut shavings (which I'm sure real coconut fans would appreciate). Overall, very pleasant experience and will probably come back if ever in the mood for rice pudding or just in the area! :)
author: R.B. P.

description: ehh .. the rice pudding was ok. The blended yogurt which my friend got was ok as well.
author: Swwtnsour T.

description: Came here because it is the only place I can find in the city offering rice pudding.  I was not disappointed!  I've tried three different flavors.  The best was the Rum Raisin with Cinnamon.  It was not only flavorful but the little raisins really made it extra yummy!  The other two I've tried were fine, but didn't touch the yumminess that was the Rum Raisin.  Parking is nearly impossible here so get ready to circle or have someone run in and pick it up.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: The Loving Cup is cutesy and romantic in a homey kind of way.  There's something ironically warm and inviting about a frozen rice pudding shop called The Loving Cup:  For me the name brings to mind images of hugs, positivity (glass half full), and someones cute grandmother who has this amazing rice pudding recipe that's been handed down for generations...I was never big on rice pudding to begin with, but since I've visited LC, I crave it.  I feel like the portions are too large, but I guess you could always save it for a midnight snack!
author: Erica K.

description:
In need of a sugar fix after work, I was on my way to La Boulange and saw the two magical words, RICE PUDDING.  I figured what the heck, let's give it a try. There were about half a dozen to choose from and I opted for the English Toffee. 

Mmmm, delicious! Creamy Rice Pudding with sweet and crunchy bits of chocolate and buttery toffee. Rice was cooked well, not gummy or too hard. Next time I think I'll give the Pistachio a try.

Wonderfully comforting. During these colder months, I'll take this any day over fro-yo. Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Rachelli M.

description:
Loving Cup is conveniently located on my walking route to my best friend Julie's apartment. I came here for the first time tonight and was pleasantly surprised. 

I ordered a small vanilla frozen yogurt with oreos. Simple, I know. I love how they mix the topping in with the fro yo. Next time, I shall be adventurous and perhaps do vanilla, nutella (yes, nutella), and oreo. Or perhaps chunky peanut butter. Love the mixing in toppings.

Also, I must say, the service was incredibly friendly. The serving size, a small, was very generous but didn't leave me feeling heavy full. What a lovely addition to Polk St!
author: Laura D.

description: Let me preface my statements by saying I love a good rice puding. So I am a little picky when it comes to judging them. I was excited about trying the place, and the shop is darling, but the rice pudding was not as delicious as I had anticipated. Pretty good, but not great. Felt like sweetness was lacking just a bit, and a tad more mushy than I like. Five stars for creative flavors though. My favorites were cinnamon rum raisin and cookies n' cream. The pecan praline, coconut, and vanilla bean were not bad too.
author: Brittany L.

description:
Rice pudding made with a little love! I had the opportunity to speak with Liz, the owner of LC and the rumors are true..the pudding is her mom's own recipe! For some reason, that makes me really happy :)
Also, I'm a sucker for a perfect latte. Yes. They make their coffee with TLC too. 

The people who work at LC is oh so friendly and easy to talk with. For being the new kids on the block, I hear they get really swamped after dinner. It only makes sense because of all the restaurants near by. I'm psyched because now I don't have to walk as far to get my caffeine and sugar fix!
author: Dorothea G.

description:
Living a block away is awesome, but also can be very dangerous!

When I first tried Loving Cup, I got chocolate with bananas mixed in and I wasn't really a fan. The next time I went back, I got vanilla and now I am addicted! My two favorite mix ins are either Oreos or chocolate chips. The yogurt is sweet, creamy & delicious. (Note: you cannot compare sweet fro yo to tart fro yo...totally different things)

I sampled some of the rum raisin rice pudding even though I didn't think I liked rice pudding, but it was delicious! Although I have yet to order a full serving of it.

The people who work there are always super friendly & pleasant.
author: Elaine S.

description: Well worth the trip to san francisco from wherever you are. The coconut pudding is a must
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Yum yum yum :) 

Wish they accepted credit/debit cards, but then again....maybe it's for the best.
author: Lisa C.

description:
My sister has been raving about this and since it was one of the few things that was open this past weekend and a good walk up the hill, we went. 

It actually was pretty good. Yay for a place like this having chocolate yogurt and while they didn't have what I normally get for a mix in at a place like Coldstones, I'm easy and I got peanut butter (creamy or crunchy! creamy please!) and chocolate chips and it was pretty damn good. I think next time I may just get chocolate with peanut butter as the chips made it a little too crunchy for me. When my sister got hers, they missed a mix in she wanted, but they didn't charge her for it and we didn't complain, but just a note to double check your order, just in case. 

Love the location next to the gym! HAHA:-).
author: Rebecca S.

description:
I came in here and ordered the "creamsicle" flavored rice pudding, fully knowing how much I hate most orange flavored foods.  I'm not even sure why I did it...I think seeing the juicy orange slice sitting on top of the pudding on a warm day did it.  I took a bite and had no regrets.  Damn good rice pudding.  I'm going for the white chocolate variety next.  

This is also a good place for frozen yogurt that isn't tart.
author: Victoria G.

description:
This little shop marches to the beat of a different drummer.

It's like an old school ice cream parlor, except with rice pudding (???) as the star attraction.  That definitely grabbed my attention since I've never even heard of a store dedicated to rice pudding before.  

We had the rum raisin, which was very rummy and delish.  Also, they have froyo, but again they did it with an individual spin.  Froyo places are a dime a dozen these days, and you can't go down any main street in the bay area without running into one or two tart soft-serve froyo shops. 

But at Loving Cup, you are presented instead with the froyo version of DQ Blizzards.  Seriously!  They blend chocolate or vanilla frozen yogurt (the sweet, ice creamy kind) with your choice of a myriad of ingredients using a giant peanut butter drill.  Or something.  Anyway, we had ours chocolate with toffee and peanut butter, and it was thick and creamy and very yummy.  If you remember from your childhood, Blizzards are supposed to be so thick you can turn it upside down without the contents or the spoon falling out.  I did it to my blended froyo and everything totally stayed put.  Awesome!  :-)
author: Monica W.

description: The line out the door might just say it all! This is a very popular local spot, serving a variety of flavored rice pudding and custom mixed frozen yogurt treats. For the frozen yogurt, you select either a vanilla or chocolate frozen yogurt base and toppings, then the toppings are mixed into the base via a big machine. They can do only one at a time, which is usually what causes the long lines. There is limited seating, so you might have to wait or go for a stroll along Polk St. I've noticed they have some great staff there, one of whom was particularly kind and friendly to my child.
author: J K.

description: Mmmm peanut butter mixed into vanilla frozen yogurt with chocolate chips on top.
author: Jason T.

description: Love!  Love everything about this place!  The vanilla rice pudding is so, so good and the people who work behind the counter are always so sweet!  I haven't tried any of the toppings, but that's next on my to do list.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Almond butter rice pudding.  Sounds gross, doesn't it?  That's what I thought until I tasted it -- soooo good.  

When I was here they had about 6-8 rice pudding flavors.  The friendly woman behind the counter let us taste almost each one before we made our selection.  They all tasted really fresh and wholesome, with a lot of cool flavors.  I'll never think of rice pudding the same way.   

However, you'll have to take the yummy stuff to go.  When I was there, there wasn't a table or chair in sight.  Also, it seemed like the interior could use some work.  But if you are in the 'hood take some of this stuff home with you.
author: Ryan L.

description: Yummy froyo with great fresh ingredients! -1 star for only accepting cash.
author: Ryan W.

description:
A place to get coffee on a corner that badly needed it ... yes there's a Royal Ground a few blocks away, but as someone who waits at one of the two nearby bus stops, I appreciate a place I can dash to and from quickly. 

Which is fine since you can't hang out here for long anyway. There's no place to sit and nothing to look at when you're inside. Nothing but three casserole dishes of pudding and a row of bottled water in the cooler when I went in (7:30 am). 

Coffee station was also bare, which is too bad because their coffee is GREAT. Like boutiquey, bluebottle good. My coffee additive choices were half-n-half and sugar. And my cup size options were Small and Smaller. 

Oh well, I'll probably come back a lot.
author: Jena E.

description:
I would come here for the rice pudding but not the froyo - the froyo was pretty watery (or I guess there were too many crystals).  
The rice pudding was yummy, I haven't had rice pudding much, this was good but maybe a tad too sweet.  
Wish it was a "warmer" place - not really a place where you want to hang out.
author: Cathy L.

description: Are they sure this stuff is healthy?? It tastes way too good to be frozen yoghurt.
author: Zen K.

description: Great neighborhood dessert spot. I usually order the same thing (yes, I'm predictable) but there are so many combinations that sound yummy. The service is a little slow but the staff is very friendly and accommodating of different requests. In addition to the mix-your-own yogurt, I also really like the coffee milkshake (forget the actual name).
author: Amy F.

description: Sooooooo nice!! And to see them make your Frozen Yogurt to order... doesn't even compares to pre made ones.
author: Maria C.

description: What a fun little place! You can design your own frozen yogurt. Brilliant! I am definitely a fan but I noticed that there is only one person who helps out and if there are a lot of people in line it might take a while. There are only 3 seats inside and a bench outside so it's an "eat'n'go" type of thing. I love it anyways!
author: Oyo S.

description: The concept is not new. The yogurt is good; however, most of the yogurt was left in the mixing contraption which made for a skimpy portion (note---I paid for a LARGE). The person behind the counter was humorless and not at all welcoming. There were no other customers and she clearly wasn't interested in providing a bit of customer service. It was clearly our first time and will be my last. Too many froyo places with decent counter folks.
author: Minou V.

description: When a froyo place is open till 10 pm at night, how can you not be stoked about that.  My friend Asami brought me here to grab late night froyo before my drive back to South Bay.  I'll definitely be visiting here more often.
author: Shad B.

description: Had the coconut rice pudding which was flavorful. Fewer stars for the bad service. The guy working was uninviting and didn't really make us want to be there.
author: Henri G.

description: Who knew rice pudding could be the main draw to a foodshop? Creative yummy flavors and servings are huge! The small is enough for two people really. I really liked the peanut butter. It didn't have a strong jiffy-like flavor, it was more of a chopped Thai peanut sauce flavor, very light. Just right. The cinnamon rum raisin was also yummy for those who like raisins. Cute little cheery yellow place. Service at the counter very friendly. They even let you sample before you buy. Cute spot.
author: Farah S.

description:
Heaven on earth! The frozen yogurt is fabulous.... this is how it works:

- select your non fat yogurt (chocolate or vanilla)
- select your mix ins from a lengthy list of temptations
- they blend your concoctions 
- they lovingly DOUBLE churn your yogurt mix

so, so delicious. my only warning is that if you go with friends you may leave in a legitimate fight over whose loving cup was better

a few flavor recommendations after taste testing, you can't go wrong with these!: 
peanut butter, nutella, vanilla
nutella, banana, vanilla
strawberry, nutella, vanilla
junior mints, vanilla


ps-the rice pudding is decent, but not out of this world. stick with the froyo!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Is rice-pudding a Bay Area thing? Is fro-yo/rice pudding the dessert movement of the west similar to the very-far-behind-the-curve cupcake-movement of the Washington DC area? I don't know.

Fortunately - I only sublet in Russian Hill for a month - and found Loving Cup in the third of my fourth week living there. Otherwise, I'd probably be broke.

I am more of a yogurt fan than rice pudding - so I will speak to how the vanilla/oreo mix captured my lactose intolerant heart the moment I took my first bite. Terrible shame they are having trouble with their dairy-free provider now and are not stocking it on the menu - so I suffer through - the dairy, the love that is put in that cup. If I have to be 'good' and eat frozen yogurt over ice cream (ala Swensons) - I'll take it.

My wallet needs a rest though - I still find myself wanting to 'travel' for a visit to Loving Cup. 

ps- awesome, friendly staff - always.
author: Jessica M.

description: Oh Loving Cup, why must you be on my walk to and from class? Why must your thin mint ice cream be so amazing? I am going to be broke and five hundred pounds in about three months, but I'll be smiling the whole way. Friendly staff, fun music, great ice cream. They make my day.
author: Beth K.

description: Loving cup is known for their coconut rice pudding on the 7x7 Big Sweet, but what they should be on the 7x7 for is their yogurt! I had the strawberry shortcake yogurt combo which takes a yogurt base, mixes it with toppings in a special shaker machine, and waa-lahhh!! Perfectly delicious yogurt which they claim is fairly healthy! How healthy?? I'm not quite sure, but hey, when it tastes that good, who cares!?
author: Kristen C.

description: Not self serve Froyo, but good nonetheless. I recommend getting peanut butter and animal crackers with a vanilla Froyo base :)
author: Leemor Y.

description: Love the rice pudding.  The Fro Yo not so much.
author: John K.

description:
Been to this place two times. One time they had run out of rice pudding 2nd time they only had 2 flavours left.

the food is OK the service and attitude of the staff is below poor if you like rice pudding maybe try else where unless you like a attitude to go with!

amazing how bad staff can leave a bad impression on customers wont go back again!
author: Mark H.

description:
my boyfriend is a diehard frozen yogurt devotee, so we felt it necessary to locate a frozen yogurt shop during our week-long stay in san francisco. we had passed by some chain shops, but my bf disapproved of them, for some unknown reason. we randomly spotted loving cup during a quick drive down polk st., and later walked to the shop from our hotel, a short two-block trip. 

we only expected to satisfy our frozen yogurt craving for the week, but ended up going three days straight. loving cup is actually known for their rice pudding, but serve frozen yogurt as well as shakes and smoothies. we got the yogurt of course; you have a choice between vanilla, chocolate, and non-dairy, and have the option of adding on fruits, nuts, and what-have-you to create your sweet treat. the yogurt and toppings are then blended in a machine, and the outcome is perfect: icy sweet, and you can still taste the individual ingredients you added in!

i ordered their vanilla bean rice pudding on my last day, and it was delicious. the only downside is that additional ingredients are 75¢ each, but worth it if you visit once in awhile. (it can becomes quite hefty if you visit daily, unless you can afford it.) because of that, i limited my selection to just strawberries, though i wished to try it with steamed milk as well.

the interior is cute and quaint. the staff is really friendly and their work environment resembles a clean and homey kitchen. the place is small though; there are approx. 6 seats available. 

even though it was cold in sf, it was worth the windy trek for froyo 3 days in a row!
author: Jeane C.

description:
In need of some frozen yogurt, I walked by the cute little place and couldn't resist walking in.  The name itself is just adorable.  As I am new to this general area, frozen yogurt is a staple dessert for me and this place has it!

Every frozen yogurt is mixed in their mixing machine.  This makes it so the yogurt has your topping in it!  Sweet!  I have become addicted to the vanilla yogurt with bananas and chocolate chips as the yogurt goes from tasting like vanilla to bandanna!  All of the fruit there looks great, but I am truly addicted to the banana. 

The only thing negative about this place is that there is only one mixer which could make the process slow if there are several people waiting in line for yogurt.  But even if there was a line, oh well, because this place is just too good to pass up.
author: Cara D.

description: During my previous visits I had their froyo or smoothie. Both of which were only okay .. maybe because I haven't found the right blend or preferences. I came in and sampled the English toffee .. and OMG it was amazing! I'm not even a fan of rice pudding. YUMMM!!!!
author: Jen P.

description: Wow! I had a vanilla with oreos and Nutella. They blend everything together, it's delicious! Best yogurt I've ever had. This is where you will experience your first yogasm.
author: Jul T.

description:
Loving Cup offers a rotating variety of about five or six rice puddings that change daily. They also offer coffee, smoothies, and frozen yogurt. The puddings are made with healthy, natural ingredients (i.e. nonfat milk, etc.).

When I first moved to the city two months ago, I nearly stopped in my tracks when I saw that there was a rice pudding shop just a few short blocks away from my house. After diving in to a small vanilla bean rice pudding (my boyfriend got a chocolate frozen yogurt with creamy peanut butter mixed in), we both decided that we did not want this place going out of business. 

Well, we've certainly done our part to keep the place in business. I'm there about 1-2 times a week. My go-to is a small rice pudding: I love the coconut, peanut, vanilla, rum raisin, and lemon. I also love their Cubano espresso: a shot of espresso pulled through packed brown sugar, which gives the espresso an interesting flavor of caramelized sugar. 

Note: Loving Cup only accepts cash. 

They also have a frequent buyer card, which you can get punched each visit and get a free small pudding after 9 visits. (Although some cashiers seem a tiny bit reluctant to punch it, which I find strange.)

Decor is sunny and cheerful. If you like frozen treats, you have to try the frozen yogurt with an item blended in. Be sure to taste test the rice puddings before you buy, too-- it makes it more fun!
author: Lauren M.

description:
Such an adorable fro-yo, pudding, sweet shop. Very nostalgic feel. Small, simply decorated interior with a few places to sit inside and outside. I have yet to try the pudding, which seems like what' their known for, or were before the fro-yo craze hit. But their fro-yo is my favorite I've ever had. Simple, you pick either vanilla or choc. Then you decide what you want as your 'topping' instead it's not just a topping they mix it all up. I'm a peanutbutterholic so any time pb is an option no matter how much I may want something else or how curious I am to a different flavor I just can't pull the trigger to stray. So unfortunatley I can't speak to many other options. But i gotta say everything I've mixed with the pb has been bomb. My latest favorite is vanilla base, with peanutbutter and bananas. They put it all in this machine and it churns it all up. AND oh the best part is the peanut butter is fresh made there in the shop! They also do almond butter. 
My pal that I usually go w/ is a sucker for nutella - so she does that and it's delish as well. Very good spot, go there instead of tutti melon next time you're on polk and you won't be disappointed.
author: Audrey V.

description:
you know when you date the best guy ever and they set the bar so high that everyone else after that, even if they look like hollywood royalty and treat you like a princess, are so far beneath.

i'm afraid after loving cup, all other frozen yogurt just won't please. 

new addiction! yayaya!
(favorite in order: vanilla + pb + banana, vanilla + strawberry, chocolate + coconut)
author: Coco E.

description:
I'm not in the neighborhood very often anymore, but I always seem to find a new gem when I have the time to wander. I am so thrilled to have happened upon Loving Cup!

I was on my way to a client yesterday when I walked by the place. Rice pudding is an unusual dessert item to see here on the West Coast, so I was intrigued.I am a gluten-free eater, so any place that has a treat that is gluten-free is a bonus. I was warmly greeted by Liz, the proprietress. She is proud of her shop and she has reason to be. Bright, clean, and comfy place with a nice display of the fare. 

I tasted the Madagascar Vanilla pudding and was duly impressed. Not too sweet, tasted from-scratch homemade. I purchased a "small" (plenty of pudding for a 2:45pm snack) with Lemon Vanilla and a bit of Nutella. It's cool, creamy, and delightfully earthy. Those of you who are lemon fans, the Lemon Vanilla satisfies - you can see the lemon zest in the stuff. And Nutella fans will love her recipe. Yum yum yum! And everything seems to be organic, and eco-friendly compostable spoons provided. Did not try the pro-biotic frozen yogurt, but will next time.

Oh, and the 'Churros' cinnamon crisped rice treat! What a hit. Haven't seen it anywhere else and it's fantastic.

Thanks, Liz! I hope Loving Cup is around for a long time. I might be finding myself over in Russian Hill a bit more often now...
author: Lara K.

description: Just got back from a weekend SF trip with my hubby and daughter.  We had a sweet tooth one night and Yelped for a good place.  This place had good review and we love rice pudding so we took the cable car out here.  Absolutely delicious.  We have the Rum Raisin and Coconut.  Loved It!  Can't comment on their other stuff because we didn't try anything else.
author: Teresa N.

description: Rice pudding is the shiz, and they blend your yogurt ingredients TWICE!! Def going back to convert some more friends. The best fro yo in the city.
author: Drew B.

description:
Yum! The rice pudding is delicious--the perfect ratio of creamy pudding to rice. The frozen yogurt was great too--the vanilla with english toffee is great because you get the awesome chunks whirled in there.

Love that the nutrition is posted--only 130 calories (or something) for the small cup of rice pudding which was half the calories I had thought I was eating. A small cup is more than enough. 

Only down side is that the people that work here can be seriously rude and Debbie Downers. Cheer up, guys! It's called LOVING cup.
author: Abbie B.

description:
Loving Cup is the only place I know in SF that has rice pudding.  I'm a huge fan of rice pudding.  All the flavors are heavenly...even though there are only about 5 flavors per day.  It's definately no match compared to Rice to Riches (NYC), but it's pretty good.  

They have other treats too, such as frozen yogurt, etc.  I have no tried those yet, but they do look good.  If you like rice pudding, then you must try this place.
author: Annie S.

description: Wow. Super delicious! I tasted a bunch of the rice puddings but decided to go for froyo. I got vanilla with pistachios and was in heaven. The froyo is not as creamy as most froyo is but that's kinda what I liked about it. It was almost like a italian ice that had some cream and was shaped like froyo with great flavor and good texture. I definitely want to get the rice pudding when I am more in the mood for it. And I want to try the chocolate!
author: Lauren A.

description: This place is about rice pudding.  They make extremely high quality rice pudding in a variety of flavors.  It is worth while to go out of your way to try this stuff.  I'm tempted to deduct a star because of all the calories, but instead I'll just suggest that you plan to share a cup with someone special.
author: Art A.

description: I stumbled upon this place by accident and walked in thinking I would grab a cup of coffee. However, the minute I walked in coffee was suddenly the last thing on my mind. The front counter display offered a variety of amazing looking rice puddings, but the thing that caught my eye was the giant frozen yogurt and mix-in's sign. That is, you have the ability to choose between nonfat vanilla or chocolate frozen yogurt and have anything mixed in--ranging from frozen fruit to any type of candy/syrup you can think of. I got vanilla with raspberry and it was delicious! Also the woman behind the counter was lovely--super helpful!
author: Lauren J.

description:
my new favorite froyo stop in the city!

went here last night for dessert with Cathy Y. and we were both drawn to the frozen yogurt machine.  I don't think i'm a fan of rice pudding, but the flavors looked interesting and like something i may someday branch out and try again.  

but on to the froyo.  this is the best execution i've seen of the 'we blend it for you in a machine'.  i had some really nasty blueberry blended disgustingness a few weeks ago somewhere else, so i was a little skeptical, but quickly my fears were assuaged.  the flavors that come out of this machine! the amalgam of toppings and base yogurt! i got a combination of nutella and english toffee and was so happy with the result.  I will come out of my way (though when you live 10 blocks away, is it really 'out of the way'?) for this froyo.  it was thick, filling, tasty, perfect.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: Love the staff they are super friendly and will let you sample as many flavors as needed.. This review is for their rice puddings because that is all I ever get when I come here, it is soooo amazing. I seriously never cared for rice pudding until a friend forced me to try this place. I am obsessed, the cookies and creme rice pudding is the best thing I've ever had!
author: Sadie L.

description:
Have you noticed that there is a near perfect correlation between affluent San Francisco neighborhoods and the density of yogurt/fro-yo/ice cream spots? 

My first thought, "Just what we need! Another froyo place."

But Loving Cup proved me wrong. Quality ingredients, attention to detail, generous portions that almost justify a bare minimum $4.50 cup o' love because its so healthy, sustainable and totally big enough to share (share?). Plus its really good. Try the vanilla with fresh strawberries and English toffee. 

Bottom line: best way to get a (natural, organic, sustainable, totally morally and politcally correct) sugar high that will make you forget about spending $5 for a cup of frozen yogurt!
author: Claire G.

description: I've only gone for the frozen yogurt and it's sooo good! I get the thin mint which is vanilla fro-yo, junior mints, and oreo cookies. I really like they they put all the ingredients together in this crazy machine so that they are mixed evenly. They also have stamp cards for regulars which you've gotta love!
author: Jamie E.

description: I'm a loving cup addict...literally! The frozen yogurt is SO good and I love that they mix all the toppings into the yogurt for even better taste.  Go and try it-you'll love it too!
author: Tiffany K.

description: I bought 2 living social deals for $10 for $20 to spend. And of course, like the procrastinator that I am, I waited until the last day to use them. The worker was real cool and let me use both of them. Can you imagine what $20 can get you at a fro-yo/rice pudding place? WOW the wonders they make with their rice pudding. They all looked so yummy but I chose one cup of cookies and cream and one cup of almond praline rice pudding. Then i got one cup of strawberry banana fro yo and one cup of just banana. Sounds like a lot but i promise i didnt eat it all by myself. i gave them away and everyone LOVED them. I will definitely go back but wont leave with all of that next time.
author: MONICA G.

description:
I just finished working out at the gym and wanted to find a somewhat healthier treat to relax post-work out last night.  I searched for places that were still opened at 9:30 p.m. for smoothies on Yelp and was easily persuaded to try Loving Cup by all the  great reviews. 

I ordered frozen yogurt (vanilla with strawberries and bananas) and my boyfriend ordered a smoothie (Peaches 'n Creme).  The frozen yogurt was amazing! I agree with Connie C., I'm already thinking of what combination I want to get for my next visit.  I definitely want to give the rice pudding a try some time since it was completely sold out last night.  The smoothie was also really good, but I think I'm going to stick with my frozen yogurt.  

The prices weren't bad, but if you're use to going to places that charge by the ounce it's going to cost you a little more.  The price difference is definitely worth it.  I know for sure I'm not going back to any of those frozen yogurt places. 

I'm definitely super excited for my next visit! This place is a must try for everyone!
author: Michelle T.

description: I love love love Loving Cup. I love their coffee, I love their rice pudding (mmmmm coconut), and I LOVE their chocolate fro-yo (especially since I have been on a diet and it's actually not that bad for you). They have lots of great mix-ins and their staff is always ready to suggest something new to try. I also appreciate the fact that they are really cool about giving samples of the rice pudding because sometimes I just want a little taste with my chocolate yogurt. :)
author: Jess B.

description: IMO the best fro yo in SF (and I have tried a lot...)
author: Kelly D.

description: Pumpkin Rice Pudding to die for!!! I chatted up the owner of this place after a friend of mine brought me here...so glad I did, she's got a charming personality and amazing rice pudding!!!  Another noteworthy comment...she uses all compostable products!  This soup lady will be back:)
author: Brooke C.

description: I love the idea of this place. Alone that gets 5 stars. If you like your food "sweet", be careful what you order. I've been here 5 times. Pudding, definitely great, heavy, and filling, and it's awesome. 5 stars on that. But some of the shakes just don't have the sweetness one expects I always add the sweet after I get it. It's a great place if you want rice pudding though.
author: J. Avid P.

description: Per my previous yelp, do not miss the pudding and frozen yogurt. Some of the best I've ever had. And as I learned today, if you are in need of a caffeine fix, you won't go wrong with the sugar infused cuban latte. The flavor was outstanding, with only the price ($4) holding it back from five stars.
author: Jason B.

description: It doesn't come close to marco polo but it's a good neighborhood spot if you want a quick healthy sweet fix.  I think the base fro yo (vanilla) is a bit strong and over powers other add-in flavors. I was hoping for a place like Angora's in Boston for a good custom-made fro yo fix.  This comes close - but it's not there yet.  It's very clean and the workers are always friendly though, which i like.
author: Theresa N.

description:
i'm not a huge rice pudding person, but i applaud a place who has the balls to market a rice pudding shop.

lucky for me, this place is in my 'hood and offers frozen yogurt with a variety of mix-ins.  my fave mix-ins would be nutella or english toffee.
author: Helen T.

description: We ended up going here a few more times on vacation, as we both couldn't get this place out of our heads. Perfect thin mint- we loved it! Gotta franchise this place Loving Cup!
author: Julie H.

description: Mmmm, rice pudding at it's best. A medium was huge. I got just plain vanilla, because that is what I am used to, but next time I am thinking of trying the orange creamsicle. My wife had the frozen yogurt, and kept talking about the fresh banana flavor, and how it was one of, if not the best fro yo, she has ever had. She kept talking about what flavor she would try next time with her chocolate, banana mix, which delighted me, because I want to go back too.
author: Kayte B.

description: A wonderful neighborhood spot with a quirky approach to frozen yogurt. While a bit taboo, the rice pudding / frozen yogurt combo is delicious.
author: Adam C.

description:
Forget the FroYo and give me some rice pudding!    
Flavors change daily, here is what i have had so far...
Vanilla with a black bottom  = Great
Key Lime = Good
Nutella = Fair
Pistachio = Amazing 
Rum Raisin = Fair
Almond Butter = Next on the list!
author: chris p.

description:
more like, "not so loving cup."

it breaks my heart to give this place a bad review, because it shows so much promise. however, i do feel that the quality of service is just as important as the quality of your offerings...

after a late night dinner, a girlfriend and i cabbed to check this place out. it seemed like a san francisco version of rice to riches, and as a former new yorker i was thrilled!

we arrived around quarter to 10, ready to indulge in a little sweetness before calling it a night. i ended up getting the rice pudding, which wasn't bad. they had some interesting flavors, and the coconut was good. after we ordered, we sat at the counter and chatted for a bit. to our knowledge, the place didn't close until 10:30. at least that's what yelp said.

a little after 10, the girl at the register told us that they were closing and that we had to leave. thinking that i had seen that they closed later on yelp, i asked, "well don't you close at 10:30?" "no, we close at 10 tonight." well that was that. so we left.

when i checked hours on yelp again, it definitely said 10:30! friday night or not, there should be a certain amount of respect for paying customers whether or not you want to get off early to begin your weekend. i'd never experienced anything like that before, and was pretty put off by it. 

perhaps loving cup shouldn't be hiring high schoolers?
author: Jessica S.

description:
We popped into Loving Cup for frozen yogurt tonight and had a solid visit. The two guys working the shop were friendly and the yogurt is darn tasty. I had vanilla yogurt mixed with Oreos. Melissa tried vanilla plus bananas. We were both pleased with our choices and will definitely be back for more. 

While the shop is still obviously working out its kinks - like hours (a coffee/smoothie shop right at Polk and Union that opens at 11am? it's completely missing the bus stop AM coffee crowd, hmm) and inventory (they didn't have chocolate yogurt available tonight) - it's going to be a nice addition to Polk Street once they've settled in. I do think the store could have been laid out a bit better (there is no seating at all, even at what could be a cute counter area near the front window) and they need to work on hiding the storage behind the counter. 

I look forward to trying the rice pudding and welcome Loving Cup to the neighborhood.
author: Annie Z.

description:
so great if you love rice pudding.

get the vanilla bean with ganache. If you like rice pudding, you'll keep coming back to this place.
author: Rupa V.

description: Absolutely wonderful rice pudding! Try the almond one, it's incredible!
author: Daniel F.

description:
The Shop: It's really cute with the pastel yellows and blues which fits perfectly with the name of the place.

The People: The workers were all smiles and they genuinely looked like they were enjoying their work. The lady on the yogurt machine, though laboriously pumping the lever to swirl the frozen yogurt, was jolly and chatting with the cashier.

The Yogurt: I know this is a rice pudding place, but I can't deny myself frozen yogurt when it's presented to me. So I ensured that at least one of my friends were getting the rice pudding so I could at least say I had a taste and treated myself to a Vanilla frozen yogurt swirled with Strawberries. The wait was rather long since the frozen yogurt seemed to be popular but I must say, the yogurt was very good. It was really icy since they take out the blocks of frozen yogurt RIGHT before they throw it in the heavy duty "swirl"-er machine. Then they throw in a bunch of fresh strawberries and voila! I have my frozen yogurt. Not too sweet, since they were fresh strawberries, but it was a little lacking in the vanilla flavor I expected. 

The wait for the yogurt was a bit on the long side, but it was to be expected. There was a long line and everyone seemed to be ordering the  yogurt.

Overall, I liked it but maybe I would've gotten more flavor if I ordered one of the more sweetened add-ins to my yogurt.
author: Virginia C.

description:
I've been here a few times now and it's always so good! I get the frozen yogurt, so I can't say much about the rice pudding. As for the yogurt, you pick a base flavor (vanilla or chocolate), and then you can pick from an assortment of fruits and sweets (oreos, nutella, etc.) to have blended in with your yogurt. Then they go to this big blending machine, and mix everything together and it tastes delicious.

The staff is always very friendly and they have good music playing, too. Cash only, though, so make sure to bring some.

This place may have the best frozen yogurt I've ever had.
author: Naveed R.

description: I really liked their Coconut Rice pudding.  I'm generally not a fan of rice pudding, but this place had such good reviews and it's a block from my place, so I figured I'd give it a try.  I'm glad I did!!! www.bomb.com
author: Ted G.

description:
Where do you find good Bread Pudding in S.F?

I tested their Chai Rice Pudding. Taste good and I'm not a Rice Pudding Fan. Staff are Friendly and helpful. 

The have some cupcakes too, but I opted for a Double Chocolate Bread Pudding(only for Weekends). Recommend that you have them heat it up  for at least 7 mins. (Excellent when piping hot). I went there on Sunday so they must have put it in the fridge on Saturday. 
I didn't try their frozen fruit or yogurt items. (Nothing wrong with their stuff, I just make my smoothie every day and don't feel like getting any.)  They use a screw-type extruder to fuse your condiments with the yogurt. Kinda cool to watch.
Recommend this place over the Pinkberry-like places because the topping are infused in the yogurt.
author: Toeknee T.

description: Loving Cup is soooo cute! You feel like you're in a cute little vintage ice cream shop in the 50's when you're sitting in there, I just love it! Best yogurt place in the city! The workers are really sweet, too.
author: Jamie B.

description: I tried the rice pudding this time! Pistachio flavor, and it was really good. I've seriously never liked rice pudding before. Loving your cups of love, loving cup!
author: Melissa H.

description: Yummy rice pudding and yogurt, fresh, clean, lots of add in options, good coffee/espresso too. I just wish it was open later.
author: Emily C.

description: I don't like the frozen yogurt here at all. The flavor is too bland for me and e extra effort they take for each cup is nice, but to me, adds little and only furthers the wait. Not a fan.
author: Andrew H.

description: I visited San Francisco during my Spring Break. We walked into this place because one of my friends wanted Yogurt and this place had a sign that said frozen yogurt. We almost didn't try it because we were so use to having Yogurtland and Nubi's where their were toppings on the yogurt. It was only because it had the sticker "People love us on Yelp" that we even bought something. By total accident we walked into the best place we went to the entire trip. We got the flavor of the day yogurt. Strawberry Chessecake?(Vanilla, Strawberry, and Animal Crackers). The worker was also very friendly. IT WAS THE BOMB.
author: Cody Z.

description: My sister bought a groupon for here so we decided to try it out.  You can pick chocolate or vanilla and a myriad of toppings to mix it.  I did vanilla with cookie dough - it was soooo good.  My bf did oreos and vanilla and his was also super good.  We each had a small which was the perfect size.  The service was fast and good - and they have compost recycling available.  I will be walking up here from my house to reward myself with froyo!!
author: Arica V.

description: We just moved near the neighborhood and were on a desperate mission for frozen yogurt. We scoured Polk Street for about 15 minutes when we came upon Loving Cup. Pudding, intriguing. Fresh made by the cup frozen yogurt? Sold. I got the vanilla with peanut butter and it may be the best frozen yogurt I've ever had. Completely unique flavor, not your standard corner store out of the machine type, and pretty reasonably priced. The ladies who work here are are friendly and helpful. Even though we popped in about 5-10 minutes before they closed, they were more than happy to help. So glad we found our new fro yo spot so soon!!
author: Julie D.

description:
Yummy pudding and yummy frozen yogurt blend!

I went last time got a small pudding... IT WAS AMAZING!
This time I went I got a Vanilla blended with PINEAPPLE! 
Wow, so GOOD!

*thumbs up!* 

I would definitely go back! with good service or not! love it!
author: Wen T.

description: I was very much looking forward to coming here as many people have recommended it; however, the staff was so arrogant and decided to close early and not serve us. It seems that if they feel they want to be done for the night, they do not need your business.
author: Candice W.

description: Rum raisin rice pudding=very good (if you like rice pudding). Americano=watery (but that's not what we came for).
author: Davis V.

description: My favorite frozen yogurt spot in SF! Always friendly service and they keep the shop clean. Docking 1 star because you pay $4 for a yogurt and almost all of the people who work there don't fill the cup up very high and end up throwing away half of what they create in the machine. There's one new girl that works there that actually gives the customer a good serving. Product is good but they should aim to put more yogurt in your cup for the price you are paying!
author: Christie Y.

description: I totally love this place.  It's exactly what a unique neighborhood shop should be.  I'm not wild about rice pudding, but the few times I've sampled it it's been delicious.  I am a frequent visitor for their frozen yogurt.  My favorite is chocolate with chunky peanut butter blended in, or vanilla with Oreo.  The staff is always really friendly, and the quality is always excellent.  I can't imagine Polk Street without this joint.
author: Josh G.

description: I was driving in Russian Hill, saw the sign, immediately braked and started looking for parking. A rice pudding shop?! Are you kidding me?? Turns out this place was A-MAZ-ING. This IS true love in a cup. TRUE LOVE.
author: Alex H.

description:
Really friendly staff, and the rice pudding was pretty good.  Definitely will go back.  Its a bummer there's only like 5 flavors every day, and they aren't predictable.  But you can always find one that's yummy.  

It's definitely not NY's Rice to Riches, which is one of my fav's.  But LC is someplace I'll frequent being only six blocks away.
author: Julie E.

description: Grandma is going to have a little competition with this one. Love the variety. Great tasting, makes me want to come back for more!
author: Belinda M.

description: I'm a sucker for rice pudding and after stumbling onto Loving Cup, I've found a new "have to go out of my way" place to visit.  The flavors available that day were nutella, madascar vanilla and cinnamon rum raisin.  You can top them off just like a sundae.  Coffee lovers should ask for the shot of espresso (Barefoot Coffee).  It is a wonderful mess, but it will wire you up for the rest of the day.  Since the flavors rotate and I missed the peanut butter, I'll be back real soon.
author: Jason A.

description:
(Based on the frozen yogurt alone) 
Congratulations Loving Cup on thinking up an idea that forces me to want to come back, many times. 

At this fro yo spot you pick vanilla or chocolate, and then which toppings you want them to mix in. That's right, mix in, not just put on top.  Being that it was my first time, I really had no idea what to try, but I wanted it to come out good! I heard someone else in line order chocolate with banana and animal crackers. Sounded pretty good. I asked the friendly guy working there for a recommendation and he suggested vanilla with strawberries and chocolate ganache... so I went with it. So good and unique! 

Now I just have to go back because I'm curious about that chocolate/banana/animal cracker combo. I'm also looking forward to reading some yelp reviews to learn what other awesome concoctions people have come up with. Can't wait to go back. CASH ONLY.

Oh and yelp you need to update their hours! According to their website they are open 11-9:30 M-F and 11-10:30 Sat & Sun.
author: Caitlin B.

description: Bf had vanilla frozen yougurt with bannanas and gunmy bears. I had a small rice pudding with 2 flavours: coconut and rum raisin. I have been wanting to come here for awhile. Super nice young black guy working the counter, very outgoing and very conversational. First off, a small rice pudding is huge. Definitely good for 1 person, and i would've split it w/ my boyfriend if he liked rice pudding. coconut had lovely tender flakes of coconut, rum rasin was cinnamony ad had plenty of raisins. I did feel like there was alittle something missinh though, perhaps vanilla. They had vanilla rice pudding, but there should b alittle vanilla in each. I feel like it was lacking alittle flavour. The frozen yougurt machine was really cool! They put in frozen bananas and the machine mixed it up completely to the point that there were no banana bits that i could even taste, it just made the frozen yougurt taste like banana- which was really cool. Gummybears were topped on top, and they were fresh too however they freeze and get harder 2 chew- which just happens if you put them on something cold. The guy said they get realy busy super late at night for some reason. Afew bar stool seats w/ coutertop facing window inside, and a little bench outside. Really cute, friendly, and clean shop, and they certainly give you your money's worth!
author: Brittainie B.

description: Couldn't find a place specifically dessert-oriented in the area so ended up here, attracted by its clean retro look.
