After trying the specialty of the house, the rice pudding, I wasn't too impressed - don't get me wrong, it's not bad, it's not super, for the price...well...let me quote "MEH, I've experienced better." It's just rice pudding, prices must be lowered or some truly unique and exceptional flavors should be invented.
author: Paolo D.

description: Came in for its rice pudding. Tried their almond butter, it was disgusting! Not sure if it was only for that flavor or what. Service was just okay. They also have frozen yogurt, but it takes long time to wait for your cup. My boyfriend said it tasted like thicken smoothie, it was not bad but it was not froyo. I expected a lot for the rice pudding, may give it another try next time I am in the area.
author: Gillian G.

description: As a big froyo and rice pudding fan, this is one of my favorite places in the city!  The frozen yogurt is mixed together for you and incredibly fresh.  The rice pudding is also delicious and they often have seasonal flavors.  My favorite is Nutella, Granola and Pistachio vanilla froyo!  Parking can be tough in this area, but it is worth the trip!
author: Erin C.

description: Vanilla bean rice pudding = love at first bite
author: Wei L.

description:
Organic frozen yogurt has really been making a big splash in SF, and Loving Cup is one of the better ones out there.  Yesterday, while ambling around Russian Hill, I couldn't resist walking into this cute shop after some window shopping.  I was initially drawn in to sample the rice pudding, thinking it would be orgasmically similar to Manhattan's Rice To Riches, but it's not nearly as sinful given it's made with non-fat milk.  It's a healthy indulgence to be sure, but it could use a little more fat to qualify as a true comfort food.  I opted for a small chocolate frozen yogurt instead, and watched as she used the frozen yogurt machine to mix it.  It's actually really cool!  
The first bite of the yogurt was chocolately with a slight yogurt tang, but all that melted away with subsequent spoonfuls.  It was slightly sweet, clean tasting and refreshing!  Though not as good as Fraiche (which just opened up on Fillmore!!!), I liked it nearly as much and walked back into the store to ask for my frequent buyer card.  It's definitely a place I'd go to if I was in that neighborhood!
author: Janet L.

description: The chocolate fro-yo with toffee blended in is an excellent combination.  The real star for me is the rice pudding.  I love rice pudding and you hardly ever see it anywhere.  I tried the pistachio and then ordered the rum raisin.  Both are amazing!  If I'm ever back in this hood I'll be there to try the other flavors.
author: Corey V.

description: I thought I'd give this place a try one evening and I was anticipating some awesome rice pudding since it's a $5 cup (IMO that's a lot of money for some rice pudding). I was really disappointed! I've made better pudding myself and seriously the pudding tasted no better than the one I've bought at Trader Joe's except I was paying more and getting less. I was so annoyed!!! Didn't try the frozen yogurt and I don't think I will do so because I was so annoyed by the not so yummy rice pudding.
author: Joy H.

description: So good!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Vanilla, Jr Mints and Oreos. Ummmm
author: amy r.

description: I was sceptical.  I'm not a fro-yo fan to begin with, I'd rather have gelato or ice cream.  I also have to admit the way the fro-yo is extruded isn't the most appetizing of sights.  I saw that they had a base flavor and that you could mix in Nutella.  So I had one and oh my god it's like naught it's so good!  Kinda like you're taking down the whole jar and a) it's perfectly acceptable and b) you're not consuming the calories...which ordinarily I don't care about but when you feel like you're taking down the nutella jar, kinda comes into play.  I'm hooked!
author: Kirsten M.

description: Vast variety of rice puddings and different flavors of fresh blend froyo in my favorite neighborhood. You'll find me here on the next warm day in the city.
author: Katie K.

description: Best rice pudding I've ever had.  Fun place to come for a quick dessert fix. The sprinkled nutmeg on top of vanilla bean rice pudding is absolutely delicious.
author: Chris S.

description: Love it!  Especially since it is so close to home! The Madagascar Vanilla (favorite!) is delicious and so is the rum raisin.  The toppings are unlimited and I am always switching it up. YOu have to do it right! The price is fair for the cups. All the gals who work here are complete dolls and super friendly. I will forewarn you it is addicting! :)
author: Tiffany L.

description: Rum Raising rum with whipped cream on top, one of those pleasures that are impossible to resist
author: Alex A.

description: I had high expectations for a shop dedicated primarily to rice pudding. My primary complaint is that there aren't that many different flavors. I had hoped for unusual flavor combinations in the same vein as Humphry Slocombe, but settled for plain because the rum raisin and coconut flavors didn't appeal to me. The quantity was a bit much for a small, but the price wasn't too high. Meanwhile, my boyfriend enjoyed his mini cupcake.
author: Susan J.

description: My friend's girlfriend found this online and wanted to hit it up on her visit out here.  My friend knows I love anything that has rice in it so he took me here for the rice pudding and I've going ever since.  My favorite thing is the (small) cinammon rum raisin rice pudding with the black bottom (chocolate).  I've had the others and sometimes I get half and half but I hardly stray from the cinammon rum raisin unless they're out of it.  Just a warning....cash only.
author: Chris A.

description: Toffee rice pudding was awesome, I just wanted more and more! I wasnt interested in any of the others though, so maybe they could work on more offerings.
author: Eric A.

description:
can i give this place 10 stars?

i just got back from my umpteenth time here... and this time, i branched out further from my usual plain vanilla. thanks to the good advice of vanessa and christina, i am now convinced this is the most amazing froyo i've ever had, ever, even more than i thought before. (my uncle owns his own chain of frozen yogurt shops and i prefer this place wayyyy more. shhh! don't tell). 

vanilla bananarama for the win!
author: Michelle K.

description: Sooo a little history I'm a bit of an ice cream whore and have always snubbed the froyo places. deeming them not adequate. Well Ya walk in and the counter is on the left seems like a cozy place.. So how it works you start with a base. Vanilla or Choclate. Then you add your topings whether it's oreo, almonds or what ever. They take out your choice of base in a hockey puck shape out of a bag. put it in a grinding machine then they add the toppings. They run it through twice to make sure it is all fused together well. I chose choclate and oreo's since I'm a newbie to this place i wanted to go basic. Well to my delight this was fantastic. I am a fan and would love to try many of there other wonderful selections.
author: Chuck G.

description:
Update:  Went back...the yogurt nazi's were gone, and the new people (as well as the super sweet owner) were great.  In regards to the yogurt, I might try to have some toppings on top as I do miss sometimes having crunchy shit in my yogurt.  Thanks Liz and team for a good experience today...the slate has been wiped clean!  Besides, how can you not love a place named after one of my favorite songs and that has great pics of one of my favorites bands (the Stones) on the wall.

Hmm...so this is weird.  About two months ago I was singing some serious praises for this place in my "My City" write-up in the Examiner (http://www.sfexaminer.com/entertainment/My-City-Banana-bread-frogurt-and-taking-in-a-game-43550157.html) and tonight I just had one of the worst "dining" experiences I've had in a while.  There used to be two really, really sweet, cool girls who worked all the time, what happened to them?  

Anyway...so like usual, me and a couple of friends go to Loving Cup excited to eat some good frozen yogurt.  We walk in, take a look at the toppings while trying to figure out what which ones we wanted and then bam!...all of the sudden, some really rude voice from behind the counter says "You know, everything you see there is on the wall listed".  It wasn't just said in a helpful voice, but in a rude, "hurry up" voice.  What if I wanted to look at the toppings versus read words such as "Junior Mints"?  Strike one.  Then, as we are deciding what we want (and letting people go ahead of us), the same girl (heavy-set, blonde hair) says "let's start with chocolate or vanilla, then go from there", again rushing us.  Strike two.  I then make my decision..."I'll have half chocolate, half vanilla" and she says "you may as well just get all chocolate, it will taste the same" and me and my friends look at each other puzzled.  How will half chocolate and half vanilla taste the same as all chocolate?  Just doesn't make sense.  Let me just order what I want...I'm the paying customer...right?  Strike three.  I then tell this very unhappy girl what I want, they make it (won't make a big deal that it was much less yogurt than usual)  and when I go to pay and ask for the punch card and the punches for me and my two friends (which I paid for) and she said "only one punch per visit."  Um, we bought three things...why only one punch?  She then realized that was absurd and then gave us one punch each on three separate cards.  I said "that isn't how punch cards work normally in restaurants" and she said "people have really been taking advantage of the punch cards."  That's her response...really?  Taking advantage of punch cards.  Loving cup owners...I think you should install a punch card security system to crack down on those "punch stealers".  This is absurd.  So yeah...the other guy working really wasn't too nice either and hasn't been the last couple of times I've been there but this girl really left a mark.  

Congrats Loving Cup, it's been about a year since I've posted a review, good or bad, but tonight just couldn't go untold.  Still deciding if I will return, but I do know one thing...I'll never list them as my favorite yogurt place again.
author: Jared P.

description: Great rice pudding, awesome they have nutella.  The bearded guy behind they counter gave me some great life advise too!
author: Sean G.

description: I'm giving this place a 5 star only because its a new unique experience. Rice Pudding is one of my faves and when I was just driving around to waste some time before I had to leave I found this. Had to park and go in. I had the cookies and cream rice pudding. Medium size. Perfect size and oh sooo yummy.
author: Amy L.

description: I am a big fan of frozen yogurt.  I have been to most places in the Marin, Pac Heights, and Russian Hill areas and Loving Cup is by far my favorite.  I am there at least once a week.
author: Anne T.

description: ok, this place is so good. i love it so much. i'm not a fan of plain, but a cup of plain vanilla rice pudding is enough for me. DELISH! go get some. and tip the server - they're sweet!
author: Regina T.

description: Incredibly delicious! I was surprised that one of the first locations on a search for yogurt near Polk St. turned out to be so good. We had both the rice pudding - rum raisin, and the homemade, probiotic, local, nonfat- all those things that they advertise- mango yogurt. Both were good, but the rice pudding was amazing. If I lived locally, I would be found there everyday.
author: Danielle r.

description:
My favorite frozen yogurt ever!!!  Start with a vanilla or chocolate base, and then mix in as many toppings as you want (fruit/nuts/candy/sweet sauces).  It's like a Dairy Queen Blizzard/McDonalds McFlurry but yummier!  The fact that I live just up the street means I will be here way too often.

I'm not a big rice pudding fan, but I've heard that it's good.  They sell coffee and cupcakes as well, but I'm all about the fro-yo!
author: J C.

description: Yummy stuff!  The machines they use to blend ingredients into the yogurt are pretty nifty to watch.  Wish they offered more than just vanilla and chocolate yogurt.  Will have to come back to try one of their many flavors of rice pudding.
author: Becky S.

description:
i love rice pudding and can't but think this is a weird business idea to market it and that's why i like it.  it's weird because what else can follow this business style? gelato to frozen yogurt to rice pudding to tapioca or custard to jello? to oatmeal? to cream of wheat? to flavored grits? to varieties of colored mushed meat and proteins in a cup? it's wide open, i hope enough other people like rice pudding.

The shop is a cool little place, nice service, fun tasting, good treat.
author: Today Y.

description: This is by far the best frozen yogurt I have ever had! Choose your own toppings and yogurt base (vanilla or chocolate) and watch the staff churn everything together right before your eyes--nutella with vanilla is my go to. If you're not into fro yo, try the scrumptious rice pudding, homemade cupcakes, or refreshing smoothies.
author: Jackie G.

description: My sister took me here to enjoy dessert.  On the way I kept chanting that line from the movie Freaks, "A loving cup, a loving cup.  We accept her, we accept her gooble gobble, gooble gobble.  We accept her, we accept her, one of us, one of us."  I was in such a good mood and laughing because of the line that I thought I'd have fun at the restaurant.  Well it's not really a restaurant.  Unfortunately, they didn't have any seating, so we knew immediately we'd have to enjoy our  pudding elsewhere.  The employee behind the counter was very nice and he handed out samples, but it's a little strange. Every time he dipped in with a mini-spoon, it looked like he was dipping into your mama's pot of nastiness.  It just didn't look palatable.  They had only three flavors in the case when we dropped by, which were Almond Butter, Creamsicle, and Chocolate, all of which were merely okay.   My sister ordered the last bit of Madagascar Vanilla Bean, which was already packed in a medium container and the guy offered to make her a black bottom, which meant that he'd put it in another container where he smeared some Nutella on the bottom.  But did the stuff taste good?  Eh.  Quite frankly, Kozy Shack Rice Pudding, the stuff you find in your local grocery, is richer and creamier than this boutique stuff.  If you come, then make sure you bring cash.  Although there is an ATM close by, the guy didn't know where it was and it's a pain to have to go out of your way.  Oh, and by the way.  There is a cool little tip cup next to the cash register that says "Loving Cup Coffee."  I assume this was the inspiration for the store name.  But really, there was no table service, the flavor of their feature item is lacking, and they don't take credit cards.  Why would I give you a tip?  It was more of a hassle to visit place, what with the difficulty of finding parking and buying the product.
author: Babette C.

description: WOW. I love this place. I discovered it on an ideal bite email and I am so glad I found it. I hadn't known of a place that serves rice pudding other than Rice to Riches in NY (which I love and miss very much!). The first time I came here was about a month and a half ago and I come back here about every other week when I have acupuncture. My favorite rice pudding so far has been the cookies and cream. I've also very much enjoyed the orange creamcicle (especially on a hot day). The froyo is pretty delish too. Love how they mix things like fresh fruit, candy etc right into the yogurt. AHh I miss you already loving cup!
author: Trina A.

description: Had the mixed frozen yogurt. My friend and I tried 2 different ones, one with chocolate yogurt and peanut butter and the other with vanilla yogurt and cookie dough bits. The chocolate peanut butter one was pretty good but the vanilla one was TERRIBLE. It was very icy and gritty. Not sure if it was icy due to the yogurt itself or the cookie dough pieces, but for $3.75, this was way too much to pay for the quality. Also, have cash on you, else they will charge you $0.25 extra if you pay by card and don't ring up $10. Wont be returning.
author: Anonymous J.

description: I was told during my visit that seating is on the way, FYI for the reviewers that mention that.  Nice service from the proprietor's mom and most importantly, delicious creamy yogurt and rice pudding.
author: T-Bone L.

description:
curses on you loving cup!!!

why must you be across town making it a two bus venture to get to your heavenly doors? i dreamed of the chai rice pudding all night.

i love you and it's sickness.
author: Wendolyn A.

description: I've never had rice pudding in my life. This was delicious. I had a small english toffee. It was very good.
author: Johanna W.

description: Yummy! Fresh rice pudding?? *drooool* I got the vanilla and coconut in a cup, completely heavenly. The rice provides a nice texture to the smooth pudding. Definitely a good place to stop at after a trip to Umami.
author: Fiona N.

description: This is absolutely one of my favorite places in San Francisco. The Loving Cup's coconut rice pudding was listed at #15 on 7x7's "The Big Sweet SF 2010: 50 Treats to Eat Before You Die," and it definitely merits the praise. First, Loving Cup is an incredibly friendly and upbeat establishment. I've been there dozens of times, and no matter who is behind the counter, the staff is consistently full of smiles and hellos and questions about how your day is going. Second, their rice pudding is out of this world. Every day they have about 6 different flavors. My favorite is definitely the Almond Butter, but the Coconut and the Cinnamon Rum Raisin are close seconds. Their rice pudding is made from just 6 ingredients (nonfat milk, Arborio rice, eggs, sugar, salt, and vanilla bean, plus whatever flavor/topping you choose) and a small Madagascar Vanilla packs just 195 calories and 3.5 grams of fat. They also have all-natural, nonfat frozen yogurt which is hand-churned to order, and I'd imagine quite delicious, but I've historically stuck to the rice pudding. I can't help but stop into Loving Cup almost every time I walk by (which is frequently), but even if you don't live in the neighborhood, it's worth making a trip the next time you are craving something sweet!
author: Katherine K.

description:
ive never been a fan of rice pudding. 
i am now a fan.
this place is adorable.
they are best known for (at least im guessing) their rice pudding.
they had a pistachio flavor, vanilla, something else, and a chai.
it cost around 4 dollars.
it was very tasty.
smooth, nice textures, and the chai flavor was well executed. it was not overpowering. 
i felt extremely refreshed after ingesting this treat.
try it out. wonderful during the late hours.
the late hours being around 10 15 PM.

oh they have others options too...like...frozen yogurt with toppings...some cupcakes (red velvet!) and uh...oh oh some smoothies. yeah. cool place!
author: Spencer P.

description: Yum Yum Yum!! Best frozen yogurt anywhere near Polk Street! They blend whatever topping you want (and they have tons of choices!) into your yogurt; it's like customizing your own flavor. I love this place! I have also tried their all-fruit smoothies (no yogurts) and those are delicious too! You must check this place out!!
author: Anne A.

description:
Hot Apple Cider (2 stars) = Disappointment. It tasted watered down compared to the cold apple cider

Rum Raisin Rice Pudding (4 stars for flavor) = Great flavor, but um...still don't like rice pudding.
author: S. H.

description: We love this place. Always a delight coming here. Their pudding is really good, you have to try it for yourself. I can't wait for my next trip!
author: J C.

description: I couldn't resist their special today (Shouldn't of looked in their cute window front).  A couple of days ago, my neighbor told me about their chocolate peanut butter Fro-Yo as we were walking to Tuttimelon.  Now, I love me some Tuttimelon but I am feeling a bit sinister, and the chocolate peanut butter fro-yo did hit the spot (which she raved about).  It's really not that evil; afterall, it is natural, organic and local and lesser calories then ice cream.  ;-)
author: Sheila W.

description: I LOVE Loving Cup!  I am a froyo junkie and Loving Cup passes my test with flying stars!  I suggest chocolate yogurt with peanut butter or chocolate yogurt with junior mints.  The only downside is that they use frozen fruit (I like chewing through icey fruit).  Otherwise, rock on, Loving Cup!
author: Crystal K.

description: Pretty good stuff.  A great little spot, the staff is very friendly and helpful (and not in the annoyingly too helpful/friendly way).  I am not a huge fan of rice pudding, but it was as good as any other I have tasted.  They let you sample so that you can tell if you like it or not.  I usually get the frozen yogurt, which is delicious.  You pick chocolate or vanilla as a base and then a mix of anything to add in (peanut butter, sprinkles, animal crackers, gummy bears, strawberries, bananas, granola, etc).  It is put in a yogurt mixer and chopped up and stirred in... worth a stop by if you are nearby.  Descent prices.  It is also comes in compostable cups with compostable spoons... very SF.
author: Owen S.

description: 6 different type of rice pudding folks.  SIX.  Incredible staff.  I love this place.
author: Megan M.

description: After the gym, I stop over at Loving Cup for a Frozen Yogurt.  I'm currently addicted to Nutella and Banana with vanilla. It's expensive, but worth it.. No more Tuttimelon, when I'm on Polk!
author: Michael S.

description: I came here with my friends to try out their famous rice pudding.  We arrived a little before closing time and all of the rice pudding was gone!  Luckily, one of the workers had an extra order of chocolate yogurt with crunchy peanut butter and oreos that was made by mistake, which they gave to us for free!  A-mazing  Ever since then, I've been going back regularly for that same combination!
author: Jon T.

description: Mmmmmm....  Vanilla rice pudding with chocolate ganache!
author: S C.

description: Great Coffee too guys! Organic fair trade mocha's Yummie:) and they VIV.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Just discovered this place, it might just be my favorite new thing. I had no idea rice pudding could be so delicious!
author: Kelly L.

description: One of the best Yelp finds ever!  I don't even live or work in SF yet I find myself going here at least twice a week.  The vanilla & coconut are my favorite.  I will usually buy a medium of each flavor...the rice pudding lasts about 3 days in the refridgerator, so I try to spread out my portions.
author: Lisa S.

description:
a great addition to this part on polk st.  cute lil spot.  never had the fro-yo, just the rice pudding & baked goods.   LOVE their yummeee rice pudding -- so far i love the pistacchio and almond butter.    

a bit dangerous for me as it is conveniently too close to my gym.  i just need to remember to turn left away from loving cup instead of right where i wouldn't be able to resist.
author: Cindi N.

description: Loving Cup, you're so divine. One lick of you just blows my mind.
author: Nancy G.

description: Yummerfic! Their rice puddings are fantastic, the frozen yogurt "technology" with the mix ins is phenomenal! So delicious...poor Jennifer N. it's right next to her house, I wouldn't be able to keep away.
author: Rada I.

description:
Super cute! I was looking for a new froyo place to try and stumbled upon this little gem. The main feature is their rice puddings, but the froyo is my new fav in the city. I did sample the cinnamon rum raisin pudding and it was good, I'm just not into rice pudding in general. The flavors were very pronounced, though, and I'd go here if I grew up on rice pudding and actually considered it a dessert. 
Oh the froyo!! You start with base of chocolate or vanilla, then add whatever mix-ins and they swirl it up. Reminds me of Coldstone, but much more delicious and healthier!! I had vanilla mixed with organic animal crackers (the Disney ones from Costco). So perfect! Other mix-ins I remember were Oreo, peanut and almond butters and strawberries. The lady working was super nice and offered me samples of all the puddings. Also had some pastries for sale- muffins, cookies, cupcakes. The small is $3.75 and includes one mix-in. Kinda pricy,  just a bit over my limit, please don't raise prices :) Can't wait to return!!
author: Heather I.

description: Loving Cup, I love you (even though everytime I say your name, my fiance reminds me of a not so loving internet clip involving a cup...) Every Friday, I look forward to indulging in a cup of heavenly froyo for lunch.  I'm definitely a vanilla kind of gal and I usually swirl in some fruit (preferably mango or blueberry) with granola. Last week I was feeling frisky and went for sprinkles and it was well worth it.   The rice pudding is also amazing, however, I can't steer away from my true love, yogurt.
author: Mary M.

description: a store primarily dedicated to rice pudding?  odd.  but does work.  the coconut and the pistachio are definitely worthwile and the basic vanilla is the standard, not to be missed.  can't say much about this place, i guess.  what can you really say?  a store dedicated to rice pudding. yep. nuff said.
author: dan h.

description:
I've been meaning to review these guys a while now. Their drinks are a tad bit steep, but their frozen yogurt and rice pudding are totally worth their price and I have loved the chai lattes I've gotten from them. You can mix your own flavors out of either a chocolate or vanilla base and toppings.
  All their ingredients are fresh and organic, and their employees are so super, super nice. Given their yummy treats and their wonderful staff, I try to support them as much as I can.
author: A J.

description: Like most of the other reviewers, I have no idea about anything else here except the rice pudding and the hot apple cider.  The cider was lovely, fresh hot and hit the spot.  The rice pudding - - - OMG!  Wow!  I like rice pudding as much as the next person but this was really great!  They let us taste several which I always think is nice.  Really super friendly staff.  We went in after dinner on Sat nite.  I had the nutella and my bf had the coconut.  Really fabu stuff!  I would TOTALLY go back.  The flavors were amazing, portions were generous (my small was enough for 2 servings.  great midnight snack!) and the staff were friendly.  They dont take cc's but for 2 small servings and a hot cider it was only about $10ish.  We sat on the bench out front and nibbled, sipped and watched the ppl go by.
author: Amy L.

description: Whenever I decide to leave San Francisco, Loving Cup is the thing I will miss MOST about the city!!!!!!!! BEST RICE PUDDING AND FROZEN YOGURT!!!!!!! The coconut and rum raisin flavored rice puddings are delicious (get them with their black bottom-SO GOOD) and their frozen yogurt is the amazing.  I cannot say enough good things about Loving Cup.
author: Alexis L.

description: First and only fro-yo my ice-cream loving Huz ever liked. In fact, he likes it so much we went 4 nights in a row. He sez that it just doesn't have that funny aftertaste that most fro-yos do (chemical). Blending the toppings into the yogurt takes it to a whole new level too. This is my all time favorite gluten-free dessert! More more more more!
author: Cydney B.

description: The fro-yo is pretty decent. I like the concept (being able to make your own creation), but the texture is a little too icy for me. I tasted the rice pudding, and definitely think I'll come back for a cup, it was delicious! Oh and they use compostable cups and spoons which is awesome.
author: Rose K.

description:
a 3.5 for me

i wish they had WAY more flavors. 
also wished they didn't run out of Everything...seriously...ever topping i asked for, they were out...and it was a Sunday!

i had the vanilla with black bottom? (genache) with walnuts. i know. not super exciting

i have to say, i've been craving it since i had it...wish there was one in Northbeach!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: visited Loving Cup 2 days in a row. Am hooked on the coconut vanilla frozen yogurt with almond butter and granola! try it its soooo good!
author: Deanna B.

description: This place has earned a spot in our weekly desert rotation. I absolutely love the rum raisin rice-pudding and my wife always gets the pistachio. Very fresh, very good. A bit a a walk from our apartment, but well worth it.
author: David M.

description:
Amazing, organic, fresh.
New rice puddings everyday... LOVE IT!
author: Kelly O.

description: Not a fan!  Customer service sucked when I tried to use my free pudding punch card that was full because I've bought so many containers of their pudding.  My card was full but the server was so rude and put out, that I've decided to never go back ad left my card for a free pudding on the counter.
author: S W.

description: Love their Berry Banana Smoothies!  Dairy free and delicious.  Adorable place to visit in Russian Hill!
author: Lisa M.

description: I'll have to try it again...it was super hot out and the yogurt was quite melty when I got it (not so fro-yo). Also they got the peanuts from my friend's yogurt before me in mine. They had run out of vanilla (and strawberries) so I got the chocolate w/junior mint. It was good (minus the meltiness and peanut taste). I tried my friend's rice pudding, that was pretty tasty! Cash only so be prepared for that. Again, I will be open to trying again, it was during our heat wave so I think they were way more swamped than usual which would explain my couple of comments above.
author: Abby W.

description: I went here on a nice day and i think it's so cool how you choose your toppings and then they blend it in this weird drilll machine. It's almost like having a mcflurry froyo style except without them blending it with that stick and they don't blend it in the cup-- if that makes any sense. I had the vanilla base with oreos and mints so pretty much a THIN MINT. Next time I have to try their rice pudding . The lady was really nice and the shop is pretty small so don't expect to sit down. There is street/metered parking available also.
author: Iba N.

description: i love making my own concoction of sweet treats.  my last visit was coconut yogurt  with milk chocolate and pecans.  so luscious like a very dense milkshake!  i like their obscure toppings, they provide high quality sprinkles.  who wants gross gummy bears or artificially flavored crappy confections?  not i, said the lamb.
author: Noel J.

description: Good rice pudding and I would go back if in the area or I had a craving but it's definitely not the best rice pudding I've ever had.  I found it to be a little too much on the sweet side for my taste.
author: Engelbert H.

description: Dang!  Pretty cool/cute place.  You choose a base flavor (choc. vs vanilla) and then the toppings (organic fruits, nuts, org. peanut/almond butter, etcc).  They put it into this machine and whoalah!  Some crazy yogurt!  Tasty and healthy.   I picked vanilla, banana, and toffee.  Try my mix.. SOOOO good.  Gotta try their rice pudding next time.
author: Young K.

description: Killer frozen yogurt spot.  Tiny place with only a few seats, but great spot to grab a treat.  One of my girlfriends lives a few blocks from this place so I try and make it over when ever I am visiting her place.
author: Anna G.

description: the coconut rice pudding is so delish!!  haven't tried much other than that but one day i will branch out.  but for now, coconut rice pudding hits the spot!
author: Anita L.

description: Holy Mother of God - are you kidding me?  An establishment that makes and serves home made rice pudding?  Classic?  Caramel?  Pumpkin?  Other unique flavors?  SO DELICIOUS!  I will absolutely be a regular here.
author: Anna R.

description: Stopped into Loving Cup for the first time today and ordered a triple berry smoothy. Cute decor and menu. My smoothy was alright. Nothing special but had tons of fresh berries which tasted good but I ended up with dark blueberry chunks stuck in my teeth after drinking it, it was a little too chunky for my liking. The smoothy was $4.50 which isn't bad but I wish they had protein options or something else to add to it.  I'll have to revisit this if I stop back in for their fro-yo or rice pudding as it's probably not completely fair to rate them based on smoothy.
author: Lindsay A.

description:
Have only been once, but on that occasion they were: out of pistachio rice pudding, so I had to get the vanilla.  Wanted rum raisins, but they were out.  Pudding was more cream than rice, making it difficult to finish even a small.

Wife's frozen yogurt with granola and raspberries was outstanding.
author: Justin H.

description: A charming little shop selling gourmet rice pudding and frozen yogurt with mix ins. It's often a little crowded but well worth the wait. The choices are unique and delicious.
author: Ted D.

description: I just returned form a visit to Loving Cup and recieved the worst customer service possible.  The woman working the cash register rushed us for our order, was very short with us when we asked questions and was just plain rude.  While I love their frozen yogurt I will not continue to support a business that treats its customers so poorly.
author: Leona W.

description: My husband and I went to this place based on its good yelp reviews, and we were very happy.  We had a vanilla rice pudding with chocolate.  As we do not eat wheat, it was a perfect snack/dessert for us.  In addition, it was inexpensive and the staff was very friendly.  Only thing is it would be great if the smallest cup they offer is, well, smaller.  If you eat a "small" by yourself you won't be having dinner.  Sharing is a must.
author: Helena J.

description: rice pudding?  what?  who would've thought that i would like rice pudding.  I added gummy bears to my vanilla rice pudding. yum. i finished it in 2 minutes.
author: con c.

description:
I went here today and they only had 4 flavors. I was disappointed. I ended up getting a medium madagascar vanilla and pecan praline for 4.75. the lady serving me had a attitude. GEEZ be happier. its a rice pudding shop I'm not asking for much. That's why i minused a star for this place. the other ladies that werent helping me were a lot nicer!...so if you see the lady with black hair STEER CLEAR...otherwise damn good rice pudding very light in flavor.

the other 2 flavors were peanut butter and espresso. I hope to come back soon
author: Crum B.

description: If you need some tasty rice pudding in your life, (and i'm pretty sure everyone does) then you need to get your butt over to Loving Cup ASAP! Their rice pudding is perfect, and I happen to be a rice pudding expert (self-proclaimed that is). The pudding has the perfect balance of creamy subtle sweetness that makes your taste-buds feel like they have died and gone to heaven! I love the Madagascar Vanilla Bean!!
author: Henriette P.

description:
rice pudding is good.  rather, THEIR rice pudding is good.  the staff is very upbeat and friendly.  while i haven't had a chance to check out their frozen yogurt, i'd definitely like to - it looks very good.  their prices are very fair.

it's a good alternative to the fro-yo craze that's been going on.  it makes me happy.
author: Jason J.

description: Absolutely delicious ! I have never been a big fan of frozen yogurt but theirs is amazing, not too sweet and not too tart, just per-fect. Bravo !
author: Sof L.

description: off the bat i had to take off a star for the fact that you had me want you again the day after i first tried you, and your store was closed on a friday at 10 in the morning.  but on with the review.  i had the espresso rice pudding, and it was subtle and yummy.  my dude had the chocolate chip froyo.  he said that it tasted like something that you can make at home, so that means he liked it.
author: Mea W.

description:
I need to retract my previous review. This place has made some changes, and it is much better. I think they increased the portion size, which was a good move. I am now willing to pay for it. I am enjoying this place more and more. I am still only giving 3 stars because the service is slow and not friendly. 

If I owned this place I would get another yogurt machine to speed things up, and talk to my employees about putting on a smile......
author: Laura R.

description:
i have been wanting to go here for at least a month...finally i made it through the doors. i couldn't have been more welcomed in from the freezing weather.
sweet pudding and very nice people behind the counter. i ordered the rum raisin  cinnamon pudding and it couldn't be any better!!! thanks for totally meeting my expectations :) i will be back.
author: Amy S.

description: I dream about this place - their coconut rice pudding is the best thing in the world.  I honestly look forward to getting it for days.  My boyfriend loves their ice cream too - the vanilla with mixed in peanut butter and oreos.  This place is amazing.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Finally, decent homemade, consistently great rice pudding comes to SF. I guess they also have frozen yogurt with all sorts of tasty ingredients, but will all the intriguing flavored rice puddings (I had white chocolate today - damn good!) I don't know if I'll ever try them. The owner got the recipe from her mom in New Jersey and has really run with it. Everyone who works here is polite and definitely friendly. At $4.75 for a medium it is a bit pricey, but then again, so is rent on Polk St, not to mention trying to run a business in SF.
author: Nicko G.

description: The rice pudding from Loving Cup is a creamy and delicious fantasy. The only thing missing from this fantasy is a "the-yummy-guy-behind-the-counter" flavor.
author: Phoi B.

description: best frozen yogurt I ever tried !
author: Sulaiman B.

description: By far the best for-yo in the city, plus amazing rice pudding.  GO GO GO!!!
author: Ashley K.

description: ilu loving cup.  when a sweet craving hits, the english toffee rice pudding really hits the spot.  the madagascar vanilla, on the other hand, needs a little more kick.  the yogurt is the go-to for the bf, and is quite tasty, though i prefer yogurt of the tart variety.  slightly pricey, but justified as you're using local, organic ingredients.  will definitely be back.  many times.
author: Allison B.

description: I still am in like with your yogurt, oh Loving Dup....but WHAT is with the insanely loud music  (hard-core alternative style??) that was playing from at least 4:10 to 4:30 (entire time that I was there)  out your speakers on Sunday, Aug. 1st?  I like loud music, but it felt entirely out of place in the sweet looking 1950s organic rice pudding/yogurt store.  All of the strangers in line around me shook their heads, firmly in agreement, however, we could hardly hear each other to discuss iit any further.  Of course, I said nothing to the guy with the mustache who was at the register (I'm not complaining to anyone who is immediately in charge of my food) nor to the other two workers who appeared thrilled to be able to hear the music loudly and clearly over the sound of the yogurt mixing machine.   Idea of music is great, but please consider lowering the volume so one doesn't feel like they are screaming at a nightclub on a relaxing Sunday afternoon when searching and venturing into what one expects to be a   "natural," "healthy", "homey," and "comforting"  type of place.
author: Elle S.

description:
Coffee snob here - this place has 5 Star Espresso - very legit beans and machine...and they know how to use them.  A short ristretto pull - very good and friendly service to match.  I will def. have espresso here movign forward.  Otherwise I end up at BB or Ritual...yeah I know...too snobby for my own good.

This coffee is much better than Crave down the street who advertise their use of Ritual beans (which are indeed great...if the person working knows how to make espresso and Crave needs some training...)
author: Dan G.

description: I felt that this was the most boring yogurt place ever.  Despite the number of people coming in, I didn't understand the buzz.  The vanilla yogurt is mixed with extras.  Perhaps there wasn't enough mango?  the rice pudding equally was bland, dull, not worth even eating.  Will never return.
author: shila c.

description: luv to get my red velvet cupcake best in town.. n my coconut pudding..yumm...luv it..
author: kat r.

description: Well, it seems my review will just be a little excessive seeing how great it's already doing but I really had to compliment this great establishment! I really love this place!! I can't say enough how awesome it is to find a place like this! I got their coconut rice pudding after tasting like a tub's worth of their various flavors! Hahah the servers were very nice about my  curiosity/indecision. Even though it was on the pricier side, you'll forget how much it costs once your tastebuds are screaming in orgasmic pleasures from the very first bite to the last. The coconut flakes are roasted to bring out the toasty crunch that adds a nice texture to the pudding overall. It wasn't too sweet and just perfectly made. I'm the type who would go home and try to replicate food that I eat outside...let's just say, my version made me grateful that I can always go back to get a loving cup to make me feel better about my terrible skills in the kitchen.
author: Tu L.

description: A friend brought over some rice pudding and its totally delicious.  I'm not a huge fan of coconut but in the rice pudding-YUM.  Had the rum raisin too.  It has a little bit too much rum, but still really delicious.  The consistency of the rice pudding is perfect.  Not runny and not too thick.
author: F S.

description: I came here on the suggestion of my fellow yelp users.  When my girlfriend and I came in, the place was fairly empty; only one other couple was ahead of us.  The lady behind the counter was very nice, asking if I would like to try anything.  I tried the chocolate chip rice pudding, it was ok...  My girlfriend tried the vanilla bean rice pudding and she thought it was ok.  It's definitely more chunkier than the rice pudding I've had from the jello company.  Next we stood around for another minute or two and the lady behind the counter, sensing our confusion said we could try more flavors or all of them if we liked.  I tried the creamsicle and my girlfriend tried the coconut.  She said she preferred the vanilla bean better.  I ordered two smalls which was plenty at $3.75 each a person.  After I ordered, my girlfriend asked if I had ordered a small and I replied yes.  Her suggestion was to just have an even "smaller small".  There is not that much space here as you can only fit two people at the counter sitting towards the "kitchen" or two at the window and a wooden bench outside.  My girlfriend and I went and sat on the bench outside and passerby started dropping in after watching us eat.  I think the rice pudding is just ok.  I will be back to try their frozen yogurt or other treats though.
author: Brandon Y.

description: Delicious rice pudding! Loving Cup seems an appropriate name for this place. The young lady who owns the place probably adds "love" when making her family's recipes. I could not make up my mind so I got have White Chocolate and half Chai. The menu showed that one small cup of rice pudding has only 125 calories. Next time I will try the frozen yogurt.
author: A M G.

description: So I really, really, really wanted the Loving Cup to do well and we've been excitedly watching as they've gotten closer to opening. I mean, what could be cooler and more artisanal than a place that specializes in rice pudding? And on Russian Hill there's not that many places open in the evenings just for dessert so we were psyched. Even though their sign on the front door claims that they're open 11:00-9:00pm "everyday" my 6 year-old son and I walked in around 3:00pm just to be sure that they would be open after dinner for a treat. The woman said "oh yes, until 9:00pm!". Fast forward to 6:45pm the SAME DAY! After dinner we put on our warm clothes and walk down there and--- they're completely closed, chairs up, lights out. Cue the disappointed six year-old (and 40year-old). Now I understand that things happen, but if you want to endear yourself with neighborhood locals who would frequent you 2-3 times a week, and recommend you to friends and family, don't start off by making commitments that you're not going to keep. I hope this place makes it, I really do, but flaking out on potential regulars is not a very good way to start. ***UPDATE A few days after my post I got a relatively nice note from someone @ Loving Cup explaining that they closed earlier that day due to an electrical problem. Fair enough, though a note on the window would be nice. We're looking forward to trying again and do like the idea of speciality rice pudding!
author: C R.

description: So the yogurt is really good and it's a cute place and all, but... they asked us to leave right after making our yogurts.  It's a small place, so there's only one yogurt blending machine thingy.   And I understand that it takes time to make several different orders.  But my friend had only just started eating hers when they started their closing routine and asked us to leave.  Indeed it was closing time, but it seemed lame that they couldn't just have let us stay in the warm shop while we were eating our cold dessert.  They were only just starting the clean up.  Could have been 5 stars.
author: Ryan G.

description: I've been going to Loving Cup for what seems like forever.. and I love them. The rice pudding is like poetry... delicious creamy poetry.. Mmmm.
author: Joyce P.

description: when i had my first taste of vanilla + nutella i believe my exact words were "oh shit, this is good." while i don't love the name of this place, i am going to be lovin' me a cup of frozen yogurt much more often now. conveniently located right next to the gym... what's the sit-up to fro-yo conversion?
author: Sara C.

description: When I passed Loving Cup for the first time, I was reminded of Rice to Riches in NYC and I had to go inside! I tried the Coconut and Pecan Praline flavors. Both were excellent!!! Sweet, but not too heavy or overwhelming. I can't wait to go back and try the other rice pudding flavors (the nice lady behind the counter said that Madagascar Vanilla, Rum Raisin, and Coconut were the most popular).
author: Cecilia W.

description:
Darn it. I was excited at the prospect of a fro yo place closer to my home. Although the walk to Union and Filmore can be used as lame justification for shoving a giant glob of frozen yogurt into my pie hole, there are times when a shorter walk would be nice. 
When Loving Cup first opened, I checked them out. I asked about prices of the loving cups. It seemed kind of high. Indeed. 
Well, the other day I was in a hurry, no time for a walk to Cow Hollow, so I decided to take the plunge and spend some hard earned money on what I knew would be substantially less fro yo than to which I am accustomed. But how much less was truly disappointing. 
Yes, I have lived on the East Coast, and so am familiar with the "puck" style yogurt that can be blended like a Dairy Queen Flurry. I loved it when I was living out there. However, I would not have loved it had I paid what I did here. A small cup was $3.75. And that includes a mix in. But I did not want a mix in! What if you crave plain old chocolate or vanilla? Or (gasp!) BOTH! 
No swirls here, folks. And don't worry about overindulging. That small cup was literally half full. And no, I did not get a mix in. I was charged as though I had got one, but I did not. 
For $3.75, I received approximately 1/3 cup of frozen yogurt. I'm pretty sure the fro yo is not organic. The rice pudding may be. I don't know. I don't eat rice pudding, so it matters not to me. In any event, 1/3 cup of frozen yogurt for $3.75? At my usual yogurt store, I receive at least 3 times as much, no exaggeration, for $.25 less. Probably more like 4x as much, and sometimes more, depending on the server. 
And, I don't get charged for toppings I do not want or receive. That makes no sense! I like frozen yogurt cuz it's fat free. I don't want to add candy, as it adds fat and more sugar. I don't want fruit in my frozen yogurt. So why be charged for it? Arrrrgh! 
You can get fancy gelato at Naia for these prices.  And you'll have more choices and can get more flavors in one cup!
Oh well, the store is cute. The person working there was nice enough. But for frozen yogurt? No way. I'll walk the extra 10 blocks for sure. 
Oh, and it does take a long time to make one yogurt, even if I hadn't had several questions (I did). Not worth it.
author: Allucaneat G.

description: I love this place! Everything I tried there has been DELICIOUS! The pistachio rice pudding and the PB & banana smoothie are my favorites. There's endless sweet combinations with all the toppings and add-ins. The only thing is that it is dangerously close to where I work so I go there way too often!
author: Maggie F.

description: I'm in love.  The Loving Cup is my new ATF.  I give it a perfect 10 for both looks and service.  The location is really cute and inviting, just what is needed to put you at ease and in the mood for the experience.  Both RP (rice pudding) and FY (frozen yogurt) is on the menu, and I've tried both, but the FY is the way to go.  Each serving is prepared individually, unwrapped and put through a diabolical looking machine, with your choice of toppings.  No clock watching here!  The English Toffee seems to work best for me.  Its the penultimate GFE (Great Food Experience).   What a discovery!  Plus its totally legal.
author: David T.

description: Anyone who hates on this place is lame. I live around the corner and have been here every single day since it has opened; and Im not even a big frozen yogurt fan. Anyone with a sweet tooth must go here. They have an edge over any other fro yo joint in the city because it's old fashioned creamy style AND they mix in the toppings as opposed to throwing them on top. The chick who runs it is rad and their cinnamon rice krispie treats taste like churros. The pistachio and cookies & cream rice pudding are legit.  Great addition to Polk St.
author: Kit V.

description: One morning I wanted a smoothie because I walked all the way from North Beach to Russian Hill and I found Loving Cup. As soon as I took a sip of their Banana and berry smoothie I loved it. It was so thick and fruity!
author: Jacob A.

description: execellent and fresh delicious, guiltless yogurt!  you can cret any combination.  i took my roomie and she loved it.  you can get a stamp card too.  a refreshing treat.  cant wait to try th rice pudding when it gets colder.
author: lux j.

description: Awesome - one of the best finds in the area.  The rice pudding is amazing and the mixed yogurts are very tasty.  So happy I discovered this place.
author: Lisa K.

description: this place is INSANE. mm......nutella. pumkin pie. try it!!! way better than tuttimelon...
author: Lindsay H.

description: love the froyo esp vanilla base with strawberries and animal crackers. another favorite is chocolate base with almond butter. they also have a pretty good variety of rice pudding.
author: J J.
